Demonstrated successful customer service experience with the ability to manage complex customer issues with calm, comfort, and ease Strong troubleshooting and support skills, including the ability to creatively utilize all available resources to satisfy customer Ability to take ownership of complex issues/assignments and follow through to completion Demonstrates aptitude to prioritize and handle multiple issues simultaneously Effective oral and written communication skills Strong attention to detail and accuracy Ability to work independently in a fast paced technical environment Ability to function and contribute in a team environment Effective time management and project management skills Must be willing to work flexible hours Minimum of 2 years’ experience working in a technical support environment Bachelor’s degree in computer science or related field preferred Microsoft Office Suite com or other Support call tracking systems Basic understanding of Internet and networking technologies Familiarity with a programming language

title: Life Science Marketing & Sales medewerker
summary:
Wij zijn op zoek naar een kandidaat die de marketing van laboratorium apparatuur gaat doen!
In deze rol ga je aan de slag met de marketing en communicatieve…
description: Life Science Marketing & Sales medewerker Location: Amsterdam Contact: Robin van Amersfoort Job type: Temp to Perm Contact phone: +31 (0)20 406 97 50 Industry: Life Sciences, Biotechnology, Microbiology, Technology, E-Commerce, Telecommunications, Hardware Contact email: robin_vanamersfoort@oxfordcorp.com Werk jij nu op het laboratorium, maar denk je dat je beter tot je recht zou komen in een rol waarin je meer communicatief bezig bent? Wij zijn op zoek naar een kandidaat die de marketing van laboratorium apparatuur gaat doen! Functieomschrijving Voor een bedrijf dat producten verkoopt die in de life science laboratorium industrie worden gebruikt zoeken wij iemand die niet langer laborant wil zijn. In deze rol ga je aan de slag met de marketing en communicatieve kant van de verkoop van producten. Natuurlijk zul je zelf ook veel in contact staan met klanten. Bijvoorbeeld door middel van het beantwoorden van vragen die komen naar aanleiding van de nieuwsbrief die JIJ hebt geschreven. Ook zul je zelf klanten benaderen om het klantenbestand uit te bereiden en werk je samen met je collega 's toe naar een zo goed mogelijk voorziene markt. Zeker in deze tijd van Corona is er veel vraag naar de producten die dit bedrijf verkoopt, dus veel werk en uitdagingen. Verantwoordelijkheden Bedenken van creatieve content voor de nieuwsbrief en de website Het schrijven van stukken voor de website, LinkedIn en de nieuwsbrief Meewerken aan het uitbreiden van het klantenbestand Technische vragen van klanten beantwoorden over de apparatuur die je verkoopt Profiel Afgeronde MLO of HLO opleiding, bij voorkeur in de life science richting Kennis van moleculaire, microbiologische en biochemische technieken is een grote pre Creatieve en communicatieve vaardigheden Punctuele en gestructureerde mindset Goede beheersing van de (Nederlandse en) Engelse taal Arbeidsvoorwaarden Dienstverband: Start via Oxford Global Resources, uitzicht op vast dienstverband bij de opdrachtgever Salarisindicatie: van €2000 - 2800 Werktijden: 40 uur per week Standplaats: Regio Utrecht Vacaturenummer: 17133 Oxford Global Resources is het grootste recruitmentbureau binnen de vakgebieden Science, Engineering en IT. Al onze recruiters hebben zelf een relevante achtergrond binnen deze gebieden en helpen je graag bij het vinden van de perfecte baan in ons uitgebreide netwerk. Als gespecialiseerde partij hebben wij een groot aanbod aan laboratorium vacatures op het gebied van Quality Control (QC) en Research & Development (R&D) binnen diverse sectoren, waaronder de Farmaceutische industrie, Biotechnologie, Contract Manufacturing, Contract Research, Voedingsmiddelenindustrie, Chemie, Milieu en Plantensector. Oxford is altijd op zoek naar talent met expertise op het gebied van Biotechnologie, Immunologie, Biochemie, Virologie, Microbiologie, Moleculaire Biologie, Life Science, Analytische Chemie, Fysische Chemie, Polymeerchemie, Petrochemie en Diagnostiek. Wij komen graag in contact met kandidaten die ervaring hebben met een of meerdere van de volgende technieken: USP (Upstream Processing) DSP (Downstream Processing), Bioprocesses, viruskweek, celkweek, ELISA, FACS, Western Blot, SDS-page, PCR, RT-PCR, qPCR, kloneren, sequencing, eiwit zuivering, purificatie, HPLC, UPLC, chromatografie, fysische chemie, viscositeit, smeltpunt, pourpoint, pH, XRF, GC, GC-MS, LC, LC-MS, ICP ICP-MS, AAS, UV, titraties, Karl Fisher, formuleren, steriliteit, determinaties, bioburden, environmental monitoring, LIMS, GMP, GLP, GCP, GDP, ISO17025. Vind je deze vacature interessant? Of ben jij op zoek naar een functie op MLO, HLO, BSc, WO, MSc of PhD en heb je interesse in de vacature laboratorium Assistent, Laborant, Laborant monstervoorbereiding, Analist, Technician, Assistant Scientist, Associate Scientist, Scientist, Manufacturing Specialist, Process Engineer, Validatie Engineer, QA (Quality Assurance) Officer, RA (Regulatory Affairs) Officer, Supervisor, Teamleider, Afdelingshoofd, Hoofd Laboratorium, Manager, Director, etc. Neem dan direct contact met ons op! Apply Now

title: Marketing Analyst (Performance & Lifecycle & CRO)
summary: We are looking for someone to join our Growth Analytics team who is passionate about marketing analytics and who will support the development and execution of…
description: About the team At the Growth Analytics team it is our responsibility to uncover what our users are aiming to accomplish within Miro. And we are doing this at scale! As the name, Growth Analytics suggests, we are working a lot with understanding user behaviour by analysing their actions. But this is not everything we do though! We create hypotheses, build growth models, own metrics and experiment together with our fellow Growth PMs and Growth Marketing people. About the role We are looking for someone to join our Growth Analytics team who is passionate about marketing analytics and who will support the development and execution of highly targeted marketing campaigns for Miro users, and help us keep our dashboards, quantitative research analytics up-to-date. In this role, you will help to build, launch, and analyze various marketing campaigns, from emails, SEO, CRO, and through that help to drive Miro business growth. This is a unique opportunity to join a fast-growing team and leave your mark as the team scales up. Your efforts will support the foundation for the Growth Marketing team and will contribute to the company's growth. What you'll do Independently performing analyses and interpreting the results Communicating analyses and findings to relevant stakeholders Creating dashboards with key metrics for internal teams Participate in pro-active research projects where we provide novel insights to internal teams What you'll need 3+ years of experience in analytics & insights within product customer-centric organizations Strong analytical and problem-solving skills The ability to (independently) perform SQL queries (strong requirement) and experience with statistical/ data analysis tools (strong preference; preferably Python/ R) The ability to work independently and pro-actively pick up tasks but also keen to be part of an experienced group of data analysts, scientists and user researchers What's in it for you Stock Option Grant Medical Insurance coverage Travel allowance for your commute Lunch, snacks and drinks provided Allowance to facilitate remote working during WFH period Weekly team activities (even virtually) to keep the spirits high Opportunity to work for a truly global team Inspiring workplace in the heart of Amsterdam About Miro Miro is an online collaborative whiteboard platform that enables distributed teams to work effectively together, from running brainstorming sessions and workshops to planning projects, from designing new products and services to facilitating agile ceremonies. With over 10 million users, Miro is trusted by Dell, Cisco, Salesforce, PWC, EY, Deloitte and many more global companies of all sizes. At Miro, we are a team of dreamers. We look for individuals who dream big, work hard and above all stay humble. Collaboration is at the heart of what we do and through our work together we hope to create a supportive, welcoming, and innovative environment. We strive to play as a team to win the world and create a better version of ourselves everyday. If this sounds like something that excites you, we want to hear from you! Check out our career page for all our open roles or hop onto this Miro board to learn more about us!

description: Medscape, a division of WebMD, develops and hosts physician portals and related mobile applications that make it easier for physicians and healthcare professionals to access clinical reference sources, stay abreast of the latest clinical information, learn about new treatment options, earn continuing medical education credits and communicate with peers.  All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or veteran status. Medscape is seeking a highly qualified and experienced Sr. Procurement Analyst to join its Business Operations Team. The Sr. Analyst will be responsible for the pricing of proprietary solutions and the negotiation and execution of vendor and client contracts. RESPONSIBILITIES: Pricing/Contract support for WebMD Medical Affairs Contract management Create standard and complex contracts with legal department Act an intermediary between WebMD legal team and the client’s legal team to facilitate efficiencies and speed to solutions, elevate challenges to supervisor as appropriate Review and approve contracts submitted for signature Meticulously maintain library of approved documents Ensure compliance with WebMD legal, finance, and accreditation policies Pricing Complete Pricing requests for Proprietary Solutions with the goal of optimizing profit by facilitating profitable sales, achieving marketing and corporate growth objectives. Develop constructive relationships with clients, vendors and internal staff across functions to develop legally compliant cost/price solutions Develop and maintain solution baseline budget template Maintain pricing database Complete ad hoc analysis QUALIFICATIONS: MBA, Business/Finance Minimum of 5 plus years of relevant experience in pricing, financial analysis and contract negotiation Strong critical thinking, problem solving and analytical skills Excellent verbal and written communication skills. Must be responsible, accountable, results-driven, and comfortable in a fast-paced environment. Ability to collaborate with Vendors and internal teams Microsoft Office Suite proficiency (Excel / Word – Intermediate to Advanced) Preferred: Experience using Salesforce and SharePoint Online Experience working remotely Experience working within medical affairs

title: Informatie Analyst in Noord Brabant
summary:
Maar ook denk je mee in verschillende marketing campagnes en maak je samen met de afdeling marketing deze campagnes meetbaar.
Hbo werk en denk niveau.
description: Voor dit leuke bedrijf in Noord Brabant ben ik op zoek naar een Informatie Analyst. Deze alom bekende nieuwsorganisatie gevestigd in Tilburg staat bekend om de Brabantse gezelligheid. Vrij vragen voor carnaval hoeft hier ook niet, je bent het gewoon! Het bedrijf telt ruim 150 medewerkers, verdeeld over verschillende afdelingen. Afgelopen jaar hebben zij ruim 200 miljoen bezoekers op de website gehad, om dit vast te kunnen houden en uit te kunnen bouwen zijn zij opzoek naar een innovatieve Informatie Analyst. Dat moet je aan denken aan verschillende Apps, social media etc etc. Maar ook denk je mee in verschillende marketing campagnes en maak je samen met de afdeling marketing deze campagnes meetbaar. Communicatief goede skills moet je hebben om deze functie goed in te kunnen vullen, daarnaast ben je ook echt een people manager. Dit heb je nodig omdat je met veel verschillende personen/teams aan het sparren en aan het levelen bent. Links haal je in business taal de requierements op en rechts zet je dit in software taal uit. Daarom is het ook belangrijk dat je de afgelopen kennis hebt vergaart van verschillende programmeertalen. Je bent hier zelf niet hand-on mee bezig maar kennis hiervan is wel nodig om het team en de struggles te begrijpen. Eisen Hbo werk en denk niveau Minimaal 3 jaar werkervaring als Product Owner/Informatie Analyst Analytisch & communicatief sterk Je kunt snel schakelen Kennis van Php, Microsoft .NET is een pré Aanbod Salaris op basis van ervaring (€3.000 – €5.000) Vakantiedagen + vakantiegeld Interne en externe opleidingsmogelijkheden leuke uitjes en bedrijfsborrels Ben jij geïnteresseerd in een leuke, nieuwe uitdaging en herken jij jezelf in het bovenstaande profiel? Neem dan snel contact met mij op! Ik ben te bereiken via ruben@starapple.nl of op 088 321 8 123.

title: Network Development Analyst
summary:
Our business encompasses the marketing and sales, research and refining of petroleum products.
Kuwait Petroleum International, known by our trademark Q8,…
description: About Q8 Kuwait Petroleum International, known by our trademark Q8, refines and markets fuel, lubricants and other petroleum derivatives outside Kuwait. Our main activities are focused on Europe and the Far East. Established in 1983, Kuwait Petroleum International is the international subsidiary of Kuwait Petroleum Corporation, which brings together all the state owned elements of the Kuwait oil sector under one corporate umbrella and is recognized as one of the world’s top ten energy conglomerates. Our business encompasses the marketing and sales, research and refining of petroleum products. Q8 markets fuel via over 4,000 service stations across Europe and operates a direct sales operation, providing road fuel and heating oil. Our International Diesel Service (IDS) is dedicated to the needs of international road transport companies; Q8Aviation provides jet fuel at more than 60 airports internationally and Q8 Oils manufactures and markets some of the world’s finest lubricants. For more information: http://www.q8.be/ or http://www.q8.com  We are currently looking for an Network Development Analyst within IDS.  PURPOSE Assist the IDS Network Development Team in collecting and analyzing internal and external data/information in order to support business decision-making and control, as it relates to current and future planned activities.  Assist the Network Development Manager in converting the outcome of the data analysis into a professional communication package/business cases for management reporting.  For the purpose of this Job Description reference to Q8 Global Cards refers to IDS activities in all countries except Denmark and Sweden where IDS activities are managed locally.  PRINCIPAL ACCOUNTABILITIES Collection and Analysis of NWD data: Collect and maintain all relevant Network Development information (competitors, number of sites, number of lanes, etc.) and develop a database which will enable reporting and support future decision making Cooperate and communicate effectively with main stakeholders being IDS Management Team, NWD Team, Strategy and Market Team, Sales Teams and Business Analyst as well as the support teams of Supply Logistics and IT in order to achieve valuable data collection Management Reporting and Presenting: Develop and maintain, in alignment with the Network Development Manager, templates to be used for Management Reporting purposes (KPNWE Investment Board, IDS Pricing Committee, M meetings etc., External meetings with partners, etc…) Participate in Network Development periodic as needed and assist with project implementation Participate and present in internal meetings and selective external meetings with Q8 Global Cards partners Assist the Network Development Team in Network Development projects: Maintain and follow up contract renewals of CO lease rental contracts and Hospitality and Card Acceptance Assist the Network Development Regional Managers in coordinating communication with internal and external stakeholders relating to ongoing and future projects HSSE: Apply and comply with all corporate HSSE policies and procedures in order to ensure a safe working environment for all Q8 Global Cards staff and other personnel  NECESSARY EXPERIENCE Experience Minimum of 2 years’ experience in an analytical role, ideally within the petroleum sector Knowledge of the Commercial Road Transport business, customer and/or network perspective Knowledge in (financial) analysis, reporting & control Education/Minimum Qualifications University/ Bachelor degree in Business Economics/ Finance/ Accounting/ Engineering Languages Fluency in English (prerequisite) Other European languages (preferred) Other Experience in an international & multicultural organization Expert Microsoft Office & Power Point user Knowledge of SAP, SAP BW & BO Commercial minded Structured Analytical Flexible Team player Self driven Good communicator Capable of challenging given assumptions Inquisitive and tenacious  We offer Q8 offers you an exciting and responsible position within an international, rapidly expanding company that is one of the market leaders in the fuel sector. You will be part of smart and sustainable solutions that make our customers’ lives more comfortable. You will discover an innovative, stimulating environment and community, focusing on accountability, collaboration, experimentation, personal growth and development, along with highly motivated and capable colleagues. In return for your solid commitment, you can count on an attractive salary package including an extensive package of extra-legal benefits, additional vacation days and a work policy that encourages and enables a positive work-life balance through ea. remote work. Your work home base will be The Hague.

title: Manager, Distributor Markets - EMEA
summary:
Develop annual sales and marketing plan for assigned markets.
Successful at gaining alignment and support of internal partners to support distributor sales and…
description: Manager, EMEA Distributor Markets - Verathon® Verathon® is actively recruiting for a Manager, EMEA Distributor Markets to manage sales and marketing activities in Europe and other select distributor markets. The individual will represent Verathon’s entire product line, including GlideScope video laryngoscopy and single use bronchoscopy systems and BladderScan bladder volume measurement devices. The individual will be responsible for managing and growing sales through the company’s network of independent distributors in assigned markets. The Manager, EMEA Distributor Markets will report to the Vice President of Europe, Middle East and Africa or his/her designate and will have approximately two direct reports. This role will manage distributors directly as well as supervise Business Development Managers (BDMs) responsible for select markets. This role is based in Europe and is a remotely based role. Principal Responsibilities: Develop annual sales and marketing plan for assigned markets. Identify, select and train distributors. Work with Marketing and other Verathon partners to plan and execute training of distributors and end users. Work with distributors to develop existing and new markets within their territories. Assist in cultivation of Key Opinion Leaders (KOLs) and reference sites. Work with Respiratory and Surgical Solutions (RSS) and Imaging Systems and Solutions (ISS) marketing teams to manage product launches through distributor network. Collaborate with Verathon team members, including Customer Care, Technical Service, Finance and Marketing to ensure distributor operations are run smoothly. Negotiate and manage pricing within geography consistent with company strategy and company policies. Supervise team of Business Development Managers (BDMs) who oversee select markets in EMEA. Partner with EMEA tender manager and company contract analysts to ensure new contracts and contract renewals comply with approved templates and approval procedures. Assist in managing product end of life (EOL) for discontinued products. Perform quarterly and annual business reviews with assigned distributors. Maintain robust, structured sales pipeline and monthly/quarterly/annual forecasting process. Evaluate performance and capabilities of current distributors. When appropriate, recruit new distributors and manage offboarding of terminated distributors. Ensure compliance with regulatory guidelines and company policies. Ensure new distributors have been approved by company’s Quality organization. Work with finance to manage credit and terms with distributor partners. Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities: University bachelor’s degree in relevant field. Minimum of 5 years’ experience managing medical device equipment distributors in Europe. Experience managing medical device sales personnel. Successful sales track record of achieving growth and quota targets in distributor markets. Strong results in building a distributor based business, ideally with existing relationships and knowledge of the medical distributors in Northern Europe. Skilled at managing and motivating distributors. Experience in establishing contracts, onboarding and offboarding distributors. Ethical leader with a commitment to compliance (regulatory, quality, financial, human resources). Strong negotiation skills. Structured thinker regarding pipeline management and forecasting process. Excellent trainer. Able to provide product training to distributor partners and end customers. Successful track record of recruiting, onboarding new distributors. Ability to work with cross functional, international teams to achieve goals. Successful at gaining alignment and support of internal partners to support distributor sales and marketing initiatives. A collaborative team player who cultivates a collegial spirit, respects other people’s ideas and understands how to gain agreement and acceptance for new initiatives throughout the organization. Strong level of cultural sensitivity for internal and external partners and customers. Comfortable with having to adjust to changes in work environment, work under pressure with a sense of urgency and meet tight deadlines. Fluency in English is required. Other European language skills, particularly those applied in the countries in charge, are desirable. A dynamic, high energy and self-starting individual. Well-developed communication, presentation and negotiation skills together with strong influencing skills to drive change and achieve alignment. “Customer first” mentality – proactive approach to high quality customer service delivery, through empathizing, anticipating customer needs and exceeding customer expectations. Strong leadership capability. About Verathon: Verathon is a global medical device company focused on supporting customers by being their trusted partner, delivering high-quality products that endure over time and ensure clinical and economic utility. Two areas where Verathon has significantly impacted patient care, and become the market leader in each, are bladder volume measurement and airway management. The company’s BladderScan portable ultrasound and GlideScope video laryngoscopy & bronchoscopy systems effectively address unmet needs for healthcare providers and meaningfully raise the standard of care for patients. Verathon, a subsidiary of Roper Technologies, is headquartered in Bothell, Washington, USA and has international subsidiaries in Canada, Europe and Asia Pacific. For more information, please visit www.verathon.com. Verathon is an equal opportunity employer and strongly supports diversity in the workplace. We believe that diverse ideas, opinions and perspectives will build a strong foundation for success. In order to provide equal employment and advancement opportunities to all individuals, employment decisions at Verathon will be based on merit, qualifications, and abilities. Verathon does not discriminate in employment opportunities or practices on the basis of race, color, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, or any other characteristic protected by law.

title: Compensation Analyst
summary:
From our innovative tech teams to marketing experts and Reward specialists, we're always looking to attract the best global talent.
Ready for the next step?
description: Do you already have some analytical experience in the Compensation & Benefits work field? Ready for the next step? This is an exciting opportunity to be part of a team where you will have the ability to influence the strategy of the combined Just Eat Takeaway Reward Team. Our story (the bitesize version): Since our first order back in 2000, we've grown from an attic start-up to become a food delivery powerhouse. As Just Eat Takeaway, we serve millions of dishes every day with brands across 23 countries. The key ingredient in our success is people. From our innovative tech teams to marketing experts and Reward specialists, we're always looking to attract the best global talent. All about the role: In this role, you will be responsible for identifying, implementing, and maintaining the right compensation structures to support the strategic direction of the business. Reporting into the Reward Manager, a varied position covering BAU compensation activities and project work. Key responsibilities Compensation analysis; assist in the annual cycle and administration for salary and bonus programs, including executive compensation analysis (e.g LTI programs) and sales incentive programs. Provide guidance, statistical analysis, data modelling, and cost analysis Assist in benchmark surveys participation, project managing submissions, providing analysis of survey results and insights/recommendations Provide analysis and advice on compensation packages for employees in line with the compensation framework Build and maintain reports and dashboards in Workday to support the team, HR and management requirements. Draft compensation administrative procedures and communication materials Contribute to the development of the compensation strategy Support and provide guidance to the respective HR team and management as needed Deliver knowledge on the market and competitor remuneration and advise accordingly Assist in the planning and implementation of compensation (and wider reward) programs and projects. Can you deliver... Here are the ingredients we need from you: MSc in Business Administration/Law/Economics or equivalent At least 2 years of analytical experience; interpreting data and using the information to inform business options and outcomes. Good understanding of job evaluation, pay structures, bonus plans and related legislation. Experience with benchmarking (Mercer, WTW, Hay and Radford) Strong communicator, with the ability to influence at all levels Demonstrable project management skills Able to hit the ground running Ability to operate in a multinational and fast-moving business environment Experience with Workday Generalist HR experience Experience with sales incentives, share plans, tax, global mobility and benefits What we offer Like the perfect food pairing, your skills and these great rewards belong together: Variety in your work within a young, dynamic and international team and an informal atmosphere A challenging environment that will stimulate you to grow as a professional Responsibility with great opportunity to learn and take ownership Competitive salary and paid travel costs Monthly lunch allowance Full-time basis with 26 holiday days a year Interested in this role? Apply today!

title: Senior Analyst Global Advertising
summary:
Collaborate with other analysts/data scientists and help guide strategy based on learning from other analyses/projects.
You are data and analytically intensive!
description: eBay Classifieds Group (eCG) is an innovative leader in online classifieds with ten brands that span the globe. Our sites help people find whatever they’re looking for in their local communities – whether it’s a job, an apartment, a sofa, a car, a concert ticket, financial services or new friends. Every connection made or item found makes a difference by creating a world where people share more and waste less. People who want to connect and trade visit our sites because they’re fun, easy to use and built on trust. About the business: Classifieds is shaping the future of local commerce by bringing people together through an enriched online experience that allows them to reach out to the community around them. We are comprised of more than 1,000 people who are passionate for local trade and maintaining the customer-centric nature of the Group, while exploring growth opportunities in both the countries where eCG already has a presence and in prospective markets. About the team: The Central Analytics team is responsible for Global Analytics and building Analytics capabilities across all Business Units. "We make decisions based on data, by providing high-value data, deep insights, and addictive tools." About the role: We are looking for a gifted analytics professional to join our Central Commercial & Advertising Analytics team. Join us! Your main focus will be to contribute to the development of our Advertising platforms and tools from an Analytics data-driven perspective, working in close contact with both our Advertising Center of Excellence, and our Product & Technology team. As a member of the global analytics team, you will be proficient with data tools and sources, thrive on solving highly analytical problems, and turn data into impactful insights. This global role comes with the challenge of understanding and contributing to many facets of the business, including advertising operations, product, finance and data management. You are data and analytically intensive! Successful candidates should be quick learners, strategic problem solvers, operational and execution driven facilitators, problem solvers, and have an entrepreneurial spirit. This role is heavily cross-functional and ideal for candidates who enjoy both defining and solving complex problems, while getting deeply involved in the design of our future advertising platforms and tools. Skills in problem definition, rigorous analysis, recommendation development and influencing capabilities will also be critical, as well as demonstration of exceptional interpersonal skills, initiative and integrity. Key Responsibilities & Accountabilities: As a main focus, contribute to the development of our Advertising platforms and tools from an Analytics perspective. Those capabilities include ad serving, targeting, testing and experimentation, decision engines, pricing optimization, and more. Ensure that all platforms, features and initiatives are properly measurable, by defining and applying measurement and tracking frameworks and making sure all prerequisites are embedded in the product development process. Monitor and collect the appropriate data, create insights, and communicate with the teams to effectively steer the product performance and roadmap. Structure complex, ambiguous business questions and utilize analytical skills to synthesize impactful business insights, to the benefit of commercial leaders in the organization. Design, plan, and execute methodologies to measure successes of business initiatives. Analyze results and trends across business units, verticals & revenue streams, to uncover opportunities and improve business performance. Collaborate with other analysts/data scientists and help guide strategy based on learning from other analyses/projects. Perform ad-hoc analysis and benchmarking as needed. Create and maintain insightful automated reports and dashboards utilizing typical data quality functions (e.g. standardization, consistency, etc.) Work closely across the matrix with teams like Advertising CoE, Product & Technology, Engineering, Finance, Marketing, Product, and more. Scale analytics best practices and knowledge sharing across the organization. Continually improve your knowledge of analytics tools, our data warehouse, the business, and methodologies. Minimum qualifications: Bachelor’s degree in Mathematics, Computer Science, Business, Engineering or other quantitative field 4+ years of professional experience in using data to facilitate business decisions Excellent communication (written/verbal) and presentation skills in English Exceptionally diligent to detail and embracing of collaboration People minded; eager to build positive and productive relationships with partners General knowledge of the digital advertising ecosystem and related performance metrics Experience manipulating large data sets, interpreting data trends and using a multitude of disparate data sources and tools Ability to shift priorities quickly, while maintaining a high degree of organization and control Good knowledge of SQL or similar Experience in at least one visualisation tool (Tableau, Looker, Data Studio, PowerBI, etc.) The highest proficiency in Excel & PowerPoint Preferred qualifications: Experience with AdTech (DV360, Google Ads, Ad Manager, AdSense, Bing, etc) Hands-on experience with one scripting language (R, Python, Java, etc) Familiarity with web and app analytics Knowledge of A/B testing Experience applying statistical modelling to drive business decision making What we offer: Dynamic, very international team with highly skilled personalities, a passion for e-commerce, integrity and a good sense of humor. High team autonomy and agile environment The chance to work closely with other teams across Europe, North America and APAC. A competitive salary and benefits, and an excellent working environment. Silicon Valley amenities, such as iPhones and MacBook Pros, exciting high spec dev machines and very nice office facilities. An opportunity to build applications, which will be used by millions of people globally Interested? From the moment that you join, we seek to make your employment experience an outstanding and engaging one. If you are hardworking and thrive in a reciprocal and friendly environment then apply and send us your CV. Benefits: Benefits are an essential part of your total compensation for the work you do every day. Whether you’re single, in a growing family, or nearing retirement, eBay offers a variety of comprehensive and competitive benefit programs to meet your needs. We love creating opportunities for others by connecting people from widely diverse backgrounds, perspectives, and geographies. So, being diverse and inclusive isn’t just something we strive for, it is who we are, and part of what we do each and every single day. We want to ensure that as an employee, you feel eBay is a place where, no matter who you are, you feel safe, included, and that you have the opportunity to bring your unique self to work. To learn about our Diversity & Inclusion click here: https://www.ebayinc.com/company/diversity-inclusion/ Covid-19 People are the heart of the eBay Classifieds business, and their health and well-being are our first priority. We continue to monitor local government guidance and partner closely with medical advisors to determine the safest and best next steps for everyone. As a result, most teams are working remotely, with a few teams able to collaborate in person with enhanced safety procedures. We will discuss the particular case for your region during the interview process. As a general rule, interviews will be completed remotely over video calls. eBay Inc. is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, veteran status, and disability, or other legally protected status. If you are unable to submit an application because of incompatible assistive technology or a disability, please contact us at talent@ebay.com. We will make every effort to respond to your request for disability assistance as soon as possible.

title: Chemical Insights Analyst - Energy Insights
summary: We offer services along the oil and gas value chain, including exploration and production, refining and marketing, natural gas, trading and oil field services,…
description: QUALIFICATIONS Bachelor's or advanced degree in chemistry or chemical engineering 2-4 years of experience in the chemicals industry ideally in a technical, operational or market analysis role Background in consulting, strategy and/or research a plus Modeling capability using Excel and experience managing large datasets with databases Distinctive analytical and quantitative skills Proven record of leadership in a work setting and/or through extracurricular activities Ability to work collaboratively in a team environment Ability to communicate complex ideas effectively both verbally and in writing WHO YOU'LL WORK WITH You will be based in Amsterdam and will work with our Energy Insights team. Energy Insights, a specialist data and analytics unit, provides distinctive analysis, insights and support to energy players. We offer services along the oil and gas value chain, including exploration and production, refining and marketing, natural gas, trading and oil field services, and equipment. Energy Insights’ dedicated specialists apply proprietary tools and methodologies and a data-driven approach. With our strong ties with McKinsey’s oil and gas consulting practice and access to the expertise of the wider McKinsey network, our research and analysis yield knowledge available nowhere else. WHAT YOU'LL DO You will work in teams to solve some of the most pressing and complex client issues as well as support the development of new proprietary market perspectives for an array of chemical industry value chains. You will work in teams of typically 3-5 consultants, playing an active role in all aspects of the client engagement that includes gathering and analyzing information, formulating and testing hypotheses and developing communication and recommendations. You will also present results to client management and implement recommendations in collaboration with client team members. You will contribute to McKinsey’s industry knowledge by staying up to date with the latest in the chemicals industry and you will contribute to proprietary models and analyses that includes gathering the information necessary to develop these tools and synthesize your findings into McKinsey-formatted products. These products may be in the form of complex models and summary reports which evolve into stand-alone presentations that outline key findings and recommendations to internal and external audiences.

title: Head of Performance Marketing (Fulltime, Amsterdam)
summary: You have the chance to build out a team yourself with different roles to be fulfilled like: senior performance marketer(s), a senior CRM marketer, a marketing…
description: Are you looking to make your mark on a platform that touches the lives of millions of people? Then you’re at the right place. It's an amazing time to be joining the Inner Circle team as we continue to expand globally. And that's where you come in.  You spearhead the online user acquisition within the marketing department to drive Inner Circle’s user growth with new and active members while staying within the brand guidelines. You will work directly with our CMO.  Your key job is to look at every acquisition channel, every source, and every step of the user acquisition funnel and look for opportunities to innovate and grow.  Next to this, you will be the driving force behind the new performance marketing team. You have the chance to build out a team yourself with different roles to be fulfilled like: senior performance marketer(s), a senior CRM marketer, a marketing analyst, junior performance marketers and later ASO/ASA specialists.  What are your main result areas? Define the strategy and KPIs of effective marketing campaign execution in all digital performance acquisition channels across search engines, social, app store optimisation and display advertising. Create an inspiring and empowering work environment for the performance marketing team, assisting in the execution of their result areas if needed and ensure that their professional skills are consistently growing. Explore and drive innovation via new (online) marketing opportunities to improve our channel mix, reach our target KPIs and contribute to the company’s growth goals. Oversee, build and improve custom tracking, dashboards, internal reports and testing systems to communicate progress and results with relevant stakeholders and ensure internal alignment on performance.  What we offer A chance to built, lead and scale our performance marketing efforts in a global market A competitive salary matched with your experience and ambition The fun and hustle of a tech scale-up An amazing work environment in our own 400 m2 office at Prins Hendrikkade, at the heart of Amsterdam. A Macbook or other hardware of your choice to be able to do your job Training and development budget An annual trip with the whole company (when COVID-19 restrictions are lifted again) Frequent team get-togethers (when COVID-19 restrictions are lifted again) Monthly Inner Circle events to meet all the cool members IRL (when COVID-19 restrictions are lifted again) Free Inner Circle VIP membership for you and your single friends Monthly Stay Healthy allowance  Requirements Experience with mobile B2C subscriptions is a must 5+ years of relevant working experience in online/growth/digital/performance marketing You’re a natural leader Strong analytical skills Proficiency in the English language required, Dutch or additional languages are a plus Excellent stakeholder management skills About Inner Circle Inner Circle is a global dating app for like-minded ambitious singles who are serious about dating. We challenge singles to stop aimlessly swiping and up their dating game, to meet their match (and not just any match). With a community of 3 million singles in 42 cities around the world, we help you match based on values and interests, making it easier to meet people on your level. The independent bootstrapped tech company ranked in the FT1000 2020 list as one of the fastest-growing companies in Europe. The company was also the winner of Deloitte’s Technology Fast 50 in The Netherlands in 2018.

title: (Senior) Data-analist
summary:
Naast deze werkzaamheden verzorgen wij bovendien de schadebehandeling, marketing en verkoop.
Als Data-analist ontvang je een salaris van maximaal € 4.601,-…
description: De data-analist transformeert, uit verschillende bronnen afkomstige, ongestructureerde data tot geoptimaliseerde data in een analysevriendelijk formaat en legt deze vast in een datawarehouse. Door het analyseren van data voorzie de je de organisatie van data gedreven inzichten en voorspellingen. Hiervoor ontwikkel je de benodigde (SQL) selecties en machine learning modellen. Middels het realiseren van (management)rapportages en/of interactieve dashboards worden data en voorspellingen door jou gevisualiseerd voor interne en externe belanghebbenden.  Het betreft een functie binnen de afdeling datamanagement. Op de afdeling zijn momenteel zeven gedreven data-analisten werkzaam die zich onder andere bezighouden met het realiseren van risicopremiemodellen, fraudemodellen en het in informatie voorzien van de organisatie. Naast dat je nauw samenwerkt met de andere data-analisten stem je veel van het werk af met interne en externe belanghebbenden.  Taken en verantwoordelijkheden Extraheren en transformeren van bedrijfsdata op zodanige wijze dat een goede basis voor het creëren van gevraagde inzichten in de data is gewaarborgd; Ontwikkelen van voorspellende modellen door gebruik te maken van een verscheidenheid aan technieken, zoals machine learning, process mining, data-analyse en toegepaste statistiek; Analyseren van data op (gedrags)patronen en deze vertalen naar concrete feedback voor de gebruikers; Realiseren van heldere overzichten op basis van informatieverzoeken; Visualiseren van data door dashboards en managementrapportages te ontwikkelen en beheren; Verantwoordelijkheid dragen voor de architectuur en de conventies van het datawarehouse, de rapportages en het modellenlandschap; Documenteren en testen van het eigen werk of dat van collega’s; Aanmoedigen van de organisatie om datagedreven te werken.  Functie-eisen BSc/MSc werk- en denkniveau, in de richting van econometrie, (bedrijfs)wiskunde, (bedrijfskundige) informatica, artificial intelligence of vergelijkbaar; Kennis van en ervaring in het programmeren met één of meerdere technieken zoals TSQL, R, Python, Data Analysis Expressions (DAX), of vergelijkbaar; Kennis van Microsoft BI Tooling, zoals SSIS, SSRS, SSAS, Power BI, is een pre; Medior niveau: Minimaal twee jaar relevante werkervaring, voor een senior vragen wij minimaal vijf jaar relevante ervaring; Kennis van en ervaring met data engineering; Kennis van en ervaring met data-analyse en het visualiseren van de data; Kennis van en ervaring met het analyseren en modelleren van (ongestructureerde) data in datagedreven oplossingen; Kennis van Big data, machine learning technieken, artificial intelligence en deep learning; Analytisch sterk onderlegd, flexibel, zelfstandig en communicatief vaardig.  Wat bieden wij jou? Een leuke en uitdagende functie bij een organisatie met korte lijnen, open cultuur en informele werksfeer. Als Data-analist ontvang je een salaris van maximaal € 4.601,- bruto per maand, als senior Data-analist is een maximaal salaris van € 4.918,- bruto per maand mogelijk. De CAO voor het Verzekeringsbedrijf is van toepassing. Daarnaast hebben we uitstekende secundaire arbeidsvoorwaarden zoals een 13e maand, pensioenregeling via werkgever, flexibele werktijden en de mogelijkheid tot het volgen van cursussen en opleidingen.  Over ons Turien & Co. Assuradeuren B.V. in Alkmaar en Ansvar verzekeringsmaatschappij N.V. in Amsterdam vallen samen onder de Turien & Co. Holding. De functie bevat werkzaamheden voor beide bedrijfsonderdelen. De standplaats van deze functie is Alkmaar.  Turien & Co. Assuradeuren biedt een uitgebreid pakket verzekeringen aan van meerdere verzekeraars. Wij zijn hierbij de 'gevolmachtigde partij'. Dit betekent dat wij werkzaamheden uitvoeren namens de verzekeraar, zoals het accepteren, wijzigen en beëindigen van verzekeringen en het innen van premies. Naast deze werkzaamheden verzorgen wij bovendien de schadebehandeling, marketing en verkoop. Ansvar is dé duurzame verzekeraar, hieraan wordt invulling gegeven door een duurzaam beleggingsbeleid. Maar ook door hoogwaardige producten en de manier van zaken doen; vol overtuiging bouwen aan duurzame relaties.  Geïnteresseerd? Ben je enthousiast geworden over dit profiel en denk jij degene te zijn die wij graag aan ons team toevoegen? Dan nodigen wij je graag uit om jouw sollicitatie (motivatiebrief en CV) voor 28 maart as. te richten aan de afdeling P&O: personeelszaken@turien.nl.  Voor nadere informatie kun je contact opnemen met de manager Datamanagement, Bram van Empelen, te bereiken op telefoonnummer: 06- 29 126 046.  De volledige sollicitatieprocedure bestaat uit twee sollicitatiegesprekken, een pre-employmentscreening, een referentiecheck en een social-mediacheck.

title: Stage Data Analytics en/of Data Science
summary:
Ad hoc klantenkaart data analyses tbv merchandising teams, marketing teams en customer data & retention team.
Jouw nieuwe baan en werkplek.
description: Jouw nieuwe baan en werkplek Ben jij een enthousiaste student(e) met een flinke dosis motivatie en opzoek naar een leerzame stage bij Ahold Delhaize? Bekijk dan de volgende vacature:  Dit ga je bij ons doen Met onze klantenkaart en app hebben we toegang tot een grote hoeveelheid klantenkaart en transactie data, waar we klantsegmentaties mee hebben gemaakt, en analyses kunnen doen op klant of transactie niveau. Dit staat nog in de kinderschoenen maar de mogelijkheden zijn natuurlijk eindeloos. Voor de stage zijn we op zoek naar iemand die kan ondersteunen bij data analyses, en/of eventueel zelfs mooie data science modellen op zetten, enerzijds met onze klantenkaart- en transactie data, maar ook met Nielsen marktdata. Je gaat direct bijdragen aan de dagelijkse operatie van het team en hierin aan de gang met eigen en gezamenlijke projecten. Je werkt hierbij samen met de Loyalty data scientist, business analist, andere afdelingen binnen Etos en Nielsen. Ben jij iemand met sterke analytische skills en eventueel full on programmeer ervaring of interesse in data science, dan hebben wij echt een superleuke plek voor jou in ons team. Je gaat je onder andere bezighouden met: Ondersteunen bij wekelijkse en periodieke klantenkaart programma performance analyse Wekelijkse analyse email performance (omzet uplift, transactie uplift) Ad hoc klantenkaart data analyses tbv merchandising teams, marketing teams en customer data & retention team Eventueel meehelpen met bouwen nieuwe klanten segmentaties en algoritmes ten behoeve van bijvoorbeeld email klantenselectie Nielsen marktdata periodieke markaandelen analyses Verbeteringen aanbrengen in de periodieke Nielsen analyses Support en uitleg aan leveranciers mbt klantenkaart data rapportages\  Jouw nieuwe werkplek Bij Etos, onderdeel van Ahold Delhaize, hebben we maar één doel: mensen helpen en inspireren om gezonder en gelukkiger te leven. Werken bij Etos betekent werken bij een organisatie in transitie. Je helpt mee in het vormgeven van de (online) drogist van nu én in de toekomst. De afdeling E-commerce is verantwoordelijk voor de online kanalen zoals de webshop en email. Via het loyalty programma genaamd 'Etos Extra' kunnen deze kanalen worden gepersonaliseerd, met als doel het binden van de klanten aan het merk Etos. Dit doen we mede door het spaarprogramma, het aanbieden van extra acties aan onze deelnemers en het versturen van diverse digitale nieuwsbrieven met beauty & gezondheidstips en inspiratie voor jonge ouders. De twee data scientisten werken nauw samen met bijvoorbeeld de business analisten binnen Marketing, maar ook met de afdelingen Digital, Campagne en Merchandise. Onze doelstelling is om klanten loyaler te maken en te inspireren met relevante kortingen en informatie. Normaliter werk je vanuit ons bruisende hoofdkantoor in Zaandam, op de vijfde etage. Vanwege de huidige situatie is thuis jouw nieuwe werkplek.  Dit bieden we jou Interessante en veelzijdige stageplaats voor 5 of 6 maanden; Veel verantwoordelijkheid en ruimte voor eigen initiatieven; Een kijkje op de afdeling waar meegedacht en –gewerkt kan worden aan alle vernieuwingen en verbetering voor de winkel en de medewerker; De Ahold Delhaize internship experience (borrels, events en netwerken met alle stagiairs binnen het hoofdkantoor); Goede stage- en reiskostenvergoeding (450-500 euro per maand plus reiskostenvergoeding); Stage waarin je échte werkervaring opdoet in het veld! Mogelijkheid tot afstuderen in combinatie met 4 dagen meewerken. Dit breng je mee HBO/WO werk- en denkniveau met gewenste afstudeerrichting; Studie (Commerciële) Economie, Econometrie of Data Science, of aanverwante studies. Andere studierichtingen niet uitgesloten, maar wel met duidelijke motivatie Affiniteit met retail en ‘hands on’ mentaliteit. Je werkt zelfstandig en bent in staat om prioriteiten te stellen Een passie voor data en mogelijk data science Een sterke analyticus die snel situaties kan doorgronden en tot de kern komt Kennis en ervaring met analystic tools of data science en ervaring met een of meerdere programmeertalen zoals Python, PySpark, R is een pré." Solliciteer en kom binnen Werken bij Etos betekent flexibel werken. Vanuit huis en op ons hoofdkantoor in Zaandam. Wil je mee bouwen aan het succes van Etos? Solliciteer direct, en zeker vóór 21 maart. We willen je vragen om geen standaard motivatiebrief te sturen, maar een antwoord te formuleren op de volgende vragen: Waarom zou je bij Etos stage willen lopen? Waarom denk jij dat je geschikt bent voor deze stageplek? Vermijd woorden die in deze vacaturetekst staan en houd het persoonlijk. Wat is een van je sterke punten en welke vaardigheid zou je (verder) willen ontwikkelen tijdens deze stage? Eerst meer weten voordat je de stap maakt? Fleur Wijtman vertelt je meer over deze vacature via fleur.wijtman@etos.nl. Algemene vragen over stages kan je mailen naar stage@aholddelhaize.com  Wat bieden we? Als vulploegmedewerker bij Etos ontvang je een uitstekend salaris en goede secundaire arbeidsvoorwaarden. Gezelligheid Afwisselend werk Goed worden in adviseren en verkopen Leren om service- en klantgericht te zijn Leren en groeien in vakgebied Expertise opbouwen Beste drogisterij van Nederland 2018 Medewerkersbetrokkenheid 88%

title: Email Marketing and Automation Specialist
summary:
2-5 years of experience with marketing automation and email marketing, preferably with Sendinblue.
Partner with our data analyst to provide critical marketing…
description: Do you want to hop on board our rocketship and become part of a fast-paced, dynamic, SaaS start-up? And are you ready to join us on our mission to make all audio accessible? Keep reading! We are looking for a data-driven, perfectionist marketer, with experience in automation and email marketing. As a specialist, you are going to leverage our user base of over 1 million customers from 150 countries and join our international marketing team in our hyper-growth journey. About Amberscript “We value taking ownership and setting ourselves ambitious goals while staying genuine and delighting customers.” We are Amberscript, a dynamic startup with the goal of making audio accessible by transforming it into text. With the best speech-recognition algorithms on the market, we save our customers hundreds of thousands of hours of manual labor and we enable thousands of people with auditory impairments (deaf and hard of hearing) to understand video and audio more easily. We are in the process of disrupting a very traditional market (transcription & subtitling). Now that we have achieved product-market fit, we are scaling rapidly. Our AI speech-to-text engine obtains the best results in the market, as proven by independent tests in the media. Our product is being used by 1 million+ users worldwide. The profile of a Marketing and Automation Amber: 2-5 years of experience with marketing automation and email marketing, preferably with Sendinblue Experience with B2B and B2C campaigns, MQL systems and nurturing campaigns Deep understanding of email best practices HTML/CSS knowledge highly desirable Fluent in English and preferably another European language Attention to detail and analytical mindset Entrepreneurial by nature, you love to be around people and to improve yourself Self-organized ‘go-getter’ mentality You can work with little or no supervision and you are results-driven Flexibility to work in a startup environment with team members from all over the world A strong passion for disruptive technology. Responsibilities: Implement marketing automation across the Amberscript website Develop a strategy for automated campaign workflows Create, test, deploy and track email campaigns, landing pages, and lead generation forms alongside our data analyst. Partner with our data analyst to provide critical marketing metrics, custom reports, and actionable insights to enable data-driven decisions Work in campaign concepts for different sectors and markets, create messaging, and campaign deliverables with email best practices, and ensure mobile-responsive designs Manage and maintain email calendar Benefits: Work from home opportunities Discounted/free food Free drinks Stock options Job Types: Full-time, Contract Work Remotely: Temporarily due to COVID-19 COVID-19 Precaution(s): Remote interview process Virtual meetings Sanitizing, disinfecting, or cleaning procedures in place

title: Data Analyst Internship
summary:
You have a willingness to understand and contribute to the marketing data infrastructure.
At Packaly we're looking for a Data Analyst Intern to increase our…
description: At Packaly we're looking for a Data Analyst Intern to increase our analytical power and together with our Growth team explore new directions. Internship · Packaly HQ About the job Being part of the growth team gives you the position to work on the new technology we build and contribute to the directions we take. Our growth team is growing every month and you are part of the foundation of our platform and help the company shape it's decisions smarter and faster. What are your main responsibilities? You contribute to build analytical business solutions. You improve the efficiency of our products and software from a data driven perspective. You work on tasks that include, but are not limited to data pipelines, data warehousing, building dashboards, predictive analysis, and algorithmic implementation. You are willing to investigate and build multiple projection frameworks for analysis You have a willingness to understand and contribute to the marketing data infrastructure. You improve and streamline the current data infrastructure in close corporation with the Growth team. Contributing to a greener world, one parcel at a time. Our mission What are we looking for? Great knowledge of SQL Similar experience in a role or the drive to learn on the go Enthusiastic and pro-active attitude with ability to motivate others Great verbal and written communication skills in English (B1 or B2) Ready for a fast-paced and flexible working environment You have a data-driven mindset and proven problem-solving skills Not a 09:00 till 17:00 mentality Available for 6 months internship period You are inquisitive and forward-thinking - curious and thoughtful, questioning the status-quo You are very thorough and attentive to detail  You have a passion for sustainability You have a valid EU work permit and live in The Netherlands Cool, you are still there? Bravo! It’s good to know what kind of culture we have at Packaly. We are a startup, which means that you just need to watch all seasons of Silicon Valley and you are up to date… No, just kidding. Here are 3 examples that probably will explain our culture best: We don’t have a 9:00 till 17:00 mentality. Our CEO starts his day at 5:30 with a run, where our CTO starts his day at 9:20 with the standup from his living room when he is working from home. We don’t mind working from home, just make sure that you don’t miss your standup meeting at 9:30 or any other meeting that is planned for your day. It’s 16:30, Monday afternoon and the sun is doing his thing pretty well today. Time to grab some cold beers from the fridge and join the rest of the team for a quick recap of the day, the latest news or latest Netflix episodes that keep you busy at night. Last minute appointment with a friend, need to leave the office earlier than you expected? We don’t take track of time, we just make sure our work is done on time! Sounds pretty straightforward to me. When you onboard to the team you will be handed all the information you need on a silver plate. We call it The Packaly Handbook. This is what we offer you: Open vacation policy. We don’t mind how many days, just check with your team that the work still gets done. We do not count vacation days. Free lunch, tea, coffee, snacks, soda or whatever you fancy! Relaxed, informal ways of working and sociable colleagues. Every week we have drinks with the team around a ping pong table, or remote! A great network of influencers, potential lifetime friends, talented geeks and promoting connections. FREE SPOTIFY to listen to the Packaly Spotify Office tunes Great startup compensation pack. Internship fee of €350,- A great office in the center of Utrecht, with all it's great benefits. Working from home during COVID-19.

title: Supply Chain Analyst – English – Utrecht
summary: As the Supply Chain Analyst you will define and execute the inventory strategy to ensure product availability to meet customer requirements.
description: As the Supply Chain Analyst you will define and execute the inventory strategy to ensure product availability to meet customer requirements. Delivering in line with the business Supply Chain strategies and processes you will balance demand to ensure volumes are within the targeted solution. Collaborating cross-functionally with Sales/ Marketing, Distribution, Finance, Customer Care, Regulatory & Quality you will lead category strategy, cost reduction initiatives, lead time forecasting and on-time delivery, quality, supplier performance, supplier consolidation/ rationalization and improve on vendor relationships. Responsibilities Review business forecast and create purchasing and production plans. Develop and monitor KPIs to measure production and supplier performance, issue and distribute reports to management. Manage vendor relationships and drive year-over-year performance improvements with quality, delivery, costs. Drive continuous improvements to achieve cost targets. Define and manage winning category strategies and approaches with suppliers. Act independently to prescribe methods and innovative approaches on new and special assignments. Support goals and objectives as established by management. Ensure master data is set in alignment with distribution strategy. Provide program ownership and governance for the maintenance of accurate planning lead times. Requirements Bachelor’s degree or equivalent preferably in Supply Chain/ Finance/ Business Administration/ Engineering Professional experience within Supply Chain, Planning or related function End to end supplier/contract manufacturer experience Experienced in KPI and performance setting Advanced Microsoft Excel User Highly adaptable and able to work in a fast paced environment Plans effectively and works well in a team or individually Strategic thinker with hands-on mentality Fast learner who is able to work independently Solution focused with a high level of self-motivation, drive and tenacity Fluent written and spoken English Ability to work with little supervision

title: Junior Data Analist (Marketing)
summary:
Zijn woorden als big data, data science en data marketing jou op het lijf geschreven?
Voor de functie van data analist is nog geen vastomlijnd profiel, maar…
description: Bedrijf Ben jij net hbo of wo afgestudeerd? Ga jij grote hoeveelheden data niet uit de weg? Zijn woorden als big data, data science en data marketing jou op het lijf geschreven? Lees dan snel verder! Onze klant in Utrecht is op zoek naar net afgestudeerde dataspecialisten die klaar om in te stappen in hun trein voor uitdagingen op het gebied van data-analyse, dataverwerking en alles wat hierbij komt kijken. Op het gebied van klant gedrag gaat dit bedrijf net een stap verder dan andere bedrijven. Met zo’n 20 man personeel, helpen zij de eindklant met het registreren, analyseren en interpreteren van hun klant gedrag. Door zowel on- als offline kanalen samen te voegen, zijn zij in staat om een uitgebreid klantprofiel te creëren. Functie Omdat zij de toekomst in handen hebben en hier graag in door willen groeien, zoeken zij een zeer gemotiveerde starter (één of twee jaar ervaring is ook welkom!) die zijn eigen pad kan gaan bepalen binnen het bedrijf. Na een gedegen inwerkperiode ga jij samen met je collega’s aan de slag bij een van de eindklanten om te bepalen welke werkwijze nodig is, welke tools en technieken nodig zijn en door dit te combineren zet je een platform neer waar de klant uiteindelijk zijn marketingstrategieën op kan baseren. Voor de functie van data analist is nog geen vastomlijnd profiel, maar zoeken ze iemand die affiniteit heeft met de online wereld en op een enthousiaste manier de klanten kan adviseren met betrekking tot het optimaal inzetten van de online data. Om zo relevanter te kunnen zijn in hun uitingen naar de eigen klanten. Eisen Hbo/ wo Informatica of andere relevante opleiding Maximaal 2 jaar werk ervaring Ervaring met data analyse Consultancy vaardigheden Aanbod Salaris tussen de € 2250,- en € 3000,- Mogelijkheid om 4 dagen te werken (4 x 9) 8 % vakantiegeld Flexibele werktijden Auto van de zaak

title: Data Scientist bij Transavia
summary:
Denk aan marketing & sales, revenue management, planning & scheduling, technische dienst, het operations control center, etc.
Wij zoeken jou als Data Scientist.
description: Wij zoeken jou als Data Scientist  Voor ons Strategy, Data & Intelligence (SDI) team bij Transavia zijn wij op zoek naar een Data Scientist. Dit team leidt de transformatie naar het data-gedreven werken, adviseert afdelingen aan de hand van informatie en inzichten, en bouwt aan data- en AI-oplossingen voor klanten en medewerkers van Transavia. Het team is opgericht om Transavia naar een hoger niveau te brengen in Data & Analytics.  Als Data Scientist ontwikkel je een brede range aan advanced analytics en ML/AI oplossingen: van recommenders tot forecasting modellen en decision support tools. Heb jij een passie voor slimme modellen en optimalisatie strategieën? Ben jij gedreven om de business nog slimmer te laten werken en klanten beter te servicen met advanced analytics en ML/AI oplossingen? Dan ben jij mogelijk de Data Scientist naar wie wij op zoek zijn!  Wat ga je doen? Je werkt aan AI, Machine Learning en Optimization oplossingen voor de verschillende domeinen binnen Transavia. Denk aan marketing & sales, revenue management, planning & scheduling, technische dienst, het operations control center, etc. Samen met een Data Analyst en/of Engineer vertaal je de doelstellingen van het AI/ML product door in data (kwaliteits)vereisten en een opzet voor het experiment/prototype of nieuwe release. Samen met de Data Engineers werk je aan de data en machine learning pipelines om het model in productie te kunnen zetten in onze Microsoft Azure cloud omgeving. De resultaten deel je (tussentijds) middels visuals en dashboards. Met andere woorden, je werkt aan de AI/ML oplossingen van begin tot eind: van concept, ontwikkeling en implementatie tot beheer en monitoring van de tools in productie; van MVP/prototype tot verschillende opvolgende releases. Zo optimaliseren we flight schedules, automatiseren we real time aanbevelingen voor klanten, forecasten we de benodigde crew standby en call center bezetting of bedenken we hoe we ons netwerk en vluchtschema kunnen optimaliseren.  Je zal onderdeel uitmaken van het Strategy, Data & Intelligence (SDI) team dat naast Data Scientists bestaat uit de Lead SDI, Lead Data Scientist, Analytics Translators, Data Engineers, Data Analysts en Business Consultants. Je zal veel samenwerken met jouw SDI collega’s, de business en onze (data) collega’s bij Transavia Frankrijk.   Wie ben jij? Je herkent je in onze waarden daadkrachtig, bevlogen, verantwoordelijk en vriendelijk, én je hebt dat “tikkeltje lef”; Je hebt een WO-diploma in een business analytics of data science gerelateerde studie en/of relevante ervaring in een data science positie; Je bent beschikbaar voor minimaal 32 uur per week; Je spreekt en schrijft vloeiend Nederlands en Engels.  Als Data Scientist Heb je data science kennis (vanuit zowel de theorie als praktijk) op het gebied van advanced analytics, machine learning, operations research, statistics, data visualization, software engineering, model interpretation, etc; Gebruik je deze kennis om een probleem uit de business te vertalen naar een wiskundige en technische oplossing; Kun je problemen, maar ook kansen identificeren en begrijpen. Daarnaast ben je in staat om je data om te zetten in een concreet advies waar jij zelf, of het team, mee aan de slag kan; Heb je kennis van verschillende AI/ML best practices en ben je continu op zoek hoe je de kwaliteit van onze producten kan verbeteren (en hoe dit breed in het team toegepast kan worden); Heb je ervaring met Python en veelgebruikte packages (bijv. Pandas, Numpy, Scikit-learn, Keras, Tensorflow, Pyspark, etc.) of soortgelijke programmeertalen en de ambitie om Python te leren; Kun je goed overweg met SQL, Git en CLI. Ervaring met Cloud en/of MLops is een pré; Werk je agile. Wat je ontdekt, pas je gelijk toe.  Wat kun je van ons verwachten? Werken voor dé nummer 1 budgetluchtvaartmaatschappij; Vrijheid om je functie naar eigen inzicht vorm te geven; Veel ruimte en initiatieven voor persoonlijke ontwikkeling; (afhankelijk van salaris) een eindejaarsuitkering; 22 verlof- en 4 adv dagen o.b.v. een fulltime dienstverband; Vriendelijke en bevlogen collega’s; Last but not least; ben je reislustig, dan is onze IPB regeling (tegen mooie tarieven vliegen indien plaats beschikbaar) zeker de moeite waard! Deze functie is ingeschaald in een functiegroep 10 of 11. Afhankelijk van kennis en ervaring doen wij een aanbieding van tussen de € 3.202,- en € 6.120,- euro bruto per maand op basis van een fulltime dienstverband.  Over Transavia Ons motto is: ‘We make low cost feel good.’ We zetten daarbij graag een stap extra voor onze passagiers en voor elkaar. De sfeer in de organisatie kenmerkt zich door bevlogen medewerkers met een groen hart! Elke dag werken we met elkaar samen om een gemeenschappelijk doel te behalen: een memorabele klantbeleving.  Transavia is een dynamische organisatie (never a dull moment) die continu probeert bij te blijven in een veranderende luchtvaartwereld. Wil jij graag werken in een omgeving met enthousiaste daadkrachtig collega’s die oog hebben voor elkaar? Krijg je energie van verandering en vernieuwing en voel jij je het prettigst in een omgeving waar je regisseur bent van je eigen werk? Dan komen we graag met jou in contact.  Is deze functie jou op het lijf geschreven en wil je solliciteren? Ben jij de Data Scientist die wij zoeken en kom je ons team versterken? Solliciteer dan direct via onderstaande button. Heb je vragen over deze vacature? Neem dan contact op ons via recruitment@transavia.com  Werk je bij een bureau en wil je een kandidaat voorstellen voor deze vacature als Data Scientist bij Transavia? Bedankt, maar hier gaan we niet op in. We werven onze nieuwe collega graag zelf.

title: Digitaal Platform Strateeg
summary:
(zoals product owner, e-commerce manager, conversie specialist, digitaal strateeg, web- of business-analist);
Dan is deze rol écht iets voor jou!
description: Voor ons kantoor in Amsterdam of Rotterdam zoeken we een Digitaal Platform Strateeg met een track record in e-commerce, die het als uitdaging ziet om digitale platformen beter, effectiever en leuker te maken! Als leading digital agency streven wij naar de beste online-oplossingen en tevreden klanten. Als Digitaal Platform Strateeg met een specialisatie in het (door)ontwikkelen van digitale producten, bij voorkeur in e-commerce, heb jij daar veel invloed op! Ben jij op zoek naar de volgende stap in je carrière waarbij je vanuit je jarenlange expertise een bredere verantwoordelijkheid pakt voor het neerzetten of de doorontwikkeling van digitale platformen? Dan is deze rol écht iets voor jou! Als Digital Platform Strateeg adem je digital en ben je constant aan het nadenken over de gezonde balans tussen doorontwikkeling van een digitaal platform. Je bent assertief, kent de markt als geen ander en hebt een scherp oog voor ontwikkelingen die klanten helpen hun digitale business te versnellen en kunt dit helder uitleggen. Door jouw manier van communiceren win je het vertrouwen van de klant en ziet die jou als belangrijke gesprekspartner, op operationeel, tactisch én strategisch niveau. Jij bent een held in adviserend verkopen en spot commerciële kansen die je samen met de accountmanager vertaalt in voorstellen voor de klant. Je geeft vorm aan de visie en strategie en vertaalt deze door naar functionele roadmaps en backlogs, waarin duidelijk wordt waaraan het team van designers, developers en marketeers gaat werken. Je zorgt ervoor dat de juiste experts aangehaakt worden, maar kijkt graag mee en zorgt ervoor dat geen onderwerp zoals als IT, design, digital marketing of meetbaarheid over het hoofd is gezien. Oftewel: onder jouw toezicht zorg je voor geweldige digitale platformen en tevreden klanten. Klinkt dit je als muziek in de oren? We zijn een jong bedrijf en de knapste koppen werken elke dag voor een breed scala aan klanten, zoals Bugaboo, Bol.com, Eneco en Takeaway. We willen het liefst de meest getalenteerde experts aan boord, maar we zijn ook op zoek naar de perfecte Dept-fit. Iemand die er niet voor terugdeinst om te leren, te inspireren en te streven naar een betere wereld. Iemand die vooruit kijkt, het podium durft te pakken, en die op vrijdagmiddag met ons proost op een geslaagde week. JIJ: Hebt een afgeronde WO-opleiding in de richting van business, innovatie of design; Hebt -5 jaar ervaring met het (door)ontwikkelen van digitale producten; bij voorkeur binnen e-commerce. (zoals product owner, e-commerce manager, conversie specialist, digitaal strateeg, web- of business-analist); Hebt ervaring in het ontwikkelen van een productvisie, meerjarenstrategie en roadmaps; Bent op zoek naar de volgende stap in je carrière waarbij vanuit je expertise een bredere verantwoordelijkheid pakt voor het neerzetten of de doorontwikkeling van digitale platformen; Hebt geweldige communicatieve skills waarmee je het vertrouwen wint van de klant en zo zorgt dat die jou als belangrijke gesprekspartner, op operationeel, tactisch en strategisch niveau ziet. Wilt het best mogelijk platform maken voor onze klanten die ze helpt hun doelen te bereiken en vergeet niet de eindgebruikers centraal te stellen; Ontwikkelt de digitale visie en strategie via cocreatie en interactieve workshops en houdt je interne en externe stakeholders betrokken. Gebruikt data of gebruikersonderzoek om je keuzes te onderbouwen; Kijkt verder dan alleen de (door)ontwikkeling van het platform en helpt onze klanten bij het organiseren van het digitale team; Bent ondernemend, gezellig om mee te werken en weet mensen te motiveren en inspireren. Combineert inhoud en vorm, bijvoorbeeld met gelikte presentaties; Spreekt vloeiend Nederlands en Engels. WIJ BIEDEN: Een open cultuur; Een door ons gefaciliteerde thuiswerk setup; Een bijdrage aan je pensioen opbouw; De mogelijkheid om je skills nog verder te ontwikkelen en trainen; Lekker en gezond eten; Twee keer per week bootcamp die niets kost; Een spetterende vrijmibo en legendarische teamuitjes; Een NS-Business Card; Een laptop en een telefoon. WIE ZIJN WIJ? Hi, wij zijn Dept – een internationale agency met de meest ervaren denkers & doeners. Eén agency waar creativiteit, technologie en data samenkomen. Wij helpen met het opnieuw uitvinden & versnellen van jouw digitale werkelijkheid door het creëren van ervaringen die mensen willen en organisaties nodig hebben. Solliciteer nu via Whatsapp, stuur ons je CV op 06 824 42 120 !

title: Oil Market Analyst - Energy Insights
summary: We offer services along the oil and gas value chain, including exploration and production, refining and marketing, natural gas, trading and oil field services,…
description: QUALIFICATIONS Graduate or post-graduate degree in management, engineering, economics, energy finance or any other quantitative focused discipline from a top tier university Proven interest in energy sector (e.g. through degrees, courses, internships or work experience) Advanced Excel skills Superior problem solving and analytical skills Strong interpersonal effectiveness Proven people skills and ability to thrive in a complex and dynamic environment Excellent written and oral communication skills Proficiency in English; other foreign language skills is a plus WHO YOU'LL WORK WITH You will be based in our Amsterdam office as part of our Energy Insights team. Energy Insights, a specialist data and analytics unit, provides distinctive analysis, insights, and support to energy players. We offer services along the oil and gas value chain, including exploration and production, refining and marketing, natural gas, trading and oil field services, and equipment. Energy Insights’ dedicated specialists apply proprietary tools and methodologies and a data-driven approach. With our strong ties with McKinsey’s oil and gas consulting practice and access to the expertise of the wider McKinsey network, our research and analysis yield knowledge available nowhere else. WHAT YOU'LL DO You will research global oil markets and help update our Energy Insights perspectives on a periodic basis with the help of the broader Energy Insights team. Your focus will be on the upstream oil sector and how the players are responding to the changing market conditions (e.g. energy transition, decarbonization). You will also collaborate with your McKinsey colleagues from other industries to validate research hypotheses. Daily problem solving will be an important part of your job and you’ll do this in partnership with your manager, the leadership of Energy Insights and a range of colleagues within the wider firm. Over time, you will have the opportunity to contribute to the strategic direction of your area and help develop new and more detailed projections. You will deepen your global energy markets expertise and based on your knowledge, you will increasingly become the person-to-go-to in your content area, available for questions from colleagues as well as clients. This can potentially also include longer-term staffing on client-serving projects. You will also contribute to the strategic direction of your area and help develop new and more detailed forecasts.

title: Sr Central Operations Analyst (Electrification), EMEA
summary: Uber has commited to become a 100% electric platform in London & Amsterdam, and 50% electric across seven major European capitals by 2025 (external commitment).
description: About the Role Uber has commited to become a 100% electric platform in London & Amsterdam, and 50% electric across seven major European capitals by 2025 (external commitment). This is a key step on our journey to be fully electric in major US, Canadian, and European cities by 2030. These are very ambitious goals, and hitting them goals would put us a decade ahead of Paris Climate Agreement targets. This is a unique opportunity to be part of the team which will manage, grow and fulfill our Sustainability Commitments in Europe. The Sr Central Operations Analyst will play a crucial role in informing the strategy and investments we pursue as well as enabling us to report externally on our progress. This role requires strong technical capabilities balanced with eye for business, the ability to project manage across a wide range of partners and comfort communicating and presenting findings. A genuine passion for delivering our Sustainability commitments is a must. What You'll Do Work across the different workstreams of the Central Ops Electrification Program completing bespoke pieces of analysis to determine strategy, future investments and to understand the impact of electrification efforts. Examples include pricing modelling and recommendations for zero emissions products, analysing our vehicle emissions data, estimating geographic demand for electric charging infrastructure and analysing the impact of past experiments and rider facing product launches Scope potential new growth opportunities e.g. feasibility to launch a rider facing Green product in different markets, estimating size of opportunities and competitive dynamics Centralize and standardize electrification data and reporting across EMEA. Own target setting models.
