Build out and maintain dashboards and share outs, driving understanding and performance of electrification efforts (driver and rider), and to drive the EV performance of local operations Build out decks and storylines to explain to LT and stakeholders our strategic recommendations and to report on past results Deliver a set of data analysis and insights that will support the successful execution of our Electrification commitments across the EMEA region. Partner with other functions (Product, Policy & Comms) to maximize the things we value of Uber electrification program. What You'll Need** ** Minimum 5 years of demonstrated experience in Data Analytics, Operations or Data Science. Data-driven business judgment through strong analytical thinking and experimentation. Background in banking, consulting, technology or automotive companies. Strong technical skills: Data Science / Analytics including: advanced experience in data manipulation (SQL, Google Sheets) and experience in statistics and modelling (Multivariable regression and simple time series analysis) Data pipelining, API connections, Web-scraping (intermediate python experience). Strong problem solving skills - ability to solve problems with technical business, through critical thinking and understanding of the operational impact of the work. Experience in crafting presentations, including: building out compelling storylines, presenting data to audiences and distilling the key messages Strong project management skills. The ability to prioritise and successfully drive a project from beginning to end and to work across multiple projects simultaneously. Proven experience in engaging with diverse sets of partners. Great teammate -you will work with a range teams (Legal, Product, Marketing, local and regional operations) and will need to adapt to support teams get the job done Ability to take initiative in a constantly-changing work environment and execute quickly At Uber, we ignite opportunity by setting the world in motion. We take on big problems to help drivers, riders, delivery partners, and eaters get moving in more than 10,000 cities around the world. We welcome people from all backgrounds who seek the opportunity to help build a future where everyone and everything can move independently. If you have the curiosity, passion, and collaborative spirit, work with us, and let's move the world forward, together.

title: Digital Strategy Consultant (DigitalBCG)
summary:
In a corporate role focused on technology/digital initiatives (e.g. business analyst);
In a tech start-up leadership role; or in a "consulting-like" industry (e…
description: Location: Amsterdam Geography: Europe & The Middle East Capabilities: Big data & advanced analytics, Strategy, Technology & digital, Transformation and BCG TURN Industries: Automotive & Mobility, Biopharmaceuticals, Consumer products, Energy & environment, Engineered products & infrastructure, Financial institutions, Health care payers & providers, Insurance, Media & entertainment, Medical devices & technology, Metals & mining, Process industries & building materials, Public sector, Retail, Technology industries, Telecommunications, Transportation, travel & tourism Who We Are Boston Consulting Group partners with leaders in business and society to tackle their most important challenges and capture their greatest opportunities. BCG was the pioneer in business strategy when it was founded in 1963. Today, we help clients with total transformation-inspiring complex change, enabling organizations to grow, building competitive advantage, and driving bottom-line impact.  To succeed, organizations must blend digital and human capabilities. Our diverse, global teams bring deep industry and functional expertise and a range of perspectives to spark change. BCG delivers solutions through leading-edge management consulting along with technology and design, corporate and digital ventures—and business purpose. We work in a uniquely collaborative model across the firm and throughout all levels of the client organization, generating results that allow our clients to thrive.   Digital BCG BCG has a long history of driving growth by embracing innovation and new ways of thinking. Through DigitalBCG, we bring together a diverse mix of consultants and digital specialists to ensure that we are supporting our clients throughout their digital transformation journeys. We work with our clients to fully understand the impact of digital on their business and set priorities that will transform their vision into value. Whether it be developing new technologies to support their core business, making better use of their data, or pursuing entirely new sources of revenue, our aim is to achieve radical improvements in productivity, flexibility, and speed. We are innovating how our clients are using artificial intelligence, robotic process automation, internet of things, personalization, blockchain technologies, and more to gain competitive advantage.  DigitalBCG encompasses a broad set of data, digital, and technology capabilities from BCG consulting teams and practices, along with our business units such as BCG Digital Ventures, BCG Platinion, and BCG GAMMA. Practice Area Profile BCG’s Technology Advantage (TA) practice focuses on helping clients deliver competitive advantage and business superior performance through the use of data, technology and digital. TA is the fastest growing practice at BCG and at the heart of the strategic impact we have with our clients. Our consultants and experts globally work across all industries and provide deep experience and expertise across a number of topics including: * Digital Transformation * Data & Digital Platforms * Software & Agile * Digitizing the Tech Function What You'll Do Our world is being driven by digital and at BCG we are at the heart of it. In DigitalBCG, you would use your expertise and generalist consulting skillset to help CEOs and their teams solve their most pressing challenges, and think about how digital and technology will change the shape of their business.  You would help your clients answer questions such as “How will AI disrupt my business model?”, “How can businesses use data and analytics to create highly-personalized outreach delivered through a seamless omnichannel experience?”, “How can I ship higher quality digital services to my customers faster by using agile?” and much more.  As a member of our team, you would work on a variety of these topics, applying your consulting skills to strategic digital, technology, and digital transformation questions.  As a Consultant, you will be given end-to-end responsibility for the larger and more complex “modules” within a BCG project, and begin to develop specialized knowledge to help you solve our clients’ problems. You’ll work closely with clients to understand their issues, create strategies for change, win buy-in for your recommendations, and collaborate with fellow BCGers to transform client potential into performance.  A broad skillset and passion for digital & technology is important. As part of our digitally-focused consulting team, you would work on a variety of digital topics, applying generalist consulting skills to strategic digital & technology questions. You will be supported by an extensive training curriculum (the same programme as all BCG consultants), plus digital-specific training and mentoring to help you build your skills. What You'll Bring (Experience & Qualifications) We’re looking for exceptional talent from consulting or industry to join us. You would typically: Have a minimum of 4 years’ experience working: with a leading consulting firm (focused on technology/digital initiatives); in a corporate role focused on technology/digital initiatives (e.g. business analyst); in a tech start-up leadership role; or in a "consulting-like" industry (e.g. digital strategy, digital marketing) Have an outstanding academic track record from a leading university Have excellent verbal and written communication skills in Dutch and English Who You'll Work With Our consultants within DigitalBCG are an integral part of BCG's core consulting team; we work side-by-side with all practice areas to create value & competitive advantage for our clients.  We offer multiple career paths for the world’s best talent to have a real impact on business and society. As part of our team, you will benefit from the breadth and diversity of what we are doing today and where we are headed next. We count on your authenticity, exceptional work, and strong integrity. In return, we are committed to supporting you in discovering the most fulfilling career journey possible—and unlocking your potential to advance the world. TO JOIN US All candidates must complete an online application to be considered. Date Posted: 01-Jan-2020 Boston Consulting Group is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, age, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity / expression, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected under national, provincial, or local law, where applicable, and those with criminal histories will be considered in a manner consistent with applicable state and local laws. BCG is an E-Verify Employer.

title: Downstream Insights Analyst - Energy Insights
summary: We offer services along the oil and gas value chain, including exploration and production, refining and marketing, natural gas, trading and oil field services,…
description: QUALIFICATIONS MBA or other graduate degree in engineering, economics or other quantitative-focused field 1-3 years of industry expertise in the downstream (e.g. refining, petrochemical) sector preferably around market risk and investments or diligence focused consulting Entrepreneurial mindset and strong stakeholder management Interpersonal effectiveness and leadership potential Strong communication, writing and problem solving skills WHO YOU'LL WORK WITH You’ll work with our McKinsey Energy Insights team and will be based in our Amsterdam office. McKinsey Energy Insights, a specialist data and analytics unit, provides distinctive analysis, insights, and support to energy players. We offer services along the oil and gas value chain, including exploration and production, refining and marketing, natural gas, trading and oil field services, and equipment. McKinsey Energy Insights dedicated specialists apply proprietary tools and methodologies and a data-driven approach. With our strong ties with McKinsey’s oil and gas consulting practice and access to the expertise of the wider McKinsey network, our research and analysis yield knowledge available nowhere else. WHAT YOU'LL DO You will deliver market analyses and forecasts for both internal and external clients and develop bespoke insights in the refining/petrochemical sector, often in a client facing consulting role In this role, you will contribute to daily problem solving, structuring, modeling and analytic support for our global downstream tools and related analyses. You will gather the information necessary to develop these tools and to synthesize your findings into targeted, McKinsey-formatted products. These products may be in the form of complex models and summary reports which evolve into standalone presentations that outline key findings and recommendations to internal and external audiences. You will deepen your downstream markets expertise, specializing in the relevant sectors over time (e.g. refining, petrochemicals) and develop your analytical approach as well as thought-partnership skills. You will work closely with senior expert practitioners to build synthesized perspectives for clients as well as state-of-the-art knowledge and analytical tools. You’ll have the opportunity to gain new skills and build on the strengths you bring to the firm. You will receive exceptional training as well as frequent coaching and mentoring from colleagues.

title: Senior Pricing Analyst
summary:
Fulltime Senior Pricing Analyst, werkgebied Nederland.
Met jouw kennis op het gebied van pricing en slimme pricingtechnieken help je mee het expertise gebied…
description: Senior Pricing Analyst   Fulltime Senior Pricing Analyst, werkgebied Nederland  Met jouw kennis op het gebied van pricing en slimme pricingtechnieken help je mee het expertise gebied Product & Pricing op te zetten en succesvol te maken. Je speelt een belangrijke rol bij de verdere professionalisering van het pricing vakgebied richting fact based waarde sturing en het ontwikkelen van nieuwe concepten in de afvalrecycling industrie. Als strategische en inhoudelijke Pricing Analyst zie jij de juiste kansen voor ons in de markt en denk je mee over nieuwe diensten en pricing strategieën. Dat je daarvoor de juiste tarieven moet berekenen, slim nadenkt en rekening houdt met verschillende (commerciële) belangen en regels, hoeven we jou niet te vertellen. Jij weet als geen ander hoe de dynamiek van de markt in elkaar steekt. Van rol containers tot het recyclen van matrassen, van multinational tot consument: jouw focus ligt op de pricing van deze nieuwe diensten. Zo houd jij onze businessmodellen up-to-date en draag jij bij aan het creëren van een optimale dienstverlening voor onze klanten. Wat ga je o.a. doen? Je bent een senior. Daarom weet je met jouw kennis, ervaring en inzet van slimme pricing strategieën en technieken de afdeling naar een hoger niveau te tillen. Jij verzamelt en interpreteert cruciale marktinformatie en brengt de invloed hiervan op de tarieven van Renewi in kaart. Vanuit jouw expertise adviseer je management over het optimale prijsbeleid en marketeers van Renewi over prijstellingen en proposities. Tactisch, strategisch en gedreven werk je nauw samen met je collega’s van het team Pricing en collega’s van Sales, Marketing, Operatie en IT om nieuwe diensten te realiseren. Je speelt een (inhoudelijk) leidende rol bij diverse strategische projecten zoals het rationaliseren van de productportfolio en het implementeren van waarde sturing binnen de divisie. Samen met je team zorg je voor de vaststelling van de prijzen van de producten van Renewi Jouw profiel Om onze dienstverlening (nog) beter te maken en nieuwe bundels en pakketten bij Renewi op de kaart te zetten, is lef, aanpakken en een hands-on mentaliteit onmisbaar “walk the talk”. Je hebt een stevige persoonlijkheid, die eenvoudig de verbinding legt en conceptueel denkt. Je staat bekend om je haarscherpe analytische vermogen en je sterke consultancy- en communicatie skills. Jij bent een positieve, overtuigende, sociale expert op je vakgebied, die: een wo-opleiding heeft afgerond, denk aan economie, econometrie, bedrijfskunde of bedrijfseconomie; minimaal 8 jaar ervaring meebrengt, opgedaan bij een organisatie die hierin al bewezen succesvol is (zoals telecom, energie, retail) precies weet hoe je succesvol nieuwe proposities ontwikkelt, prijst en optimaliseert; de ontwikkelingen in de markt op de voet volgt - sterker nog: je zet ontwikkelingen om in kansen en concrete actie en proposities; de juiste knowhow heeft als het gaat om pricingtechnieken, zoals value based pricing, pakket pricing, dynamic pricing, commodity pricing, marktonderzoek technieken zoals conjunct en nomadic; en ervaring heeft met handel en next level risicomanagement data gedreven waardesturing heeft geïmplementeerd of uitgebouwd een agile mindset heeft, gecombineerd met denken, doen en humor. Naast bovenstaande punten herken je jezelf in de volgende competenties: Overtuigingskracht, Analytisch, Nauwgezet, Integer, Innovatief, Besluitvaardig, Planmatig, optimistisch en open minded.  Waar kom je terecht? Je komt terecht in het nieuwe team Product & Pricing. Je rapporteert aan de Manager Product & Pricing en helpt hem om het vakgebied op te zetten op een data gedreven manier. De werkomgeving is dynamisch, de circulaire economie is immers volop in beweging, en uitdagend. Er heerst een open en directe cultuur waarin veel waarde wordt gehecht aan enthousiasme, humor en resultaat. Samen met jouw collega’s help jij mee aan onze missie: marktleider zijn op het gebied van waste-to-product. We willen marktleider blijven en daar hebben we ook jouw talent bij nodig! Hoe maken we jou blij? Een goed primair salaris, laptop, mobiele telefoon en goede pensioenregeling. Minimaal 27,5 vakantiedagen! De vaste feestdagen ben je al vrij. Overige arbeidsvoorwaarden conform cao Beroepsgoederenvervoer. De allerleukste online trainingen, waarbij je zelf kan bepalen wanneer, wat en hoe je leert! Een standplaats in overleg, waarbij je minimaal 2 dagen thuis mag werken (momenteel werken we fulltime thuis). Een leuk team en collega’s die zich dagelijks hard inzetten voor een betere wereld. Een uitdagende werkomgeving - met veel ruimte en vrijheid - die volop in beweging is en waarbinnen je jezelf nog verder kunt ontwikkelen en kunt doorgroeien.  Kun jij niet wachten om als Pricing Analyst aan de slag te gaan? Neem dan contact op met Michael van de Ven (Senior Recruiter) en/of Thijs de Bruijn (Manager Product & Pricing), via het contactformulier. Ben je zo enthousiast dat je direct wil solliciteren? Reageer dan uiterlijk 28 maart via de solliciteerbutton. We kijken uit naar jouw sollicitatie! De eerste gespreksronde staat gepland voor: donderdag 1 en vrijdag 2 april via MS Teams.  Side note voor bureaus: Wij geloven in de kracht van onze eigen medewerkers, dus ook in die van onze Recruiters. Om deze reden wordt Acquisitie niet op prijs gesteld. Mail je ons toch een CV dan kunnen daar geen rechten aan worden ontleend.

title: Manager Demand Planning & Market Analysis
summary: Shimano Europe Group is the intermediate between the headquarter in Japan and the European market for marketing, sales, product development and technical…
description: Manager Demand Planning & Market Analysis In the role of Manager Demand Planning & Market Analysis for the bicycle division you are responsible for the teams and systems that connect market information and customers with our global headquarter in Japan to improve the planning, delivery and supply chain for Europe. Your main responsibility is the analysis of the market and sales forecasts/customer demand planning. You manage the Market Analysts team, consisting of 4 people and you represent the Sales Administration team, which supports the sales & purchase process (e.g. order entry and customer support). Next to this you will be a leading contributor within projects focused on improvements in the interaction of ordering between key customers (e.g. bike manufacturing company's) and our global headquarter. Are you up for this role where you act as a bridge between the EU market & customer insights and our global headquarter? Then this might be your new opportunity! The Challenge You work closely together with the EU Area Sales Managers in order to collect information and requirements from the market and customers. You provide and coordinate sales forecasts/customer demand planning in order to identify the requirements of the production planning to the global headquarter. You manage the Market Analysts team, which is responsible for the collection of market analysis on customers and business information handling (e.g. pricing, product, order, lead-time information). You investigate the demands of the Bike Manufacturing and aftermarket customers to understands their future needs of purchasing order/planning and logistics solution, and you discuss/create solutions with the internal departments and the global headquarter. You develop and execute a plan for achieving yearly targets and KPI's and their monitoring. Next to that you manage the budget. You manage and develop team members to achieve company performance objectives and own development goals. Who are you? Requirements: You have at least a Bachelor degree. You have 5+ years of experience with market analysis, customer demand planning and/or order intake processes. You have working experience with or within international (Japanese) environments. You are fluent in English, both verbally and written. You have management experience. Experience within the bike industry is a big plus. Competencies: You have a hands-on mentality meaning at one side contributing/operating in strategic projects and on the other side supporting the teams with day to day business. You have excellent multi-level communication and collaboration skills because you will be communicating with multiple people within different levels and cultures(e.g. team members, customers, Sales Offices, customers, our global headquarters). You have strong analytical skills. You are able to explain the story behind the numbers and address this to the stakeholders with the aim to create impact. You are adaptable meaning you can easily switch between the different areas of coverage/expertise and people. You are a self-starter.  Our company Shimano is a worldwide supplier of highly advanced bicycle components, fishing tackle, and other sports equipment. Shimano Europe Group is the intermediate between the headquarter in Japan and the European market for marketing, sales, product development and technical service. Shimano Europe Group’s mission is to be an excellent supplier and valuable partner for their customers throughout all distribution channels in the European bicycle and fishing tackle industry. The vision is to become and stay European market-leading supplier of high quality products and be a well-respected supplier in the outdoor business, ensuring good relationships and acting very customer and market oriented. Over 12.000 members of Team Shimano in the world are united by a common philosophy. The more than 700 members of Team Shimano Europe are spread over multiple offices and countries. The European Headquarter is located in Eindhoven. Shimano offers a pleasant, informal working environment with colleagues who work well together, and are proud to work for Shimano. Next to good working conditions, Shimano offers you the opportunity to work in a responsible and challenging position within a dynamic, international and ambitious environment. Together we want to win therefore we have a strong focus on team achievement.

title: Stage Guest Experience
summary:
Het woord touchpoint klinkt jou bekend in de oren.
In deze functie maak jij van de customer journey namelijk een echte beleving.
description: Jouw functie Het woord touchpoint klinkt jou bekend in de oren. In deze functie maak jij van de customer journey namelijk een echte beleving. Je stapt in de huid van onze gasten en ervaart zelf hoe de optimale klantenreis eruit moet zien. Als stagiair, voor deze functie, kan jij goed schakelen tussen de wensen van de gast en de kernwaarden van Landal GreenParks. Dus heb jij lef en zie jij deze stage wel zitten? Ga dan per september 2021 de uitdaging aan! Je werkt nauw samen met de Digital Guest Experience Specialist en vormen samen een sterk team. Jullie gezamenlijke doel is het verhogen van de customer experience vanaf het begin tot het einde van de klantenreis. Jouw eigen ideeën worden daarin zeer op prijs gesteld. Je krijgt goede begeleiding en er is genoeg ruimte voor een schoolopdracht. Verder krijg je te maken met de volgende werkzaamheden: Het schrijven van teksten en verzamelen van bijpassend beeldmateriaal; Alle bestaande informatie dat verstrekt wordt aan de gast up-to-date houden; Het dagelijks monitoren van de gasttevredenheid; Ideeën en oplossingen aandragen om de service naar onze gasten nog beter te maken. Dit breng je mee naar Landal GreenParks De ideale stagiair voor deze communicatie stage is een creatieve en leergierige HBO student (bij voorkeur communicatie, toerisme, international business). Je bent meedenkend, werkt nauwkeurig en kan goed zelfstandig, maar ook in teamverband werken. De Nederlandse en Engelse taal beheers je goed. Bij deze functie is het mogelijk om een aantal dagen thuis te werken. Ontdek wat groen kan doen voor jouw carrière! Reageer dan nu op deze Stage Communication Guest Experience. Jouw arbeidsvoorwaarden Hoe leuk dat je van vakantie je vak wilt maken! Om jouw stage zo goed mogelijk van start te laten gaan, hebben we onze belangrijkste arbeidsvoorwaarden vast voor jou op een rij gezet: Een stagevergoeding van € 350,- bruto per maand op basis van een fulltime dienstverband, die maandelijks op jouw rekening wordt gestort*. Voor elke maand die je stage loopt bouw je een vakantiedag op* We gaan er vanuit dat je in het bezit bent van een OV-studentenreisproduct. Indien je niet in het bezit bent van een OV-studentenreisproduct of deze niet geldig is gedurende de te werken dagen, dan worden volledige OV-reiskosten door Landal vergoed. Reis je in deze situatie met de auto, dan ontvang je in overleg met je manager een tegemoetkoming in reiskosten conform de reiskostentabel. Goede begeleiding door een gediplomeerd praktijkbegeleider Ruimte om 1 dag in de week aan een eventuele opdracht te werken Een gunstige personeelsboekingsregeling waarmee je kan profiteren tot 20% korting op een verblijf Jouw werkomgeving Landal GreenParks is een dynamische organisatie die toonaangevend is in het management, beheer en verhuur van bungalowparken. Landal beschikt over ruim 95 parken in Nederland, België, Duitsland, Oostenrijk, Zwitserland, Tsjechië, Hongarije, Engeland en Denemarken met in totaal ca. 14.000 vakantieaccommodaties. Daarnaast beschikt Landal over 1.350 campingplaatsen. Op jaarbasis realiseren 2,8 miljoen gasten 14 miljoen overnachtingen. Op de parken en de diverse kantoorlocaties werken ca. 3.000 medewerkers. Meer weten over Landal GreenParks, klik dan hier. “De onderlinge sfeer met collega’s is persoonlijk en informeel; het voelt als een grote familie. ” Frank van der Salm - Marketing Analyst, Kantoor Leidschendam

title: Jr. Pricing & Data analyst
summary:
Jr. Pricing & Data analyst | HBL Online B.V.
We use various marketing channels and marketplaces to find our customers.
| Tilburg | 32-40 hours per week |.
description: Jr. Pricing & Data analyst | HBL Online B.V. | Tilburg | 32-40 hours per week | Fixami is a fast-growing pure e-commerce player selling professional tools and DIY related equipment. Through websites and several marketplaces, we are active in multiple countries with our brand names Fixami (Belgium, France, Spain and Italy) and Gereedschapcentrum (the Netherlands). In the Netherlands and Belgium, the group holds market leading positions, while aiming at top 3 positions in the other markets, with a goal of rapidly expanding in Europe. Having achieved ‘fastest growing company in the south of The Netherlands’ awards the last 5 years in a row, Fixami is continuously working on innovation and optimization of the technology and organization. As this is only possible by continuously attracting amazing talent Fixami is now looking for a (Jr.) Pricing & Data Analyst. What will you do in your role as Jr. Pricing & Data Analyst? In e-commerce, offering the right product at the right place at the right time and price is of great importance to achieve maximum results. We use various marketing channels and marketplaces to find our customers. Within this role you conduct quantitative and qualitative market research, collect and combine datasets from different sources and monitor trends in sales and demand (per channel), all geared at defining and optimising the sales policy per channel. Based on your continuous analyses you design and implement strategies to respond to constant changes and you signal issues and opportunities to the team and other departments. You will have direct impact on the conversion and profitability of our channels and products. By using competition- and data analysis you optimize our automatic pricing methodology used for product and bundle pricing leading to adjusted prices of our products in all channels. Your pricing tests result in finding the optimal pricing points to maximize conversion of visitors at the right profitability. You do research on new pricing methodologies and you play an important role in the development of these techniques within our organization while working closely together with the various teams around you, like purchase- and category managers, business analysts, pricing manager and sales and marketing colleagues. You are our ideal candidate if: You have a University Degree (Masters is an advantage) in Econometrics, Mathematics, Statistics, Industrial Engineering or comparable You have 0-2 years of experience in a commercial data / pricing role Experience in an analytical role and/or data analysis is an advantage You have great analytical skills. You are able to find the patterns in data and are able to explain in a clear and structured way You are able to think from a commercial perspective You are innovative and creative in finding solutions You have strong communication skills and you are proficient in the English language You are "eager to learn" with an entrepreneurial mindset Experience with Python / R studio and SQL is an advantage What we have to offer: Above all, a very interesting and challenging job in a fast-growing, informal and inspiring international work environment We highly appreciate your vision and input Flexible working hours and location (from home) A competitive salary in combination with secondary benefits, including 25 vacation days (option to purchase extra), company fitness, attractive staff discount & great company parties! Working in a brand-new office from summer 2021, with great facilities Send your CV + letter of motivation to [email protected] Acquisitie naar aanleiding van deze vacature wordt niet op prijs gesteld.

title: Market Intelligence Intern
summary:
Interact with external analysts and Senior Management.
Your learning outcomes will include becoming more knowledgeable in the areas of business strategy,…
description: As our Market Intelligence Intern you will focus on providing support for the development of global market and competitive analyses. Working directly with different internal stakeholders (Sales, Marketing, Business Development, Product Management) and external third-party research companies, you will support the Market Intelligence team’s mission to identify market trends, provide early warnings, and continuously support decision making by offering a clear view of the market and its different players. Your learning outcomes will include becoming more knowledgeable in the areas of business strategy, marketing, market research and in the various industries Irdeto is involved in (digital media, video games, automotive, healthcare and more). You will be applying your theoretical knowledge and research skills within an international workplace whilst undertaking real-time global projects which can in turn expand your professional network. What you will be working on: Perform creative desk-based quantitative and qualitative research on market drivers, market sizing and competitive analysis. Gather/cleanse data, build analysis models and run scenarios. Write recommendations, draft reports and presentations based on performed research. Create business cases under the supervision of the Market Intelligence team. Interact with external analysts and Senior Management. Maintain and update the Market Intelligence Portal (an online repository to share market and competitive intelligence material). Create in-depth reports based on collection of market and competitive intelligence material. Create and maintain detailed profiles for top competitors, including industry benchmarks (by regions and by solutions lines), SWOT analyses, etc. Support during Business Planning process providing insights and analysis for tactical and strategic decision making. What can you bring to the team? You are positive, self-motivated, dedicated, initiative-taking, not afraid to take risks, passionate about making a difference, and have a can-do attitude You are in the midst of obtaining a degree in market research/analytics/intelligence, business, or another field. You have advanced skills in using Microsoft Excel and have good skills in using Microsoft PowerPoint. You are passionate about working with data and being creative in gathering and analyzing ( online) secondary research. You have excellent verbal and written English communication and presentation skills. Internship start date: March 2021 (flexible) If this internship appeals to you and you are available for a 6 month (minimum 5 months) full-time (40 hours per week) internship we’d love to hear from you. Due to coronavirus restrictions, this role will be based partially at our Irdeto HQ in Hoofddorp and part ially working remotely. The balance of remote- and office-based work may change during the internship depending on regulations and government advice. We unfortunately cannot accept applications from students who are studying outside of the Netherlands. Why join Irdeto? We are on a mission to build a secure future, where people can embrace connectivity without fear. Our lives are increasingly connected. At Irdeto, we enable people and companies to experience connectivity effortlessly by protecting them from cyber attacks. Security is the enabler of the connected world we live in. Our solutions and services ensure that you can enjoy the latest video games, the best blockbuster movies and your favorite live events. And it does not stop there; our technology also secures connected transport and IoT connected industries – just to name a few. With 50 years of expertise in security, we protect over 5 billion devices and applications for some of the world’s best-known brands. What do we offer you? Irdeto is a people first organisation where you can secure your future. Our values of Trust, Accountability, Agility and Innovation inform our culture. We believe in connecting people and developing careers with a strong focus on collaboration, creativity, health and happiness among our globally diverse workforce. In addition to competitive remuneration and an extensive benefits we offer: An international & multicultural environment where diversity and inclusivity are celebrated and embraced Professional educational opportunities and training program Innovation sabbatical Volunteer Day State of the art office space On the job coaching and mentoring Flexible work arrangement Some of us run city marathons and even go on snowboarding trips together! Casual Friday? Casual every day! And many additional perks customized to global locations (canteen, fresh fruit, amazing coffee, parking, on-site gym, yoga room to name a few) With over 50 successful years of business innovation behind us, and an exciting digital and connected future ahead of us, Irdeto is a progressive company to join. We are looking for people who will keep us at the forefront of innovation and creativity. Welcome to Irdeto! Irdeto is proud to be an equal opportunity employer and we do not discriminate on identity or innate characteristics, instead we aim to build a diverse, inclusive culture where your talent counts

title: Business Analyst [Freelance - 6-month project]
summary: Maykers is an online platform that facilitates smart connections between farmers and their partners to make the business of farming successful.
description: Maykers is an online platform that facilitates smart connections between farmers and their partners to make the business of farming successful. We make it simple to sell, find and buy professional products based on fair prices and clear conditions. We’re a team that cultivates service excellence, growth and teamwork. Together with an international team of around 50 people we have the common goal to make farmers’ business run smoothly. For our fresh and fast-growing eCommerce start-up, we are looking for a smart, results-oriented and communicative Business Analyst to strengthen our team!  Your mission:  In this job you play an important role in scaling up our business and specifically in translating business needs into IT solutions. You will be part of the scaling up our digital marketplace and our international expansion into more European markets. You will enable stakeholders to formulate their wishes, unravel the requirements, structure them and you ensure that it can be built by our development teams. You will be investigating and performing data analysis and making recommendations for solving problems. This is not an average BA job. You will come across an environment that is quite complex and includes many different stakeholders at different levels. But who can beat a challenge as beautiful as this? You are not taking on this challenge alone. You work closely with the Product owner, the Scrum teams and our Marketing team.  What will you bring to the table:  We are looking for someone who preferably has experience in an eCommerce (b2b / b2c) environment Bachelor or University degree with technological focus or equivalent work experience 3+ years of relevant practical experience Affinity and love for a fast-moving environment Ease and clarity in communication with both internal and external stakeholders Significant time spent as a Freelancer - you understand how to quickly pick up a project and run with it  You are:  Analytical: data tells a story and you use it to experiment, adjust, come up with the ideas and bring them to life Self-motivated and self-directed: you take the initiative, you can multitask and set priorities with little guidance Communicative: You build relationships easily and quickly with all stakeholders at different levels and different backgrounds - tech and non-tech  You would work in a scale-up environment and culture while having the solid funding and market power of a corporate You'd be joining a new platform that will revolutionize the agri industry in the next years You'd be joining a small team where every new teammate makes a lot of difference You'd be in an energetic and flexible place, perfect for developing yourself and improving your entrepreneurial skills We cherish a great working atmosphere with smart colleagues with a good sense of humor N.B. to Recruiters: at this stage we don't require any assistance for this role. If that changes we will reach out to you. Please don't contact anyone on our team prior to this.

title: Financial Analyst
summary:
2+ years of experience in a highly analytical role within a fast-paced metrics driven environment.
Demonstrated ability to build and manage financial models.
description: 2+ years of experience in a highly analytical role within a fast-paced metrics driven environment Demonstrated ability to build and manage financial models Ability to perform complex analysis and simplify its communication Advanced computer literacy (MS Excel, SQL/other Database) Bachelor's in finance, economics, computer science, mathematics, statistics Fluent in English Since launching its first European websites in 1998, Amazon has grown into a global leader in e-commerce, with customer-facing websites selling physical goods across many European geographies, including in The Netherlands as of 2020. We are currently looking for a highly analytical and self-motivated Financial Analyst to join our Amazon Netherlands Finance team in Amsterdam.  The Financial Analyst will contribute to reporting, planning and control processes, as well as drive independent analysis to improve business features and visibility into results. In this role, you will partner closely business and cross-functional teams (Operations, Transportation, Marketing, Accounting, etc.) to deliver on growth initiatives and financial commitments. This role will be fast paced, thought provoking, but most of all extremely rewarding as we realize tangible results from our efforts to continuously delight customers.  Core Responsibilities Include: Ensure financial controls/processes are in place and respected through continuous audit, reporting and systems implementation Partner and communicate actively with business partners to manage and develop daily, weekly and monthly financial controllership rhythms Establish, maintain and improve operating and business metrics and dashboards to improve accuracy and pace of decision making Build short and long-term financial plans Partnering with business teams to calculate and understand financial trade-offs of key business decisions, while providing strategic recommendations Develop end-to-end business cases supporting growth initiatives, and presenting to leadership Using data to perform root cause analysis to provide improvement plans Excellent analytical skills, a passion for metrics and data, and the ability to get into the details, while also seeing and understanding the big picture Ability to meet tight deadlines, prioritize workload and achieve effective results in a fast-paced, dynamic, ever-growing and often ambiguous environment Strong interpersonal skills including written and oral communication

title: Digital Experience Analyst
summary:
Dit doen we door een geïntegreerde en gastgerichte marketing, communicatie- en salesaanpak.
Het samen met je marketing collega’s werken aan het meten en…
description: Jouw functie De website van Landal GreenParks is voor veel van onze gasten hét start punt van een onvergetelijke vakantie. De meeste boekingen komen namelijk binnen via onze website. Om nog beter te kunnen inspelen op de wensen van onze websitebezoekers moet de juiste informatie voor iedereen snel en makkelijk te vinden zijn. Als Digital Experience Analyst ga je het gesprek aan met je collega’s en challenge je hen op feiten en data inzichten. Dankzij jouw analytische inzichten verzorg je de beste adviezen, waar uiteindelijk de websitebezoekers nog meer van profiteren. Jij weet als geen ander door de bril van onze gasten te kijken en dit door te vertalen naar een prettige Guest Experience op onze website. Nieuwe inzichten en adviezen creëren begint bij het verkrijgen van de juiste data. Waar kunnen we de website verder optimaliseren? Klopt de tagging en tracking van alle functionaliteiten? Je kan door de ogen van de gasten naar onze Guest Journey kijken, maar je kan als expert met data werken. Samen met je collega’s van het E-Business team, onderdeel van de afdeling Commerce, ben je continu bezig met het optimaliseren van onze campagnes en de website. Jij bent dé Digital Experience Analyst die de verantwoordelijkheid pakt bij: Het creëren van inzichten d.m.v. verdiepende analyses met Google Analytics, Data Studio en/of Tableau ter verbetering van de Guest Journey Het kunnen vertalen van data/inzichten in concrete adviezen voor de Product Owners Het ondersteunen en adviseren van jouw collega’s op het gebied van diverse typen testen (A/B testen, machine learning gedreven testen) Het samen met je marketing collega’s werken aan het meten en verbeteren van de ROI van online campagnes en het behalen van de gestelde KPI’s Het debuggen van meetproblemen Het helpen uitvoeren van de strategie op het vlak van webanalyse en conversie optimalisatie Dit breng je mee naar Landal GreenParks Uiteraard werk je het liefst met data. Hier komen jouw analytische vaardigheden helemaal tot z’n recht. Je bent nieuwsgierig en staat communicatief stevig in je schoenen. Je weet collega’s mee te nemen in de analyses en samen te werken aan verbeter voorstellen. Het liefst werk je samen in een hecht team waar iedereen elkaar inhoudelijk uitdaagt en helpt. Als het gaat over het debuggen van meetproblemen, dan ben jij een ware troubleshooter. Ook durf je binnen bepaalde kaders de vrijheid te pakken. Daarin neem je jouw collega’s mee in de voortgang van jouw gemaakte ontwikkelingen. En dan beschik je als Digital Experience Analyst ook nog over: Een HBO- of WO-diploma, bijvoorbeeld in de richting Bedrijfskundige Informatica, Business Information Management of Economie 3 à 5 jaar ervaring bij een commerciële organisatie. Ervaring aan bureauzijde is tevens een optie Uitgebreide ervaring met Google Analytics 360, Google Tag Manager 360, Google Cloud Platform, Google Data Studio, Tableau en A/B testing tools Bij voorkeur ervaring met Big Query, API’s Kennis van HTML, Javascript en CSS en ervaring met werken met grote hoeveelheden data Heb je vragen over deze vacature? Bel Sanne Gehner (Manager Recruitment & Employer Branding) op 06 109 064 91 of mail naar Sanne.gehner@landal.com Jouw arbeidsvoorwaarden Samen zetten we alles op alles om onze gasten het beste te bieden. Als jij meedoet, wordt je harde werken door ons beloond met: Een jaarcontract op basis van 32-38 uur per week, bij goed functioneren wordt dit contract na 1 jaar omgezet in een contract voor onbepaalde tijd Een salaris tot max. 4548,- euro per maand o.b.v. een fulltime werkweek* 26 vakantiedagen bij een bij een fulltime werkweek* Flexibele werktijden en de mogelijkheid tot thuiswerken Uitgebreide trainings- en opleidingsmogelijkheden zowel Online (ruim 150 learnings) als Offline, gericht op het ontwikkelen van je vakmanschap en zelfontplooiing Een reiskostenvergoeding conform de Landal reiskostentabel. Indien je besluit om met het openbaar vervoer te reizen, worden de door jou te maken reiskosten 100% vergoed. Landal wil namelijk haar medewerkers stimuleren om met het openbaar vervoer naar de werkplek te komen Deelname aan de pensioenregeling van Landal bij Nationale Nederlanden. Deze regeling voorziet in de opbouw van een pensioen op basis van het beschikbare premiesysteem. Ook kent de regeling een Nabestaandenpensioen op risicobasis. De premie voor deze pensioenregeling wordt op dit moment volledig door Landal betaald Diverse collectieve verzekeringen Een gunstige personeelsboekingsregeling Een fulltime dienstverband bij Landal kent een 38-urige werkweek Jouw werkomgeving Landal GreenParks is een dynamische organisatie die toonaangevend is in het management, beheer en verhuur van bungalowparken. Ruim 95 parken met in totaal meer dan 13.700 vakantiewoningen in 9 landen en 1.350 campingplaatsen. Bij de afdeling Commercie richten we ons op de marktbewerking in diverse landen. Dit doen we door een geïntegreerde en gastgerichte marketing, communicatie- en salesaanpak. We zijn actief voor de merken: Landal GreenParks, Landal SkiLife, Landal Business Line, Landal Camping en Resort Hof van Saksen. Landal GreenParks is een duurzame, innovatieve en gastgerichte organisatie. Door onze effectieve samenwerking dragen we bij aan het succes van Landal GreenParks. Samen vormen we een datagedreven, internationaal team en zetten wij ons in om Landal GreenParks op de kaart te zetten en daar ook te houden. Bij alles wat we doen, staan onze gasten centraal. Dit sluit aan bij onze kernwaarden: betrouwbaar, persoonlijk en respectvol. Wij versterken onze merken, dragen bij aan de internationale groei van het bedrijf en vertalen de kennis die we hebben over onze gasten en de gasttevredenheid naar aansprekend aanbod, producten en diensten. Onvergetelijke vakanties zitten in onze natuur. Dat is de missie van Landal GreenParks en ligt ten grondslag aan alles waar wij voor werken. We zijn gastgericht, vernieuwen continu en gaan duurzame relaties aan. We willen het elke dag net iets beter doen. Wij werken als één Landal om de verwachtingen van onze gasten te blijven overtreffen. De commerciële afdeling is niet zomaar één team, maar bestaat uit meerdere internationale teams: Revenue Management, Marketing & Sales, Marketing Communication, E-business Development, Corporate PR & Interne Communicatie en het Contact Center. De focus van onze teams is om een goede balans tussen gastbeleving en commercie te vinden. Wij zetten dan ook alles op alles om dat te bereiken.

title: Product Manager - Website
summary:
Want to turn the world of cycling upside down and take the digital experience of more than 200,000 members to the highest level?
The ideal candidate will have:
description: Want to turn the world of cycling upside down and take the digital experience of more than 200,000 members to the highest level?  We are Swapfiets; started in 2014 and currently active in nearly 70 cities, across 7 different countries. At our HQ in Amsterdam, we work with around a hundred colleagues to offer the very best user experience to our members, who in turn receive epic service from a team of 1100+ Swappers and Mechanics.  We are looking for a curious, data-driven and detail-oriented Product Manager. In this role, you will be part of the Product team and get full responsibility for a number of web-products in our website, including signup conversion flows (B2C, B2B) and member account environment. While you lead for your products, you also get the opportunity to contribute to the development of our mobile app - for many members the friend who’s always there to provide and experience the Swapfiets service whenever that’s needed.  In this role, you have a direct impact on the daily lives of our 200K+ members and the scalability of our business. In your first months, you get responsibility for driving conversion optimization, self-servicing and improving user experience across digital touchpoints. You do this by solving problems with, and as a member of, your scrum team. Also, with your team, you help Swapfiets grow further with the support of new business opportunities.  In your day to day activities, you will work directly with your scrum team and stakeholders, ranging from our Marketing team to the team where our mobility Products are designed, and colleagues working from our various Country Offices. This position requires a user-first mentality, a strong eye for detail and an analytic mindset. You have robust stakeholder management skills and have solid data available to back your arguments. We’re looking for a candidate who brings focus to the work, structure to the team, and clarity to the stakeholders. And in short: you like to make complex things simple.  Responsibilities Lead strategy and roadmap prioritization for 1 digital product Contribute to the digital Product Team a solid knowledge of the various constraints of the business Contribute to the digital Product Team a deep knowledge of our users, and the data about how our users engage with our digital products Accountable for ensuring solutions for medium complexity problems are valuable and viable; delivered on time and budget Track industry trends and the competitive landscape as they pertain to the digital product Collaborate closely with digital Product Designers and Engineers to discover effective solutions, and then work together to deliver those solutions to market Take part in user discovery, testing and advocating for building the right thing for our members. Lead impactful digital product changes and rollouts, facilitates change management Contribute to improving digital product development life cycle; implementation of best practices Organize product demos for stakeholders, having the team present outcomes created by sprint goal achievement. Project level stakeholder management  The ideal candidate will have: Higher vocational or academic working - and thinking level Minimum of 3-5 years experience as either a Product Manager, Product Designer, Engineer, Data Analyst, Data Scientist, or User Researcher working on digital products Demonstrated understanding of the techniques and methods of modern digital product discovery and delivery Demonstrated ability to figure out solutions to hard problems with many constraints, using sound judgement to assess risks, and create a well-structured, data-informed narrative. Proven ability to engage with engineers, designers, and company leaders in a constructive and collaborative relationship. Experience with Scrum way of working Excellent communication skills in English. Considered as a plus: basic understanding of programming languages and product management software.  Are you ready to join a team with high ambitions? We are growing fast internationally. With your help, we want to continue expanding. What we are most proud of is how much we have already achieved as a team. Our team (around 20 developers, testers, designers, and product managers) is characterized by a positive and collaborative atmosphere, flexibility, and ownership. But also: lots of humor, after-work activities (boot camp, climbing, cycling, hackathons), daily lunches, and Friday afternoon drinks. Note: we follow governmental guidelines and therefore follow a working from home policy. Once restrictions are lifted, we foresee a healthy combination of working from HQ and working from home.      Swapfiets in Amsterdam: your new workplace? Our office is located in a hub with lots of other small, creative companies, next to the Amstel River and Martin Luther King Park. It’s also easy to reach by public transport (Amstel Station) and of course with your Swapfiets Deluxe (which you get from us). As a Product Manager, you can also count on: Salary 32 vacation days! A solid pension plan. Lots of responsibility, challenging work, and friendly colleagues. A training budget of 2K/yr and room for professional development. MacBook Pro (or a Dell; as you prefer). Travel allowance. Procedure You can now directly apply for this vacancy. As soon as we think: you've got what it takes to qualify for this position, our recruitment team will contact you to check some basic information and ask you about some of your previous successes related to the role. Next, the first interview is with a Product Manager and our Head of Digital Product. The second interview is held with two team members, followed by a third-round, which is a case presentation (prepared at home). The fourth round is an informal coffee with our Data, Digital and Technology Director. Are you and Swapfiets still as enthusiastic at the end of the process? Then you will receive an offer to join the Swapfiets team!  ANSWER YOUR QUESTIONS Do you have questions about this vacancy? Contact our recruiter via marleen.hovers@swapfiets.com. We already have cooperation with external parties, so that means recruitment agencies should not respond to this job opening.

title: Data Analist
summary: Onze opdrachtgever is een internationale leverancier van marktinformatie, oplossingen en diensten, die haar klanten in de Fast Moving Consumer Goods (FMCG)…
description: Wat ga je doen als Data Analist? Puzzelen is jouw ding. Logische verbanden zien en zo stapje voor stapje de code kraken! Als Database Medewerker ben je de projectleider over jouw klanten en databases. Prioriteiten kunnen stellen en het overzicht weten te bewaken zijn dus erg belangrijk in deze rol. Bij onze relatie hechten ze veel waarde aan groepsgevoel en sfeer op de afdeling. Dus: ben jij er bij met de volgende vrijdag middag borrel of surprise avond? Wat zijn jouw taken en verantwoordelijkheden als Database Medewerker? Jij bouwt nieuwe database en past bestaande databases aan, dit alles op projectmatige basis; hebt meetings met klanten om de wensen over de indeling van de database te bespreken; voert intern meetings om de wensen van de klant te bespreken met de betrokken afdelingen; bewaakt deadlines en informeert klanten over de voortgang van het proces; informeert klanten bijtijds over de 'status'' van de database; zoekt naar verbetering in je werk en werkprocessen. Wie ben jij? Ten eerste ben je een logische denker. Voor het oplossen van sudoku's en puzzels moet je bij jou zijn; monds genoeg om vragen te stellen als je iets niet begrijpt; je in staat in te zoomen en tegelijkertijd het overzicht te behouden. Daarnaast toon je eigenaarschap over je functie; durf je kritisch te zijn op de huidige werkwijze maar weet je deze ook te respecteren; weet jij repeterend werk zelf uitdagend te maken. Wat wordt jou als Data Analist geboden? Ten eerste biedt onze relatie jou een salaris van maximaal 2000,- bruto per maand Hierbij komt nog een 13de maand 32 vrije dagen waarvan 25 vakantiedagen en 7 ADV dagen Daarnaast kom je te werken in een dynamisch bedrijf met een collegiale sfeer waarin passie, plezier en prestatie centraal staan; afwisselende functie, uitdagend werk met ruimte voor eigen initiatief; organisatie met ruimte en ondersteuning voor persoonlijke en vakinhoudelijke ontwikkeling; doorgroeimogelijkheden binnen het bedrijf. Het bedrijf Onze opdrachtgever is een internationale leverancier van marktinformatie, oplossingen en diensten, die haar klanten in de Fast Moving Consumer Goods (FMCG) branche helpt om succesvol te zijn op marketing- en salesvlak. Jouw afdeling maakt de commerciële vertaling van de data die ingevoerd worden. Voorafgaand aan deze afdeling is er een operationeel team verantwoordelijk voor de juiste invoer hiervan. Deze data kun jij vervolgens gebruiken in je onderzoek. Onze relatie biedt jou de mogelijkheid om flexibel te werken, hecht veel waarde aan de onderwerpen duurzaam, fit en actief, heeft een actieve personeelsvereniging die frequent leuke activiteiten organiseert en tot slot heerst er op de (digitale) werkvloer een hele goede sfeer. Hoe nu verder? Ben jij geïnteresseerd en wil je erachter komen of je in deze functie past? Mail, bel of whatsapp dan naar Jeanne op 06-8359 7840 of jeanne@lefrecruitment.nl De eerste gesprekken zullen vanwege de coronacrisis middels een videocall plaats vinden. LEF houdt van snelle actie en doorpakken. Je krijgt binnen 24 uur een reactie en we willen zo snel mogelijk de procedure afgerond hebben. Is het toch niet jouw vacature, kijk dan naar onze andere vacatures in de data of neus verder door al onze vacatures.

title: Accountmanager New Business
summary:
Ons team bestaat uit business analysts, front officemedewerkers, developers, vormgevers en online marketeers.
Het spel van overtuigen en aansluiten beheersen;
description: Positie: Je bent regelmatig onderweg en spreekt met prospects en opdrachtgevers uit allerlei branches om new business te genereren. Daarnaast richt je je op het netwerken en het onderhouden en verbreden hiervan. De opdrachten variëren van maatwerk websites of webshops tot aan volledige databaseapplicaties of online advertentiecampagnes. Jij vertaalt behoeftes/ wensen in de juiste oplossing. Daarbij werk je nauw samen met onze Business Analyst om de meer complexe opdrachten in goede banen te leiden. Jij blijft het aanspreekpunt voor de klant en zorgt voor versteviging en verbreding van de relatie. Wie zoeken wij? Een resultaat gedreven salesmanager met een krachtige uitstraling en een stevige impact; HBO werk- en denkniveau; Bewezen ervaring met koude acquisitie, het genereren van new business en het upsellen van bestaande klanten; Zelfstandig, vindingrijk, logische denker; Analytisch scherp met een goed beoordelingsvermogen; Het spel van overtuigen en aansluiten beheersen; Je hebt kennis over of interesse in IT; webapplicaties, databaseapplicaties, webshops, e-learning, API's, online verdienmodellen, online marketing, hosting et cetera. Ons aanbod: Een vaste baan (32 tot 40 uur per week) met groeiperspectief; Marktconforme arbeidsvoorwaarden, goede secundaire voorwaarden; Fulltime salaris tussen de € 3.500, - en € 4.200, - bruto per maand; 25 vakantiedagen per jaar op fulltime basis + 8% vakantietoeslag; Alle ruimte voor je eigen ambities, persoonlijke groei en balans werk-privé; Een betrokken en jong team van nu 11 professionals die samen goed werk opleveren en dit samen vieren; Informeel werkcultuur waarbij resultaatgerichtheid, open communicatie, persoonlijke ontwikkeling en werkplezier centraal staan. Over Adecon Ruim 20 jaar is Adecon, Beneden-Leeuwen, een zeer ervaren en betrouwbare partner in het ontwikkelen van websites, van iedere omvang. We helpen organisaties online ondernemen. Ons specialisme is tailormade oplossingen die naadloos aansluiten op de organisatie van onze klanten. Elke online vraag nemen we serieus en zorgvuldig in behandeling. We ontwikkelen maatwerk websites en webapplicaties van iedere omvang. Daarnaast bieden wij onze klanten een CRM/ERP-systeem. Ons team bestaat uit business analysts, front officemedewerkers, developers, vormgevers en online marketeers. Kom jij ons aanvullen? Graag ontvangen wij via onderstaand sollicitatieformulier je aanbod. Voor meer inhoudelijke informatie over de functie, kun je contact met ons opnemen via het algemene telefoonnummer 0487 - 59 50 59. N.b. Acquisitie op deze vacature wordt niet op prijs gesteld.

title: CRM Campaign Specialist
summary:
Passion or understanding of retail marketing.
3+ years coordinating/managing/specializing in the field of CRM marketing.
That's the Power of Us.
description: About PVH Corp. PVH is one of the most admired fashion and lifestyle companies in the world. We power brands that drive fashion forward – for good. Our brand portfolio includes the iconic CALVIN KLEIN, TOMMY HILFIGER, Van Heusen, IZOD, ARROW, Warner’s, Olga and Geoffrey Beene brands, as well as the digital-centric True&Co. intimates brand. We market a variety of goods under these and other nationally and internationally known owned and licensed brands. PVH has over 40,000 associates operating in over 40 countries and $9.9 billion in annual revenues. That's the Power of Us. That’s the Power of PVH. The Position The CRM Campaign Specialist will be responsible to support bringing the CRM roadmap to life by leading the implementation through all project phases for customer lifecycle automated trigger programs, operational brand campaigns and transactional projects. The role will drive the execution process of Tommy Hilfiger’s multi-channel communications landscape, in order to strengthen the brand loyalty, increase customer engagement, retention, revenues and ultimately LTV. Day-to-day, as the CRM Campaign Specialist, you will work closely with internal PVH departments and external vendors to ensure the development of campaigns are built to specifications from a content, data and technology perspective. You will be closely with the CRM Automation Specialist and Data Analysts to ensure back-end up setup, UAT and data tracking are fully integrated in the execution process. The role will give you opportunity to work on a range of projects that are highly visible, innovative and exciting. All contributing to the capabilities, maturity and success of CRM & Loyalty. This role will report to the SR CRM Campaign Execution Manager. Key Responsibilities: Collaborate with Consumer Journey and rest of Marketing to be CRM representative in campaign taskforces Drive the discovery, definition, build, test and deployment of end-to-end phases for each campaign project Execute email marketing campaigns focused solely on customer lifecycle automated trigger programs, operational brand campaigns, and transactional projects to drive consumer through key life stages with the brand Lead and deliver monthly and quarterly reporting updates to relevant stakeholders concerning new campaign initiatives Devise and implement impactful A/B testing procedures on campaigns to help improve and evolve communication & content strategies for the consumer Work extensively with Salesforce Marketing Cloud to ensure development of campaigns, technical logic, UAT and targeting specifications are in place Author creative briefs that lay out direction for Creative Studio regarding key campaign objectives, strategy and content requirements for specific campaign projects As project lead, ensure all projects are delivered on time, within scope and within budget Coordinate with internal resources and vendors to ensure flawless execution of campaigns Identify and implement process improvements for campaign activity and lead adoption of new ways to improve quality, reduce campaign cycle time and increase output to drive higher automation in everything you do Be fully aware, and integrate in BAU, monthly planning and activities in partnership with the CRM Coordinator Assist in campaign builds and/or QA as needed, as backup to CRM Coordinator The Ideal Candidate: Exceptional project management and organizational skills, with an unparalleled attention to detail Demonstrated energy, drive, determination and persistence Self-motivated individual – no task is too big or too small Keen on learning and developing, with an “outside-of-the-box” mentality Proactive team player and problem-solver Excellent interpersonal skills, able to effectively work cross-functionally with strong verbal and written communication skills; results-driven and fact-based communication style Focused and able to work under pressure in a fast-paced environment Understanding of campaign performance metrics Passion & knowledge of CRM and the digital environment A University degree (e.g. Business, Marketing or Marketing Communications) 3+ years coordinating/managing/specializing in the field of CRM marketing 2+ years’ experience in delivering CRM campaigns within an International or ecommerce brand that drive consumer response Experience with Salesforce Marketing Cloud or similar Some non-specialist knowledge of HTML preferred Mobile experience or understanding of mobile trends in campaign execution Fluent in English (written and verbally) Nice to Haves: Experience working with fashion or lifestyle brands Passion or understanding of retail marketing What You Can Expect from Us: A beautiful state-of-the-art Campus, complete with our very own People's Place Gym and People's Place Cafés A company culture that fosters development, offering training and learning opportunities through our very own PVH University An international environment which respects diversity, equality, and individuality A smart work program that empowers our associates to work at their preferred location within a flexible schedule A chance to unwind with weekly social activities  Please include a cover letter with your application. We would love to know why this is THE role for you!  PVH Europe and our brands, TOMMY HILFIGER and CALVIN KLEIN, are committed to fostering an inclusive and diverse community of associates with a strong sense of belonging. We believe we are bettered by all forms of diversity, and take pride in working with top talent from every walk of life and corner of the world. In the spirit of inclusivity, qualified applicants will be considered without regard to age, ethnicity, ability, gender, gender expression, gender identity, nationality, race, religion or sexual orientation.

title: Data Quality Manager
summary:
Our team of analysts is relatively young.
The CoE is still relatively small and currently consists of 4 analysts, 2 data engineers, and a data scientist.
description: Mendix is on a mission to enable anyone in any organization – from the marketing coordinator to the software developer to the CEO – to create things that are transformational for their company. We are fundamentally reinventing the way applications are created and we’re reinventing the future of software development. Sounds ambitious, right? We agree.  Not to brag, but nearly 4,000 organizations worldwide, including KLM, Medtronic, Merck, and Philips, rely on Mendix to build web and mobile applications. Thousands of our customers use our platform to delight their clients and empower their employees. It’s no surprise that we’re a recognized Leader by Gartner and Forrester in a red-hot market expected to exceed $21 billion by 2022. Ok, maybe we did want to brag a little. But we’re proud of what we’ve accomplished…and…we’re humble enough to admit that we need you to make us even more effective.  Are you the experienced Data Quality Manager to help create Mendix’s analytics center of excellence? Do you have a good view on what an analytics center of excellence within a pioneering tech company should look like? Then we are looking for you.  What is our analytics center of excellence (CoE)? Mendix has doubled in size in only a year and a half. As such, the need for analytics insights and automation are becoming increasingly important. The analytics center of excellence will be providing different business units with dedicated partners that create new analytics products and insights to improve the performance of their units and make the right decisions. The COE is supported by a technical data engineering team who are responsible for the Mendix’s data landscape (datalake & data warehouse). The CoE is still relatively small and currently consists of 4 analysts, 2 data engineers, and a data scientist. However analytics has been recognized as an incredibly important area of investment by Mendix’s management. Therefor we will be hiring several new members in the CoE this year and hope to more than double the size of the team by the end of the year.  What job would you be applying for? You should expect to become the ‘go-to’ person for data. Any person in the organization that has a question about data will probably end up with you and you need to be able to assist them or steer them in the right direction. We expect that you will establish data governance processes and frameworks in the organization that will truly empower the business to use data, instead of having conversations on whether this is ‘good’ or ‘bad’ data. We are looking for someone that can partner up with the business. Mendix is a young and dynamic organization that does not have many established business processes or governance frameworks in place. It will be your challenge to help the business see the value of establishing these governance frameworks and to create them. Mentoring people in the business as well as younger members of our CoE is an important part of your role. We are looking for people with new ideas and several years of experience that can help enrich the CoE and raise it to the next level. Overview of activities: Establishing governance frameworks within Mendix that introduces data ownership within each business unit (responsibility and accountability); Establishing governance frameworks and processes around data creation, processing, and reporting within each business unit; Coordinating with stakeholders to gather, map, and document meta data from each business unit (master data management); Coordinating with stakeholders to create a clear overview of data flows between systems and data used in reporting; Setting standards for data quality and data accuracy for products created by the analytics CoE; Monitor and improve data quality and being able to identify and improve the reliability of the data; Being a key consulting stakeholder when the business has questions related to the internal data landscape; Identifying risks and solutions for projects where the internal data landscape is involved; Planning and creating the internal data landscape roadmap and strategy. About you: You are a senior data professional that can help shape our new center of excellence. Our team of analysts is relatively young. Our organization is also new to data driven decision making. We are therefore looking for people that can bring industry best practices into the CoE and have several years of experience working in an agile work environment. If you have several years of experience in a variety of data related roles and you are eager to bring your experience in a young, thriving, and quickly scaling organization, then you are the person we are looking for! Technical requirements: 5+ years’ proven experience and excellent understanding of data administration, (master)data management functions (collection, analysis, distribution etc.), regulatory aspects (GDPR, HIPAA) and experience with FAIR, data governance and data stewardship principles; Experience with data processing languages or scripting languages such as: SQL, R or Python. Business requirements: You are a hands-on person with a “can do” mentality and you are not afraid to set up collaborations, make decisions, set priorities and put them into action in a dynamic environment; You are a critical thinker that is not afraid to challenge the business and move the organization to a new maturity level in data driven decision making; Experience with quickly learning about and familiarizing yourself with different business domains; Experience as a trusted advisor for data related questions or inquiries (the “go-to data person”); Experience with working in an agile scrum environment; Experience with mentoring and/or teaching subject matter to colleagues; Able to speak fluent English; Speaking Dutch is a plus. Personal character traits: A good understanding of business needs and the ability to act accordingly, taking measured risks into account and the ability to take the organization to a next maturity level. The ability to remain fully functional by adapting to changing circumstances (environment, procedures, people). Absorb new information readily and to put it into practice effectively. Assertiveness; the ability to bring one’s views across clearly without damaging the relationship with stakeholders. Creativity; the ability to come up with original and innovative ideas and solutions, to adopt points of view outside the usual parameters. The ability to ask further with the ambition to deeply understand other perspectives and views in order to generate support.  If you don’t comply with the following criteria please do not respond to this job offer: All technical requirements; Experienced as a trusted advisor for data related questions or inquiries; Experienced in challenging the business and moving the organization to a new maturity level in data driven decision making.  Get a taste of Mendix Blue culture and see the latest updates to our product by registering for our annual flagship event, Mendix World 2020 launching on September 1st. Attend live Q&A sessions with leaders from R&D, watch demos of the product in action, and meet the Makers who use Mendix everyday. Registration link: www.mendix.com/mendix-world/?&utm_medium=sales&mxworld=mxrec&utm_campaign=GL-CE-2020-09-01-Mendix-World  Our Guiding Principles  While we live on different continents, speak different languages, and work on different things, we are bound by our “MendixBlue” guiding principles. Being “MendixBlue” means that you live the culture, and you consistently improve it as we grow. It’s kind of a big deal.  We put the customer first. Without our customers, we have no business. So, if you act in the best interest of our customers, always…you belong here.  We think big. We work to have a meaningful, lasting impact on the world. So, if you aim high and think long term…you belong here.  We innovate. We want to be what happens next. So, if you ask “what if?” and work to find a way or make one…you belong here.  We nurture talent. We look, not just at the sum of what an individual has done, but at the potential of who they can be. So, if you’re up for learning from your failures…you belong here.  We hear every voice. Inflated egos don’t last here, humility does. So, if you share credit and ensure that the best ideas win – regardless of who they come from…you belong here.  We own it. If something needs doing, we do it. So, if you focus on the outcome, and take initiative to get it done…you belong here.  We have fun. We use laughter as a common language. We can ask for help and we’re happy to give it. So, if you find joy and purpose in what you do…you belong here.  Make your career at Mendix.  There are precious few jobs that let you create the future. But you’ll find one at Mendix. We are at a pivotal time in our company’s existence: where rapid growth meets stable funding. This is the time for industrious people to raise their hands to solve the next generation of problems. Mendix is a place where ambitious people can thrive; where you can identify an issue, propose a solution, and build the structure to make it happen.  Important to know: Mendix is a Siemens business, which means we’re backed by the resources and stability of one of the world’s largest and most forward-looking enterprises. Think: job security.  Since our company was founded in 2005, our aim has been to create a great work environment for people at all stages in their careers. That’s why we are so pleased and honored that we were rated a top Cloud Computing Company to work for in 2019, based on feedback from our employees on Glassdoor. With offices in the Netherlands, the UK, Germany, and the US, (and more coming), we provide an international playground to truly impact the world through low-code.  Organization: Digital Industries Company: Mendix Technology B.V. Experience Level: Experienced Professional Job Type: Full-time

title: Data Analyst
summary:
We are looking for a determined data analyst to help shape our digital solutions and change the way insurance is bought online.
Go ahead and apply today.
description: About iptiQ iptiQ is a risk tech start-up within Swiss Re Group. Swiss Re is one of the world’s leading providers of reinsurance, insurance and other forms of insurance-based risk transfer. We anticipate and manage a wide variety of risks, from natural catastrophes and climate change to cybercrime.  iptiQ provides digital, bespoke and transparent L&H and P&C protection products in a B2B2C manner. Founded in 2014, we're transforming the way consumers buy insurance with a unique digital insurance engine which incorporates the latest technology with world-class underwriting capabilities. We build strong partnerships to sell insurance via trusted brands.  iptiQ offers a flexible working environment where curious and adaptable people thrive. Are you interested in joining us?  About the Role We are looking for a determined data analyst to help shape our digital solutions and change the way insurance is bought online. No more insurance talk that only a lawyer understands, we are here to make a difference. As a Data Analyst, you will work in a multi-functional environment to design, enhance and operate our analytics and reporting capabilities and impact our marketing and product building decisions! Your responsibilities Enable a data-informed culture within iptiQ Lead and grow web analytics and user & customer behaviour understanding capabilities Partner with key stakeholders in Marketing, UX and Technology to optimise strategy & tactics based on data Based on business requirements and stakeholder needs, create standardised, automated reports and dashboards Deliver ad hoc insights and analytics to partner teams to optimise the customer experience (e.g., A/B tests, segmentations or survey analytics) What we look for Advanced technical knowledge of web analytics and behavioural analytics. Google Analytics, Google Tag Manager, Optimize are your second nature. Experience in building analytics solutions using SQL and Python Hands-on knowledge of BI and reporting tools (DataStudio, Tableau) Interest in applying machine learning techniques for customer data analytics and process automation Basic knowledge of web technologies (e.g., JavaScript, HTML5) Passion for data and storytelling with data Interest in working in a multi-locational team within Europe Great team player: you collaborate effectively with team members, express technical leadership supporting your views and ideas while keeping open to different opinions Avid learner who stays up-to-date with the latest trends and can vet with pragmatism and long-term vision the adoption of new technologies Master’s or PhD degree in a data-focused field or equivalent working experience Ability to speak and write English fluently Interest in learning about B2B2C digital insurance products About the team We’re a start-up embedded within an organisation known for its high-caliber talent and excellent benefits. So you get the best of both worlds - a fast paced, challenging environment with a genuine work-life balance and more. Do you love thinking ahead and identifying new opportunities or anticipate future challenges? Do you enjoy pushing borders and have a passion for the latest technologies? Go ahead and apply today.
