We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, or disability status.

title: Data Analyst
summary:
3 to 5 years’ experience as a data analyst within a marketing/agency environment.
Help drive a performance marketing mindset and culture when it comes to media…
description: Job Description : Diageo Context Diageo was created in 1997 but its business is built on the principles and foundations laid years before by giants of the industry – Arthur Guinness, John Walker, Elizabeth Cumming and many more. Today, Diageo is a world class leader in beverage alcohol, producing an outstanding collection of over 200 brands and owning the top two largest spirit brands in the world, Johnnie Walker and Smirnoff and 20 of the world’s top 100 spirit brands. Its portfolio also includes Crown Royal, J&B, Buchanan’s and Windsor Whiskies, Cîroc and Ketel One vodkas, Captain Morgan, Baileys, Don Julio, Tanqueray and Guinness. Diageo has built a strong platform for growth – through investment in its own brands, and by acquisition to broaden the geographical footprint and category depth and range. The company’s strong local business units are well-positioned to win in increasingly competitive and fast-paced environments. Diageo’s portfolio is well-diversified across price-tiers, enabling it to participate where consumer opportunity is greatest, and to capture shifts in consumer preference. Diageo's culture is built and maintained by the five values that underpin its business and guide how Diageo works. At Diageo, employees are passionate about its customers and consumers and want to be the best . They give each other the freedom to succeed and value each other . Employees work hard so they can be proud of what they do and how they do it. While Diageo moves at pace, constantly evolving and improving, its values remain consistent. Diageo wants that employees live these values every day, everywhere so that Diageo can be proud of what they do and be the best that they can be. More about Diageo is available at its web site: https://www.diageo.com/ Role Dimensions A unique opportunity for anyone with a real passion and flair for to turn raw data into clear, actionable insights that matter to our business with the right accurate reporting. Working with the Head of Culture & Entertainment, Media and Digital you will be working on identify the right insights for our customer journey as part of a team leading Diageo’s in Northern Europe in close collaboration with key internal stakeholders and external agency partners to deliver category and brand growth. Part of the team’s mission is to future-proof our organization and create a differentiated advantage for Diageo by responding to changing consumer, media and market landscapes in an agile and impactful way. Top Accountabilities Acting as a holistic data and insights expert responsible for delivering world class reporting for our brands that are activated brilliantly and working seamlessly with the category brand teams You are analyzing trends in data and are able to setup and automate dashboards into simplified reports and visualization to help interpretate and make decisions based on facts Work in collaboration with senior stakeholders to influence media investments decisions Ensure appropriate use of data, & insight as part of our process, to understand local business challenges and opportunities and translate them into briefs, as well as predict trends and campaign impact Help drive a performance marketing mindset and culture when it comes to media optimization Know how to work with the algorithms of Google, Microsoft and Amazon. Responsible for accurate reports to set up predict and optimization models to understand our consumer better and be future proof Able to set up our data strategy with 1st, 2nd and 3rd party data and able to set up solutions for capturing data in media, and market insights Ideal experiences / Qualifications / capabilities You are constantly curious about consumers; have a deep understanding of consumer behavior across all media channels and an eye on the future to ensure Diageo is always at forefront of change A strong team player who enjoys working in a fast-paced team environment. Always ready to roll-up your sleeves and get things done 3 to 5 years’ experience as a data analyst within a marketing/agency environment Experienced in Power BI, preferable Salesforce (Datorama) Proven ability to setup reports into activations that have delivered YoY growth Confident digital native that can work independently Demonstrated brilliant execution to impeccably high standards Deep personal accountability for great performance Analytical mindset, understands continuous testing and improving based on details and data. Able to transform them for performance optimizations Pro-active and positive mindset Worker Type : Regular Primary Location: Amsterdam Additional Locations : Hamburg Job Posting Start Date : 2021-02-22-08:00

title: Mendix Developer (People and Culture)
summary: Mendix is on a mission to enable anyone in any organization – from the marketing coordinator to the software developer to the CEO – to create things that are…
description: Mendix is on a mission to enable anyone in any organization – from the marketing coordinator to the software developer to the CEO – to create things that are transformational for their company. We are fundamentally reinventing the way applications are created and we’re reinventing the future of software development. Sounds ambitious, right? We agree.  Not to brag, but nearly 4,000 organizations worldwide, including KLM, Medtronic, Merck, and Philips, rely on Mendix to build web and mobile applications. Thousands of our customers use our platform to delight their clients and empower their employees. It’s no surprise that we’re a recognized Leader by Gartner and Forrester in a red-hot market expected to exceed $21 billion by 2022. Ok, maybe we did want to brag a little. But we’re proud of what we’ve accomplished…and…we’re humble enough to admit that we need you to make us even more effective.  Mendix is on a mission to fundamentally reinvent the way applications are created, by abstracting the process and enabling everyone who has a stake in an enterprise’s digital future — business people and analysts, web developers, software engineers, even CEOs — to meaningfully participate, thereby creating better applications faster. Our goal is simply to create the future of software development.  The Mendix AppFactory is a team of Mendix Makers, with a focus on building applications with our own Mendix platform. In other words: for Mendix with Mendix! These applications vary in nature from improving business processes, facilitating R&D innovations, building industry solutions, cross-industry components and showcasing the power of Mendix at our events.  Not only is the Mendix AppFactory turning ideas into Mendix Apps, we are also a breeding ground for Mendix talent. We are on a mission to produce great Mendix apps and even better Mendix Makers!  As a Mendix Developer, you will be a part of this endeavour. Helping out people from within our company to realise their ideas into smoothly running and user-friendly applications, putting a smile on people’s faces as you make their job easier to do! You will be in a unique position, that allows you to learn a lot about Mendix: how to create better apps, but also how different departments within the company operate, or help out building complete soltions with Mendix. You will also be instrumental in setting up new and testing existing guidelines and digital execution practices.  In this role, you will be the primary developer exclusively dedicated to a passionate People and Culture(P&C) team. With a people-first strategy guiding our department, we have a team of people who wake up each day motivated to make an impact. Motivated to drive value for the company. Motivated to help employees live their best[work] lives. We’re ambitious. We’re fun. We’re hard working. We curse. We collaborate regularly and are always looking to disrupt the traditional approach to HR-related issues. The“norm” is not good enough. Good enough is not good enough. We have three pillars of our strategy: to grow manager capabilities, to increase career development, and to ensure that our guiding principles are embedded into everything we do. Our work never ends, and we kinda like that. You’re the Mendix developer we need if you: Invest in people and know how to help them improve their skills, both on a technical and personal level. Are a teamplayer, and have a positive attitude. Even when things go wrong. Inspire your team to experiment and take(calculated) risks, because you know this is how people grow. When things fail, don’t look for someone to blame. Take responsibility and use your energy to fix the problem at hand and allow the team to learn from it. Of course, don’t fix the same bug twice. Don’t believe in‘my way or the highway’. You know when to step aside and let the team decide their own course of action, giving them ownership. Have excellent communication skills, both talking and listening. You can explain complicated technical matters in a simple manner. Have a keen eye for detail, but you never lose sight of the bigger picture. Have a proven track record in delivering custom software solutions in enterprise environments, of which at least 1 year of Mendix development experience Have a good understanding of technologies like SQL, BPMN, MDD and possibly Java(you don't have to be a coder, but a general understanding is definitely a plus) Have advanced language skills in English. Our Guiding Principles  While we live on different continents, speak different languages, and work on different things, we are bound by our “MendixBlue” guiding principles. Being “MendixBlue” means that you live the culture, and you consistently improve it as we grow. It’s kind of a big deal.  We put the customer first. Without our customers, we have no business. So, if you act in the best interest of our customers, always…you belong here.  We think big. We work to have a meaningful, lasting impact on the world. So, if you aim high and think long term…you belong here.  We innovate. We want to be what happens next. So, if you ask “what if?” and work to find a way or make one…you belong here.  We nurture talent. We look, not just at the sum of what an individual has done, but at the potential of who they can be. So, if you’re up for learning from your failures…you belong here.  We hear every voice. Inflated egos don’t last here, humility does. So, if you share credit and ensure that the best ideas win – regardless of who they come from…you belong here.  We own it. If something needs doing, we do it. So, if you focus on the outcome, and take initiative to get it done…you belong here.  We have fun. We use laughter as a common language. We can ask for help and we’re happy to give it. So, if you find joy and purpose in what you do…you belong here.  Make your career at Mendix.  There are precious few jobs that let you create the future. But you’ll find one at Mendix. We are at a pivotal time in our company’s existence: where rapid growth meets stable funding. This is the time for industrious people to raise their hands to solve the next generation of problems. Mendix is a place where ambitious people can thrive; where you can identify an issue, propose a solution, and build the structure to make it happen.  Important to know: Mendix is a Siemens business, which means we’re backed by the resources and stability of one of the world’s largest and most forward-looking enterprises. Think: job security.  Since our company was founded in 2005, our aim has been to create a great work environment for people at all stages in their careers. That’s why we are so pleased and honored that we were rated a top Cloud Computing Company to work for in 2019, based on feedback from our employees on Glassdoor. With offices in the Netherlands, the UK, Germany, and the US, (and more coming), we provide an international playground to truly impact the world through low-code.

title: (Junior) Business Analyst
summary:
Knowledge of Google/Firebase analytics, Google Ads, Commercetools, SFMC and marketing attribution is a big plus.
“Gaming Together, Wherever You Are!”.
description: “Gaming Together, Wherever You Are!” GamePoint is one of the largest social game developing companies, based in the Netherlands. Every month we welcome large groups of unique players on Web, Facebook and Mobile from all over the world with our synchronous Bingo, Social Casino, Card and Board games. Some of our games are among the top 100 best earning games in the world. Due to the unique social features, users play an average of 120 minutes per day within our games. Our current top games are GamePoint Bingo, RoyalDice, GamePoint Casino and CardParty. We are committed to entertain and support a live global audience, building long term relationships with all of our players on a daily basis. Our dedication to localized community management and support is second to none.  Operating from The Hague and Kiev, we cultivate brilliant talented team members and we only hire the best from around the globe to complement our growing teams. Since our founding in 1998, we’ve been building a company where we take risks and dream big. We currently have 160 international team members embracing a common vision for quality experiences and all have a passion for gaming. And together, we bring fun and entertainment to our millions of players across the globe!  See for more information our corporate Website: www.gamepoint.biz or play our great games on www.gamepoint.com.  Position Summary – Business Analyst We currently have a great opportunity for a data driven Business Analyst within our state-of-the-art Business Intelligence team. You will learn from and work together with our Data Analysts, a Data Engineer and our head of Data. As Business Analyst you will analyze current and past campaign efforts, analyze the effectiviness of our Sale Campaigns, crunch user data and identify trends. With the gained insights you will be supporting decisions and presenting findings to various stakeholders. Note: EU-residency is mandatory  Key Responsibilities Develop reports using BI tools and languages (e.g. Tableau, Amazon Redshift, SQL, Python or R) to help stakeholders track their progress & achievements Conduct the execution and integration of highly sophisticated analytics to promote understanding of different business areas or critical business challenges/opportunities. Aanalyze business needs, translating data into actionable insights and visualizing your findings to drive the commercial success Collect data from different platforms, and merge date into data sets Reports actionable insights and statitics to various teams: Monetization, Marketing, User Acquisition & Game Development Work on new projects to further improve analytics across departments  Educational & (Work) Experience An academic quantitative degree (BSc) is required preferably in Econometrics/Economy, Mathematics, Statistics, Data Science, Artificial Intelligence or another related field with a strong emphasis on quantitative analysis Experience in using data analysis in a commercial environment Experience in E-Commerce is highly rated  Essential skills Knowledge of Google/Firebase analytics, Google Ads, Commercetools, SFMC and marketing attribution is a big plus Excel: Pivot tables, table structure, formula creations SQL: Query writing, query optimization, ability to handle huge databases Ability to create visualizations of your analysis, solid knowledge of Tableau is required Being able to do in-depth analyzes like for example customer lifetime value, cohort analysis, sales forecast, customer segmentation, customer churn modelling;  Additional qualifications Fluent English (written & spoken) and good communication skills Comfortable in presenting analysis to higher Management  What do we have to offer We offer a competitive package packed with pension benefits, a lunch arrangement and a fun and casual work environment, frequent team building events and lots of more fun and perks! We have a casual international work environment in a beautiful historical building in the middle of the center of The Hague!  Contact Do you have what it takes? Submit your resume and motivational letter explaining your history and why you think you should be a good fit for this role, our team. If you would like more information regarding this unique position within GamePoint B.V. please contact Inge van der Burg (HR Manager) by phone: +31 (0)70 – 3110110 or by e-mail: iburg@gamepoint.com.  See for more info information our corporate Website: www.gamepoint.biz  Please do not contact us for sales purposes

title: JUNIOR TRADE MARKETEER
summary:
Goed ontwikkeld begrip van marketing.
Samen met onze inkoper ben je verantwoordelijk voor het gehele (marketing)proces.
Deze eigenschappen zoeken we ook in jou.
description: Junior Trade Marketeer De organisatie Wij zijn gek op alles wat met foto en video te maken heeft. Onze klanten maken we blij met geweldige foto- en videoproducten, bijzondere accessoires en gadgets. Kamera Express is al meer dan 20 jaar dé foto- en videospecialist van Nederland en België. Wij zijn sterk aan het groeien met een sterke omni-channel benadering waarbij de fysieke winkels en de webshop naadloos op elkaar aansluiten. Naast Kamera Express bieden wij verhuur aan via Budgetcam en fotoprints, fotoalbums en wanddecoratie via Profotonet. De 20 winkels van Kamera Express zijn plaatsen waar foto- en videoliefhebbers samen komen om te sparren en deskundig advies in te winnen over hun hobby of beroep. Enthousiast, inspirerend, nieuwsgierig, betrokken, oprecht en verrassend, zijn kenmerken die passen bij Kamera Express. Deze eigenschappen zoeken we ook in jou. Voor onze afdeling Marketing en E-commerce zijn wij op zoek naar een enthousiaste, creatieve Junior Trade marketeer. Omschrijving van de functie Kamera Express bevindt zich midden in de dynamische wereld van de omni-channel retail. Een markt die – zeker nu – meer dan ooit in beweging is. Dit brengt uitdagingen met zich mee. Als Junior Trade Marketeer ben je verantwoordelijk voor het samen opstellen en doorvertalen van de merkplannen en merkactivaties van onze leveranciers naar de Kamera Express kanalen (zowel online als offline). Jij bent de verbindende schakel tussen onze leveranciers, ons inkoopteam en marketing & E-Commerce. Je zorgt ervoor dat alle belangen goed worden meegenomen zodat de (jaar)planningen van de verschillende stakeholders goed op elkaar aansluiten. Binnen onze brand guidelines, maak je gebruik van je marketing en sales ervaring om de doelstellingen te vertalen naar actieplannen. Je weet als geen ander hoe je een campagne ontwikkelt, onderhoudt en hoe je learnings vervolgens strategisch toepast op volgende campagnes Samen met onze inkoper ben je verantwoordelijk voor het gehele (marketing)proces. Van marketingafspraken met onze leveranciers tot en met de doorvertaling (uitvoer), ontwerp, inzet en rapportage. Dit doe je uiteraard samen met een team van specialisten binnen Kamera Express. Je bent niet alleen een teamspeler, maar je werkt makkelijk zelfstandig en proactief. Je krijgt veel ruimte om zelf vorm te geven aan deze discipline binnen het team. Je bent in staat om met enthousiasme en flair jouw visie, inzichten en plannen te presenteren en collega’s mee te nemen. Je werkt data-gedreven en met de inzichten die je creëert optimaliseer je campagnes zodat de belangen van zowel Kamera Express als haar leveranciers tot haar recht komen. Samen met het gehele team, zorgen we ervoor dat de klant altijd centraal staat! Jouw belangrijkste taken en verantwoordelijkheden: Verantwoordelijk voor de marketingafspraken met onze leveranciers, de vroegtijdige ontwikkeling en doorvertaling naar onze kanalen van de actie en promoties. Samen met het inkoop en marketing & E-commerce team werk je aan de jaarkalender. Je zorgt ervoor dat de learnings en aanbevelingen worden meegenomen in de evaluatie en dat deze worden gedeeld met onze partners en de organisatie. Monitoren en terugkoppelen van ontwikkelingen en acties van de markt, concurrent en kanalen. Verantwoordelijk voor een up-to-date Trade Marketing budget I.s.m. onze MI analist opzetten, monitoren van wekelijkse, maandelijkse en kwartaal rapportages t.b.v. management en directie. Wat wordt er van jou verwacht? HBO/WO werk en denk niveau. Goed ontwikkeld begrip van marketing Werkervaring minimaal 3-5 jaar, waarvan min 2-3 jaar ervaring als trade marketeer in de retail branche. Je staat stevig in je schoenen en bent in staat om zelfstandig en assertief de planning te managen. Je bent relationeel sterk en hebt een goed gevoel voor organisatiesensitiviteit. Sterk resultaatgericht, je hebt strategisch & analytisch inzicht i.c.m. de drive om continu zaken te verbeteren. Je werkt nauwkeurig en planmatig en bent organisatorisch sterk (project management). Goed kunnen plannen, organiseren en opvolgen is jouw ding. Je bent goed in staat om de verschillende belangen op elkaar af te stemmen en je collega’s daarin mee te nemen. Je spreekt en schrijft uitstekend Nederlands en Engels, (kennis Duits is een pre) Je bouwt graag mee aan een organisatie die nog volop in ontwikkeling is Je bent voor 40 uur per week beschikbaar Wat wordt jou geboden? Als Junior Trade Marketeer ga je aan de slag binnen het Inkoopteam sta je in nauw contact met het marketing- en e-commerceteam en andere disciplines binnen KE. Je hebt echte invloed op de prestaties van het hele team en de financiële performance van het bedrijf. Een brede, verantwoordelijke, zelfstandige en afwisselende job waarbij je veel ruimte krijgt om zaken zelf op te pakken en te organiseren. Korting op alle spullen die we verkopen 24 vakantiedagen Een baan bij één van de top bedrijven in de Twinkle100 Een enthousiast team met korte lijnen Een salaris naar werkervaring en secundaire arbeidsvoorwaarden die passen bij de functie en branche. Marktconform pensioenregeling. Budget om jezelf te trainen en verder te ontwikkelen.   Gaat jouw hart hier sneller van kloppen? Stuur een mail met een korte motivatie en je CV naar [email protected] t.a.v. Harold Konijnenberg, Director Category Management. Locatie: Capelle aan den IJssel Een referentiecheck maakt deel uit van het sollicitatietraject bij Kamera Express.

title: Senior Analyst, Commercial Strategy & Planning
summary:
If you aren't completely confident that you fit our exact criteria, please reach out anyways.
Humility is a wonderful thing - we're at least as interested in…
description: ABOUT THE ROLE About sennder: If you aren't completely confident that you fit our exact criteria, please reach out anyways. Humility is a wonderful thing - we're at least as interested in your character as in your talent.  sennder, with its HQ located in the heart of Berlin, is changing the way people think about logistics. We revolutionize road freight logistics by making it simpler, quicker, and more cost-efficient to move Full Truck Loads across Europe. We offer the best option for moving freight even to the largest companies by providing a network of technology-connected trucking companies. Shippers get real-time GPS tracking on all shipments, and business analytics to improve their supply chain. You can learn more from us here.  About the role: The Commercial Strategy and Planning team works directly with Commercial leadership to shape our strategic go-to-market approach, inform decisions with data in order to drive sustainable growth, and implement changes and coordinate actions across Sales, Operations, Finance, and other cross-functional teams. The team has recurring responsibilities leading our Commercial planning cycles, regular strategy refresh, reporting and governance. Additionally, the team runs analytical projects including business intelligence and visualization, data products, and anything else our team needs to scale as rapidly as possible. As the business grows, we need strong problem solving & project management skills in order to serve the business and our teams. This is where you come in.  We are looking for a Sr. Analyst with some serious ops resourcefulness to support business planning and execution; someone who isn't afraid to jump into the front lines to figure out the business and operational problems, and has the technical skills to find or build a better solution; someone who is passionate about driving impact by democratizing data and empowering the team; someone who understands and speaks data, operations and strategy equally well.  From day one you will be a trusted partner to executive leadership and relied upon to provide guidance on a variety of complex commercial issues.  Join on the ground floor and help us build the future of freight!  WHAT YOU'LL DO Strategy : Work closely with the Commercial leadership, program managers, and product to align and iterate on overall Commercial strategy and new product launches Planning : Build and maintain financial and headcount models, operational reporting, OKRs, projections, and key business metrics to inform the leadership and the entire org of where the business stands Program/Project Management : Be a resourceful, go-getting multitasker, supporting initiatives across the business by working with cross-functional stakeholders Process Improvement : Identify the biggest operational gaps, inefficiencies, and risks using our internal data and deliver solutions Scale: Build, maintain, and communicate detailed reporting models to assist regional and pan-EU expansion efforts, and make data-driven decisions Develop Relationships : Interface with other functional areas (Carrier, Operations, Product, Finance, Marketing, Legal, etc.) to ensure efficient and productive working relationships PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS 5+ years of investment banking / consulting / business intelligence / strategy or related experience; some high-growth operations or startup experience is very much preferred Ability to work with remote teams to develop strategies and foster a cohesive and creative work environment Balance attention to detail with swift execution - we need to do things quickly, and need to do them well Self-starter - the ability to self-serve, investigate and get the data we require will make you much more effective in this role Experience in defining solutions to complex, strategic topics with a deeply analytical and data-driven approach to issues Clear communicator. You are a clear and concise communicator with the ability to synthesize a lot of information quickly, highlight the key takeaways, and disseminate actionable insights Bachelor's degree, Master's degree is preferred Fluency in English, written and spoken Experience in Logistics and/or tech industries preferred Some exposure and/or experience in B2C/B2B marketplaces a plus

title: Commercial Policy Director - Sleep & Respiratory
summary:
Guide and coach business analyst.
Philips is growing its marketing capability enterprise wide.
Commercial Policy Director - Sleep & Respiratory.
description: Job Title Commercial Policy Director - Sleep & Respiratory Job Description In this role, you have the opportunity to lead the commercial policy framework within sleep & respiratory care globally. You are responsible for Lead the Commercial Policy framework improvement for across channels (e.g., indirect, B2C) globally Drive culture change moving to pay for performance for indirect channel partners Enhance and ensure deployment of the commercial policy training to market teams Coach market and business teams, share best practices, design and execute programs to build world-class pricing capability for digital and indirect channels Own daily management dashboards, monthly reporting and review with market and business teams Drive consistent evaluation of promo action to help market teams optimize them. Provide feedback to supporting functions on processes, analytics, and tools improvements. Engage with business team to ensure strategic alignment between business vision and strategy and Commercial Policy programs, provide insights to business team on portfolio pricing challenges. Lead the evolution of Commercial Policy to new business models (e.g., subscription, risk sharing). Support building the value proposition for indirect partners to move to online platform. Guide and coach business analyst Act as a role model for compliance and Philips behaviors You are a part of A central dedicated commercial policy team with global scope constantly striving for improvements and increasing strategic alignment. To succeed in this role, you should have the following skills and experience Strong commercial understanding (> 10 years’ experience) and ‘can do’ mentality to search for solutions Ability to work both on a strategic level as well as an operational level in a virtual team with a wide array of stakeholders (cross-functional, cross-layer) Strong conceptual and analytical skills and also hands-on Intercultural fluency, strong communication and interpersonal skills. Interacts internally and externally with executive level management, requiring negotiation of extremely critical matters. Influences policy-making. Proven leadership skills in a highly dynamic matrix organization Project management skills Previous exposure to B2B business. Experience in health systems is a plus LEAN certified (advanced) preferred In return, we offer you A path towards your most rewarding career. Philips is growing its marketing capability enterprise wide. Succeeding in this market-based role in a complex environment will open many doors for your long term career, in other areas in Philips or otherwise. Why should you join Philips? Working at Philips is more than a job. It’s a calling to create a healthier society through meaningful work, focused on improving 2.5 billion lives a year by delivering innovative solutions across the health continuum. Our people experience a variety of unexpected moments when their lives and careers come together in meaningful ways. Learn more by watching this video. To find out more about what it’s like working for Philips at a personal level, visit the Working at Philips page on our career website, where you can read stories from our employee blog. Once there,you can also learn about our recruitment process, or find answers to some of the frequently asked questions. #LI-EU Contact If you forgot your password, you can click the Forgot Password button on the Sign In screen to reset it. If you have any other questions regarding the recruitment process please refer to our FAQs. In case of technical difficulties with the website, please send an email to careersite@philips.com. (Note: To ensure fairness and legal compliance in our recruitment processes, only technical issues will be monitored through the above inbox. Please do not submit resumes or applications to this email, as they will not be reviewed. Only applications received through the online application process will be considered.)

title: Regional Marketing Manager
summary:
Minimum of 3 years marketing programs/field marketing/ ABM experience.
Prior experience in enterprise software marketing.
If so, come join the Pega team!
description: Meet Our Team: Our Client Engagement team is accountable for driving global engagement at scale through the development and execution of region wide, vertical- and account-specific marketing campaigns; the development and activation of industry leading content and webinars to fuel Pega’s marketing engine; the creation and execution of alliance marketing programs to amplify engagement with Pega’s partner ecosystem; and project management support across Pega’s key marketing programs. Picture Yourself at Pega: Do you enjoy partnering with sales to make an impact at target accounts? Are you tired of running one-size-fits-all programs that struggle to break through the noise? If so, come join the Pega team! The Regional Marketing Manager (RMM) will support the development and execution of account-based marketing programs aimed at driving engagement and influencing pipeline at target accounts. The RMM will help coordinate a cross-functional set of stakeholders to identify the right objectives and corresponding strategy for each targeted segment, and then assemble the right set of activities needed to achieve success. RMMs are empowered to “own” the Pega experience for accounts in their region, and to ensure that it tells the Pega story in a way that is most relevant to their situation. What You'll Do at Pega: Assist with the creation of account-based marketing programs that are tailored to segments of both individual organizations, as well as groups of organizations with similar business models and challenges Leverage the quarterly planning process with sales to identify the right objectives, strategies and prioritization for marketing to each of the targeted segments Coordinate a broad group of channel owners and/or work with external agency partners in the assembly of tactics and activities that come together as an integrated account-based marketing (ABM) program to drive customer engagement Support relevant 3rd party and Pegasystems events in your campaign plan, from event communication to coordination with the events team Help drive activation of key marketing programs to the field sales teams, and conversely communicate needs of the field back to corporate marketing Share lessons learned with regional marketing team members in order to continually challenge the status quo and create best practices that improve the regional marketing model Who You Are: A winner! You’re motivated to work in an environment where your personal impact will show and where strong performers are recognized. The Regional Marketing Manager need to excel at working with a diverse set of functions and levels. You should be comfortable operating in a high growth environment where you will be challenged to prioritise limited resources to drive maximum return to the business. The RMM should be comfortable using data and analytics to determine and support strategy definition and be comfortable leading the group to consensus on a plan that will serve the priorities of the business for the region. A RMM should take initiative and needs to be excellent at supporting multiple projects simultaneously, managing competing priorities and appropriately manage the expectations of stakeholders both at a local level and global. What You've Accomplished: Bachelor’s degree Minimum of 3 years marketing programs/field marketing/ ABM experience Demonstrated ability to effectively manage multiple projects, prioritize work and meet deadlines A curios self-starter who embraces new challenges and opportunities and can apply their knowledge and experience to create strong business outcomes A team player who contributes to the overall team development and impact but is also comfortable leading your own initiatives Exceptional interpersonal skills and flexibility to work effectively with people at all levels Ability to navigate a complex org structure to build consensus around ideas and plans Ability to operate in a high growth environment, and dealing with ambiguity whilst navigating and succeeding in a rapidly evolving business Excellent written and verbal communication skills Strong analytical skills and a demonstrated ability to leverage data to drive strategy and decision-making Proactive and ambitious you are excited about working in a growing business to make a demonstrable impact Prior experience in enterprise software marketing Proficiency with MS Office, Excel, PowerPoint, Social Collaboration tools; LinkedIn, Twitter, Google Analytics  Pega Offers You: Gartner Analyst acclaimed technology leadership across our categories of products Continuous learning and development opportunities An innovative, inclusive, agile, flexible, and fun work environment Competitive global benefits program inclusive of pay + bonus incentive, employee equity in the company  As an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer, Pegasystems will not discriminate in its employment practices due to an applicant's race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, genetic information, veteran or disability status, or any other category protected by law. Accessibility – If you require accessibility assistance applying for open positions please contact PegaApplication@pega.com.

title: Performance Improvement Analyst - Energy Insights
summary: We offer services along the oil and gas value chain, including exploration and production, refining and marketing, natural gas, trading and oil field services,…
description: QUALIFICATIONS University degree with excellent academic record 2-4 years of experience ideally in the oil & gas or energy industry; background in consulting, strategy and/or research is a plus Modeling capability using Excel and experience managing large datasets with databases Distinctive analytical and quantitative skills Proven record of leadership in a work setting and/or through extracurricular activities Ability to work collaboratively in a team environment Ability to communicate complex ideas effectively, both verbally and in writing WHO YOU'LL WORK WITH You’ll work with our McKinsey Energy Insights team in Amsterdam. Energy Insights, a specialist data and analytics unit, provides distinctive analysis, insights, and support to energy players. We offer services along the oil and gas value chain, including exploration and production, refining and marketing, natural gas, trading and oil field services, and equipment. Energy Insights’ dedicated specialists apply proprietary tools and methodologies and a data-driven approach. With our strong ties with McKinsey’s oil and gas consulting practice and access to the expertise of the wider McKinsey network, our research and analysis yield knowledge available nowhere else. WHAT YOU'LL DO You will spend a significant amount of time analyzing large datasets, synthesizing and communicating findings, and managing and improving benchmarking delivery tools. In this role, you will analyze large datasets using databases and Excel, synthesize communication of findings and manage the delivery tools. You will play an active role in the delivery of performance improvement and benchmarking studies. You will also liaise with clients regularly over the phone and face-to-face in management presentations. You will design new client services and tools for the oil and gas and energy industries. You will build upstream oil and gas industry expertise while specializing in a range of sectors over time. You will work with senior expert practitioners to develop insights and play a key role in managing this knowledge. You will manage the benchmarking delivery tools including the proprietary databases and models, as well as play a key role in the continuous efforts to improve ways in which we develop and deliver results to clients. You’ll have the opportunity to gain new skills and build on the strengths you bring to the firm. You will receive exceptional training as well as frequent coaching and mentoring from colleagues.

title: Business Information Analyst Salesforce
summary:
Maar ook aan Selligent en Pardot voor e-mail marketing en Glance om co-browsing met de klant mogelijk te maken.
Over de afdeling Digital Platforms.
description: Bij Aegon voelen we ons verantwoordelijk voor de financiële bewustwording van mensen. We bieden begrijpelijke oplossingen waardoor onze klanten zelf bewuste keuzes kunnen maken voor een gezonde financiële toekomst. Om succesvol te zijn in een snel veranderende wereld wil Aegon een toonaangevende speler zijn op het gebied van data gedreven digitale dienstverlening. In rap tempo passen we onze bestaande infrastructuur aan om klanten fundamenteel beter te bedienen. Over de afdeling Digital Platforms Wij willen de organisatie in staat stellen om beter, sneller en goedkoper digitale dienstverlening naar de klant te realiseren. We doen dit voor de platformen Aegon.nl, Mijn Aegon (web/app) en het Adviseurs Portaal. Hierbij focussen wij op het ontwikkelen van generieke functionaliteit voor alle bedrijfsonderdelen. We bedienen met de generieke functionaliteit zowel de eindklant, adviseurs als de interne klantorganisatie (o.a. met Salesforce CRM), die op haar beurt ook de eindklant bedient. We kijken daarom ook continu naar de digitale ketens in gehele organisatie, om te bepalen waar we de meeste waarde kunnen toevoegen en hierbij werken wij nauw samen met andere IT-afdelingen. Wat ga je doen? Je wordt onderdeel van het DevOps CRM-team waar je, samen met 7 anderen, een aantal uiterst belangrijke interne applicaties beheerd en doorontwikkeld. Denk aan het Salesforce platform, waar we gebruik maken van o.a. Service Cloud en Live Chat om zo een optimaal 360 graden klantbeeld te kunnen bieden. Maar ook aan Selligent en Pardot voor e-mail marketing en Glance om co-browsing met de klant mogelijk te maken. Als DevOps teamlid bestaan je werkzaamheden uit zowel Development (changes) als Operations (incidenten & beheer). Jouw focus als BIA ligt hierbij zeker op de change kant waar meer dan 80% van je tijd in zal zitten. Denk hierbij b.v. aan het implementeren van een nieuwe Privacy epic binnen Aegon NL om onze Salesforce org privacy proof te maken. maar ook aan de upgrade naar Salesforce Lightning of de implementatie van een nieuwe facturatie functionaliteit binnen Salesforce. Over jouw rol als BIA Om dit goed voor elkaar te krijgen ben je als BIA van veel markten thuis: je hebt kennis van ‘best practices’ binnen Salesforce en je schrikt niet terug om business requirements te vertalen naar functionele en technische oplossingen, welke je waar mogelijk ook zelf configureert en test in Salesforce. uiteraard in continue afstemming met business stakeholders. Natuurlijk hoef je dit niet allemaal alleen te doen: je kunt terugvallen op de andere BIA’s of APEX developer van je team. En voor de inbedding in het Aegon landschap werk je ook nauw samen met de Solution Architect van het domein. Verder zal je ook contact hebben met teamleden van andere teams, om ervaringen te delen, om hun wensen goed te begrijpen en deze te vertalen naar concrete dienstverlening of om hun diensten juist te embedden in Salesforce. Daarnaast ben je ook onderdeel van de Community of Practice met andere BIA’s, waarbij je kennis uitwisselt en kan sparren over vraagstukken. De CoP organiseert onder andere verschillende kennissessies om zo ook je kennis in andere domeinen te verbreden Je bent dus een spin in het web en je grootste kracht zit in het overzien van dat geheel. Je kan abstract denken, goed de hoofdzaken scheiden van de bijzaken en de grote doelstellingen efficiënt terugbrengen tot hapklare brokken die het team kan oppakken in de sprints. Hierbij heb je de senioriteit om het team mee te nemen in de uitvoering totdat de doelstellingen gehaald zijn. We vragen heel veel en bieden daarom ook graag ruimte voor persoonlijke ontwikkeling. Dus als je een bepaalde ervaring mist maar denkt dat je ons ervan kan overtuigen dat je dit snel onder de knie hebt, reageer dan vooral. Ook dan maken we graag kennis met je! Kortom: een uitdagende allround functie in het hart van de IT-organisatie waar we je met heel veel stakeholders binnen Aegon contact hebt. Wat neem je mee? Je hebt een HBO werk- en denkniveau met minimaal 2 jaar werkervaring in een vergelijkbare rol met requirements analyse en de vertaling hiervan naar functioneel en/of technisch ontwerp (Business Analysis, Business Value Optimization) Wij werken in een Agile/DevOps omgeving en verwachten dat jij hier ervaring mee hebt en naadloos in mee gaat. Kennis van en ervaring met Salesforce voor analyse & configuratie werk Je bent communicatief sterk op diverse niveaus, zowel mondeling als schriftelijk (Nederlands en Engels). De voertaal in het team is voornamelijk Engels Je bent klantgericht, analytisch sterk, initiatiefrijk en beschikt over een goed probleemoplossend vermogen Je bent pragmatisch en vindt het leuk om aan nieuwe zaken te werken en daarvan te leren Je staat open voor innovatie binnen het vakgebied en volgt de marktontwikkelingen Je bent proactief op zoek naar kansen om iedere dag jezelf en het team verder te ontwikkelen.  Wat kunnen wij je bieden ? Je salaris bedraagt maximaal € 6.299,- per maand op basis van 40 uur Je krijgt een dertiende maand en vakantievergoeding in de vorm van een maandelijks flexbudget van 16,7% van je maandsalaris. Alle ruimte én budget om je persoonlijk te ontwikkelen. Minimaal 27 vakantiedagen. Vergoeding van je reiskosten. Een uitstekende pensioenregeling. Internationale collega’s Inhoudelijke uitdagingen om je tanden in te zetten Een superleuk team met veel ervaring om jezelf in te ontwikkelen als Salesforce expert Enthousiast? Solliciteer! Spreekt deze rol jou aan en wil jij straks als BIA Salesforce bij Aegon het verschil gaan maken? Dan nodigen wij je graag uit te solliciteren. Wij ontvangen Een online assessment maakt onderdeel uit van het selectieproces. Voor meer informatie kan je contact opnemen met Max Krajenbrink, Talent Acquisition Manager a.i. via max.krajenbrink@aegon.nl of op telefoonnummer 06-48564163 #LI-MK01

title: (Junior) Consultant in Energy & Utilities
summary:
Sia Partners is a next generation management consulting firm and pioneer of Consulting 4.0.
We offer a unique blend of AI and design capabilities, augmenting…
description: Company Description  Sia Partners is a next generation management consulting firm and pioneer of Consulting 4.0. We offer a unique blend of AI and design capabilities, augmenting traditional consulting to deliver exceptional value to our clients. With 1,800 consultants in 18 countries and expertise in more than 30 sectors and services, we optimize client projects worldwide. Through our Consulting for Good approach, we strive for next-level impact by developing innovative CSR solutions for our clients, making sustainability a lever for profitable transformation.  Sia Partners Netherlands In 2009 the office in Amsterdam was opened, which is now situated at the 28th floor of the Rembrandt Tower with a great view on the city of Amsterdam. We focus on the following sectors: Energy & Utilities, Financial Services, Marketing & Customer Experience, Data Science and HR, Transformation & Change. The Dutch team is experiencing strong growth and has now built up an impressive client portfolio, supported by and cooperating with colleagues from our international offices. Sia Partners Netherlands employs approximately 55 consultants.  Job Description  When starting at Sia Partners, you will be warmly welcomed in the Energy team. In a rapidly changing energy market, assignments and roles cannot be predicted. Examples of assignments that we have done are: forecasting, data analytics, market entry studies, operational optimization and energy transition. Whatever the assignment is going to be, it will be impactful. Your contribution matters.  When working in a project at one of our clients, a Consultant typically fulfills a role as a Business Analyst or PMO. This means that your focus would be on defining and analyzing the requirements that the client might have for the solution that we should implement. Communication with all relevant stakeholders on the subject matter helps to find the optimal solution, and also a great way to learn all about the energy sector and the role of the client. Entrepreneurship within your position is important, you are responsible for your further career. You are constantly dared to be the best version of yourself. Working together with your team is an important factor for success. Sia Partners offers you everything you need to achieve this and values personal development.  Qualifications You have completed your Master’s Degree. Passion for energy! Some experience is more than welcome but not a must as a junior. If you have a few years experience, you will be scaled on a different level. Dutch and English communication and presentation skills are mandatory. You are able to process information, identify problems and trends, and solve complex problems. You have an entrepreneurial mindset. What do we offer? Competitive salary with great extra advantages: a company car or flexible mobility plan, a clear and structured yearly salary increase and bonuses. Flexible transport options that match your personal needs. Training plan to develop yourself as an expert in your discipline. You have the opportunity to work from home, the client or from our inspiring office in Amsterdam. Working in an international environment which creates opportunities to share knowledge and work together on international projects with colleagues all over the world.

title: Manager Business Analysis
summary:
What's in it for you?
Working in faced-paced & continuously changing environment, Healthy lunch at a reduced rates , Nearby Hoofddorp station.
description: What's in it for you? Competitive package Employee Performance Bonus Working in faced-paced & continuously changing environment, Healthy lunch at a reduced rates , Nearby Hoofddorp station What is required? People management skills Analytical Effective communication skills Why Interxion? The opportunity to make an impact Highly collaborative teams that build relationships with world-class customers A high-performing international business at the heart of the digital economy  The Manager Business Analysis is managing a team of 10 to 12 (Senior) Business Analysts (in NL & UK) and is accountable for the Consistency, Quality and Alignment of all the Business Processes within & between the company’s Centres of Excellence (CoE). Next to managing the team, the Manager Business Analysis is expected to continuously improve and optimize the BA practices and standards of the team, while also perform the role as an individual Senior Business Analyst in various projects. The BA team will collaborate with Business & Development Leads, Product Marketing, Process owners & practitioners as well as the development teams to translate business objectives into requirements and confirm that (new) business application systems can be developed and / or enabled to meet business needs. Due to the globalized nature of Interxion’s customer base, consistent and standardized customer experiences becomes increasingly important together with the goal to improve the efficiency, effectiveness and scalability of Interxion’s workforce. Therefore, it is imperative that the Manager Business Analysis has required End to End process experience within the Business Process arena. The Manager Business Analysis is reporting directly to the Director Project Office  What you’ll need Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Business Administration or related discipline from an accredited institution; At least 8+ years’ experience in a Senior Business Analyst Role in a Project based environment; Experience working closely with IT Development teams (working with both remote / off-site and on-Site teams); Familiar with financial considerations, business cases etc.; Experience in building strong and efficient teams with an eye for the group dynamics; Good Planning & Organization skills, exemplary Analytical Skills; Good communication skills, independent worker, self-starter; Fluent written and spoken English is essential. Any other European language is an advantage; willing to travel regularly, mainly within Europe.  Project Office at Interxion We’re at the heart of everything that happens in Interxion. As the business continues to grow and change at a rapid pace, our Business Analysts and Project Managers work together to deliver the projects that support this growth. This could involve anything from improving business processes in finance or introducing automation in our customer service centre, to planning a new office or data centre. It’s challenging, varied and exciting work that exposes us to every area of the business.  About us At the heart of the global digital economy, we provide fast, secure connections that enable businesses to thrive and people to access online services. In March 2020, Interxion combined with Digital Realty and we are now proud to be known as Interxion: A Digital Realty company in Europe. As part of Digital Realty, customers now have access to over 280 data centres in 24 countries across six continents. To learn more about Digital Realty click here.  Apply? To apply, click on “Apply now’. You will be redirected to our candidate management system which we will use to manage your application. #LI-DK1  Apply now

title: Incident Response Coordinator/Analyst - IBM CISO
summary: IBM Corporate Headquarters (CHQ) team represents a variety of functions such as marketing, finance, legal, operations, HR, and more, all working together to…
description: Introduction At IBM, work is more than a job - it's a calling: To build. To design. To code. To consult. To think along with clients and sell. To make markets. To invent. To collaborate. Not just to do something better, but to attempt things you've never thought possible. Are you ready to lead in this new era of technology and solve some of the world's most challenging problems? If so, lets talk.  Your Role and Responsibilities The Computer Security Incident Response Team (CSIRT) manages security incidents, leads investigations, and remediates threats to systems and data. The cybersecurity specialist works in Incident Response and Digital Forensics.  As an Incident Response Coordinator, you handle security incidents from intake through triage, protection and remediation. You communicate effectively with business and technical teams across the company, including executive management, as well as corporate functions. You conduct meetings with stakeholders to facilitate the exchange of information, agree on and track the completion of actions, and document the findings and lessons learned.  As Incident Response Analyst, you conduct the technical analysis for security incidents (for example, unauthorized access, malware/ransomware, data loss, advanced persistent threats). You apply forensically sound methods for evidence handling and managing the chain of custody. You combine data from multiple sources, including system images, event logs, digital media and threat intelligence, to investigate threats, establish incident timelines, and document the findings in detailed, evidence based technical reports.  Working with global teams across the company, you ensure that security incidents are handled in a timely and professional manner and contribute to the ongoing improvement of IBM’s overall IT security posture.  Required Technical and Professional Expertise Experience with incident management and understanding of security incident management standards and best practices. Strong oral and written communications skills in English, additional languages are a plus. Strong interpersonal and organizational skills. Knowledge of common security threats, attack vectors and penetration techniques. Experience with running and investigating systems using multiple platforms, including Linux, Windows, MacOS, Android, iOS. Experience with forensic tools such as Encase, FTK, Magnet IEF, SIFT, X-ways, Magnet Axiom and live data capture tools. Experience with event analysis and correlation, and malware analysis. Knowledge of networking technologies, including firewalls, proxies, IDS/IPS, and network protocols. Knowledge of Unix shell and common scripting languages for data manipulation  Preferred Technical and Professional Expertise At least two years’ experience in Incident Response and/or Digital Forensics in a global enterprise. At least one Information Security Professional Certification (e.g. CISSP, GIAC, EnCE, CFCE, CCE, DFCP, GCIA, GCIH). Familiarity with IBM QRadar SIEM, Windows Defender ATP and EDR platforms is a plus  About Business Unit IBM Corporate Headquarters (CHQ) team represents a variety of functions such as marketing, finance, legal, operations, HR, and more, all working together to solve some of the world's most complex problems, help our clients achieve success and build collaborative work environments for IBMers.  Your Life @ IBM What matters to you when you’re looking for your next career challenge?  Maybe you want to get involved in work that really changes the world? What about somewhere with incredible and diverse career and development opportunities – where you can truly discover your passion? Are you looking for a culture of openness, collaboration and trust – where everyone has a voice? What about all of these? If so, then IBM could be your next career challenge. Join us, not to do something better, but to attempt things you never thought possible.  Impact. Inclusion. Infinite Experiences. Do your best work ever.  About IBM IBM’s greatest invention is the IBMer. We believe that progress is made through progressive thinking, progressive leadership, progressive policy and progressive action. IBMers believe that the application of intelligence, reason and science can improve business, society and the human condition. Restlessly reinventing since 1911, we are the largest technology and consulting employer in the world, with more than 380,000 IBMers serving clients in 170 countries.  Location Statement For additional information about location requirements, please discuss with the recruiter following submission of your application.  Being You @ IBM IBM is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, pregnancy, disability, age, veteran status, or other characteristics. IBM is also committed to compliance with all fair employment practices regarding citizenship and immigration status.

title: Analytics Business Consultant
summary:
You’ll be working close together with the marketeers and market data analysts of our clients.
At least 4 years of proven experience in roles where you have been…
description: We go beyond the obvious, using intelligence, passion and creativity to inspire new thinking and shape the world we live in. To start a career that is out of the ordinary, please apply... Job Details Do you like to make complicated simple? Are you able to translate complex models into business insights that drive growth? We are currently searching for a commercially minded analytics consultant to join our Kantar team in Amsterdam. Analytics is a key growth area for Kantar, and a critical backbone for many of our solutions of the future. Kantar’s value to clients lies increasingly in the connections we can make between different data-sets that results in richer and deeper insights and allows us to offer more customized, more interesting and ultimately, more effective solutions and services to our clients. You’ll be working close together with the marketeers and market data analysts of our clients. Our clients are Fortune 500 companies in the tech, FCMG, banking, service industry and more. Kantar’s Analytic Practice is the key enabler for surfacing connected data intelligence, working across a wide variety of statistical techniques such as driver analyses, segmentation, marketing mix modelling, and discrete choice modelling, as well as newer state of the art techniques with multi-touch attribution modelling, social media modelling and artificial intelligence/machine learning. The role will be part of a growing Analytics Practice. Locally you will work alongside the data consultants, the brand and media domain teams and the commercial business development team. You will also be part of a much larger global analytics team, utilizing the global centers of excellence (GCOE’s) and bringing these capabilities to our clients in the Netherlands. This role will report into the Head of Analytics in the Kantar Insights Division in The Netherlands. Role Description In this role you will: Be responsible for the sales and execution of our analytic solutions to address client issues related to the return on total marketing investment, media effectiveness and brand equity growth. Work with our client service and practice area teams to develop and cultivate long-lasting client relationships. Take our client-first approach to diagnose your clients’ analytic needs. Translate data into insights in a way that enables our clients to answer their business issues. Present findings and sell solutions to your clients in a way that addresses not only the interpretation of the statistical results, but the business implications of the contributing analysis Advise clients on Predictive modelling, Time series forecasting, Marketing Mix Modelling, Segmentation and Path modelling. Role Requirements If you are tech savvy, passionate about data and have a commercial mindset, then we are looking for you. On top of that, we are looking for someone who has: A Masters’ Degree in Business, Marketing, Marketing Analytics, Econometrics, Statistics, Communication studies, or related fields where you were involved in data driven marketing or analytics consulting. At least 4 years of proven experience in roles where you have been involved in marketing and data analytics. Preferably at a market research organization or agency, working as a Business, Marketing or Media Consultant Understand both survey and non-survey-based research data and analytic approaches as well as data structures Be able to multi-task in a fast-paced environment Be collaborative and enjoy working in a global organization Have a good business acumen and be motivated by growing the commercial scope of our analytics solutions to drive revenue generation and profitability Fluent in English, Dutch is a plus Hold a valid workpermit JOIN US We offer you an informal and open-minded working environment, with a focus on growth. Where you will be working on exciting projects for several of the largest companies in the world. You will be part of an (international) team of experts to inspire and support you. Besides this we offer you: A global, dynamic and fun work environment Access to expertise and the latest tools within an international organization, with the opportunity to develop yourself and acquire new skills An enthusiastic, highly motivated team and a high level of responsibility We go beyond the obvious, using intelligence, passion and creativity to inspire new thinking and shape the world we live in. Apply for a career that’s out of the ordinary and join us. We want to create an equality of opportunity in a fair and supportive working environment where people feel included, accepted and are allowed to flourish in a space where their mental health and well being is taken into consideration. We want to create a more diverse community to expand our talent pool, be locally representative, drive diversity of thinking and better commercial outcomes. Location Amsterdam, AmsteldijkNetherlands Kantar Rewards Statement At Kantar we have an integrated way of rewarding our people based around a simple, clear and consistent set of principles. Our approach helps to ensure we are market competitive and also to support a pay for performance culture, where your reward and career progression opportunities are linked to what you deliver. Kantar is the world’s leading data, insights and consulting company. We understand more about how people think, feel, shop, share, vote and view than anyone else. Combining our expertise in human understanding with advanced technologies, Kantar’s 30,000 people help the world’s leading organisations succeed and grow.

title: Data Adviseur Kruidvat & Trekpleister
summary:
Je hebt minimaal 2 jaar ervaring als data analist en hebt affiniteit met retail.
Als Data Adviseur speel je een belangrijke rol door data om te zetten in acties…
description: Dit ga je doen  Als Data Adviseur speel je een belangrijke rol door data om te zetten in acties met je kennis van data analyseren en visualiseren. Je bent de spin in het web tussen commerciële teams en de uitdagende wereld van data en technologie.  Binnen Kruidvat en Trekpleister bestaat er een uniek datalandschap waarin miljoenen ‘touchpoints’ zijn opgeslagen van klanten in onze ruim 1.400 winkels, de webshops en via de loyaliteitsprogramma’s. De analyse mogelijkheden zijn dus eindeloos. En laat dat nou precies zijn wat we vanuit de afdeling Marketing Intelligence doen! We ‘slicen en dicen’ de data om kansen voor onze commerciële afdelingen te identificeren, ontwikkelen van Tableau dashboarden waardoor teams zelf met de data aan de slag gaan en dragen pro-actief verbeteringen aan om zo de klant optimaal te bedienen.  Voorbeelden van cases waar we momenteel aan werken zijn: Performance measurement;  Prijsstrategieën;  Assortimentsoptimalisatie;  Campagne analyses;  Klantsegmentatie voor CRM.  Begint het al te kriebelen? Lees dan snel verder!  Wat doe je zoal als Data Adviseur in de dagelijkse praktijk?  Je ontwikkelt dashboardoplossingen in Tableau die de business handvatten geeft om direct bij te kunnen sturen.  Je combineert verschillende datasets om hypothesen rondom mogelijke kansen te testen, nog ‘verborgen’ verbanden te onthullen en inzichten te verschaffen waarmee de business uit de voeten kan.  Je weet de data, benodigd voor visualisaties en analyses, uit diverse databases te halen en op te slaan. Hierbij werk je samen met je collega’s van Marketing Intelligence, maar ook met je collega’s van CRM, Inkoop, Marketing en eCommerce. IT is hierbij je beste vriend. Samen realiseren jullie de benodigde veranderingen.  Je blijft mee-ontwikkelen op de innovaties binnen het vakgebied en stelt vast hoe we hiermee invulling kunnen geven aan onze ambities.  Daarnaast werk je samen met je collega’s van onze business units in Londen en Milaan (eCommerce), Londen (CRM) en Renswoude (IT), waar we bij terecht kunnen voor het uitwisselen van ‘best practices’ en support vanuit onze business units in Europa en Azië.  Dit krijg je ervoor terug  Een baan bij een succesvolle internationale organisatie die continu in beweging is en waar met mooie merken gewerkt wordt.  Een goed salaris dat past bij jouw werk- en denkniveau en ervaring en verder o.a. 30 vakantiedagen op fulltime basis en… omdat jij natuurlijk fan bent van onze winkels en producten krijg je ook nog een personeelskorting op aankopen bij onze winkels van Kruidvat, Trekpleister en ICI PARIS XL.  De mogelijkheid om gedurende het jaar zelf te bepalen of je meer vrije tijd of liever extra inkomsten wilt hebben. Door onze flexibele arbeidsvoorwaarden kun je vakantiedagen kopen en verkopen.  Volop ontwikkelings- en doorgroeimogelijkheden: door de groei en het succes van onze organisatie bieden we talent altijd een mogelijkheid voor verdere ontwikkeling of om door te groeien in de toekomst.  Een eigen A.S. Watson Academy met een breed aanbod aan trainingen en cursussen.  Een informele, no-nonsense manier van werken: resultaat telt, maar vooral ook respect voor elkaar en een goede sfeer.  Dit ben jij  Je hebt een afgeronde opleiding op HBO/WO-niveau.  Je hebt minimaal 2 jaar ervaring als data analist en hebt affiniteit met retail. Je expertise ligt bij data visualiseren in Tableau en kennis van SQL of Business Objectives is erg handig.  Ervaring met ETL tools als Tableau Prep of Altreryx is een pre.  Je staat stevig in je schoenen, waardoor je in staat bent een belangrijke rol te spelen in businessprojecten en op overtuigende wijze de data analytics-rol kan vervullen.  Je bent communicatief vaardig, proactief en een ‘uitvinder’, waarbij je gaat voor resultaat!  Omdat je internationale contacten hebt, beheers je naast het Nederlands ook het Engels zeer goed in woord en geschrift.

title: Data analist
summary:
Kom dan ons Customer Intelligence & Insights team versterken als Data analist!
Het Customer Intelligence & Insights team in Nederland bestaat onder andere uit…
description: Data analist Vind jij het een uitdaging om met inzichten vanuit data kansen te vinden, nauw samen te werken met de business en een brede impact te hebben? Kom dan ons Customer Intelligence & Insights team versterken als Data analist! Data is de drijvende kracht achter onze organisatie. Je kent ons misschien nog van je schoolboeken, maar tegenwoordig zijn we de onmisbare kennispartner voor Legal, Tax en Public professionals. We bieden up-to-date informatie, software en tools en zorgen voor innovatieve manieren om deze informatie continu beschikbaar en toegankelijk te maken. We maken de omslag naar digital in de breedste zin van het woord. Hierbij maken we gebruik van de nieuwste technologieën, werken we volgens het principe Digital First en Agile.  Het Customer Intelligence & Insights team in Nederland bestaat onder andere uit een Data angineer, Data architect, een Data analist en Marketing automation analisten. Daarnaast werk je ook nauw samen met andere collega’s uit het Benelux team. Je rapporteert aan Maarten Hendriksen, Teamlead Customer Intelligence & Insights. We werken met diverse tools, zoals KNIME, Google Analytics, Eloqua en Python Power BI en leveren inzichten die we binnen onze organisatie steeds slimmer inzetten en ons in staat stellen continu te optimaliseren. Dit doen wij voor alle business units binnen Wolters Kluwer Legal en Regulatory Nederland. Personalisatie en predictive analytics zijn o.a. projecten waar we focus op hebben. Wat ga je doen? Jij helpt onze business units met data gedreven oplossingen en met personalisatie zorg jij dat wij onze producten en diensten op het relevante moment aanbieden aan onze klanten. Je hebt als doel om, samen met je collega’s van Customer Intelligence & Insights, data gedreven werken verder te brengen binnen ons bedrijf; Je ontwikkelt analyses en voert deze uit op basis van alle beschikbare klant-, markt- en productgegevens; Je maakt user profiles aan de hand van (gebruiks) data uit onze marketingdatabase; Je zorgt voor periodieke evaluaties en aanpassingen van modellen en profielen gebaseerd op ervaringen in de praktijk; Je werkt samen met de verschillende business units om data driven projecten te realiseren; Je werkt als single point of contact voor alle business units. Wie ben jij? Jij bent een expert op het gebied van inzichten halen uit data. Je bent een netwerker en vindt snel je weg binnen een organisatie. Dankzij jouw analytische vaardigheden ben je in staat cijfermatige gegevens te analyseren en te interpreteren. Je hebt een sterk conceptueel vermogen, hierdoor zie je structuren en verbanden tussen verschillende vraagstukken. Je bent communicatief en hierdoor in staat jouw boodschap helder over te brengen. Daarnaast heb je uitstekende adviesvaardigheden en een pragmatische houding. Je hebt een bèta achtergrond in combinatie met commercieel talent. Bij voorkeur heb je een opleiding gevolgd in de richting van Econometrie, Marketing of (Bedrijfs)Economie. Ervaring: Minimaal 3 jaar ervaring in soortgelijke rol op het gebied van analyses, predictive analytics en het adviseren hierover; Kennis van diverse tools, zoals SQL, KNIME, Python(of vergelijkbaar). Daarnaast sta je open voor het gebruik van nieuwe technieken en analyses; Visualisatie technieken (bijvoorbeeld Tableau, Power BI) Ervaring met complexe datastructuren; Ervaring met het vertalen van data naar toepasbare inzichten. Wat bieden wij? Naast een goed salaris bieden wij jou: Een baan voor 32 of 36 uur per week per week, zodat je een goede werk-/privé balans hebt. Een interessante winstdeling- of bonusregeling, een laptop en iPhone, een mooie bijdrage aan je pensioen (als werkgever leggen wij 2/3 in), goede mogelijkheden tot persoonlijke ontwikkeling en groei (zowel in Nederland als in het buitenland) en een baan met uitzicht op een vast dienstverband. De titel in je contract is Business Intelligence Analyst.  Daarnaast organiseren wij een jaarlijkse sportdag, een knallend eindejaarsfeest, gratis fruit en vooral veel werkplezier met leuke en professionele collega’s!  Wij zijn er trots op om voor het zesde jaar op rij erkend te worden als Top Employer in Nederland. De standplaats voor deze functie (wanneer we weer terug mogen naar kantoor) is Deventer of Alphen aan den Rijn. Daarnaast behoort thuiswerken uiteraard ook tot de mogelijkheden.

title: Paid Content Analyst
summary:
Voor de distributie van doelgerichte content werkt het paygate team nauw samen met de collega’s van online marketing.
Salaris, passend bij jouw ervaring.
description: Amsterdam, Rotterdam, Nijmegen - De kwaliteit van redactionele content is een belangrijk onderdeel voor lezers om over te gaan tot een abonnement. Daarom is het essentieel om de content goed af te stemmen op de kwaliteitseisen van de consument en zo de conversiekans naar abonnement te verhogen. Jij als Senior Paid Content Analyst speelt daar een belangrijke rol in!  Wat ga je doen Je werkt met grote data sets om kwalitatieve contentanalyses te maken; elk artikel geef je een objectieve kwaliteitswaarde mee obv arikel- en userkenmerken. Door deze informatie vervolgens te delen met redacties, wordt de redactionele content op zowel inhoud als teasing continu verbeterd. Adhv jouw bevindingen coach en begeleid je redacties met content optimalisatie. Uiteraard zonder de redactionele onafhankelijkheid en diversiteit van het product aan te tasten. In deze functie ben je onderdeel van een multidisciplinair team waarbinnen tal van specialisten in elkaars verlengde werken. Denk aan front-end developer, productmanager paygate, nieuwscontent analisten, data scientists, marketeers, hoofdredacteuren en redactie chefs. Jouw rol is naast een analysefunctie dan ook een netwerkfunctie en jij weet van elk specialisme voldoende om te kunnen sparren. Andere werkzaamheden bestaan uit: Het ondersteunen van redacties met ad-hoc analyses. Het ontwikkelen en uitrollen van een “aanvalsplan” op maat per titel, gebruikmakend van funnelanalyses en -vergelijkingen. En, het bedenken van creatieve wijzen van contentdistributie, bijvoorbeeld door slimme bundeling van content of de inzet van podcasts, video’s etc.  Wie zijn wij Je komt als Senior Paid Content Analyst terecht in het Paygate team. Dit team is onderdeel van de afdeling Circulation van DPG Media en is verantwoordelijk voor de verkoop van alle digitale abonnementen van al onze merken via de zogenoemde paywall. Omdat het aantal DPG Media brands onlangs fors is uitgebreid, is het tijd om ook het Paygate team verder uit te breiden met nog een Senior Paid Content Analyst.  Het Paygate team bestaat uit verschillende specialisten, waaronder een collega Sr Paid Content Analyst. Dit team begeleidt het Paygate het redactionele proces van ontdekken, schrijven, optimaliseren en publiceren. Hiermee is het in hoge mate medeverantwoordelijk voor de totstandkoming van een, voor de lezer zo bevredigend mogelijk, journalistiek product. Voor de distributie van doelgerichte content werkt het paygate team nauw samen met de collega’s van online marketing. Met als resultaat dat lezers vaker terugkomen en zorgen voor een consistente instroom aan nieuwe paywall abonnementen. Daarnaast zorgt dit bovendien voor een sterke toename van het ingelogde bereik, een ander belangrijke doelstelling van DPG Media.  Als hét grootste mediabedrijf van Nederland staat we open voor alle talent in de maatschappij. Wij roepen kandidaten met een diverse achtergrond in de breedste zin van het woord dan ook op om te solliciteren op deze functie. Juist door de verschillen tussen collega’s ontstaan verrassende inzichten en innovatieve oplossingen. En dat past dan weer heel erg goed bij ons als organisatie. We zijn benieuwd wie jij bent en welke kwaliteiten en ervaring jij meebrengt.  Wij bieden jou Een flexibele werkomgeving verspreid over het hele land, normaliter werk je één dag in Rotterdam, één dag in Amsterdam en één dag in Nijmegen of bij een van de andere kantoren van DPG Media. Daarnaast bieden we je mogelijkheden en faciliteiten om thuis te werken. Vrijheid om je taken uit te oefenen is een onderdeel van de cultuur op de Marketing afdeling. En natuurlijk: Salaris, passend bij jouw ervaring. 8% vakantiegeld en 4% persoonlijk budget. 36-urige werkweek. 24 vakantiedagen o.b.v. een fulltime werkweek. Volop opleidings- en ontwikkelingsmogelijkheden. Jaarlijkse winstdeling o.b.v. de prestaties van DPG Media.  Functie eisen Minimaal 5 jaar relevante ervaring. WO werk- en denkniveau. Kennis en ervaring met data analyse tooling en ervaring met de functionele vertaling van data naar een voor de redactie begrijpelijke taal. Ben je werkzaam geweest op een redacties dan is dit een grote pré. Perfecte beheersing van de Nederlandse taal spreekt voor zich.  Word jij onze nieuwe collega? Solliciteer dan snel! Heb jij eerst nog vragen? Ik beantwoord die graag via roxanne.rinkes@dpgmedia.nl of 06-21370122. Een WhatsApp bericht mag ook.

title: Integration Architect
summary:
Supporting Global Marketing team in analyst briefings (Forrester, Gartner, IDC, etc.).
Mendix is on a mission to enable anyone in any organization – from the…
description: Mendix is on a mission to enable anyone in any organization – from the marketing coordinator to the software developer to the CEO – to create things that are transformational for their company. We are fundamentally reinventing the way applications are created and we’re reinventing the future of software development. Sounds ambitious, right? We agree.  Not to brag, but nearly 4,000 organizations worldwide, including KLM, Medtronic, Merck, and Philips, rely on Mendix to build web and mobile applications. Thousands of our customers use our platform to delight their clients and empower their employees. It’s no surprise that we’re a recognized Leader by Gartner and Forrester in a red-hot market expected to exceed $21 billion by 2022. Ok, maybe we did want to brag a little. But we’re proud of what we’ve accomplished…and…we’re humble enough to admit that we need you to make us even more effective.  You’ll help our customers drive digital innovation by:  Providing product presentations and demonstrations (both online and onsite)  Acting as a player/coach to our field presales team spread across the nation  Building process and infrastructure that supports the scalability of our presales team as it grows  Running technical deep dive and integration architecture sessions with customers and partners  Facilitating workshops with customers to understand their integration landscape and provide guidance as to how best to leverage our integration capabilities  Executing Proof of Concepts with customers  Advising prospects and customers on the use of the Mendix Platform in their environment  Supporting Global Marketing team in analyst briefings (Forrester, Gartner, IDC, etc.)  Collaborating with R&D to drive the integration capabilities roadmap  You’re the integration innovator we need if you have:  5+ years of work experience with software integration products (MuleSoft, IBM, Oracle Fusion, TIBCO, Dell Boomi, Informatica, Apigee, Kong, etc.)  2+ years of sales engineering experience  Hands on experience with integration middleware, messaging queues, ESBs, API gateways, ETL, etc.  Experience with integration technologies and database applications such as, but not limited to: SOAP, Oracle, DB2, MS/SQL, REST, OData and/or EJB  Familiarity with the various technical landscapes of
