multi-channel business architectures including CRM, web, mobile, legacy, and 3rd-party software systems and the key linkages between them  Experienced designing/developing solutions with various integration architectural patterns (SOA, microservices, publish-subscribe, message queues, etc.)  Working knowledge of the aPaaS/PaaS and cloud market space  Experience/training in solution selling and or Sandler  Excellent communication and interpersonal skills with an ability to help customers find the right solution (not the obvious/easy one)  Must be able to function independently in a fast-paced, dynamic work environment  Experience with security patterns need to integrate disparate systems  Ability to lead architectural discussions and convincingly present your point of view to senior architects  Bachelor/MS degree in technology or equivalent Our Guiding Principles  While we live on different continents, speak different languages, and work on different things, we are bound by our “MendixBlue” guiding principles. Being “MendixBlue” means that you live the culture, and you consistently improve it as we grow. It’s kind of a big deal.  We put the customer first. Without our customers, we have no business. So, if you act in the best interest of our customers, always…you belong here.  We think big. We work to have a meaningful, lasting impact on the world. So, if you aim high and think long term…you belong here.  We innovate. We want to be what happens next. So, if you ask “what if?” and work to find a way or make one…you belong here.  We nurture talent. We look, not just at the sum of what an individual has done, but at the potential of who they can be. So, if you’re up for learning from your failures…you belong here.  We hear every voice. Inflated egos don’t last here, humility does. So, if you share credit and ensure that the best ideas win – regardless of who they come from…you belong here.  We own it. If something needs doing, we do it. So, if you focus on the outcome, and take initiative to get it done…you belong here.  We have fun. We use laughter as a common language. We can ask for help and we’re happy to give it. So, if you find joy and purpose in what you do…you belong here.  Make your career at Mendix.  There are precious few jobs that let you create the future. But you’ll find one at Mendix. We are at a pivotal time in our company’s existence: where rapid growth meets stable funding. This is the time for industrious people to raise their hands to solve the next generation of problems. Mendix is a place where ambitious people can thrive; where you can identify an issue, propose a solution, and build the structure to make it happen.  Important to know: Mendix is a Siemens business, which means we’re backed by the resources and stability of one of the world’s largest and most forward-looking enterprises. Think: job security.  Since our company was founded in 2005, our aim has been to create a great work environment for people at all stages in their careers. That’s why we are so pleased and honored that we were rated a top Cloud Computing Company to work for in 2019, based on feedback from our employees on Glassdoor. With offices in the Netherlands, the UK, Germany, and the US, (and more coming), we provide an international playground to truly impact the world through low-code.

title: Product / UX Designer
summary: In this team you will collaborate with a product manager, mobile/front-end developers, back-end developers, product analysts, data scientists, marketing,…
description: eBay Classifieds Group (eCG) is an innovative leader in online classifieds with brands that span the globe. Our sites help people find whatever they’re looking for in their local communities – whether it’s a job, an apartment, a sofa, a car, a concert ticket, financial services or new friends. Every connection made or item found makes a difference by creating a world where people share more and waste less. People who want to connect and trade visit our sites because they’re fun, easy to use and built on trust. About the business: Every month Marktplaats handles over 8 million unique visitors and 350.000 new advertisements each day making Marktplaats the largest online trading platform in the Netherlands. Consumer and professional sellers offer a large and varied assortment of used and new products. But we want to go even further - we are constantly changing our platform to deliver the experience our customers love. We are a mix of Dutch and Silicon Valley cultures; like both, we are an international team of passionate people who share a common interest in solving problems using software and data. We invite you to join us! About the team: Your role is located within the User Experience & Design team, where you are part of a group of Product designers, researchers and other UX specialists. You’ll start off your journey by creating the best experience for our buyers and sellers by offering them a fast, safe and fabulous experience completing transactions in terms of payment, shipping and complementary services. In this team you will collaborate with a product manager, mobile/front-end developers, back-end developers, product analysts, data scientists, marketing, customer service and more. We’re looking for a Product Designer that... Hungry to build awesome experiences for our customers, and eager to learn how to tell a compelling story to strengthen delivering these experiences. Feels at ease in a cross-functional team where you inspire, collaborate and work in an agile way with partners. Has a strong sense of responsibility solving customers problems using a structured approach in delivering outstanding designs experiences for delivery. Shows flexibility in supporting and/or working on different projects at the same time. Is experienced in designing a multi-platform experience for Android, iOS and web. Is comfortable in combining research and data insights to drive decision making in the design process and solution exploration. Validates design solutions using both qualitative and quantitative methods. Fluent in English. Bonus points: experience in the e-commerce domain! What we offer you: A young and quickly evolving team that focuses on continuous improvement, for example through team training. Together we build an environment with a lot of opportunity to express yourself, share your ideas and collaborate to make it happen. Learning, education and personal development are key when you work at Marktplaats & 2dehands. You have influence in your growth path with your own education budget. The position you have as a designer in your cross-functional team gives you a change to be part of defining and influence the direction of the central initiatives of your team. Benefits: Benefits are an essential part of your total compensation for the work you do every day. Whether you’re single, in a growing family, or nearing retirement, eBay offers a variety of comprehensive and competitive benefit programs to meet your needs. We love creating opportunities for others by connecting people from widely diverse backgrounds, perspectives, and geographies. So, being diverse and inclusive isn’t just something we strive for, it is who we are, and part of what we do each and every single day. We want to ensure that as an employee, you feel Marktplaats is a place where, no matter who you are, you feel safe, included, and that you have the opportunity to bring your unique self to work. To learn about our Diversity & Inclusion click here: https://www.ebayinc.com/company/diversity-inclusion/ Covid-19 People are the heart of the eBay Classifieds business, and their health and well-being are our first priority. We continue to monitor local government guidance and partner closely with medical advisors to determine the safest and best next steps for everyone. As a result, most teams are working remotely, with a few teams able to collaborate in person with enhanced safety procedures. We will discuss the particular case for your region during the interview process. As a general rule, interviews will be completed remotely over video calls. eBay Inc. is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, veteran status, and disability, or other legally protected status. If you are unable to submit an application because of incompatible assistive technology or a disability, please contact us at talent@ebay.com. We will make every effort to respond to your request for disability assistance as soon as possible.

title: Data Analyst
summary:
You will also support another analyst as a backup for a second business unit.
As a data analyst in the COE you will be dedicated to a specific business unit.
description: Mendix is on a mission to enable anyone in any organization – from the marketing coordinator to the software developer to the CEO – to create things that are transformational for their company. We are fundamentally reinventing the way applications are created and we’re reinventing the future of software development. Sounds ambitious, right? We agree.  Not to brag, but nearly 4,000 organizations worldwide, including KLM, Medtronic, Merck, and Philips, rely on Mendix to build web and mobile applications. Thousands of our customers use our platform to delight their clients and empower their employees. It’s no surprise that we’re a recognized Leader by Gartner and Forrester in a red-hot market expected to exceed $21 billion by 2022. Ok, maybe we did want to brag a little. But we’re proud of what we’ve accomplished…and…we’re humble enough to admit that we need you to make us even more effective.  Are you the experienced Medior Data Analyst to help create Mendix’s analytics center of excellence? Do you have a good view on what an analytics center of excellence within a pioneering tech company should look like? Then we are looking for you.  What is our analytics center of excellence (COE)?  Mendix has doubled in size in only a year and a half. As such, the need for analytics insights and automation are becoming increasingly important. The analytics center of excellence will be providing different business units with dedicated partners that create new analytics products and insights to improve the performance of their units and make the rights decisions.  The COE is supported by a technical data engineering team who are responsible for the Mendix’s data landscape (think datalake & data warehouse). The COE is still relatively small and currently consists of 4 analysts, however analytics has been recognized as an incredibly important area of investment by Mendix’s management. Therefor we will be hiring several new analysts in the COE this year and hope to more than double the size of the team by the end of the year.  What job would you be applying for?  The role of a Medior Data Analyst varies quite a bit per organization. In our case, we’re looking for people that can partner up with the business and come up with solutions and insights that will help them make better decisions and become more efficient. As a data analyst in the COE you will be dedicated to a specific business unit. You will also support another analyst as a backup for a second business unit. You will work closely together with that unit to learn the domain knowledge necessary to help create useful analytics solutions together with them.  Mentoring other members of the COE and helping build the foundation of our COE best practices will also be an important part of your role. We are looking for people with new ideas and several years of analytics experience that can help enrich the COE.  About you:  You are a Medior Data Analyst that can help shape our new center of excellence. Our team of analysts is relatively young, therefore we are looking for people that can bring industry best practices into the COE and have several years of experience working in an agile work environment. If you have several years of experience in a data analytics related role and you are eager to bring your experience in a young, thriving, and quickly scaling organization, then you are the person we are looking for! A handful of activities that you can expect to be working on throughout a normal work week: Scoping and challenging analytics requests from the business; Brainstorming about new ideas for the business; Helping the business define, create and operationalize their KPIs; Building operational and management level dashboards in Power BI; Transforming data using SQL, R or Python; Designing and doing in depth research with large raw datasets; Applying statistical techniques to metrics and hypotheses to prove significance of results; Presenting your findings and actionable recommendations or analytics products to the business; Coming up with enablement strategies for analytics products; Mentoring and teaching younger members of the COE; Introducing new techniques, tools, and best practices for the COE. Technical requirements: KPI creation, target setting, forecasting, operationalization; Data processing languages or scripting languages such as: SQL, R or Python; BI tooling such as Power BI, Tableau, QlikSense or BI dashboard creation using languages such as Python or Shiny Research and hypothesis design; Creating, implementing, releasing, and enabling the business in using analytics products such as: automated health score or priority systems, account based marketing, smart chat bots, automated notifications triggered by changes in metrics, forecasting models, prediction models, clustering systems, or other analytics related techniques or products;  Business requirements: Experience with low code (app) development; Experience (5+ years) with presenting analytics solutions or actionable insights from research to management; Experience presenting analytics solutions or actionable insights from research to high level executives; Experience with working in an agile scrum environment; Experience with gathering requirements from the business; Experience with challenging business partners to uncover the right requirements and clearly scope requests or ideas; Experience with quickly learning about and familiarizing yourself with different business domains; Experience with stakeholder management between different business units and management levels; Experience with mentoring and/or teaching subject matter to colleagues; Able to speak fluent English; Speaking Dutch is a plus. Personal character traits: A good understanding of business needs and the ability to act accordingly, taking measured risks into account and the ability to take the organization to a next maturity level; The ability to remain fully functional by adapting to changing circumstances (environment, procedures, people). Absorb new information readily and to put it into practice effectively; Assertiveness; the ability to bring one’s views across clearly without damaging the relationship with stakeholders; Creativity; the ability to come up with original and innovative ideas and solutions, to adopt points of view outside the usual parameters; The ability to ask further with the ambition to deeply understand other perspectives and views in order to generate support. Our Guiding Principles  While we live on different continents, speak different languages, and work on different things, we are bound by our “MendixBlue” guiding principles. Being “MendixBlue” means that you live the culture, and you consistently improve it as we grow. It’s kind of a big deal.  We put the customer first. Without our customers, we have no business. So, if you act in the best interest of our customers, always…you belong here.  We think big. We work to have a meaningful, lasting impact on the world. So, if you aim high and think long term…you belong here.  We innovate. We want to be what happens next. So, if you ask “what if?” and work to find a way or make one…you belong here.  We nurture talent. We look, not just at the sum of what an individual has done, but at the potential of who they can be. So, if you’re up for learning from your failures…you belong here.  We hear every voice. Inflated egos don’t last here, humility does. So, if you share credit and ensure that the best ideas win – regardless of who they come from…you belong here.  We own it. If something needs doing, we do it. So, if you focus on the outcome, and take initiative to get it done…you belong here.  We have fun. We use laughter as a common language. We can ask for help and we’re happy to give it. So, if you find joy and purpose in what you do…you belong here.  Make your career at Mendix.  There are precious few jobs that let you create the future. But you’ll find one at Mendix. We are at a pivotal time in our company’s existence: where rapid growth meets stable funding. This is the time for industrious people to raise their hands to solve the next generation of problems. Mendix is a place where ambitious people can thrive; where you can identify an issue, propose a solution, and build the structure to make it happen.  Important to know: Mendix is a Siemens business, which means we’re backed by the resources and stability of one of the world’s largest and most forward-looking enterprises. Think: job security.  Since our company was founded in 2005, our aim has been to create a great work environment for people at all stages in their careers. That’s why we are so pleased and honored that we were rated a top Cloud Computing Company to work for in 2019, based on feedback from our employees on Glassdoor. With offices in the Netherlands, the UK, Germany, and the US, (and more coming), we provide an international playground to truly impact the world through low-code.

title: Director, Strategic Services
summary: Demonstrated operational experience (7+ years) and deep knowledge of digital media monetisation through subscription and advertising revenue, media industries,…
description: Piano Overview Piano is a fast-growing enterprise SaaS company with operations in Philadelphia, New York City, Buenos Aires, Amsterdam, London, Oslo, Paris, Berlin, Singapore, Tokyo, and elsewhere globally. We provide enterprise software and strategic services to the world’s leading media companies, including NBC Universal, the Economist, Dow Jones, BBC, Techcrunch, Bloomberg, Le Parisien, Gannett, Mainichi Shimbun, and more than 400 other clients. The company is now at an inflection point as it aggressively moves into other industries outside of media. Our software and services enable these companies to create customized digital experiences for users, restrict and sell access to content online, and analyze user behavior in order to drive engagement, loyalty, and revenue.  Position Overview We are looking for a professional with 10+ years work experience in a revenue optimisation role for a digital media company or agency to join our Strategic Services team and help serve as a revenue generation partner for our clients in media and content marketing in the EMEA market. The right individual has the opportunity to join a dynamic working environment, help grow a business within Piano and work with a passionate, dedicated team.  This role has the following responsibilities: Deliver value to a portfolio of media and content marketing clients by providing strategic and tactical guidance, and hands-on execution for website monetisation: Develop, present and execute plans to guide and optimise clients’ businesses and ensure best use and value from our platform Oversee the EMEA Client Strategy team, ensuring the consistent delivery of results and high quality guidance for our clients, coaching team members to develop and improve their skills Lead Strategic Services client pitches in collaboration with the EMEA sales and client services teams Conduct discovery of client challenges and business goals Develop proposals for Strategic Services engagements designed to meet client goals Collaborate with Account Managers to ensure successful Strategic Services engagements, representing Piano as the expert in subscription revenue optimisation, user engagement and conversion in client meetings As needed, personally lead strategy, launch and optimisation engagements with the account team and clients: Define ideal use cases to drive results using Piano software for clients newly launching or already using the Piano platform Develop and execute marketing campaigns in support of client goals, defining target audiences, tactics, messaging plans and suggested copy Develop plans and execute audience research to inform strategic recommendations for clients Create recommendations for audience segmentation to support internal marketing or advertising sales for clients Collaborate with other Strategic Services team members in delivering our services to clients, including data analysts, designers, front end developers and other client strategists, sharing work and leveraging their specific skills and domain expertise Ensure the quality of all recommendations, marketing and test plans developed by the EMEA Strategic Services team for regional clients Collaborate closely with the senior Strategic Services management team ensuring clear communication of sales opportunities, new initiatives, regional challenges and opportunities Ensure the consistent in-market execution of best practices shared across the Strategic Services team, while helping to define and test innovative new tactics to drive results for clients and expand the use of the Piano platform Leverage insights, benchmarks, performance metrics and industry trends to make strategic recommendations on how clients can optimise their business Monitor client performance on the platform; identify gaps and opportunities for growth Communicate within and across functions internally, reporting on the progress of initiatives and execution activities with a focus on identifying product development or documentation opportunities Identify opportunities for new ways to use professional services in support of client goals, work with Strategic Services senior leaders to validate and define those opportunities Occasional travel to meet with clients  We are looking for candidates to meet the following requirements: Strategic mindset - ability to analyse business circumstances and audience behavior to glean insights that inform planning for a sound strategic plan and presentation Strong communication/presentation skills; presence to build relationships; consultative orientation Demonstrated operational experience (7+ years) and deep knowledge of digital media monetisation through subscription and advertising revenue, media industries, and online marketing, ideally in a hands-on role optimising marketing campaigns Experience (3+ years) managing and mentoring teams Analytical thinking and ability to identify trends and patterns A take-initiative attitude and proactive approach to client needs/issues Experience in hands-on audience insights research (survey development and analysis, user interviews, etc.) is a plus Must be fluent in English; fluency in Spanish, German, Italian or French is a plus Facility with productivity and project management tools Any hire will be required to prove he or she is authorised to work in the Netherlands without sponsorship from Piano Open to applicants based in Berlin or London in addition to Amsterdam

title: Business Development Internship
summary:
Support business analysts during bigger projects, such as country roll-outs and new product introductions.
For larger projects, you will support the business…
description: Join our HelloFresh family At HelloFresh we love food and our mission is to change the way people eat forever. That change comes conveniently packaged in a box - a HelloFresh Box, filled with the best fresh ingredients. With our meal boxes with easy to cook recipes and fresh ingredients, we are driving change in the quickly evolving food industry. From developing our recipes to delivering the boxes - the customer is at the center of everything we do. Our aim is to make every meal a moment to look forward to, for everyone at the table. No surprise then that data is our friend and for us, learning never stops. We make quick but informed decisions and as a fast-growing company, we value flexibility and speed. We need you For our young and passionate team, we are looking for a business development intern starting in August. Working in the Business Development & Business Intelligence (BDBI) team, you are supporting the growth of HelloFresh – from analysis to implementation. You will analyze huge chunks of data and provide tangible opportunities that touch upon all teams from procurement to marketing. For larger projects, you will support the business analysts in doing analyses and coordinating on project management, giving you the change to really develop yourself. You'll be working on: Analyze customer behavior and provide recommendations for improvement. Questions you will answer are "Why do customers decide to pause?" and "How is our current performance in France?" Manage projects from the beginning to end. Examples of projects are gathering more customer data via 1 on 1 interviews and benchmark our performance against competitors. Support business analysts during bigger projects, such as country roll-outs and new product introductions. Are you our perfect new colleague? For this internship, you on the one hand have excellent analysis skills so that you can crunch the numbers while at the same time having the social skills to make projects happen. You have experience in data analysis with for example Excel or Python. In addition, you like to work together with colleagues to get the most out of projects and have proven to be a great collaborator during previous internships and/or extra curricular activities. Lastly, you enjoy leaving your mark on HelloFresh and take ownership to get things done. What do we offer you? Make a serious impact on the growth of HelloFresh A lot of learning- and development opportunities within a young and dynamic e-commerce company; Freedom of idea and initiative, execution and implementation of your own ideas and initiatives; You can make use of the company benefits, which is the current situation means bootcamp sessions in the park, virtual meditations and online pub quizzes and game nights with colleagues; Next, to that, you also get a discount on the HelloFresh box; And of course, you'll earn a compensation of 500 EUR gross per month, based on a 40-hour work week. We hear you thinking, what to do if I'm interested? Well, after applying we take a look at your resume and cover letter. If we see a match, we will invite you for an online interview. Are we still positive? We will schedule a video interview with the team. We will schedule the interviews one after the other quickly, in order to let you know as fast as possible if you can start at HelloFresh! And, yes, very important: we celebrate diversity and are committed to building teams that represent a variety of backgrounds, perspectives and skills. All employment is decided on the basis of qualifications, merit and business need. Let's apply! Nice, good choice! Please click on the 'apply' button below and fill out the mandatory fields. Upload your resume and cover letter and that's it. Applications sent by email will not be processed. Before applying please make sure you are eligible to work in the Netherlands, unfortunately, we do not sponsor any work visa or permits for this position. We'd like to recruit for our own vacancies with our own resources. If we would like your help, we will reach out to you.

title: PRODUCTSPECIALIST CDD
summary:
Jij past deze kennis en ideeën toe in de productontwikkeling en de marketing van onze CDD dienstverlening.
27 januari 2021 by BAS Consultancy.
description: 27 januari 2021 by BAS Consultancy Heb jij al geruime tijd ervaring als CDD Analist en ben jij toe aan meer afwisseling en verantwoordelijkheid? Ontwikkel jezelf als consultant in de financiële wereld en ga aan de slag in de combinatierol als senior CDD analist & productspecialist CDD bij BAS Consultancy. Als kartrekker ben jij vastberaden om BAS Consultancy op de kaart te zetten binnen het specialisme CDD. Je waarborgt jouw CDD-kennis binnen de organisatie en deelt deze met onze Finance Consultants in de vorm van trainingen. Je signaleert kansen en springt graag in op ideeën in de markt door jouw actuele en vergaande kennis. Jij past deze kennis en ideeën toe in de productontwikkeling en de marketing van onze CDD dienstverlening. Een unieke kans om zowel je inhoudelijke expertise te verdiepen en te delen, commerciële vaardigheden verder te ontwikkelen en je eigen stempel te drukken op dit interessante specialisme. WAT DOE JE ALS PRODUCTSPECIALIST CDD? Op projectbasis aan de slag met complexe dossier bij onze klanten in de bancaire, financiële- en de vastgoedsector Als poortwachter fungeren om zodoende een integere bedrijfsvoering te kunnen waarborgen Makkelijk verbanden leggen tussen complexe data en kritisch durven rapporteren Optreden als coach en casemanager CCD tussen verschillende afdelingen zoals Compliance & Legal Je wordt enthousiast van ingewikkelde vraagstukken, met jouw brede kennis van compliance en Wwft. Je komt goed tot je recht binnen een coachende rol en treedt op als sparingspartner voor het management. Daarnaast ben je verantwoordelijk voor het waarborgen van de kwaliteit en consistentie binnen het Customer Due Diligence proces waardoor je in feite de gehele keten optimaliseert. Jouw analytisch vermogen is hierin van groot belang. Een functie die daarom naast inhoudelijke kennis ook om zeer specifieke gedrags- en persoonlijkheidskenmerken vraagt. Je coacht betrokkenen op inhoud en verzorgt met regelmaat workshops en trainingen op ons eigen opleidingsinstituut Creating Insights. WAT WIJ JOU BIEDEN Naast toegang tot een groot & sterk netwerk, en werken aan afwisselende opdrachten bij mooie opdrachtgevers ontvang jij als Productspecialist CDD: Brutosalaris tussen € 3.200,- en € 6.000,- per maand. Dit is afhankelijk van de kennis en ervaring die jij meebrengt. Leaseauto (ook voor privégebruik) of een NS Business Card. Kies je voor de tweede optie, dan ontvang je van ons een bonus. Overuren worden 140% uitbetaald. Maar maak ze niet te veel, want een goede werk-privébalans is belangrijk. Opleidingsbudget van € 6.000,- per jaar dat je kunt besteden aan het opleidingsinstituut Creating Insights. Mogelijkheid om een relevante post- of executive master te volgen. Nog veel meer goede voorwaarden, zoals: een contract voor onbepaalde tijd, collectieve pensioenregeling, 25 vakantiedagen (bij een 40-urige werkweek), bonussen en als je een heel kalenderjaar niet ziek bent geweest dan krijg je 5 vakantiedagen extra. Met regelmaat gezellige (online) bedrijfsuitjes en borrels. WAAROM JIJ HET VERSCHIL KUNT MAKEN Je hebt een afgeronde hbo- of wo- opleiding in een financiële richting zoals Bedrijfseconomie, Financieel Recht, MER of Bedrijfskunde. Daarnaast heb je tenminste 3 jaar relevante werkervaring in het schrijven van CDD rapporten. Met jouw open persoonlijkheid en sterke communicatie vaardigheden weet jij eventuele weerstand die je tegenkomt om te buigen en anderen op een positieve manier in beweging te brengen. Je droomt weleens over het werken als zelfstandige, maar vindt de zekerheid van een vaste baan erg fijn. Jij wilt als ondernemende financial graag door ontwikkelen als toekomstbestendige finance professional in de wondere wereld van compliance en Customer Due Diligence door kennis te maken met verschillende projecten, opdrachtgevers en bedrijfsculturen. Je hebt een groot aanpassingsvermogen en stelt je flexibel op aan veranderende omstandigheden. DIT MAG JIJ VERWACHTEN VAN BAS CONSULTANCY Tussen de opdrachten en bedrijven door zien we je graag op ons kantoor in Den Haag. Want bij BAS Consultancy gaat het er niet alleen om wie je bent, maar vooral om wie je wilt worden. Dat is precies waar onze HR Business Partner Vera ‘in the picture’ komt. Met haar stel je een persoonlijk ontwikkelplan op, met oog op de laatste ontwikkelingen binnen het vakgebied én de nodige soft skills. Via het opleidingsinstituut Creating Insights volg je diverse trainingen op het gebied van FinTech, Data, Actualiteiten, Privacy & Security en Consultancy vaardigheden. Op onze borrels, trainingen of gezellig uitjes kom je met regelmaat jouw mede BAS consultants tegen. We werken nauw met elkaar samen. Zo heb jij veel contact met onze afdelingen HR, Accountmanagement en Finance. Ook organiseren we regelmatig inloopavonden en visiebijeenkomsten met onze oprichter Peter Arensman om jouw mening en ideeën over bepaalde onderwerpen te horen Je komt terecht in een persoonlijke, ondernemende en betrokken organisatie. Wij geloven dat je door het creëren financieel inzicht & het ondersteunen en begeleiden van werkende oplossingen met grote implementatiekracht kan bijdragen aan de duurzame groei en toekomst van organisaties. Morgen is net zo belangrijk als vandaag. Een waardevolle toekomst is voor onze klanten, medewerkers en de samenleving niet denkbaar zonder respect voor mens, milieu en maatschappij. Wij delen actief kennis en expertise met andere partijen voor sociale programma’s waarin arbeidsparticipatie & onderwijs een hoofdrol spelen. We dragen bij aan diverse goede doelen en investeren jaarlijks een deel van onze winst in wereldverbeterende bedrijven. Een open relatie met partners, gericht op het actief delen van kennis en expertise is voor BAS Consultancy ook een vorm SOLLICITATIEPROCEDURE Interesse? Dan leren wij jou graag kennen. Solliciteren kan via de button. Heb je nog vragen over de functie, arbeidsvoorwaarden of ons bedrijf? Bel of mail met Wouter Aten, Business Unit Manager Profit. 06-82423899 | wouter.aten@basconsultancy.nl

title: Performance App Tracking Specialist
summary:
Fancy the task of supercharging our App marketing strategy?
You will implement and maintain our performance marketing app tracking setups.
description: Fancy the task of supercharging our App marketing strategy? Think you can decipher the data and perfect our implementations? Enjoy being part of an ambitious, cutting-edge team in our HQ in Amsterdam? Then you could be the App Tracking Specialist we're looking for… Our story (the bitesize version) We've grown from an attic start-up to become Just Eat Takeaway, a global food delivery powerhouse. With customers across 24 countries, we take millions of orders every day from Amsterdam to Auckland! What you'll do as a Performance App Tracking Specialist: Our measurement specialists are the experts at capturing all relevant data with a high accuracy in a GDPR compliant way., using a wide range of tools, platforms and strategies. This position is a varied role packed with exciting challenges. Data skills are a key part of this role. It's your job to help us in setting up, implementing and maintenance of App tracking and platform connections. You'll perform data analysis, validation and maintaining data quality of the app marketing workflow while working closely with our App Developers. You will implement and maintain our performance marketing app tracking setups. You perform data analysis, validation and maintaining data quality of the app marketing workflow. You co-develop and manage the app channel tracking strategy with the rest of the team. Maintain and further improve Universal / App Linking and App Deep Linking efforts. You perform campaign analyses and review and resolve current ad fraud detection and prevention efforts. Keep a close eye on new market developments; IOS14, SDK features, GDPR. You work closely with our App Development team. Your profile You have at least 2-3 years working experience as App Analyst, App Marketing or App Tracking specialist. You have the ability to collaborate with technical and non-technical teams. You're an expert in using Adjust, Firebase & GTM. You have a good understanding of Google Analytics, DV360, SA360, Facebook, mobile remarketing partners, SQL and dashboarding software like Tableau. You know exactly how data is gathered, processed by the different tools and are strong in deriving actionable insights. You know how to find improvement points and troubleshoot tracking implementations on App applications. A basic level of knowledge regarding specialisms (SEA, SEO, Display, App, Affiliate, etc) and related tools and technologies. You relish working in a team and enjoy collaborating and sharing knowledge with your peers You have a sense of ownership and pride in your performance and its impact on the company's success You are a critical thinker with outstanding problem-solving skills Knowledge of BigQuery or CDP/DMP implementation is a nice to have Our offer The freedom to go where no one in our company has gone before; Possibilities to strengthen your skills and grow in the role; Work in a fast-growing company; Being part of a young, professional and international team; A competitive salary; Custom workstations/laptops (Mac/Linux/PC); Opportunity to join native language courses; Traveling between the different office locations Awesome company events; Free drinks and fruits.

title: Research Analyst Intern
summary:
Global research in gaming and digital media has been in Newzoo’s core for almost a decade.
With the demand for digital media growing rapidly, so does the demand…
description: Global research in gaming and digital media has been in Newzoo’s core for almost a decade. With the demand for digital media growing rapidly, so does the demand for data on their consumers. As Research Intern, you will assist Newzoo’s data team carry out studies on games, tech, digital media, and other relevant topics. You’ll be involved in every aspect of the project, from writing and programming surveys to managing fieldwork and processing the data. Next to this, you’ll assist with data analysis, reporting, and be presenting the results visually, getting them ready to be delivered to Newzoo’s clients.  For this internship, you will be required to work from our Amsterdam office* at least 32 hours per week. The internship can be combined with a research or personal development project while enrolled at an educational institution, but that is not mandatory.  Your Responsibilities  Keeping track of developments in the games, tech, and digital media industries Analyzing data from various sources, help creating reports, and presenting results in a visually appealing format according to Newzoo’s design guidelines Assisting in online consumer research, programming and testing surveys, and processing data Providing your expertise on client or partner challenges Managing your research or development assignment  Your Profile  Bachelor or Master student enrolled in Business Administration, Psychology, Marketing, Market Research course, or relevant field Affinity with internet and digital media (a strong interest in video games, in particular, is a plus) Experience with data analysis tools and/or data processing Strong analytical and statistical skills, can answer client questions independently with statistically sound advice based on the available data Ability to work independently, problem solver, eager to learn Good PowerPoint and Excel skills Ability to work in Amsterdam (Newzoo does not assist in getting a valid work permit to work in the Netherlands) Available for 4-6 months, starting asap  Our Offer  A workplace overlooking the harbour of Amsterdam An internship with a very international outlook in a dynamic, ever-changing and fun industry Includes lunch and an internship compensation Plenty of room to develop yourself and shape your career Be part of a fast-growing, ambitious, young, and energetic team

title: Analytics Business Consultant
summary:
You’ll be working close together with the marketeers and market data analysts of our clients.
At least 4 years of proven experience in roles where you have been…
description: We go beyond the obvious, using intelligence, passion and creativity to inspire new thinking and shape the world we live in. To start a career that is out of the ordinary, please apply... Job Details Do you like to make complicated simple? Are you able to translate complex models into business insights that drive growth? We are currently searching for a commercially minded analytics consultant to join our Kantar team in Amsterdam. Analytics is a key growth area for Kantar, and a critical backbone for many of our solutions of the future. Kantar’s value to clients lies increasingly in the connections we can make between different data-sets that results in richer and deeper insights and allows us to offer more customized, more interesting and ultimately, more effective solutions and services to our clients. You’ll be working close together with the marketeers and market data analysts of our clients. Our clients are Fortune 500 companies in the tech, FCMG, banking, service industry and more. Kantar’s Analytic Practice is the key enabler for surfacing connected data intelligence, working across a wide variety of statistical techniques such as driver analyses, segmentation, marketing mix modelling, and discrete choice modelling, as well as newer state of the art techniques with multi-touch attribution modelling, social media modelling and artificial intelligence/machine learning. The role will be part of a growing Analytics Practice. Locally you will work alongside the data consultants, the brand and media domain teams and the commercial business development team. You will also be part of a much larger global analytics team, utilizing the global centers of excellence (GCOE’s) and bringing these capabilities to our clients in the Netherlands. This role will report into the Head of Analytics in the Kantar Insights Division in The Netherlands. Role Description In this role you will: Be responsible for the sales and execution of our analytic solutions to address client issues related to the return on total marketing investment, media effectiveness and brand equity growth. Work with our client service and practice area teams to develop and cultivate long-lasting client relationships. Take our client-first approach to diagnose your clients’ analytic needs. Translate data into insights in a way that enables our clients to answer their business issues. Present findings and sell solutions to your clients in a way that addresses not only the interpretation of the statistical results, but the business implications of the contributing analysis Advise clients on Predictive modelling, Time series forecasting, Marketing Mix Modelling, Segmentation and Path modelling. Role Requirements If you are tech savvy, passionate about data and have a commercial mindset, then we are looking for you. On top of that, we are looking for someone who has: A Masters’ Degree in Business, Marketing, Marketing Analytics, Econometrics, Statistics, Communication studies, or related fields where you were involved in data driven marketing or analytics consulting. At least 4 years of proven experience in roles where you have been involved in marketing and data analytics. Preferably at a market research organization or agency, working as a Business, Marketing or Media Consultant Understand both survey and non-survey-based research data and analytic approaches as well as data structures Be able to multi-task in a fast-paced environment Be collaborative and enjoy working in a global organization Have a good business acumen and be motivated by growing the commercial scope of our analytics solutions to drive revenue generation and profitability Fluent in English, Dutch is a plus Hold a valid workpermit JOIN US We offer you an informal and open-minded working environment, with a focus on growth. Where you will be working on exciting projects for several of the largest companies in the world. You will be part of an (international) team of experts to inspire and support you. Besides this we offer you: A global, dynamic and fun work environment Access to expertise and the latest tools within an international organization, with the opportunity to develop yourself and acquire new skills An enthusiastic, highly motivated team and a high level of responsibility We go beyond the obvious, using intelligence, passion and creativity to inspire new thinking and shape the world we live in. Apply for a career that’s out of the ordinary and join us. We want to create an equality of opportunity in a fair and supportive working environment where people feel included, accepted and are allowed to flourish in a space where their mental health and well being is taken into consideration. We want to create a more diverse community to expand our talent pool, be locally representative, drive diversity of thinking and better commercial outcomes. Location Amsterdam, AmsteldijkNetherlands Kantar Rewards Statement At Kantar we have an integrated way of rewarding our people based around a simple, clear and consistent set of principles. Our approach helps to ensure we are market competitive and also to support a pay for performance culture, where your reward and career progression opportunities are linked to what you deliver. Kantar is the world’s leading data, insights and consulting company. We understand more about how people think, feel, shop, share, vote and view than anyone else. Combining our expertise in human understanding with advanced technologies, Kantar’s 30,000 people help the world’s leading organisations succeed and grow.

title: (Senior) Diagnostics Analist
summary: Wij zijn op zoek naar praktische, hands-on analist met organisatie- en planningsvaardigheden die van nature het voortouw neemt.
description: Je hebt ervaring in het managen van projecten, door een grondige analyse maak je complexe processen je snel eigen en kom je met originele en alternatieve oplossingen. Je weet je teamleden op een sociale en communicatieve wijze te motiveren en enthousiasmeren. Functieomschrijving De (Senior) Diagnostic Business Analist onderzoekt de behoeften van VPD (Vehicle Programming and Diagnostics) en vertaalt deze in eisen en gebruikersvereisten in specificaties. Je verzamelt klantbehoeften en zet ze om naar ‘vereiste’ functionaliteiten voor onze interne en externe leveranciers. Je bent de proactieve drijvende kracht tussen diverse VPD klanten, het Diagnostics team en hun leveranciers.  Je bent de proactieve drijvende kracht tussen diverse VPD klanten en belanghebbenden, de GVPD en de Diagnostics teams en hun leveranciers. De belangrijkste verantwoordelijkheden:  Definiëren, opvolgen en verifiëren van alle voertuig- en systeemdiagnostische vereisten die wereldwijd nodig zijn voor onze voertuigen en motoren. Definieren, controleren en verifiëren van alle productie gerelateerde GVPD-eisen en / of alle service-gerelateerde GVPD en vervolgprojecten, vereisten. Verzeker VPD en service diagnose competitieve positie in de markt. Participeren in scrumteams waarbij je als product owner voor diagnose optreed. Vooraf de scope per sprint bepaald en deze opvolgt. Bepaal tussentijdse product- en zakelijke VPD- en servicediagnoseplannen.  De Business Analist werkt nauw samen met leveranciers van apparatuur, de afdeling Information Technology, Product Development, Manufacturing Engineers en andere Marketing & Sales teams. In deze functie wordt je binnen het gehele ontwikkel proces (klantwens, design, implementatie en validatie) met name uitgedaagd op de voor- en nafasen binnen het V-cycle model. Het continu verbeteren en het streven naar efficiëntie in samenwerking met de collega’s is van groot belang om de teamdoelen te behalen. Functie-eisen Wij zijn op zoek naar praktische, hands-on analist met organisatie- en planningsvaardigheden die van nature het voortouw neemt. Een kandidaat met een technische bachelor of masteropleiding bijvoorbeeld in automotive engineering of technische bedrijfskunde met kennis van de informatietechnologie. Je hebt minimaal 5 jaar relevante ervaring bij voorkeur in een (Truck) automotive gerelateerde omgeving. Je bent bekend met het V-cycle model en beschikt bij voorkeur over kennis van definitie en acceptatie validatie, voertuigcommunicatie en diagnostische methoden. Natuurlijk beschik je over goede communicatievaardigheden in het Nederlands en Engels. Afdelingsinformatie De afdeling Diagnostics is onderdeel van de After Sales organisatie binnen Marketing & Sales, bestaat tot 45-50 personen en is verantwoordelijk voor de hard- en software ontwikkeling, productie en onderhoud van de DAVIE-tool voor onze Trucks en onze Engines-werkplaatsen en -fabrieken wereldwijd. De DAVIE-Tool is een off-board diagnose tool en biedt dealers, garage- en werkplaatshouders in hoofdlijnen 6 functionaliteiten:  – Quick Check – Monitoring – Vehicle Updates – Customerparameters – Diagnostische testen – Manufactoring Sequences  De doelstelling van de afdeling is optimale ondersteuning bieden aan de dealers, werkplaats- en garagehouders in het diagnose-, onderhoud- en reparatieproces. Contact Voor meer informatie kunt u contact opnemen met Ruud van der Velden of Rolf Drenthen, tel: (040) 259 50 00 Standplaats Eindhoven

title: Executive Assistant
summary:
Our client is a global marketing, distribution and project development company.
Basic data analysis and work with business analyst to get information as…
description: About Our Client Our client is a global marketing, distribution and project development company. Job Description Administrative support: Manage complex agenda and travel arrangements Handling administrative activities such as travel plans and coordinating meetings for the VP Organize and coordinate meetings/conferences/events Follow up on action items and be able to anticipate ahead Follow up on actions with internal stakeholders Manage expenses Write and draft letters and meeting follow up documents Communicate with senior executives and executive PA's to arrange meetings and follow ups Sourcing/commercial activities: Maintain purchasing spreadsheets and update regularly Basic data analysis and work with business analyst to get information as requested and interpreted Work on development of Supplier Relationship Management (SRM) Engage with suppliers to advance opportunity pipeline as requested by VP Ensure Sourcing Opportunity Pipeline is updated, and project status is correct and new task listed Following up on assigned action items from meetings with suppliers Engage with other members of the sourcing team and ensure we have proper follow up on requested items Personal Assistant Support to Vice President The Successful Applicant > 5 years of experience as an executive assistant or other relevant administrative support experience. Good organization and time management Good administrative skills Good communication skills, written and verbal Fluent in English and Dutch is a must. Command of other languages is a plus Accurate and attention to detail Excellent knowledge of Microsoft office (Outlook, Word, Excel, PowerPoint and Teams) Out of the box thinker Strong problem-solving ability High degree of interpersonal skills Enjoys fast paced working conditions Must be available after office hours to respond Strong analytical skills in reviewing data and trends Must be flexible and able to work under pressure Highly adaptable What's on Offer Good salary and additional benefits Great work environment with great colleagues A very challenging job with a lot of responsibility

title: Internship : Digital Analyst Accelerators
summary:
Basic understanding of digital marketing.
You will be working closely with 3-4 analysts and a wider team of digital experimenters to identify breakthroughs…
description: Job Title Internship : Digital Analyst Accelerators Job Description In this role, you have the opportunity to Get hands-on experience on latest digital marketing tools like Adobe analytics, Google analytics, and several other platforms that you will be exposed to. You are responsible for Supporting the dynamic ‘Accelerators Tribe’ in contributing to various innovations being planned in the D2C strategy for Philips. You will be working closely with 3-4 analysts and a wider team of digital experimenters to identify breakthroughs leading to insights into customer behaviour and preferences. As part of the team you will be contributing to & learning the techniques deployed for digital experimentation (A/B testing, surveys, prototyping, design thinking etc.), documenting them & helping replicate them in multiple markets after identifying the correct ‘recipe’ for success. You are a part of As part of the Accelerators Tribe, you will be working in one of the most entrepreneurial teams within Philips. The team is trying to drive new initiatives (products / propositions / services) across multiple markets. You will work with specialists from various functions including market intelligence, analysts, designers (visual and service) and will be learning from experienced Product Owners on how to bring an idea from scratch to scale. To succeed in this role, you should have the following skills and experience Ability to thrive in a fast-paced, rapidly changing environment Well organized with an exceptional attention to detail Ability to work hands on to deliver projects from concept to completion Outstanding communication and time-management Basic understanding of digital marketing Strong affinity with ‘numbers’ Ability to work with formulas and graphs in MS Excel Inclination to quickly learn digital experimentation tools like adobe / google analytics Ability to work independently and cooperatively in a team environment Contributing to great team spirit Fluency in both written and spoken English In return, we offer you Paid full time 6-month internship based in Amsterdam. We prefer students able to start as soon as possible but not later than mid / end March 2021. Why should you join Philips? Working at Philips is more than a job. It’s a calling to create a healthier society through meaningful work, focused on improving 2.5 billion lives a year by delivering innovative solutions across the health continuum. Our people experience a variety of unexpected moments when their lives and careers come together in meaningful ways. Learn more by watching this video. To find out more about what it’s like working for Philips at a personal level, visit the Working at Philips page on our career website, where you can read stories from our employee blog. Once there,you can also learn about our recruitment process, or find answers to some of the frequently asked questions. Contact If you forgot your password, you can click the Forgot Password button on the Sign In screen to reset it. If you have any other questions regarding the recruitment process please refer to our FAQs. In case of technical difficulties with the website, please send an email to careersite@philips.com. (Note: To ensure fairness and legal compliance in our recruitment processes, only technical issues will be monitored through the above inbox. Please do not submit resumes or applications to this email, as they will not be reviewed. Only applications received through the online application process will be considered.)

title: Buying & Demand Planning Analyst
summary: Its focus is designing and marketing high-quality men’s tailored clothing and sportswear, women’s collection apparel and sportswear, kidswear, denim collections…
description: About PVH Corp. PVH is one of the most admired fashion and lifestyle companies in the world. We power brands that drive fashion forward – for good. Our brand portfolio includes the iconic CALVIN KLEIN, TOMMY HILFIGER, Van Heusen, IZOD, ARROW, Warner’s, Olga and Geoffrey Beene brands, as well as the digital-centric intimate’s brand. True&Co. We market a variety of goods under these and other nationally and internationally known owned and licensed brands. PVH has over 40,000 associates operating in over 40 countries and $9.9 billion in annual revenues. That's the Power of Us. That’s the Power of PVH.  About Tommy Hilfiger Tommy Hilfiger, which was acquired by PVH Corp. in 2010, is a global apparel and retail company with more than 16,000 associates worldwide. With the support of strong global consumer recognition, Tommy Hilfiger has built an extensive distribution network in over 90 countries and more than 1,400 retail stores throughout North America, Europe, Latin America and the Asia Pacific region. Global retail sales of the Tommy Hilfiger brand were $9.2 billion in 2019 Founded in 1985, Tommy Hilfiger delivers premium styling, quality and value to consumers worldwide with a brand portfolio that includes TOMMY HILFIGER and TOMMY JEANS. Tommy Hilfiger is one of the world’s most recognized premium designer lifestyle groups and is recognized for celebrating the essence of “classic American cool” style, featuring preppy with a twist designs.  Its focus is designing and marketing high-quality men’s tailored clothing and sportswear, women’s collection apparel and sportswear, kidswear, denim collections, underwear (including robes, sleepwear and loungewear), footwear and accessories. Through select licensees, Tommy Hilfiger offers complementary lifestyle products such as eyewear, watches, fragrance, swimwear, socks, small leather goods, home goods and luggage. The Team The Buying & Planning team is part of the TH Buying, Planning and Operations department. The team plans the seasonal collection buys as well as the non-seasonal capsule buys based on vendor allocation and regional requirements/holidays, within the calendar milestones, 4 times a year. It plays a crucial part in ensuring the sell in quantities are placed within the vendors, on a timely manner for all TH divisions. The Position In this exciting new role as Buying & Demand Planning Analyst you will ensure optimum Seasonal Planning and non-seasonal business is supported with relevant analysis and reporting from the range plan handover to the official purchase order creation based on desired KPI’s. You will be responsible for the data and analysis across all TH divisions. Key Responsibilities: Support the Cross-divisional Buying & Planning to guarantee a smooth planning process. Ensure best buy conditions are met with the support on analysis Prepare and assist global planning and divisional buying, during the planned timelines. Material Planning support, rolling commitment and material replenishment analysis Sales and Orderbook analysis during the sell in and after-market closure Maintenance of Vendor Status Report that enables a 2 year history on the total business. Seasonal KPI reporting, during and end of the sales Seasonal and non-seasonal Analysis Inbound Planning and Financial Flow Reporting on a monthly base Additional analysis and reporting based on the need of the team The Ideal Candidate: University degree in business, supply chain management or similar from an internationally minded Business School 4-5 years of work experience within Consultancy or Fashion/ Retail/ Wholesale with a focus on logistics or related supply chain areas Good analytical skills and ability to understand and map complex (supply chain) processes Affinity with and passion for systems and applications and linking these to business processes Excellent communication skills in English and ability to influence others in a multi-cultural environment Excellent MS-Office skills (Advanced Excel, PowerPoint and ideally Visio) Knowledge of SAP and PLM is an advantage Ability to handle uncertainty and change in the work environment Ambitious problem solver and ‘can do’ mentality Strong team player who values a casual and fun work environment What You Can Expect from Us: A beautiful state-of-the-art Campus, complete with our very own People's Place Gym and People's Place Cafés A company culture that fosters development, offering training and learning opportunities through our very own PVH University An international environment which respects diversity, equality, and individuality A smart work program that empowers our associates to work at their preferred location within a flexible schedule A chance to unwind with weekly social activities  Please include a cover letter with your application. We would love to understand why this is THE role for you!  PVH Europe and our brands, TOMMY HILFIGER and CALVIN KLEIN, are committed to fostering an inclusive and diverse community of associates with a strong sense of belonging. We believe we are bettered by all forms of diversity, and take pride in working with top talent from every walk of life and corner of the world. In the spirit of inclusivity, qualified applicants will be considered without regard to age, ethnicity, ability, gender, gender expression, gender identity, nationality, race, religion or sexual orientation.

title: SOC Analyst - IBM CISO
summary: IBM Corporate Headquarters (CHQ) team represents a variety of functions such as marketing, finance, legal, operations, HR, and more, all working together to…
description: Introduction At IBM, work is more than a job - it's a calling: To build. To design. To code. To consult. To think along with clients and sell. To make markets. To invent. To collaborate. Not just to do something better, but to attempt things you've never thought possible. Are you ready to lead in this new era of technology and solve some of the world's most challenging problems? If so, lets talk.  Your Role and Responsibilities IBM is seeking an experienced SOC Analyst to join the Cybersecurity Operations team in Amsterdam. This position requires a motivated fast learner who is able to identify, analyze, and remediate potential threats to the environment. The candidate will require security industry knowledge that evolves with current and emerging threats, as well as an ongoing understanding of key business and technological processes.  The SOC Analyst will perform security monitoring, investigations and perform analysis of events in order to thwart internal and external threats to the environment. Additionally, the SOC Analyst will collaborate on an ongoing basis with the Cyber Security Incident Response Team to support detection, triage, incident analysis, containment, remediation and reporting of incidents.  Security Monitoring Analyze detections and alerts and respond to security threats from Firewall (FW), Intrusion Detection Systems (IDS), Intrusion Prevention Systems (IPS), Antivirus (AV), Endpoint Detection and Response (EDR) and other security threat data sources. Conduct Security Monitoring activities to provide Security in Depth visibility into potential known and unknown threats that may pose risk to the IBM environment. Document actions in cases to effectively communicate information to internal stakeholders as well has for historical retrieval. Resolve problems independently and understand escalation procedures. Participate in security incidents and act as the technical Subject Matter Expert during significant security incidents. Conduct operations surrounding cyber security incident response technologies including network logging and forensics, security information and event management tools, security analytics platforms, log search technologies, and host based forensics as applicable. Act as an internal information security consultant to the business and technology units, advising on risks, threats and control practices related to Rapid Response. Assist in development and knowledge sharing within the team. Assist in security console tuning. Assist in establishing Global Security Monitoring discipline to support enterprise Identify and share threat intelligence that impacts IBM and their customers or products  The job role requires shift work.  Required Technical and Professional Expertise Minimum 3+ years of experience working within a SOC, Threat Hunt, or Threat Intel team Experience with Linux, Windows and MacOS systems Critical thinking and problem solving skills Passion for information security and data security Strong written/verbal communication skills Strong interpersonal and organization skills Fluent English  Preferred Technical and Professional Expertise At least 2 years’ experience in Incident Response in a global corporate enterprise Experience in fast-paced investigations Experience with programming or scripting languages Familiarity with IBM QRadar SIEM, Windows Defender ATP and EDR platforms is a plus  About Business Unit IBM Corporate Headquarters (CHQ) team represents a variety of functions such as marketing, finance, legal, operations, HR, and more, all working together to solve some of the world's most complex problems, help our clients achieve success and build collaborative work environments for IBMers.  Your Life @ IBM What matters to you when you’re looking for your next career challenge?  Maybe you want to get involved in work that really changes the world? What about somewhere with incredible and diverse career and development opportunities – where you can truly discover your passion? Are you looking for a culture of openness, collaboration and trust – where everyone has a voice? What about all of these? If so, then IBM could be your next career challenge. Join us, not to do something better, but to attempt things you never thought possible.  Impact. Inclusion. Infinite Experiences. Do your best work ever.  About IBM IBM’s greatest invention is the IBMer. We believe that progress is made through progressive thinking, progressive leadership, progressive policy and progressive action. IBMers believe that the application of intelligence, reason and science can improve business, society and the human condition. Restlessly reinventing since 1911, we are the largest technology and consulting employer in the world, with more than 380,000 IBMers serving clients in 170 countries.  Location Statement For additional information about location requirements, please discuss with the recruiter following submission of your application.  Being You @ IBM IBM is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, pregnancy, disability, age, veteran status, or other characteristics. IBM is also committed to compliance with all fair employment practices regarding citizenship and immigration status.

title: Project Manager IT
summary: You'll play a key role in communicating between internal departments and external parties working closely together with the IT program director, business…
description: Mendix is on a mission to enable anyone in any organization – from the marketing coordinator to the software developer to the CEO – to create things that are transformational for their company. We are fundamentally reinventing the way applications are created and we’re reinventing the future of software development. Sounds ambitious, right? We agree.  Not to brag, but nearly 4,000 organizations worldwide, including KLM, Medtronic, Merck, and Philips, rely on Mendix to build web and mobile applications. Thousands of our customers use our platform to delight their clients and empower their employees. It’s no surprise that we’re a recognized Leader by Gartner and Forrester in a red-hot market expected to exceed $21 billion by 2022. Ok, maybe we did want to brag a little. But we’re proud of what we’ve accomplished…and…we’re humble enough to admit that we need you to make us even more effective.  Mendix has grown and expanded fast - from start-up to scale up. In order to improve the scalability of the internal organization, the new department, Program and Change, has started to define and manage the impact of IT solutions and processes on the organizational structure, competencies and skills, organization culture, performance and readiness for change.  The role:  In the role of Project Manager IT you will have responsibility for the design and delivery of the change management IT- enabled organizational transformation programs. You are responsible for the technical side of the projects assigned to you. By nature you will take ownership of planning/budget and will ensure goals and objectives are achieved with high quality and delivering on expected business value. You know how to successfully mitigate risks and issues and will play a lead role in communicating effectively with all stakeholders involved. You will be well versed in Agile techniques and exhibit the agility mindset. You'll play a key role in communicating between internal departments and external parties working closely together with the IT program director, business analyst and the application services and infrastructure services team members. You’ll be the liaison between business and IT to successfully implement organizational changes. Your responsibilities will be: You own and drive projects from start to completion in a distributed, matrix environment applying most appropriate project management methodologies and principals You will drive the successful business implementation You provide clear communication to team members and relevant stakeholders You drive your teams in a pro-active and passionate way, being best in class yourself You develop and execute detailed project plans, schedules, dependencies, critical paths and other required project collateral following standard methodologies or agile methodologies You will be successful in this role if you have a good few years of relevant experience in a project management or change manager role in a complex environment you are IPMA-C or Prince2 practitioner certified you have a background in IT, preferably in software or a product development area you are an excellent communicator (in English and in Dutch) you have the ability of successfully handling multiple projects and working with global cross organization teams to ensure project success are experienced in driving infrastructure migrations (preferred) and with a very strong attention to detail and an eye for quality and consistency have excellent stakeholder management skills have the personal characteristics of being intelligent, analytic, highly driven, hands-on, self-learning  Our Guiding Principles  While we live on different continents, speak different languages, and work on different things, we are bound by our “MendixBlue” guiding principles. Being “MendixBlue” means that you live the culture, and you consistently improve it as we grow. It’s kind of a big deal.  We put the customer first. Without our customers, we have no business. So, if you act in the best interest of our customers, always…you belong here.  We think big. We work to have a meaningful, lasting impact on the world. So, if you aim high and think long term…you belong here.  We innovate. We want to be what happens next. So, if you ask “what if?” and work to find a way or make one…you belong here.  We nurture talent. We look, not just at the sum of what an individual has done, but at the potential of who they can be. So, if you’re up for learning from your failures…you belong here.  We hear every voice. Inflated egos don’t last here, humility does. So, if you share credit and ensure that the best ideas win – regardless of who they come from…you belong here.  We own it. If something needs doing, we do it. So, if you focus on the outcome, and take initiative to get it done…you belong here.  We have fun. We use laughter as a common language. We can ask for help and we’re happy to give it. So, if you find joy and purpose in what you do…you belong here.  Make your career at Mendix.  There are precious few jobs that let you create the future. But you’ll find one at Mendix. We are at a pivotal time in our company’s existence: where rapid growth meets stable funding. This is the time for industrious people to raise their hands to solve the next generation of problems. Mendix is a place where ambitious people can thrive; where you can identify an issue, propose a solution, and build the structure to make it happen.  Important to know: Mendix is a Siemens business, which means we’re backed by the resources and stability of one of the world’s largest and most forward-looking enterprises. Think: job security.  Since our company was founded in 2005, our aim has been to create a great work environment for people at all stages in their careers. That’s why we are so pleased and honored that we were rated a top Cloud Computing Company to work for in 2019, based on feedback from our employees on Glassdoor. With offices in the Netherlands, the UK, Germany, and the US, (and more coming), we provide an international playground to truly impact the world through low-code.  Organization: Digital Industries Company: Mendix Technology B.V. Experience Level: Experienced Professional Job Type: Full-time

title: Salesforce Administrator - Europe
summary:
This role is part technical project manager, part administrator and part Salesforce analyst.
The Salesforce Administrator will lead the ongoing development of…
description: MAIN BUSINESS OBJECTIVES: The Salesforce Administrator will lead the ongoing development of our Salesforce deployment. The successful candidate will have a record of success in improving processes and adoption using the Force.com platform. The administrator will work closely with functional leaders, organizational units, and subject matter experts to identify develop and deploy new business processes including: Sales, Service and Marketing. This role is part technical project manager, part administrator and part Salesforce analyst. The Salesforce Administrator will be responsible for the executing on the day-to-day configuration, support, maintenance, and improvement of our CRM platform.  ESSENTIAL DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES: Serve as the system administrator for the Salesforce environment for European business users. Handle all basic administrative functions including user account maintenance, reports and dashboards, workflows and other routine tasks Complete regular internal system audits and prepare for upgrades Manage Salesforce data feeds and other integrations Coordinate the evaluation, scope and completion of new development requests. Assist in training of new users, and grow the Salesforce skill set across the organization Effectively act as the liaison between our users, vendors and the application development teams Work independently with members of the user community to define and document development requirements REQUIREMENTS: Excellent project management skills and a positive attitude Demonstrated ability to meet deadlines, handle and prioritize simultaneous requests, and manage laterally and upwards Creative and analytical thinker with strong problem-solving skills Must demonstrate exceptional verbal and written communication skills Must demonstrate ability to communicate effectively at all levels of the organization Ability to critically evaluate information gathered from multiple sources, reconcile conflicts, decompose high-level information into details, abstract up from low-level information to a general understanding, and distinguish user requests from the underlying true needs Ability to assess the impact of new requirements on Salesforce and all upstream and downstream applications, systems and processes EXPERIENCE: Minimum two years of experience as a Salesforce administrator Certified Salesforce Administrator and Advanced Administrator Sales Cloud Consultant, Service Cloud Consultant and Developer certifications preferred Proven ability to design and implement new processes and facilitate user adoption. Strong understanding of the platform, with the ability to build custom apps and objects, formula fields, workflows, custom views, and other content of intermediate complexity Excellent understanding of Salesforce best practices and functionality Strong data management abilities A documented history of successfully driving projects to completion Demonstrated ability to understand and articulate complex requirements Previous experience working in a SCRUM or agile environment preferred WHY JOIN US  If you want to be part of an enthusiastic and ambitious team in an international environment, then join us! We offer great opportunities to expand your knowledge and develop your talent within a vastly growing global company.  COMPANY OVERVIEW: Established in 2000 in Toronto, Canada, Fleet Complete® is a leading global provider of mission critical connected technologies for fleet, asset and mobile workforce-based businesses. For over 20 years, Fleet Complete has been helping business owners improve their bottom line with enhanced digital dispatching, automated fleet tracking and effective mobile resource management. Fleet Complete offers its unique suite of solutions to companies all over the world, maintaining key distribution partnerships with AT&T in the U.S., TELUS in Canada, Magenta Telekom in Austria, Deutsche Telekom in Germany and Telstra in Australia. The company’s recent expansion into the European and Asia-Pacific markets, with offices now held in the Netherlands, Belgium, Denmark, the Baltics, Greece and Australia, has made Fleet Complete one of the top industry leaders in IoT (Internet of Things). Fleet Complete has won numerous awards for innovation and growth since its inception in 2000 thanks to its relentless commitment to product Innovation, Quality, Customer Focus, Productivity and People.  Learn more about us on our company website: www.fleetcomplete.nl or www.fleetcomplete.com  Fleet Complete is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity and inclusion. We are pleased to consider all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, or any other legally protected factors.

title: Engineering Excellence Manager, International (EMEA, LATAM, ASIA, ANZ))
summary:
Highly numerate and financially aware to allow project financial analysis to be completed in conjunction with financial analysts.
But you won’t do it alone.
description: Kraft Heinz, The Company As one of the world’s largest food and beverage companies, we are proud to spark joy around mealtimes with a global portfolio of more than 200 brands. Some are iconic brands like Philadelphia Cream Cheese, Kraft Peanut Butter, Kraft Dinner and Heinz Ketchup. Others are fast growing new sensations that defy status quo like CRAVE. No matter the brand, we are united under one vision To Be the Best Food Company, Growing a Better World . Bringing this vision to life are our 36,000+ teammates around the world, making food people love. Together, we help provide meals to those in need through our global partnership and commitment with Rise Against Hunger. And we also stand committed to sustainability, and the health of our planet and its people. Every day, we are transforming the food industry with bold thinking and unprecedented results. If you’re passionate like us - and ready to create the future, build on a storied legacy, and participate as a conscientious global citizen - there’s one thing to do join us.  Our Culture of Ownership, Meritocracy and Collaboration  We’re not afraid to think differently. Embrace new ideas. Dream big. It all comes down to the way we empower our people to own their work. It’s true Our employees are our competitive advantage. As part of the Kraft Heinz family you’re supported to grow and achieve. You’re recognized and rewarded for outstanding performance at every level. You’re given the opportunity to leave your mark and build legacies. But you won’t do it alone. This is where our values and teamwork thrives and collaborative spirit fuels every day.
