The tiered-brand strategy was established for Calvin Klein to provide a focused, consistent approach to global brand growth and development that preserves the brand's prestige and image. Each of the Calvin Klein brands occupies a distinct marketing identity and position. We believe that Calvin Klein is well positioned over the next few years to establish itself as the world’s favorite brand. With the North Star of "Defying the boundaries of self-expression" guiding its design, marketing and consumer engagement initiatives, we believe that Calvin Klein will convert its investments into ongoing commercial success  The Team You are part of Calvin Klein Ecommerce and Marketing departments, reporting to The Senior Manager Performance Marketing. Your role is key in driving growth to our website as well as in driving brand visibility across Europe. You will work closely with other teams within Marketing & Ecomm as well as Consumer Insights, CRM, IT and external partners.  Key Responsibilities: Collaborate with Senior Manager, data analyst and the SEM & Display to define data strategy and roadmap. Work alongside the SEM & Display teams on day-to-day and strategic analysis and optimization for ROI and revenue maximization. Leverage and aggregate SEM data at scale. Design, build, and implement custom models and algorithms to improve and optimize SEM & Display performance, customer experience, revenue generation, demand & supply maximization, and other business outcomes. Build propensity to buy, engagement, lifetime value and forecasting models. Use these models to define and inform strategical and tactical activities. Work closely with data engineers to structure and collect data, and to build tools and frameworks. Develop processes and tools to monitor and analyze model performance and data accuracy (e.g. testing framework). Identify trends, insights, opportunities – also with limited data - that will drive profitable growth within and across the different channels maximizing the potential of each channel. Support the different teams on strategy, prioritization and innovation. Develop performance forecasts, budget allocations and providing data-based rationale for these recommendations. The Ideal Candidate: 4+ years of experience in working in a fast-paced digital agency, Ecomm environment or performance marketing. Programming proficiency in Python Experience in data science and machine learning Knowledge of BigQuery, SQL or similar Experience with big data technologies and cloud platforms, such as GCP, AWS Experience in data mining & analytics, building models with large, complex and multi-dimensional data sets Experience in analyzing SEM and web data, such as Google Ads, Campaign Manager, and Google Analytics Ability to work with imperfect and rapidly changing data and ability to make sensible assumptions based on the data available Ability to translate quantitative results into actionable business insights Knowledge and understanding of paid search bid management tools and technologies e.g. Search ads 360, Marin, Kenshoo, etc. preferred Experience with analytic tools such as Google Analytics, Omniture, Insights Discover, Tableau, Looker. Strong commercial mindset Self-starter, efficient time management and strong problem solving skills Strong verbal and written communication skills, attention to detail & accuracy. Knowledge of the retail & fashion industry is a plus.  What You Can Expect from Us: A beautiful state-of-the-art Campus, complete with our very own People's Place Gym and People's Place Cafés A company culture that fosters development, offering training and learning opportunities through our very own PVH University An international environment which respects diversity, equality, and individuality A smart work program that empowers our associates to work at their preferred location within a flexible schedule A chance to unwind with weekly social activities  We would love to know why this is the role for you, so please include a motivational letter with your application.  PVH Europe and our brands, TOMMY HILFIGER and CALVIN KLEIN, are committed to fostering an inclusive and diverse community of associates with a strong sense of belonging. We believe we are bettered by all forms of diversity, and take pride in working with top talent from every walk of life and corner of the world. In the spirit of inclusivity, qualified applicants will be considered without regard to age, ethnicity, ability, gender, gender expression, gender identity, nationality, race, religion or sexual orientation.

title: Medior CDD Analist
summary: Als Medior Analist Know Your Client ben je samen met je team verantwoordelijk voor het actualiseren en completeren van klantdossiers.
description: Als Medior Analist Know Your Client ben je samen met je team verantwoordelijk voor het actualiseren en completeren van klantdossiers. Dit doe je zowel op juridisch, fiscaal als bedrijfseconomisch vlak en wordt ook wel Customer Due Diligence genoemd, ofwel CDD. Over deze functie CDD is van belang bij het aangaan van een klantrelatie, maar ook tijdens deze relatie, want klanten worden doorlopend gereviewd. Je schakelt veel met andere teams en collega's om een goede beeldvorming van de relatie te krijgen zodat je een gedegen analyse kunt maken. Dit alles draagt eraan bij dat de bank zijn klanten écht goed kent en dat klantdossiers compleet en reconstrueerbaar zijn. Door dit goed te doen, help jij mee om financiële criminaliteit tegen te gaan! Over jou  Als Medior CDD Analist ben je in staat om – naast het maken van je eigen analyses - feedback te geven aan collega’s om elkaar verder te brengen. Daarnaast ben je in staat om de coördinatie en de regie over te nemen in afwezigheid van de senior. Je bent positief ingesteld, klantgericht, analytisch, enthousiast, nieuwsgierig en gedreven. Je wil jezelf voortdurend verbeteren en je staat open voor veranderingen die ertoe leiden dat je als team beter wordt. Je bent onafhankelijk, maar tegelijkertijd ben je ook een echte teamplayer. Je hebt een afgeronde studie op hbo- of wo-niveau Je hebt tenminste anderhalf tot twee jaar werkervaring in de financiële dienstverlening, specifiek op het vlak van financiële criminaliteit waaronder KYC valt. Hierdoor heb je onder meer kennis van (internationale) compliance-eisen en aanverwante procedures Je bent in staat om jezelf complexe materie snel eigen te maken Je beschikt over goede schriftelijke vaardigheden, om analyses transparant, duidelijk, doelgericht én efficiënt te verwoorden Je kunt je ook mondeling goed uitdrukken, omdat je regelmatig klantcontact hebt Je bent secuur en accuraat Je bent in staat collega’s te coachen Je voelt je maatschappelijk betrokken  Wat wij bieden  Terwijl jij je als CDD-Analist inzet bij onze opdrachtgever, zetten wij ons in voor jou. Gedetacheerd worden door Brunel Betekent namelijk dat je bij ons in dienst treedt. Bij ons draait het om jou, dus houden wij altijd een oogje in het zeil. Hoe uit zich dat? Je hebt een eigen Brunel-Consultant die jou begeleidt, check-ups doet, nieuwe projecten voor je vindt en jouw carrière en ontwikkeling vooropstelt. Daarnaast, want daar blijft het niet bij, stellen we diverse opleidingsmogelijkheden aan je voor waardoor jij je zowel op zakelijk als op persoonlijk vlak kunt blijven ontwikkelen. Je ontvangt een goed salaris en dan hebben we het nog niet eens over al die bonuskansen gehad. Ook met de secundaire arbeidsvoorwaarden zit het wel snor. Wij hebben tenslotte ook een reputatie hoog te houden.  Over ons Je kent Brunel als zakelijk dienstverlener; wereldwijd actief en gespecialiseerd in projectmanagement, detachering en consultancy in de vakgebied Finance & Risk, Engineering, IT, Legal, Marketing & Communicatie, HR en alle disciplines in de olie- en gasindustrie. Dit doen we samen met meer dan 10.000 collega’s in meer dan 35 landen. Brunel Finance & Risk is gespecialiseerd in het detacheren van vakspecialisten binnen de financiële dienstverlening. Dankzij onze medewerkers en onze manier van werken onderhouden wij goede relaties met alle gerenommeerde financiële spelers in de branche, met wie we jou graag in contact brengen. Onze kernwaarden zijn teruf te zien in onze deelname aan en sponsoring van de Volvo Ocean Race: ambition, teamwork and operational excellence. Vandaar ook ons motto: Navigate The Future. Herkenbaar? Welkom aan boord!  WO Bachelor

title: Business Analyst
summary: Develop models and coordinate discussion to support strategic operational analyses, including business viability evaluations, operational modifications and…
description: Job description For one of our international clients in the Weert area we are hiring a Business Analyst for the FP&A department. In this position you will be part of the FP&A team which is spread around several continents to assure 24/7 support to the business. You will report to the Head of FP&A in the US. Do you have excellent analytical skills combined with pro-activeness and a high energy level? Then you might be the new Business Analyst we are looking for. Your acountabilities: Strategic financial planning and analysis Produce monthly/quarterly management reporting on operational and financial results Develop and interpret financial data/analysis in conjunction with operations management to make recommendations for business and cost improvement. Develop models and coordinate discussion to support strategic operational analyses, including business viability evaluations, operational modifications and marketing evaluations. Maintenance and operation of Group strategic financial models Financial / operational analysis and interpretation of variances vs plans on site results Coordinate budget cycle Requirements Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration, Finance or Accounting; 2-5 years of experience in a financial/analytical role; Fluent in English; Great in working with MS Excel and data sets. Terms of employment Salary indication 40.000 - 65.000 / year Bonus (max 20%) 29 holidays + national holidays Pension Travel allowance: 0,14 / km (max 140 km / day)

title: Data Engineer
summary:
Tiqets is one of the fastest-growing tech scale-ups in the Netherlands.
To keep it moving fast and making culture more accessible, we’re hiring a Data Engineer…
description: Tiqets is one of the fastest-growing tech scale-ups in the Netherlands. To keep it moving fast and making culture more accessible, we’re hiring a Data Engineer to join us! Full-time · Amsterdam Who are we? We’re revolutionising the way people buy tickets to culture and attractions all over the world. Our technology lets users easily book tickets to the best attractions in seconds, meaning customers can enter museums, zoos, theme parks, and more faster than ever. We’re dedicated to bringing simplicity to the world of travel and entertainment. If you want to join our team, working as a Data Engineer, send us your CV. We might be looking for YOU! Our values Be accessible: Help out, communicate honestly, and be there for each other. Be remarkable: Have fun, think creatively, and celebrate great moments together. Skip the line: Be fast, flexible, and smart; take responsibility and push forward. Life at Tiqets What you will do Tiqets is positioned for explosive growth in the post-pandemic world, and we're looking for Data Engineers to help us scale our Data Platform for the future. As a Data Engineer you will be involved in designing and building out much of the core Data Platform being used by the company. You will be working closely with Data Scientists, Analysts, Engineers as well as Product and Marketing teams to understand their needs and architect systems to solve these needs. You’re a Data Engineer with a passion for architecting resilient and reliable data systems. You obsess over data quality and operational excellence, build clean and efficient Data Pipelines, and constantly look for ways to make systems better. You see the value in being a data-driven organization. You’re curious about new technologies, both open-source and SaaS. You like to work in a fast-paced environment and iterate quickly while continuing to build for the medium and long term.  Responsibilities Work closely with other Data Engineers on the team to architect, build and improve our Data Platform and analytics infrastructure Design and implement fault-tolerant, resilient ELT/ETL pipelines using open source tools like Airflow or hosted AWS/SaaS services Build monitoring tools to help meet our data quality/availability SLAs and ensure high-availability for our infrastructure Ability to work independently without active supervision, and take full ownership of what you build Support Data Scientists and Data Analysts on the team to productionize their workflows, while building tools and infrastructure to improve their speed and effectiveness  Minimum qualifications Bachelor or Master in Computer Science, or other relevant technical education. 2+ years experience working as an Engineer on data-intensive applications, architecting large-scale production systems Substantial experience with Python and other scripting languages with a track record of writing clean, efficient code Experience using core Data Engineering technologies like Airflow and DBT  Reasonable understanding of relational databases like PostgreSQL, as well as Data Warehousing technologies like Redshift, BigQuery, Snowflake, etc.  Sound understanding of SQL fundamentals and past experience with data warehousing, data modeling and schema design DevOps mindset; experience deploying applications using technologies like Kubernetes and Docker on AWS  Nice to Have Experience AWS services like Kinesis, Lambda, Glue, Athena Business Intelligence tools like Looker, Tableau, Data Studio Machine Learning technologies like AWS Sagemaker and MLflow SaaS tools like Segment, Fivetran, Stitch, Snowplow Experience with event pipelines and real-time streaming use cases Experience in the e-commerce domain   Our Data Engineering Stack AWS  Python  Airflow  Redshift  DBT  Looker Perks & Benefits at Tiqets Young, dynamic, international working environment Bright, welcoming office located in the centre of Amsterdam Opportunity to make an impact in the fastest growing tech scaleup 20% personal Tiqets discount code to explore great museums/venues worldwide Annual company getaway to undisclosed location Health insurance Tiqets learning academy: skill lab, group & individual learningTuesday's Pizza & beer sessions Friday drinks Visa sponsorship Summer party Competitive salary and paid holiday leave Sports activities: free gym, running sessions, boot-camp, football, climbing and more Pension scheme and travel compensation Everyone - employed at Tiqets will receive a monthly contribution for working from home Everyone - employed at Tiqets can reimburse home work space necessities Meet the Team

title: Market Share & Competitor Insights Manager
summary:
BSc/MSc degree in marketing, business or an equivalent combination of education and experience.
Understands qualitative, quantitative and agile research methods…
description: Job Title Market Share & Competitor Insights Manager Job Description Market Share & Competitor Insights Manager In this role, you have the opportunity to Accountable for the capability development of market share & competitor insights and the delivery of actionable recommendations resulting. Develops single source of truth for sell out & market share reporting through intuitive dashboards. Providing standardized input and root cause analysis for DA reporting cadence (QPR/MPR). Ensures a clear hierarchy of insights are translated to all levels of the business and across associated teams. You are responsible for Developing single source of truth for sales & market share reporting through intuitive dashboards Orchestrates competitive intelligence activities within MI&A and associated teams and stakeholders, driving clarity of inputs per role and handover points between teams Co-ordinates the collection of competitor and market share data from within MI&A and associated teams (MA&F, Strategy, HR, IP&S). Develops methodologies for faster and more insightful means of gaining competitor intelligence Shapes clear processes with stakeholders to continuously improve the delivery of market share and competitor intelligence Performs ad hoc deep dives on market share analysis (drops/increases) Supports the roll out and use of digital tools (e.g. Owlin, Sprinklr) to facilitate always on collection of competitor intelligence information Identifies knowledge gaps and proposes quality secondary research services to fill gaps Manages daily relationship with secondary research suppliers in close co-operation with Analyst Relations Prioritizes and leads the set up, preparation and facilitation for war gaming workshops across the business as part of a multi-disciplinary team (MI&A , MA&F, Strategy) Co-operate closely with Strategy, MA&F, IP&S, HR Talent Intelligence, Marketing You are a part of The new Domestic Appliances MI&A team. This team will be responsible for transformation and innovating in the Benelux for business Domestic Appliances. As we value diversity, we have a multi-functional and diverse team, with different points of view, different ways of thinking, new capabilities to strengthen and improve the digital strategy for our customers. To succeed in this role, you should have the following skills and experience BSc/MSc degree in marketing, business or an equivalent combination of education and experience 5-10 years of working experience, in customer/consumer focused, complex, matrixed, multinational environment. Preferably with experience in consumer goods, online services, e-commerce, or mobile applications High level of expertise in technical knowledge on emerging and innovative insights and analytics techniques, tools /platforms Understands qualitative, quantitative and agile research methods and how to structure and deliver insights at the fingertips of the marketing community Cross-Functional Connector. Build bridges across the organization to deeply understand the business situation and competitive moves and scenarios High level of analytical skills critical and attention to detail Why should you join Domestic Appliances? Philips’ Domestic Appliances business is a global leader with EUR 2.3 billion in sales in 2019 in kitchen appliances, coffee, garment care and home care appliances, with successful products such as the Airfryer, Automatic Coffee Machines with LatteGo and SpeedPro Max Aqua vacuum cleaner, and many more that are used by millions of people every day across the world. In January 2020, Philips announced that it would be considering new ownership options for Domestic Appliances, as it is not a strategic fit for the company’s future as a health technology leader, and committed to finding the right home for the business to ensure that it is set up for continued success serving customers, leveraging the Philips brand and driving growth across the markets that it serves. In its 128 year history as a leading innovator, Philips has had to reinvent itself a number of times to remain competitive. This has involved several high-profile divestments, resulting in the company’s successful track record in managing complex change of this scale. Such transformations offer unique opportunities for employees to ‘make their mark’ and gain expertise in a specific and dynamic environment - those who can deliver results while navigating and contributing to changes will gain unique skills and perspective that will prove valuable for the rest of their careers. Contact If you forgot your password, you can click the Forgot Password button on the Sign In screen to reset it.

title: Manager Business Insights
summary:
Experienced in marketing and sales activities and on- and offline marketing channels.
Experience of working successfully translating business plans into…
description: Vacancy: Manager Business Insights  Looking to work in an international company with more than 35 different nationalities where collaboration and innovative ideas are key to drive future success? Seeking a role where you can add value and have the opportunity to develop and grow? Office Depot Europe has an exciting opportunity for a Manager Business Insights to join our European headquarters in Venlo , the Netherlands. The role is a fulltime, permanent position offering an excellent salary and benefits package. Your role as a Manager Business Insights The business insights team plays a crucial role in measuring campaigns performance; give insights and forecast for the development of sales and costs and other key performance indicators, analyses the customer behavior and customer trends. The manager gives guidance to the stakeholder regarding new business opportunities with respect to touch-point, customer segments and campaigns. He or she works in close cooperation with IT in order to automate a standard reporting. The visualization, summary and presentation of findings into actionable insights is as well an area of responsibility as the coordination and contribution for ad-hoc requests. Leads the team of Business Insights Analysts Heavily interacts with and consults stakeholders, shares innovations and insights, gathers requirements, translates requirements into tasks Formulates and/or coordinates inter-disciplinary project teams which are formulated to execute dedicated tasks in a highly interactive and efficient way of working Is responsible to develop a reporting landscape which gives KPIs reflecting the performances of campaign, activities, treatments and touchpoints Attract, lead, coach, appraise and develop employees, ensuring staffing and increase enablement. Collaborates with IT for automation of best practice reporting, for data requirements supporting the performance measurements Generates Insights, summarizes insights and distributes them across the business Coordinates Deep Dives on actual business topics, and creates analytics supporting those in addition to the analytics as they come from other analytical units Defines requirements regarding customer market research analytics (as executed by “Strategy Deployment, Market Insights & Communication” department) Presents Insights to Senior Management and other stakeholders Provides input to stakeholders about target setting for campaigns (that can be expected success regarding customer, product, touch-point or overall financial KPIs) Provides input to stakeholders feeding into the AOP and the business financial forecast processes. That implies the cooperation with Campaign Execution and Optimization (i.e. input about cost expectations) Provides forecast of expected customer base development and KPIs, as well as natural sales development. Simulates necessary KPI development to hit a certain sales target. Coordinates and aligns inputs from whole area of analytical CRM What do you need to be successful i n this role Bachelor and/or Master degree with a minimum of 5 years of proven experience in Statistics, Finance or Business Economics Understanding of Good SQL skills and knowledge of SAS, or other programming languages Experience on reporting tools as Tableau, Visual Analytics or others is a must Excellent knowledge of English, spoken and written. Any other language skills such as German, French and/or Dutch would be an advantage Proven project management skills for participation and leading projects Experienced in marketing and sales activities and on- and offline marketing channels Experience of working successfully translating business plans into marketing solutions Business insights; has the ability to adjust and change with the needs of the organization Plans & Aligns; create focus and reach deadlines and accurately scopes the length and difficulty of tasks, successfully sets objectives and goals and measures performance against goals Develops talent; places high priority on developing others. Consistently uses multiple methods to develop others What do we offer As we care about our people we will reward you with an excellent salary and additional benefits package. Variable bonus structure A good work-life balance with 36 days of leave per year, based on a 40 hour workweek Flexible working hours in regard to starting your day between 07:00 and 09:00 am Good travel expenses allowances E xcellent learning and development programs Solid company pension scheme Collective health insurance and discount on private insurances Several initiatives to stimulate your well-being like contributions for sport memberships I nterested? C lick ‘ Apply’ today and take your next step towards a career with Office Depot Europe. Want to know more about Office Depot in the Netherlands ? Visit our career-website: https://careers.officedepot.eu/nl

title: Application Support Lead
summary: Facilitating HO/TO duties with support managers/leads and analysts in other global regions.cilitating IT production service education and training as necessary…
description: About us  Global IT transforms the way Dyson does business through world class IT Services and Systems. We demand the highest standards of performance from the technologies we engineer and our people expect the same from the technology that supports them. We are a community that appreciates and advocates better engineering. A community of pioneers. Our aim is to strategically partner to shape our future business, to provide exceptional IT service delivery and continuity whilst driving continuous improvement to deliver transformational change across the company. We are a team that drives operational excellence within IT to achieve exceptional results.  Dyson’s Global IT applications service has end-to-end accountability for the design, delivery and support of all business applications enabling Dysons global commercial, operational and enterprise business process. Forming a large proportion of the IT Function, the team are arranged into investment areas including Owner Experience and Retail, Engineering Operations, (Product development, Supply Chain and Manufacturing) and Enterprise (Finance, Legal, Compliance, HR). About the role  The Global Support Lead will work closely with Service Managers, Account Owners and Operational Partners across the organization to deliver and maintain world class production operations capability for Dyson. In this role you will work seamlessly with equivalent counterparts and support teams in markets and other geographical regions to deliver around the clock 24/7 support capability. As such, this role may require an element of on call or shift rotation for peak periods and weekend/holiday cover. Your responsibilities will include: Providing day to day alignment across operational partners and internal teams (Service Desk/Infra/Security/Data). Providing day to day support for Dysons operational service tools and processes. Providing IT operational support on incident/problem categorization/prioritisation. Providing day to day governance and decision making for production changes and problem workarounds. Coordinating across the Dyson/Partner/Vendor organizational eco-system – establishing and chairing conference calls and mediating when required to maintain (or recover) production service. (including requirements for Applications, Infrastructure, Data, Security & Risk). Providing internal stakeholder (IT & Business) coordination and status updates on production service – including communicating impactful updates on production incidents and MIM status. Providing insight and measures on IT service performance against business processes KPIs/SLAs. Managing OAT and Service Acceptance requirements with IT delivery teams. Provisioning and managing business expectations on production outages for IT change and service maintenance. Representing Service Operations changes and acceptance decisions as necessary for CAB approvals. Maintain operational change control over CAB approved standard changes (Infrastructure and Application changes). Maintaining application run-books, and knowledge articles to ensure they are effective, accurate and up to date. Facilitating HO/TO duties with support managers/leads and analysts in other global regions.cilitating IT production service education and training as necessary across Dysons organizational eco-system. Tracking and implementing Support Practice CSI – including implementation of self-serve capability and service automation and self-heal technology. Publishing routine reports on regional CSAT, priorities operational partner performance.  About you    You will need to be customer focused, organised and confident, to have a sense of urgency and remain calm under pressure. You will need to deliver results using your own initiative and it is essential that you possess the following skills: Outstanding interpersonal communication skills. Enthusiastic advocate of business change and innovation. Experience of IT Support and Service Operations, in large and complex IT environments and organizational eco-systems. Ability to influence others and communicate with impact at senior levels across the organization. Ability to lead the resolution of service related risks through a range of internal and external resources. Ability to structure and implement organisational processes, procedures and knowledge retention. Ability to produce meaningful Senior level reports on status, trends and performance. Knowledge of ITIL service transition and service operations and analysis processes. Knowledge of project delivery methodologies (Agile/SCRUM/SAFE/DSDM). Desirable: Experience of Digital applications (Web, E-Commerce, Point of Sale, Identity Management & Content Management). Experience of CRM applications (Registration, Data Handling, Customer Support, Regulation, Security, Marketing). Experience of ERP applications (SAP/S4 Hana, Finance, Logistics, Procurement, Supply Chain). Experience of HCM applications (Workday). Experience of Service Now, Advanced Excel, Visio, Sharepoint, Teams, Confluence, Jira. Benefits   Flexible working hours possibility to work@home Company bonus scheme Relaxed dress-code Discount on Dyson machines Employee Assistant Programme Interview guidance We are following the government guidelines regarding COVID19. At this time all interviews will be conducted via video or telephone. We’re taking these precautionary measures to protect both our employee and candidate wellbeing. Our Talent Acquisition team will work with you and provide further information as appropriate.

title: VIE Analyste Quantitatif – Amsterdam, H/F
summary: A la fin de son VIE, l’analyste quantitative sera capable de prétendre à un poste d’ingénieur quantitatif au sein d’une équipe d’investissement dans le domaine…
description: VIE Analyste Quantitatif – Amsterdam, H/F  Concrètement votre quotidien ? Au sein du Quant Research Group Multi Assets & Solutions nous fournissons un support quantitatif à l'équipe Multi Asset Quantitative & Solutions. Nous jouons un rôle central dans le renforcement de leur offre de solutions clients pour des portefeuilles Multi-Asset en rationalisant l'infrastructure et au travers de recherches dans de nouveaux domaines prometteurs (avec un focus sur des projets de recherche à moyen-terme): recherche économétrique de modèles d’évaluation pour des classes d’actifs variées, stratégies dynamiques, etc… Vous interviendrez sur les missions suivantes : Contribuer à l’amélioration des processus de gestion = process engineering ; Concevoir des modèles quantitatifs pour des implémentations systématiques ou en tant qu'aide à la décision permettant de générer de la performance = génération d'alpha ; Définir des solutions d’investissements adaptées aux besoins précis des différents clients, en particulier dans Solutions & multi assets ; Contribuer à développer des approches innovantes au sein des produits et des processus d’investissements pour promouvoir l’image de « thought leadership » de BNP Paribas AM = thought leadership. L’environnement de travail, c’est important ! L'équipe QRG de BNP Paribas AM est placée au sein du département PSM (Product, Strategic & Marketing). Elle a, à ce titre, un rôle transversal, à la fois vis-à-vis de l’ensemble des équipes de gestion et vis-à-vis de l’ensemble des canaux de distribution et de vente, en coordination avec le reste du périmètre PSM (Product, Strategic & Marketing). Le principal enjeu du poste est de travailler au sein du pôle de recherche en charge des solutions d’investissements multi assets. Ce pôle remplit les 4 missions principales énoncées ci-dessus vis-à-vis des équipes de gestion diversifiée (MAQS) et des produits gérés par ces équipes. Et après ? Cette mission est une excellente opportunité de travailler sur un large éventail de sujets d’investissements et de développer ainsi une forte expérience dans l’industrie de la gestion d’actifs. A la fin de son VIE, l’analyste quantitative sera capable de prétendre à un poste d’ingénieur quantitatif au sein d’une équipe d’investissement dans le domaine de la gestion d’actifs. Pourquoi rejoindre BNP Paribas ? Notre monde change ! Aujourd’hui, ce qui compte dans un job, c’est de vivre de véritables expériences, d’apprendre, de partager objectifs et résultats avec ses collègues. Bref, de tracer son propre chemin, différent, responsable et durable. Chez BNP Paribas, nous recrutons nos collaborateurs avec l’idée qu’ils nous aideront à concevoir le monde et la banque de demain. Vous voulez connaître toutes les raisons de nous rejoindre ? Rendez-vous sur : https://group.bnpparibas/emploi-carriere/bnp-paribas  Et la rémunération ? Elle est fixée par Business France et consultable directement sur leur site. Etes-vous notre prochain VIE Analyste Quantitatif ? Vous êtes titulaire d’un BAC+5 minimum Ecole de commerce /Université ou ingénieur avec une spécialisation en Finance, mathématiques appliquées et statistiques. Vous justifiez d’une expérience de 6 mois minimum (stages et alternance inclus) sur un poste similaire. Vous avez des connaissances sur le Data processing et les modèles prédictifs. Vous maitrisez également les langages R, Python et VBA. Enfin, vous avez un niveau d’anglais courant. Vous êtes orienté(e) résultats et faite preuve d’esprit d’équipe. Votre rigueur ainsi que votre créativité et votre capacité d’adaptation seront autant d’atouts pour évoluer sur cette mission. Enfin, nous attachons une importance particulière à ce que nos futurs collaborateurs agissent au quotidien avec responsabilité éthique et professionnelle.  Disponibilité  VIE à pouvoir dès que possible pour une durée de 16 mois maximum. Curriculum et lettre de motivation en anglais requis.  Les conditions d’éligibilité au contrat VIE (selon les règles fixées par Business France) sont consultables sur : http://www.civiweb.com/  : http://www.civiweb.com/   ...

title: Business Analyst FP&A
summary: Develop models and coordinate discussion to support strategic operational analyses, including business viability evaluations, operational modifications and…
description: Location: Corporate Office THE ROLE: The Financial Planning and Analysis (FP&A) Department plays a crucial role within the Finance Department: Owner of Group management reporting framework Owner of Group budgeting & forecasting proces Owner of Group strategic modelling & scenario planning Maintain rules and compliance to Group management reporting standards for internal & external reporting Oversight of Group wide Business analysis function Operational coordination of consolidated monthly management reporting, and annual budget processes. Support for other finance functions; Group Accounting, Treasury, Tax and IR on an as needs basis Direct ad-hoc support to CFO and NMC on management reporting and Group financial analysis KEY ACCOUNTABILITIES Key Responsibilities The Business Analysts of the FP&A cover following areas: Strategic financial planning and analysis Produce monthly/quarterly management reporting on operational and financial results, consolidated/per site Develop and interpret financial data/analysis in conjunction with operations management to make recommendations for business and cost improvement. Develop models and coordinate discussion to support strategic operational analyses, including business viability evaluations, operational modifications and marketing evaluations. Maintenance and operation of Group strategic financial models Maintenance and operation of mining valuation & impairment models Maintenance and operation of DTA recoverability and going concern analysis models Financial / operational analysis and interpretation of variances vs plans on mining/refining site results Support for controlling function Provide active management, guidance, & coaching of mine/refining site BAs Provide site FMs/BAs with specialised analysis Build mining/smelting variance analysis models Coordinate budget cycle Key Relationships The Business analyst FP&A will report to the Head of FP&A Internal relationships: Accounting Department, IT, Compliance, Operations, Senior Finance Management, Treasury, Technical teams on sites External relationship: Cash management banks, Facility Agents and Programme Banks, Financing Banks and Institutions, Legal Advisers  QUALIFICATIONS/EXPERIENCE Experience Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration, Finance or Accounting 5-10 years of experience in a financial/analytical role Mining or metal smelting experience highly desirable Key attributes Excellent English written and oral communication skills\ Numerically minded Excel, cashflow modelling, ability to handle and treat and large amount of data, macros Objectives focussed, ability to handle multiple objectives efficiently Proven planning and organisational skills Strong/resolute personality Adaptable with ability to take on ideas and concepts in a short period of time Accuracy with speed, attention to detail.  APPLICATION: If you are interested in applying for this position, please send us your CV: HR.CorporateOffice@nyrstar.com. We look forward to hearing from you. Please note that only applicants who progress to the next stage will be contacted. Thank you for your interest in applying for this position. For more information on Nyrstar, please visit www.nyrstar.com. We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and take pride in a diverse workforce. We do not discriminate in recruitment, hiring, training, promotion or other employment practices for reasons of race, colour, religion, gender, sexual orientation, national origin, age, marital or veteran status, medical condition or handicap, disability, or any other legally protected status.

title: Product Analyst - Experimentation
summary:
We're looking for an expert analyst who can deliver data-driven insights and find improvement opportunities.
Want to take on a key role in our company, helping…
description: Product Analyst - Experimentation We're looking for an expert analyst who can deliver data-driven insights and find improvement opportunities. Want to take on a key role in our company, helping a talented team create the best product for our restaurant partners based on data? Then keep reading… Our story (the bitesize version) Whether it's party-night pizza or superb salads, we keep millions of food-lovers happy. Having expanded as Just Eat Takeaway.com, we're now delivering in 24 countries worldwide – from the Netherlands to New Zealand. But the secret to our growth isn't food, it's people. From marketing maestros to tech specialists and analytics experts, our international teams give us the ingredients for success. All about the role You are the Driver for a shared Product Vision and work with the team on continuous delivery. With your help, the company is led to a state of making data driven decisions to improve the product and optimize the user journey. In this cross-functional role, your initial focus will be on setting up, managing, and reporting on our A/B experiments. You will be part of the Restaurants Vertical within our Product department and report to the Product Lead. You will be closely working together with Product Owners, UX/UI researchers & designers, product analysts, and engineers. Together with this team, you are responsible for optimizing the user funnel of our restaurant applications' customer journeys and contributing directly to JETs growth ambitions. In this role, we're also counting on you to: Proactively propose business action and opportunities which is taken out from experimentation results and data to product stakeholders You are able to interpret the questions behind the question and have experience in communicating clearly and in a concise manner with product stakeholders Setup, QA, and run A/B tests using Optimizely. Guard the quality of our experiment designs. You make sure that regardless of the experiment's outcome, we will always learn something new. Ensure experiments get up and running at a high speed while maintaining our high-quality bar. Support the product teams to interpret, report and share the results with all relevant stakeholders. Team up with our product analysts to identify the biggest opportunities for growth, identify our key metrics and directly affect the prioritization of the experimentation roadmap. Be the ambassador of driving awareness about data-driven decision making and thus the value of running experimentations Provide input on the overall experimentation priorities, tactics, and strategy based on your expertise and learnings. Adapt in a fast-moving environment with shifting priorities.  Can you deliver… You have at least 2-3 years working experience as Web Analyst, Business Analyst, Conversion Optimization Specialist, Product Analyst, or similar areas. You have been working together with product and different IT departments. You know how to assist them with insights from the digital analytics platform and help stakeholders to optimize their products for web and mobile applications. Conversion optimization is not a foreign language for you, therefore you have a good understanding of what it means to work with web and app analytics and the various A/B testing possibilities. Hands-on experience with web analytics and A/B testing tools + an understanding of statistics Applicable knowledge of HTML/CSS/JS to be able to set up A/B tests using Optimizely. Being able to do in-depth analyses, for example, performance analysis about the different steps in the funnel. Scrum framework is not a foreign language to you. You have a highly structured, independent and goal orientated working method. You are a great decision maker and owner of various methods for making clear priorities. You are a 100% Team player and have a high interest in continuous reflection and improvement within the team. You are fluent in English and enjoy a multicultural work environment. You are an energetic and enthusiastic personality that has great communication skills.   Here is our offer Being part of a dynamic and international e-commerce company with flat hierarchies Joining an international and professional team We offer a schooling budget that allows you to attend conferences and Workshops, we encourage you to not only improve the product but also yourself Competitive salary and contribution to your pension plan A laptop with your desired OS Awesome team events and global gatherings, such as our annual ski trip and summer event at the beach!  Did we raise your appetite? Click the Apply button now to send us your CV.

title: Business Intelligence Analyst
summary: Marketing closely works together with the product teams in Standard Solution Management (including Technical innovation) and the Sales teams in the Customer…
description: In fast changing markets, customers worldwide rely on Thales. Thales is a business where brilliant people from all over the world come together to share ideas and inspire each other. In aerospace, transportation, defence, security and space, our architects design innovative solutions that make our tomorrow's possible. Business Intelligence Analyst Marketing closely works together with the product teams in Standard Solution Management (including Technical innovation) and the Sales teams in the Customer Account Teams (CATs) in order to define the marketing strategy, support these teams with operational marketing support and provide the intelligence required to win business. About the job As Business Intelligence Analyst you will contribute to improve the Thales Netherlands Naval information position on markets and competitors, in order to improve efficiency and effectiveness of our Customer Account Teams (CATs) and Product Teams (PTs) to improve our position in the market. You will be tasked with the following activities: Structuring methods & processes for information gathering from both Thales and external sources on customers and competitors, based on the articulated needs Marketing, Sales and Product Management; Analyse the data and create business analysis reports on customers, markets and competitors; Participate in the Thales Group Strategic Business Analysis activities, with an emphasis on the Thales global Naval business; Support the Strategic Business Plan, Sales plan and Product plan with trend analysis and customer profiles; Contribute to develop and strengthen the digital BI framework (methods, tools) Maintain the market & competitor databases. About you relevant Master Degree and preferably 5 to 7 years of experience in the defence industry; like to search for pieces of information and combine them into a relevant business analysis report; a team player, good communication skills, able to lead conversations with sales and product management and understand their business needs; ability to create and maintain effective information networks. What's in it for you Become part of a great marketing team (consisting of Marketing, Operational Business Development and Business Intelligence) in a high tech, innovative international organization (International) opportunities for growth in tech-, management- and commercial roles Attention for personal development and own initiative A nice workplace in a modern building, where we value a good work-life balance and flexibility 40 leave days per year, travel expenses and a flexible benefits à la carte package with options like purchase/sale of leave hours, internet costs, bicycle plan, company fitness, trade union contribution or relocation costs Interested? Apply now! Click on the button below to upload your profile and show your interest. As part of the process we might ask you to take a skills and competencies assessment. At Thales we provide CAREERS and not only jobs. With Thales employing 80,000 employees in 68 countries our mobility policy enables thousands of employees each year to develop their careers at home and abroad, in their existing areas of expertise or by branching out into new fields. Together we believe that embracing flexibility is a smarter way of working. Great journeys start here, apply now!

title: DA - FP&A Markets Analyst
summary: You will work closely with marketing, trade marketing, digital, order desk and sales departments as well as internal and external accounting operations teams.
description: Job Title DA - FP&A Markets Analyst Job Description In this role, you have the opportunity to Support the business and create value of the company by driving insightful analysis and coordinating financial processes for the Domestic Appliance Market Organization. You are responsible for Providing quality financial support to the business, proactively supporting Finance Business Partner and commercial teams in order to achieve financial and business goals, Supporting business planning process (Annual Operating Plan (AOP)/Rolling Forecast(RF)) in cooperation with local Management Team, DA Management Team and global FP&A team, Providing financials insights, supporting data based decision process, Providing variance analysis of business and financial results, Preparing cyclical sales and margin reports, sales channel P&L, market P&L tool, Coordination of the processes, identifying and executing simplification and saving initiatives, Work with internal and outsourced accounting team on month end closing by analyzing the actuals versus AOP and RF, identifying delta’s and provide short-term (f.e. manual journal vouchers, judgmental accruals) and long term (process adjustments) solutions, Provide (quantitative and qualitative) insight on margin movement (IGM bridge) and Sellex overrun/saving (including building and updating OFSE forecast model), Monitor Productivity task (Actuals vs Plan) and highlight risk and recommend actionable, Performing and preparing ad hoc business analysis, Being a key user for SAP, standardized reports, Business Warehouse (FP&A system landscape: QlikView, Qlick Sense, PMA). You are a part of Finance team reporting to Head of FP&A Markets Lead and closely cooperate with Market Finance Business Partner. You will work closely with marketing, trade marketing, digital, order desk and sales departments as well as internal and external accounting operations teams. To succeed in this role, you should have the following skills and experience 4-7 years of experience in an equivalent role in a multinational, matrix organization, Experience with financial control, management reporting and business analyses, preferably within an international environment, Business acumen, Team player, Advanced technical skills in Excel, ERP (SAP preferred) and PowerPoint Experience with reporting & analytical tools, like SPSS, Business-Intelligence environments, SQL, etc., Strong affinity with LEAN processes and tools, Strong knowledge of internal control processes and systems, Bachelor or Master’s degree in a Business Economics, Finance and/or Accounting orientated study. ACCA, CIMA or progress towards certification would be an asset, Experience with month-end/year end close process and financial reporting, Results oriented: take personal accountability to deliver results, Fluent English both oral and written, Strong communication skills: cross-functional partnership with business & support functions Sales and Marketing, Pricing, Supply chain & Procurement functions. In return, we offer you A path towards your most rewarding career. Succeeding in this market-based role in a complex environment will open many doors for your long term career, in other areas in Philips or otherwise. We also believe that we are at our best as a company when you are at yours as a person. Thus, we offer competitive health benefits, a flexible work schedule and access to local well-being focused activities. Why should you join Domestic Appliances? Philips’ Domestic Appliances business is a global leader with EUR 2.3 billion in sales in 2019 in kitchen appliances, coffee, garment care and home care appliances, with successful products such as the Airfryer, Perfect Care Steam Generators, Automatic Coffee Machines with LatteGo and SpeedPro Max Aqua vacuum cleaner, and many more that are used by millions of people every day across the world. In January 2020, Philips announced that it would be considering new ownership options for Domestic Appliances, as it is not a strategic fit for the company’s future as a health technology leader, and committed to finding the right home for the business to ensure that it is set up for continued success serving customers, leveraging the Philips brand and driving growth across the markets that it serves. In its 128-year history as a leading innovator, Philips has had to reinvent itself a number of times to remain competitive. This has involved several high-profile divestments, resulting in the company’s successful track record in managing complex change of this scale. Such transformations offer unique opportunities for employees to ‘make their mark’ and gain expertise in a specific and dynamic environment - those who can deliver results while navigating and contributing to changes will gain unique skills and perspective that will prove valuable for the rest of their careers. #LI-EU #LI-CE Contact If you forgot your password, you can click the Forgot Password button on the Sign In screen to reset it.

title: Category Management & Brand Growth CMI Director
summary: Our global marketing team in Amsterdam will drive Coty Consumer Beauty transformation and deliver a successful turnaround.
description: COTY is one of the world’s largest beauty companies with an iconic portfolio of brands across fragrance, color cosmetics, hair color and styling, and skin and body care. COTY is the global leader in fragrance, number two in professional hair color & styling, and number three in color cosmetics. COTY’s products are sold in over 150 countries around the world. COTY and its brands are committed to a range of social causes as well as seeking to minimize its impact on the environment. For additional information about Coty Inc., please visit www.coty.com.  ABOUT GLOBAL MARKETING, CONSUMER BEAUTY BRANDS  In Consumer Beauty, we are currently in process to drive turnaround and value creation on our most Iconic brands under the leadership of our incoming CEO Sue Y. Nabi. Our global marketing team in Amsterdam will drive Coty Consumer Beauty transformation and deliver a successful turnaround. This transformation effort includes re-centering our brand activity and innovation program on strong consumer centricity, establish a strong Global Category thought leadership and growth story leveraging emergent needs and trends, fixing base business restrainer to unlock our ability to invest into future growth. A once in a lifetime opportunity of which you could now be part of!  THE ROLE  As the Category Management & Brand Growth Director, you will re-establish strong practice and thought leadership around category growth, and how current and future demand spaces comes to life into our CB portfolio. You will provide insights on the effectiveness of our $ spent to drive mental and physical availability and ultimately top line growth. You will be an expert on Brand Health, identifying restrainer and working with the team to turn around and restart top growth. You will be familiar with both Media and Store opportunities and will be pivotal to define the right strategy to close existing gaps, de-risk brand building blocks and construct a balanced and robust category growth story for the markets. You will also help the team understand biggest restrainers to brand growth and how to optimize plans based on in market KPI for both physical and Mental availability. You will develop a strong expertise on Category Management, Brand spending effectiveness and KPIs predictive of in-market success. You will play a critical role in the transformation of CB by recognizing what works and which gaps need to be addressed, displaying a bias for action and positively influencing CB leaders to adjust plans that are not set up for success. You will play a pivotal role in instilling an inquisitive consumer-centric mindset in Consumer Beauty by driving MFT understanding of how Brand plan works through Media and in store to improve social content and improve effectiveness of $ spent.  Detailed Roles and Responsibilities: Be the go-to expert on category demand & portfolio strategy You understand category dynamics and triggers that drive brand choice and purchase. Drive clarity on future demand spaces and how these should come to life in our portfolio over time. Understand restrainer to base brand growth on our priority BMU Provide insight and data-based recommendations on how to best drive base brands productivity by fixing restrainers to mental / physical availability. Share best practices for reapplication. Build a strong and consistent Category Growth Story over time enable to team to understand how this translates this into strong Store / Shelf / Media activities. Balance scale with needed adaptations to specific contexts such as Media channels or store formats. Consolidate CB Category Management best practices . Providing strong consumer/shopper centricity to the team Support Yearly Strat Plans With Brand teams, the Analytic Director, Innovation S. Director ensure more robust SOP estimate with balanced building blocks grounded in the brand and market reality and expected projection Balanced demand sizing behind Brand plans ensure realistic assumptions around spending, distribution, shelf execution, Ensure incrementality accounts for borrowing. Collaborate closely with media team in defining sufficient / effective media spending vis a vis desired goals Leverage Media calculator, MMM, sufficiency tool to ensure budgets are balanced and realistic. Help team to understand cost of being dark. Digital Media effectiveness With Media Team/CMI Data scientists & external Partners (eg Google, Zenith…) understand best practices to drive improved conversion among different audiences within the varying path to purchase. Develop strong understanding on how to better leverage halo Leverage lessons learnt via MMMs, tracking and success stories to improve our understanding of Halo onto Base Brands  In this full-time role, you will provide Strategic Insights to drive global category management, Brand turn-around and portfolio growth. You will report into the Consumer Beauty Insights & Strategy VP and work hand in hand with the:  CB Global Brand team. Opex & Media Team CB Innovation transformation S. Director, CB Analytics Director and data scientist.  WHAT YOU’LL BRING  To be successful in this role, you will bring solid professional expertise in consumer and market insights, analytics expertise and a strong understanding and application marketing principles and how media works. We are looking for a proven ability to drive strategic insights into business decision making, preferably in a variety of Brands. Experience in Category Management at local/global level, Media planning, Brand plans are appreciated along side strong bias for action and ability to manage diverse stakeholders. Understanding of digital data alongside more traditional Media & Equity KPIs is a plus. You are constructive and collaborate strongly with MFT / vendors to deliver your work. You are able to see opportunities on how to improve current ways of working. You are curious and like to combine data from various sources to understand the full picture.  Key Requirements Bachelor’s Degree preferably in statistics, data science, marketing or business field with prior market research experience 8+ years agency or FMCG experience, preferably including health & wellness, beauty and / or luxury. Must have at least 5+ years client-side experience –understanding of Physical & mental availability drivers and how brand growth. Experience with Category management / category growth story – preferably local Strong understanding of a variety of channel dynamics and Store levers Proven ability to manage complex questions. Strong Commercial sense to and influence successfully & drive action from results. Essential to have a strong understanding of quant techniques and mindset. Knowledge and expertise around digital tools and analytics. Strong understanding of business KPI and translate reality into models with the appropriate support (analyst or vendor) Ability to leverage / integrate existing data sets or develop 80/20 estimates when information is not available Experience of managing budgets and working with suppliers to ensure actionable results, on time, best cost  Skills Thought leadership : You sense when a change in direction in business practices is needed. You set a vision of what can be achieved and have a bias for action. You create an environment where others feel committed to deliver and contribute fully. High level of maturity and Strong communication and presentation skills to interact and influence Senior stakeholders and multi-functional team. Problem-solving techniques ; curious, team player and leader; attention to detail / good project management. You know how to translate complex data into a key take outs with your analytical mindset. Project management : Organized and structured. You know how to bring multiple projects to a successful end in given timeframe. Agility & Passion to drive clarity : You don’t get easily stressed by a fluid environment, on the opposite, you get energized by the opportunity to drive clarity for the team, you are quick to adapt as new information becomes available.  WHAT WE OFFER  Competitive salary + company benefits This is a real opportunity to make an impact. You’ll get to work in a diverse environment with a team who are passionate about the work they do This is an exciting time to join Coty as we embed new ways of working and drive the company transformation.

title: Performance marketeer
summary:
Je hebt 3 - 5 jaar relevante marketing performance werkervaring.
Een B2B marketing professional die als geen ander stuurt op resultaat.
description: Vakmedianet  Dagelijks bereikt Vakmedianet (VMN) meer dan 1,5 miljoen professionals en ondernemers in meer dan 50 branches. We inspireren en informeren deze professionals met diepgaande en specifieke on- en offline content, events, opleidingen en data oplossingen. Daarmee creëren we een blijvende impact in een groot aantal branches, zoals Bouw, Food, Horeca, Logistiek, Facilitair, Automotive, Verzekeringen, HR, Finance, etc. Een aantal van onze belangrijke titels zijn: Distrifood, Cobouw, AM, Logistiek, Vastgoedmarkt en Misset Horeca. Op dit moment genereert VMN haar inkomsten vooral uit abonnementen, events, opleidingen, boeken, advertenties en contentmarketing. Net als de rest van de media-industrie is ook VMN in transitie. In 2021 verwacht VMN ruim 45% van haar omzet uit online- en dataproducten te genereren en het is onze ambitie om dit uit te bouwen naar 65% in 2023.  De uitdaging De afdeling collectieve abonnementen is verantwoordelijk voor de verkoop en implementatie van alle digitale bedrijfsabonnementen (vanaf 5 abonnees) voor de titels van VMN. Vanwege de groei en digitale ambitie van VMN zijn wij voor deze afdeling op zoek naar een talentvolle performance marketeer. Een B2B marketing professional die als geen ander stuurt op resultaat. Iemand met een sterk analytisch inzicht en die weet hoe je op basis van verschillende databronnen en online marketing meer en betere leads voor sales realiseert (SQL’s).  Wat ga jij doen? Je werkt nauw samen met de Sales Manager Collectieve Abonnementen, accountmanagers, uitgevers en product- en titel marketeers om gezamenlijk tot de beste performance marketing aanpak te komen. Op basis van data analyse segmenteer je SQL’s uit onze databronnen voor een effectievere verkoop door onze accountmanagers. Je verhoogt de kwaliteit en kwantiteit voor binnenkomende leads door optimalisering van het bezoek aan en conversie op landingspagina’s. Je realiseert e-mailmarketing campagnes gericht op het aanbieden van een aanvullende dienst die leidt naar een aanvraagformulier. Je voert een leadgeneratie campagne op LinkedIn uit door de inzet van leadforms. Je zet google advertising campagnes in voor de promotie van b.v. een White paper in ruil voor een e-mailadres en andere relevante gegevens. Je creëert dashboards met behulp van ons CRM systeem. Je zet een lead kwalificatie-model op m.b.v. een puntensysteem.  Wat verwachten wij? Je hebt een afgeronde HBO- of WO-opleiding. Je hebt 3 - 5 jaar relevante marketing performance werkervaring. Je hebt gewerkt als conversie specialist, growth marketeer, performance marketeer, growth analytics marketeer, e-commerce specialist, business analyst of iets anders wat hierop lijkt. Je hebt kennis van en ervaring met Google analytics, SEO & SEA, Social marketing, online advertising, tag-management en A/B testing. Je bent niet bang om ambitieuze targets te stellen en jezelf en anderen daaraan te houden.  Wat bieden wij? Een afwisselende baan in een energiek en groeiend commercieel team met volop ruimte voor ontwikkeling en het realiseren van je ambities. Fulltime werkweek van 37,5 uur. Marktconform salaris en een uitstekende pensioenvoorziening. En niet te vergeten leuke extra’s zoals (digitale) borrels en dart- & tafeltennis faciliteiten. In de zomer van dit jaar verhuizen wij naar een mooi nieuw kantoor in de regio Utrecht.  Je bent overtuigd! Solliciteer via de website en stuur je sollicitatie met CV en motivatie in t.a.v. Ad Heijblok, HR-manager. Voor meer informatie over deze vacature kun je contact opnemen met Jessica Hellingman (sales manager) via email Jessicahellingman@vakmedianet.nl .

title: Internship Quantitative Analyst - ABS Advisory
summary:
Creating research reports and marketing materials.
We offer a steep learning curve and the opportunity to work closely with the analysts and portfolio managers.
description: Are you interested in alternative fixed income and financial markets? If yes, then we want to hear from you  Internship  LoanClear is looking for an intern to join our fast-growing team at the Amsterdam office. We offer a steep learning curve and the opportunity to work closely with the analysts and portfolio managers. The position focuses on various projects including working on current clients' complex asset and portfolio valuations, running models and scenarios, preparing pitch presentations, etc. We are looking for naturally curious people with a genuine passion for financial markets and the ability to independently solve new problems. We offer a dynamic and challenging environment with a lot of freedom to define your work.  Responsibilities of the role are:  Analysing whole loan pools and asset backed securities under various macro and micro scenarios based on market and fundamental inputs Develop and maintain quantitative models Creating research reports and marketing materials Supporting the operations of the team  Requirements:  Currently studying towards your master's degree in Quantitative Finance, Econometric, Economics or similar fields Candidates should have a valid work permit to work in the Netherlands/studying in the Netherlands and permitted to start an internship Strong analytical skills An independent mindset capable of challenging viewpoints Experience with Excel, including VBA Strong interest in financial markets Excellent oral and written communication skills in English  About us  Launched in June 2016, LoanClear is an innovative fintech company based in Amsterdam and is on a mission to facilitate a better match between savings and credit for a more prosperous society. LoanClear brings together investors and loan originators on a global scale and works to analyse and provide insights on hundreds of millions of records to help investors make the right investment decisions and to manage and monitor their investment portfolios. LoanClear also provides investor services on asset backed securities and granular loan portfolios for institutional investors and provides a marketplace for loan portfolios. LoanClear is an independent company within Dynamic Credit Group (DCG). DCG was founded in 2003 in New York and has offices in Amsterdam, New York and Jakarta. Other business units of DCG are Asset Management, Direct Lending Netherlands and Direct Lending Indonesia.  What do we offer?  Internship allowance, travel allowance (depending on travel distance) Great colleagues, informal, international, and fun atmosphere Company lunches on Friday, monthly drinks, and fun team events throughout the year. During COVID we organise online events.  For more information please contact Iram Shah at ishah@dynamiccredit.com

title: Data Scientist
summary:
Je hebt interesse in marketing en media.
Je zult verantwoordelijk worden voor het correct en accuraat beantwoorden van (internationale) marketing vraagstukken.
description: Als onafhankelijk onderzoeks- en consultingbureau zijn we bij MeMo² continu bezig om marketing vraagstukken voor onze opdrachtgevers op te lossen. We doen dit door het meten, kwantificeren en optimaliseren van reclame-effecten. Met onze innovatieve onderzoeksproducten zijn we in staat reclame campagnes en commerciële bedrijfsprocessen te verbeteren. MeMo² is in 2019 als onderzoeksbureau van het jaar verkozen (MOA Awards) en heeft verschillende internationale prijzen behaald. Dit jaar (2020) zijn we met onze nieuwste innovatie de THX. app zeven keer in de prijzen gevallen, voor onder andere de beste mediaresearch (AMMA Awards). Als Data Scientist zal je binnen MeMo² verantwoordelijk worden voor (internationale) marketing intelligence projecten. Dit houdt in dat je je bezig zult houden met vraagstukken als ‘in hoeverre draagt een crossmediale campagne bij aan de naamsbekendheid van een merk?’, ‘wat is de invloed van een video advertentie via YouTube op de koopintentie van consumenten?’ en ‘hoeveel conversies voorspellen we voor de komende vier weken aan de hand van ons statistische modellen?’. Je zult daarnaast ook uitgedaagd worden om te innoveren op het gebied van (complexere) statistische analyses. Is de huidige manier waarop we effecten in kaart brengen nog steeds de beste? En hoe kunnen we het beste inspelen op behoeftes vanuit onze klanten? Beschrijving Je zult verantwoordelijk worden voor het correct en accuraat beantwoorden van (internationale) marketing vraagstukken. Je bent één van de voortrekkers om de huidige vraagstukken vanuit een statistisch oogpunt te benaderen. In jouw rol zul je de onderzoeksvraag concreet moeten formuleren, inzicht hebben in welke beschikbare data nodig is om de vragen te beantwoorden om vervolgens op zoek te gaan naar de juiste tools en modellen om deze vraagstukken voor de klant op de juiste manier te kunnen beantwoorden. Je krijgt de kans om je opgedane kennis op het gebied van marketing, media en modellering in te zetten om strategische vraagstukken voor (internationale) klanten te beantwoorden. Naast het beantwoorden van de vraagstukken vanuit klanten zal je aan de slag gaan met business intelligence tools, ontwikkeling van nieuwe MeMo² tools en maak je jouw collega’s enthousiast over al deze nieuwe methodieken en uitkomsten. Wij bieden jou: Een unieke kans in een succesvol bedrijf met veel young-professionals Een diverse rol met veel doorgroeimogelijkheden, waarbij je veel ruimte krijgt om jezelf te ontwikkelen De kans om met grote (internationale) klanten te werken Een eerste klas lunch en lekkere koffie Een salaris waar je blij van wordt Gunstige pensioenregeling 25 vakantiedagen per jaar Wat we van jou verwachten: WO werk- en denkniveau met een relevante studie, bijvoorbeeld: Marketing Intelligence, Econometrie, Computer Science, of (Toegepaste) Wiskunde Je hebt 1 tot 3 jaar relevante werkervaring, als data scientist of data analist in vergelijkbaar werkveld Het samenwerken in een team gaat jou goed af, maar je bent ook in staat om zelfstandig aan het werk te gaan Pro-actieve, ondernemende houding. Je wilt jezelf vastbijten in huidige en nieuwe mogelijkheden van modellering en machine learning Vloeiende beheersing van de Nederlandse en Engelse taal in woord en geschrift Ervaring met R, Python, SQL en Excel Pre: Photoshop, Microsoft PowerBI, Javascript, PhP Waar je jezelf in terug moet zien: Je vindt het leuk om strategische vraagstukken op te lossen en deze resultaten te presenteren bij de klant Je hebt interesse in marketing en media Je bent initiatiefrijk en ambitieus Je houdt van een borrel op zijn tijd (elke vrijdag wordt een drankje gedaan) Experimenteren met nieuwe datatechnieken om vragen te kunnen beantwoorden of om nieuwe tools te ontwikkelen Je woont in/in de buurt van Groningen

title: paid social executive
summary:
Pre: Certified Facebook Blueprint marketing associate or higher.
We are the only independent online performance marketing agency that operates worldwide.
description: Who we are Artefact is a new generation of a data service provider, specializing in data consulting and data-driven digital marketing, dedicated to transforming data into business impact across the entire value chain of organizations. We are proud to say we're enjoying skyrocketing growth. Our broad range of data-driven solutions in data consulting and digital marketing are designed to meet our clients' specific needs, always conceived with a business-centric approach, and delivered with tangible results. Our data-driven services are built upon the deep AI expertise we've acquired with our 1000+ client base around the globe. We have 700+ employees across 16 offices who are focused on accelerating digital transformation. Thanks to a unique mix of company assets: State of the art data technologies, lean AI agile methodologies for fast delivery, and cohesive teams of the finest business consultants, data analysts, data scientists, data engineers, and digital experts, all dedicated to bringing extra value to every client.  The Role You will be part of the paid social team and focus on the day-to-day running of paid social marketing campaigns across a range of clients and markets, delivering exceptional performance on sales and/or branding goals. You will work together with our data analytics team to provide high standards of tracking & tagging campaigns. You will research and prepare analysis, undertake paid social delivery work and liaise with clients, third party suppliers and internal teams to ensure optimal delivery, account development, and the strengthening of client relationships. Next to that, you work together with the other media specialists (programmatic, SEA, SEO, and marketplaces) to deliver data-driven results for our clients. General responsibilities Support the team with the day-to-day running of paid social marketing campaigns with a focus on Facebook advertising Understand and explain the role of social media advertising to reach the business objectives for our clients Take responsibility for key areas of paid social delivery assigned to you by members of the team Carry out research for existing projects and for new business Research and prepare reports, budgets, presentations, analysis, and campaign delivery Coordinate with internal project teams and third-party suppliers Take on ad-hoc tasks as required Paid social responsibilities Traffic, implement, and optimize social ad campaigns. Troubleshoot issues with campaigns, creative, and implementations as they arise Create social ad campaigns for any vertical and strategy (branding, prospecting, retargeting) Take an analytical approach to interpret data to adjust our strategy Work with your colleagues to optimize campaigns and maximize performance across common KPI's – ROI, CPA, COS, Revenue, Clicks, Impressions and Reach Align with media partners on campaign implementations, including using their ad servers, as necessary Own and manage in house reporting tool to retrieve data for campaign delivery analysis and optimization recommendations Develop and build out the relationship with the client: providing accurate reporting, present results, providing advice, and build performance-oriented paid social campaigns with a strong focus on quality and deadlines Who are you? 1+ year experience in a paid social environment Academic and working ability at the higher professional education level (HBO) or higher Entrepreneurial, engaged, flexible and data-driven mindset Ability to multi-task in a fast-moving environment Excellent attention to detail Demonstrate knowledge in Paid Social ads platform: Facebook Business Manager Pre: Certified Facebook Blueprint marketing associate or higher Good understanding of site-centric tools (Google Analytics preferred) Strong skills in spreadsheets (Excel/sheets) and creating presentations Great communication skills Ability to work full time Fluency in Dutch and English is required What do we offer? Attractive benefits package The chance to work in a diverse and growing team The opportunity for professional and personal growth and development Excellent (international) career opportunities The opportunity to work with major advertisers and brands on a national and international level Fun colleagues and an informal and open atmosphere A great office in the heart of Utrecht (Stationsplein) Fun activities, such as drinks and excursions A full lunch, fresh fruit and great coffee daily What makes us unique? We have experienced colleagues from the Netherlands and abroad. We achieve our ambitions together We are the only independent online performance marketing agency that operates worldwide We are growing fast: at Artefact Benelux, aspirations and fun go hand in hand

title: Digital Experience Discovery Analyst
summary: Be an active member in a wide range of projects and topics such as analytics implementation, database integration, marketing attribution, tag management,…
description: Purpose: As a Digital Experience Discovery Analyst at adidas you deliver cutting-edge analytics services to stakeholders, enabling them to make fact-based decisions. Based on defined data sources, you generate insights that help adidas better understand the consumer, expand reach, increase customer engagement and advocacy and ultimately drive sales. You are part of a team that informs the adidas digital strategy and provides the factual basis for future consumer experiences and site development.  Key Accountabilities: Analytics  Deliver analytics services by collecting, tracking, mining and analyzing data and generating fact-based insights. Support wider teams to increase reach, engagement, buy and advocacy and inform of company strategy. Provide analytics services to stakeholders, using one or several data sources. Be an active member in a wide range of projects and topics such as analytics implementation, database integration, marketing attribution, tag management, qualitative data, etc. Monitor and evaluate the implementation of the analytics toolset, ensuring the consistency of data quality. Consulting  Collaborate with stakeholders, supporting them in defining goals, selecting appropriate KPIs, monitoring performance and derive trends and opportunities. Provide stakeholders with actionable recommendations and calls for action based on your gathered insights. Translate gathered insights into engaging, actionable and easy to digest insights presentations. Maintain a strong stakeholder network with high level of trust that facilitates action-ability of insights. Implement and use data driven decision processes, in line with a fact-based decision culture.  Reporting  Implement new reporting structures or support existing structures. Develop best practice guidance and provide them to markets in your scope of responsibility and other adidas stakeholders to maximize the use of analytics capabilities.  Innovation  Build an internal and external network to keep up with the latest trends and technological advances.  Requirements: Education & Professional Experience University degree in the field of Business or equivalent 5+ years of experience in Digital Analytics Experience in eCommerce environment is a plus Soft-Skills Ability to deliver data-based recommendations Strong communication skills, comfortable presenting complex topics to stakeholders at various organizational levels both in person and remotely Strong presentation skills and story-telling Hard-Skills Advanced experience with web-analytics tools and disciplines (adobe analytics, GA). Experience with advanced analytics tools and disciplines is a big plus (SQL, Python, R). Proven project management skills, including the ability lead projects or work on several projects simultaneously. Fluent English both verbally and written

title: Manager Manufacturing Analytics
summary:
Everyone knows Vistaprint for its business cards.
But what many people don’t know is that we print much more than that.
This is a site of approx.
