description: Everyone knows Vistaprint for its business cards. But what many people don’t know is that we print much more than that. We print (almost) everything that can be printed: business cards, posters, mugs, window stickers, flyers, cards, photo gifts, phone cases and much more. And it all takes place in Venlo at our European automated production facility! This is a site of approx. 31,500 m2 where around 500 employees work with nothing but modern, high-tech machines and the latest technology.  For our Data & Analytics (D&A) department in Venlo we are currently looking for a Manager Manufacturing Analytics (1 FTE)  Venlo Analytics provides analytical and reporting support for all aspects of our internal fulfillment operations, including production, quality, logistics, & supply chain management areas. Through close partnership with Vistaprint operations teams, we aim to create, build and bring value to our customers while achieving our financial operating goals for the company.  Your role will involve: Managing the Manufacturing & Supply Chain Analytics practice in Venlo. With support coverage for all departments in Venlo, you will be tasked with driving exceptional customer service and operational efficiency through development of our core data, analytics, and reporting systems. You will do this in strong partnership with Venlo Leadership and global stakeholders in Manufacturing Software, Marketing, Finance and the central D&A team. As Analytics Manager, you will manage the D&A team in Venlo, which consists of several Manufacturing, Quality, and Logistics Analysts.  Your role will also involve the following: Leadership of the Venlo Analytics team. Continuously develop and grow our analytical talent through coaching, mentorship, and day-to-day management of all team deliverables supporting the business. Ownership for Venlo Manufacturing KPIs, enabling identification of opportunities for continuous improvement. Provide analytical insights to highlight problems and offer solutions based on data, and coordinate standards and logic with central Data and Analytics (DNA) Data Product teams. Manage global interactions with software development teams to represent Venlo manufacturing systems requirements. Participate in global initiatives, communicate operational impacts of intended changes and develop solutions for increased local functionality. Provide technical guidance and support on analytics best practices with respect to our data products and technologies (Data Management, SQL, R, Python, Tableau, Looker)  We are looking for someone with A Bachelor or higher qualification in analytics, computer science, engineering, or other related disciplines >3 years of experience in a manager role, preferably in a manufacturing or operations environment Demonstrated proficiency in the operational analytics and data best practices Demonstrated proficiency in production systems and working in complex environments Proven ability to support strategic evaluations and communicate findings to executive audiences Experience managing local and global relationships and being a team advocate for initiative support Advanced knowledge of SQL and familiarity with databases including Microsoft SQL Server and Snowflake. Advanced knowledge of data manipulation and visualizations tools such as Microsoft SSRS, Tableau and Looker Demonstrated leadership with an affinity for developing high-performing teams Deep systems-thinker with a track-record for using structured learning to solve complex problems Excellent written and communication skills High level organisational and interpersonal skills Excellent time management skills and ability to multi-task and prioritise work  What’s in it for you? Vistaprint is an organization that is constantly developing thanks to her growth. By using the latest machines and technologies we can continue to guarantee this growth. This means that our employees are also developing and growing. You will be working in an organization with many different development opportunities. Although we are a global organization, our corporate culture is informal and accessible. The door is open for everyone.  Here at Vistaprint we believe in our 6 cultural behaviors: ✓ We are authentic ✓ We continuously learn and adapt ✓ We operate with our hearts and our heads ✓ We co-create solutions ✓ We act like owners ✓ We hold the bar high  We have good working conditions and benefits/perks, including: Flexible working hours (between 7 AM and 7 PM) Possibility to work from home Travel allowance Pension Plan 28 vacation days per year ‘The Break Award Program’: a two week break after every fifth continuous year that you have been under employment. The possibility to purchase 5 extra vacation days per year. A lot of growth and develop opportunities  We are looking for the best talent no matter what your rass, gender, race, religion, nationality, background, age and sexual orientation is.  Interested? Click to apply directly! If you have any questions, please contact our Recruiter Cemre Hayirli ; careersvenlo@vistaprint.com or 0031 6 28 56 56 40  More information about our organization can be found at: www.vistaprint.nl #LI-CH1

title: Data Analyst
summary: As the company’s main Data Analyst you’ll be working alongside game developers, product owners and marketing specialists.
description: This fast-growing scaleup in the gaming industry are now building out their data team. The company operate in the hybrid casual and midcourse space, self-publish, and can successfully count 250 million downloads in their portfolio. They have an informal culture where ideas are free to be shared, and are highly customer focussed.  Industry: Gaming Tech  What to expect: As the company’s main Data Analyst you’ll be working alongside game developers, product owners and marketing specialists. Put yourself in the mindset of the player’s behaviour, establish KPIs in the company and build data solutions to cross-functional problems. You will also present your statistical work back to the business via visualisations and effectively tell the story of data.  Perks: Flat hierarchy and easy-going culture working on diverse projects across a booming industry (particularly during Covid). Good benefits package including flexible working, extra holidays and training budget. Entertaining office atmosphere with, unsurprisingly, plenty of games around.  Requirements: Their current data stack includes Python, SQL, GCP, Looker, Firebase, Amplitude, Appsflyer. Ability to operate autonomously and take responsibility over analytics projects company-wide, interacting with C level. Nice to haves include maintaining some data engineering capabilities and previous gaming industry experience. Real user and customer focus when defining business problems and their relevant data solutions.

title: Data Engineer
summary: Collaborate with product managers and analysts throughout the company to deliver reliable data that powers actionable insights.
description: Data Engineer (Remote)  At Docker, we simplify the lives of millions of developers who are making world-changing apps. Docker helps developers bring their ideas to reality by conquering the complexity of app development. We simplify and accelerate workflows with an integrated development pipeline and application components. A fast-growing startup, Docker offers a dynamic work environment.  The Products Team at Docker is looking for a Data Engineer to help transform billions of data points generated from the Docker product and services ecosystem into actionable insights to directly influence product strategy and development. You'll leverage both software engineering and analytics skills as part of the team responsible for managing data pipelines across the company: sales, marketing, finance, HR, customer support, engineering, and product development.  In this critical role, you'll help design and implement event ingestion, data models, and ETL processes that support mission-critical reporting and analysis. You'll work together with other data engineers, analysts, product managers, and subject matter experts to deliver impactful outcomes to the organization. You'll participate in high-visibility projects and directly influence product development. As the company grows, ensuring reliable data flows to all business units and surfacing insights and analytics is a huge and exciting challenge!  Responsibilities: Implement, document, oversee and evolve the Snowflake and ETL infrastructure Maintain the integrity of data within our data pipeline and warehouse Ensure quality of data and completeness of event logging across Docker codebase Integrate data from 3rd party services via ETL tools and custom pipelines Develop ETL jobs and tests to process, validate, transport, collate, aggregate, and distribute data Transform raw event logs into higher-order tables to make existing analysis easier and new analysis possible Creating automated reporting of weekly and monthly metrics and ROI for the executive management team and board Integrate emerging methodology, technology, and version control practices that best fit the team. Design, build and automate business metrics into self-serve dashboards via Looker Collaborate with product managers and analysts throughout the company to deliver reliable data that powers actionable insights Champion a data-informed mindset within our culture Qualifications: 2+ years of relevant industry experience Familiarity with data warehousing concepts including data model design and query optimization strategies Experience using and maintaining BI visualization tools such as (but not limited to) Looker, Tableau, or Power BI. Creating production-ready ETL scripts with Python and SQL Experience with version control systems such as Github, Gitlab, Bitbucket etc. Experience automating business and reporting processes Experience using data analysis and/or statistics to inform decisions Strong verbal and written communication skills Preferred Qualifications: BS/MS in Computer Science, Math, Physics, or other technical fields At least 6 months of experience with Looker and LookML Proficiency in building data pipelines leveraging Docker and orchestration frameworks such as Jenkins/Airflow/Luigi Experience designing and deploying high-performance systems with reliable monitoring and logging practices Proficiency working with a Data Warehouse platform (e.g. Snowflake, Redshift, BigQuery, AWS Athena, or Spectrum) Experience using data collection platforms such as Segment, RudderStack, Fivetran etc. Familiarity with at least one cloud ecosystem: AWS/Azure Infrastructure/Google Cloud Experience of working in an agile environment and using tools such as JIRA/Asana/Trello What's most important is that you're quick on your feet, meticulous, and excited to take on new challenges! You can tackle an ambiguous assignment and derive valuable insight. You use multiple tools and methods to find solutions, and couple that with intuition and quick tests to prioritize how to unravel complicated problems.  #LI-REMOTE

title: Senior Staff Product Manager
summary:
Represent platform security for industry analyst responses.
Influence product marketing teams to provide direction for product positioning, messaging and…
description: Job Title: Product Manager  Company Work matters. It’s where we spend a third of our lives. And the workplace of the future is going to be a great place. We’re dedicated to bringing that to life for people everywhere. That’s why we put people at the heart of everything we do.  People matter. Our people have a passion for learning, building, and innovating. Whether you’re an engineer, a sales professional, a finance professional, or anything in-between, our roles aim to provide each person with meaningful impact and plenty of space to grow. Team The Platform Outbound Product Management team is passionate about evangelization and ecosystem enablement. We are where the ServiceNow technology meets the customer to help drive customer adoption, understanding, and ultimately innovation with Platform solutions.  Role In this role you have key responsibilities related to supporting and enabling a high impact set of emerging Security solutions for the Now Platform. These responsibilities allow for cross functional workload with daily interactions with Customers, Prospects, Sales, Marketing, Product Management, Services, Support, Licensing, and Engineering. What you get to do in this role: Educate You will be both the internal and customer-facing Subject Matter Expert on Security emerging products. This requires the interest and willingness to be constantly learning the cybersecurity space and its intersection with industry standards organizations and regulated markets. With this combined proficiency and set of soft skills you will be able to simplify and articulate the products’ complexities for all audiences. Evangelize, enable, and energize core sales, solutions consulting and peer product specialist sales teams on platform security solutions. Sales Success You will be on the leading edge of establishing the go to market strategy and motion by collaborating with Inbound Product Management and Product Marketing to understand sales motions and value propositions. You will use those concepts to be the main coordinator and contributor of enablement content across multiple customer-facing teams to ensure the go to market motions are successful. You will support our internal go to market teams in their pursuit of deals related to our emerging Security products. Represent platform security for industry analyst responses. Inform and collaborate on pricing/packaging strategy for optimal user conversions across product packages. Influence product marketing teams to provide direction for product positioning, messaging and enablement that is both internal and public facing. Product Success You will be responsible for helping our early adopting customers achieve value from our emerging Security solutions. You will establish a series of customer success stories that can be published to help jump-start the reference engine for our emerging Security solutions. Be the voice of the customer, partner and sellers to establish oneself as the trusted advisor on platform security solution matters Customer Support – You will be working closely with customer support to ensure customer matters are adequately resolved to yield high customer satisfaction. Enable At Scale You will be a key contributor for establishing the emerging Security products Implementation best practices to yield optimal customer outcomes. You will be responsible for establishing repeatable action plans to drive customer focused outcomes to challenges related to current and emerging Security products, from activation to implementation to adoption and success, migrations and product end-of-life/support. Identify inefficiencies and new opportunities to improve business growth metrics.  In order to be successful in this role, we need someone who has: 6 to 8 years of relevant outbound product management experience in a fast paced, high growth agile SaaS environment 5+ years experience with cloud security technology and its design, application, and implementation Experience with security governance/regulations pertaining to the financial industry The ability to make trade-off decisions between possible and desirable, which requires a good sense of what is technically feasible Experience with delivering product presentations to large audiences Proven ability to execute to plan and getting things done Strong verbal and visual communication skills Exceptional problem-solving skill Enjoys working in a highly collaborative environment CISSP certification recommended but not required

title: Reporting Specialist
summary:
Van productie tot marketing; je vindt het bij Greetz allemaal onder één dak in Amsterdam.
Het Finance team bij Greetz breidt uit met diverse specialisten op dit…
description: Het Finance team bij Greetz breidt uit met diverse specialisten op dit moment. Dit komt grotendeels doordat we sterk groeien met de organisatie en ook dat we met de Moonpig Group sinds een maand beursgenoteerd zijn. Naast deze positie zijn we op zoek naar meerdere specialisten op het gebied van Reporting en FP&A. Wij zoeken een Reporting Specialist / Analyst binnen onze financiële afdeling. In deze rol ben je verantwoordelijk om de diverse stakeholders te voorzien van adequate en juiste informatie. Dit bevat zowel interne als externe rapportages. Voorbeelden van de interne rapportages zijn oa: maandelijkse balans, P&L, cash flow overzichten en consolidatie richting moedermaatschappij, interne maandrapportages naar onder andere commercie, management en IT zodat deze inzicht hebben in de maandelijkse performance en op basis hiervan kunnen bijsturen en beslissingen kunnen maken. Externe verslaggevingen zoals belasting aangiftes, CBS opgaves en jaarverslaggeving behoren ook tot je takenpakket. Je rapporteert in deze rol aan de Head of Accounting & Reporting. Het totale team bestaat zo uit een 5 ambitieuze en ook gezellige collega’s.  De functie als Reporting Specialist kent veel dynamiek en mooie uitdagingen. Maar wat hoort nou allemaal tot jouw takenpakket? Beheren van de interne rapportages en deze op tijd en accuraat uitsturen naar de diverse stakeholders Interne rapportages richting de moedermaatschappij waaronder consolidatie in Cognos en het opstellen van diverse presentaties Bewaken van internal control framework Externe verslaggeving van het jaarverslag Diverse externe rapportages en opgaves waaronder: Belastingdienst, CBS, Afvalfonds Verpakking Deadlines bewaken en escaleren waar nodig  Je bent HBO/WO opgeleid in een bedrijfseconomische richting; Je hebt minimaal 5-7 jaar werkervaring in een audit rol met daarnaast ervaring in het commerciële bedrijfsleven. Kennis en ervaring met IFRS en RJ Je werkt accuraat Ervaring met systemen zoals Exact/SAP en Cognos is een pre Ervaring met Excel Vloeiend in Engels en Nederlands Je bent zelfsturend, een doordenker en pro-actief  Greetz Met ruim 3 miljoen klanten is Greetz van Nederlands marktleider in online echte wenskaarten uitgegroeid tot hét online platform voor persoonlijke verrassingen zoals bloemen, ballonnen, fotocadeaus en kaarten. Van productie tot marketing; je vindt het bij Greetz allemaal onder één dak in Amsterdam. Met een team van ruim 160 gedreven en enthousiaste mensen werken we hard aan de groei van Greetz. Want wat je ook stuurt via Greetz; het eindresultaat is altijd een glimlach. En daar krijgen we nooit genoeg van. Greetz in NL en Moonpig in de UK vormen samen de Moonpig Group. De Moonpig Group is sinds februari 2021 beursgenoteerd in Londen (London Stock Exchange LSE).  Solliciteren Om jouw interesse kenbaar te maken voor deze functie graag online reageren via onderstaande button. Goed om te weten dat een case study en het afleggen van een capaciteitentest onderdeel is van deze procedure.  Aanbod We bieden een uitdagende functie in een nieuw team binnen Greetz. Gezien het vaarwater waarin de organisatie zich nu in bevindt ontbreekt het aan uitdaging en dynamiek niet. Verder krijg je een jaarcontract, een bonuselement van het jaarsalaris, reiskostenvergoeding, telefoon & thuiswerkvergoeding, toegang tot onze Online Academy en een pensioenbijdrage van 70%.  Thuiswerken Op dit moment werken het kantoorpersoneel van Greetz volledig van huis volgens de richtlijnen van de overheid. We werken aan een nieuw werkbeleid voor post-Covid waar thuiswerken een onderdeel van zal blijven zijn.  Acquisitie naar aanleiding van deze vacature stellen wij niet op prijs, wij hebben al de keuze gemaakt hoe wij deze werving aanpakken en we zullen hiernaast geen extra partij of bureau verder aanhaken.

title: Business Analyst
summary:
Appnovation Nederland is op zoek naar een ambitieuze business analist!
Facilitate communications between a wide range of individuals – creative / business /…
description: Appnovation helps brands thrive through innovative, people-inspired experiences and solutions. By embracing the powerful combination of technology and agility, we seamlessly integrate strategy, experience, design, development and analytics. We create standout digital experiences by collaborating with brands to understand the individual challenges and goals for every initiative. Focusing on our clients' customers, we effectively combine empathy, evidence and real-world insight so that solutions are derived from truth and meaning. Appnovation is an award-winning team dedicated to inspiring possibility. Working closely with project stakeholders, you will define the business requirements and functional specifications on each project. Excellence in customer service, along with a dedicated proactive attitude, is an essential component of this role. Our goal is to achieve a true balance between quality, client satisfaction, efficiency, success and profitability. YOU WILL HAVE AN OPPORTUNITY TO: Work with Account managers and Project Managers to determine the approach, deliverables and estimated effort necessary for the business analysis activities. Elicit client's requirements through various techniques such as interviews, workshops, document analysis, brainstorming exercises etc. Work within an agile environment, leading backlog grooming and sprint planning, estimations and story creation for Agile projects, including translating requirements into specifications in the form of Epics and Stories. Work in an international team, across projects. Provide professional client-facing documentation with excellence in version control. Facilitate communications between a wide range of individuals – creative / business / technical with various levels and departments within the customer's organization - executives / IT / marketing / customer service. Use other methods if required to support the requirements such as use cases, process diagrams and wireframes using industry standard software applications. Assist project manager to establish project scope & facilitate requirement clarifications, collaborating with the development team to troubleshoot problems/roadblocks throughout the development cycle. Interact with tech leads to align functional and technical requirements. Build and maintain good strong relationships with clients and stakeholders and act as a proxy for the client to the development teams. Provide client training when needed for areas such as for content administration or other utility functions developed for the client. WHO YOU ARE: The ideal candidate is expected to have proven experience in business analysis. You are comfortable collecting technical requirements and creating user stories for technical interfaces. Experience using JIRA 2+ years of BA experience, in Enterprise Web-Application, Website or Mobile Projects. You have a Bachelor degree in Computer Science, Business Management, related field or extensive work experience equivalent. You use these terms in everyday language – requirements, stakeholders, user stories, wireframes, process and user experience. Client facing background and experience partnering with multiple stakeholders is an absolute must have. Experience in organizing and presenting complex information in simple visual models Solid experience working with teams. Experience working in an agency or IT professional services environment. You're passionate about keeping up to date with the latest trends in technology, web and new media and improves domain knowledge through continual professional development. A proficient Dutch speaker WHAT DOES APPNOVATION HAVE TO OFFER? Competitive salary and vacation days Company pension Rocketing growth – yours and ours. Lots of opportunity for personal and professional growth. We are a culture of internal promotions A healthy working environment like a sit and standing desk, laptop stand and a large second screen, and our annual sports day A working environment in which there is a lot of attention for quality, help from others, learning at work Yearly fitness allowance Health benefits package Travel/commute allowance Home office allowance Nederlands Zit je vast in je huidige werk of werkomgeving? Wil je elke dag meer leren en deel uitmaken van een team met ambitie? Ben je toe aan een nieuwe uitdaging in een internationale omgeving? Appnovation Nederland is op zoek naar een ambitieuze business analist! Appnovation helpt merken te groeien door innovatieve, door mensen geïnspireerde ervaringen en oplossingen. Door de krachtige combinatie van technologie en flexibiliteit te omarmen, integreren we strategie, ervaring, design, ontwikkeling en analytics. We creëren opvallende digitale ervaringen door samen te werken met merken om de individuele uitdagingen en doelstellingen voor elk initiatief te begrijpen. Door ons te richten op de klanten van onze klanten, combineren we empathie, bewijs en inzicht in de echte wereld, zodat oplossingen worden afgeleid van waarheid en betekenis. Appnovation is een bedrijf dat zich inzet voor inspirerende mogelijkheden. In nauwe samenwerking met project stakeholders, definieer je de business requirements en functionele specificaties voor elk project. Uitmuntendheid in klantenservice, samen met een toegewijde proactieve houding, is een essentieel onderdeel voor deze rol. Ons doel is om een echte balans te bereiken tussen kwaliteit, klanttevredenheid, efficiëntie, succes en winstgevendheid. JE KRIJGT MOGELIJKHEDEN OM: Samen te werken met de Client Service Managers en Project Managers om de aanpak, deliverables en geschatte inspanning die nodig is voor de business analyse activiteiten te bepalen. De eisen van de klant te ontrafelen door middel van verschillende technieken, zoals interviews, workshops, documentanalyse, brainstormingoefeningen, enz. Te werken binnen een agile omgeving, leiding te geven aan backlog grooming en sprintplanning, schattingen en story creatie te maken voor Agile projecten, inclusief het vertalen van requirements naar specificaties in de vorm van Epics en Stories. Te zorgen voor professionele client-facing documentatie met uitmuntendheid in versiebeheer. Communicatie te faciliteren tussen een breed scala aan personen - creatief / zakelijk / technisch met verschillende niveaus en afdelingen binnen de organisatie van de klant - leidinggevenden / IT / marketing / customer service. Andere methoden te gebruiken indien nodig om de eisen te ondersteunen, zoals use cases, procesdiagrammen en wireframes met behulp van industrie standaard software applicaties. Interactie te zoeken met tech leads om functionele en technische eisen op elkaar af te stemmen. De projectmanager te ondersteunen om de scope van het project vast te stellen en om requirements te verduidelijken, Samen te werken met het ontwikkelingsteam om problemen/wegversperringen op te lossen gedurende de gehele ontwikkelingscyclus. Goede relaties te bouwen en onderhouden met klanten en stakeholders en op te treden als vertegenwoordiger van de klant naar de ontwikkelteams. WIE BEN JIJ? Van de ideale kandidaat wordt verwacht dat hij/zij aantoonbare ervaring heeft met business analyse. Comfortabel met het verzamelen van functionele eisen en het creëren van user stories. Ervaring met het gebruik van JIRA of vergelijkbaar ticketsysteem. 2+ jaar BA ervaring, in webapplicaties, websites of mobile apps. Je hebt een Bachelor diploma in Informatica, Business Management, aanverwante richting of gelijkwaardige werkervaring. Je gebruikt de volgende termen in dagelijks taalgebruik - requirements, stakeholders, user stories, wireframes, proces en user experience. Een klantgerichte achtergrond en ervaring met het samenwerken met meerdere stakeholders is een absolute must. Ervaring in het organiseren en presenteren van complexe informatie in eenvoudige visuele modellen Ervaring met het werken met teams. Ervaring met het werken in een agency of IT omgeving. Je bent gedreven om op de hoogte te blijven van de laatste trends in technologie, web en nieuwe media en verbetert je domeinkennis door voortdurende professionele ontwikkeling. WAT BIEDEN WE JOU? Door bij ons te komen werken, word je onderdeel van een snel groeiend internationaal bedrijf met grote ambities en geweldige collega's. Naast het werk dat we voor onze klanten doen, zijn we trots op onze open, diverse en inclusieve bedrijfscultuur. Wij geloven in openheid, oprechtheid en professionaliteit, richting onze klanten en collega's. Naast onze uitdagende projecten en onze familiaire werkomgeving bieden we uitstekende secundaire arbeidsvoorwaarden, waaronder: Concurrerend salaris en vakantiedagen. Bedrijfspensioen. Een gezonde werkomgeving zoals een zit- en stabureau, laptopstandaard en een groot tweede scherm, en onze jaarlijkse sportdag. Een werkomgeving waarin veel aandacht is voor kwaliteit, hulp van anderen en leren op het werk. Een explosieve groei - van jou en van ons. Veel mogelijkheden voor persoonlijke en professionele groei. We zijn een cultuur van interne promoties. Fitness-vergoeding. Reis-/ woon-werkvergoeding. Thank you for your interest in a career with Appnovation Technologies! Please note that only those selected for an interview will be contacted. Appnovation is an equal opportunity employer and committed to diversity and inclusion. We encourage applications from all qualified candidates and accommodations are available upon request throughout the recruitment process.

title: Commercial Analyst
summary: My client is a leading global developer, manufacturer and marketer of innovative medical technology and consumables used for the diagnosis and treatment of…
description: About Our Client My client is a leading global developer, manufacturer and marketer of innovative medical technology and consumables used for the diagnosis and treatment of pelvic health in the Urology, Gynecology, and Colorectal fields as well as gastrointestinal procedures. Job Description * Creating sales analytics using dashboards (Power BI) to understand the business in greater detail and ensuring the commercial team have granular targets that are consistent with the group's strategy. * Support the Commercial team to provide insights into the business and establish, implement and contribute to the achievement of commercial objectives. * Maintain and Update CRM tool and regular training and support of the commercial team as needed. * Maintain and improve existing commercial reporting on Power BI. * Work closely with Sales, Operations, Marketing to understand and challenge product sales forecast (including understanding all inputs and assumptions). * Involve Director of Finance Europe and other team members in areas of complexity, risk mitigation and strategic importance. * Lead continuous improvement of Commercial and financial tools, business models, Commercial planning, and processes that can scale with the company's growth. * Budget preparation and tracking of actuals vs budget by product line, business units and regions. * Prepare monthly forecast updates by region. * Track and support Finance KPI to management/board presentations. * Responsible for preparation and tracking of Opex budgets as well as analysis deployed to budget owners. * Analysis of gross margin by product - mix tracking. * Support the Director of Finance in ad-hoc Corporate analysis as needed Great Opportunity Exciting work place The Successful Applicant * BS/BA in Accounting, Finance or related field. * Highly proficient in excel and Power BI. * 2+ years in progressive commercial roles, preferably in medical device, consumer goods and/or pharmaceutical companies. * Experience in commercial analytics and budgeting, within an evolving commercial organization with global locations. * Excellent communication and presentation skills, both oral and written. * Proven ability to build strong partnerships across the organization, influence others, and work collaboratively within a team-oriented environment. * Able to effectively coordinate efforts across the organization (both internally and externally) to achieve key objectives; demonstrated ability to work effectively in a highly-matrixed organization. * Fluent in written and spoken English. What's on Offer The firm is focused on creating new and exciting career opportunities and professional challenges for existing and prospective employees. In addition to working with great people, we promote a supportive work culture and offer competitive compensation, comprehensive benefits programs, as well as many opportunities for career advancement

title: Commercial Strategy Analyst
summary: Het ondersteunen van category management, digital, marketing en merchandising teams voor besluitvorming en strategie, door middel van excellente datagedreven…
description: Krijg jij energie van een dynamische werkomgeving waarin je veel schakelt met diverse stakeholders? Heb je een sterk commercieel inzicht en ben je een kei in het analyseren van data? Vind je het leuk om meerdere projecten naast elkaar te managen en om nieuwe kansen te spotten? Lees dan snel verder! Wat ga je doen? Als Commercial Strategy Analyst binnen Holland & Barrett heb je een afwisselende en uitdagende functie. Met jouw oog voor detail en uitstekende adviesvaardigheden ben je in staat om overtuigende ‘storylines’ te creëren richting jouw stakeholders (inclusief directieniveau). In deze functie ben je namelijk één van de belangrijkste sparringpartners voor datagedreven werken in de Benelux. Je houdt je voornamelijk bezig met het geven van advies op basis van omzet- en margeanalyses en customer insights (teneinde de klanttevredenheid en merkloyaliteit te kunnen verhogen). Verder houd je je onder andere bezig met: het analyseren van kansen, ontwikkelingen en trends het ondersteunen van category management, digital, marketing en merchandising teams voor besluitvorming en strategie, door middel van excellente datagedreven advies, inzichten en rapportages het bijdragen aan het verder optimaliseren van operationele processen in ons distributiecentrum en onze winkels het verbeteren van onze markt- en klantkennis Jouw scope zal echter breed zijn, met veel ruimte en vrijheid in je functie! Holland & Barrett groeit snel, waardoor je echt waarde zal kunnen vinden en toevoegen op veel plekken binnen de organisatie. In deze functie rapporteer je aan Jeroen, onze Finance & Data Business Partner (hij bekleedde de functie van Commercial Strategy Analyst hiervoor). Je zal ook nauw samenwerken met de (Benelux) directie en de collega’ in de UK (met name voor projecten). Profiel Je beschikt over wo werk- en denkniveau (Bedrijfskunde, Economie, Analytics) Je hebt circa 3-5 jaar relevante werkervaring opgedaan in een soortgelijke functie Je hebt een achtergrond in (strategie) consulting (bijvoorbeeld in de advisory tak) of retail, inclusief ervaring met commerciële-en klantgedreven analyses Je beheerst zowel de Nederlandse- als de Engelse taal goed in woord en geschrift Je beschikt over sterke analytische- en probleemoplossende vaardigheden Je bent behendig in het werken met (meerdere) grote datasets om hier hét inzicht uit te halen Je kunt goed overweg met het MS-Office pakket; met name Excel en PowerPoint kennen voor jou geen geheimen Je hebt ervaring (of je bent bereid om dit te leren) met ‘advanced analytics tools’ zoals Alteryx/Knime, SQL en Python/R met bijbehorende statistische technieken. Je kunt je bovendien vinden in de volgende eigenschappen: communicatief sterk, creatief, zelfredzaam, ondernemend en een uitstekend oog voor detail. Wat wij je bieden Dit is jouw kans om de strategie en tactics van de grootste health-&-wellnessretailer van de Benelux vorm te geven! Holland & Barrett biedt een interessante functie in een succesvolle en informele omgeving aan, waarbij er ruimte is om jezelf te ontwikkelen en nieuwe ideeën te realiseren. Binnen onze organisatie zijn doorgroeimogelijkheden een prioriteit. Verder bieden we een goed salaris welke afhankelijk is van jouw ervaring. Tevens hebben wij goede secundaire arbeidsvoorwaarden zoals personeelskorting, pensioenregeling, 28 vakantiedagen, een eigen training Academy, gratis fruit, een eigen gym op kantoor (maar momenteel werken we natuurlijk vanuit huis) en diverse collectiviteitskortingen op zorgverzekeringen. Sollicitatieprocedure Heb je interesse in deze functie? Solliciteer dan direct met jouw CV en motivatiebrief via de solliciteerbutton op onze website. Indien je positief bent geselecteerd dan word je uitgenodigd voor een telefonische screening met onze recruiter. Mocht je na deze screening positief worden bevonden, dan plannen we zo snel mogelijk een eerste sollicitatiegesprek met jou in. Je kunt maximaal twee gespreksrondes verwachten. Een case kan onderdeel uitmaken van de procedure. Over ons Holland & Barrett is een van de meest geliefde en vertrouwde merken in biologische voeding, vitaminen, supplementen en clean beauty, allemaal verkocht door goed opgeleide en gekwalificeerde adviseurs. Holland & Barrett heeft meer dan 1.300 winkels wereldwijd, waarvan meer dan 230 in Nederland en België. Met meer dan 1300 werknemers in de winkels en het hoofdkantoor in Amsterdam, is de Benelux de grootste van Holland & Barretts internationale markten én een van de meest concurrerende. Holland & Barrett is sterk gegroeid over de afgelopen jaren, en onze groei is de laatste tijd – om overduidelijke redenen – alleen maar versneld. Ondertussen hebben we onze operatie en cultuur versterkt om nóg klantgerichter te worden, en de wereldwijde leider in health en wellness. We nodigen jou uit om hieraan deel te nemen en om verdere groei als echte omnichannel retailer mogelijk te maken.  * Acquisitie naar aanleiding van deze vacature wordt niet op prijs gesteld. Aan CV's die ongevraagd worden aangeleverd kunnen geen rechten worden ontleend.*

title: Business Analyst H/F
summary:
 Vous êtes diplômé(e) d'un Master en business administration/digital marketing/marketing ou autre domaine lié.
Coordonner la préparation des business reviews.
description: Sous la responsabilité du tuteur, vous devrez fournir un soutien analytique et apporter des recommandations aux départements marketing et au Customer Management Office, dans le but de d'augmenter les ventes et la satisfaction des clients aux Pays Bas. Votre domaine de compétences couvrira l'ensemble du parcours clients en ligne. Dans le cadre de cette mission, vous développerez des compétences techniques et comportementales dans les domaines suivants :  Marketing : Coordonner la préparation des business reviews Mesurer l'impact des campagnes marketing sur l'activité digitale et fournir des recommandations pour les campagnes à venir, Concevoir les objectifs online des campagnes en collaboration avec les équipes marketing, Fournir des analyses concernant le profil de nos utilisateurs/acheteurs,  Digital : Participer à la définition des objectifs digitaux pour les années suivantes en coordination avec les stratégies marketing, Analyser l'expérience client sur les sites et optimiser en mettant en place des A/B Tests, Mesurer quotidiennement les performances digitales et améliorer les dispositifs en coordination avec les différentes équipes et/ou prestataires, Développer des rapports et dashboards permettant de mesurer l'impact des campagnes marketing, Participer à la mise en place des nouveaux projets digitaux, Profil  Vous êtes diplômé(e) d'un Master en business administration/digital marketing/marketing ou autre domaine lié  Maîtrise avancée d'Excel, Powerpoint, Google Analytics, Power BI et Datastudio.  Vous faite preuve d'autonomie et de rigueur et savez présenter de manière ludique vos découvertes.  Vous aimez exploiter la donnée, avez une grande capacité d'analyse et savez traduire ces données en actions concrètes.  Vous parlez un Anglais courant, le Néerlandais est un plus. Durée du contrat 24 mois Poste à pourvoir le 01/07/2021 Localisation du poste Pays Europe, Hollande Ville Amsterdam Critères candidat Niveau de diplôme préparé Bac+5 Langues Anglais (C1 - Courant (3,5 - 4,4 Bright))

title: Senior Financial Analyst
summary:
At 10x Genomics, accelerating our understanding of biology is more than a mission for us.
This is the century of biology, and the breakthroughs we make now have…
description: At 10x Genomics, accelerating our understanding of biology is more than a mission for us. It's a commitment. This is the century of biology, and the breakthroughs we make now have the potential to change the world. We enable scientists to advance their research, allowing them to address scientific questions they didn't even know they could ask. Our tools have enabled fundamental discoveries across multiple application areas, including cancer, immunology, and neuroscience. Our teams are empowered and encouraged to follow their passions, pursue new ideas, and perform at their best in an inclusive and dynamic environment. We know that behind every scientific breakthrough, there is a deep infrastructure of talented individuals driving the life sciences industry and making it possible for scientists, engineers, clinicians, computational biologists, and more to make new strides. We're dedicated to finding the best person for every aspect of our work because the innovations and discoveries that we enable together will lead to better technologies, better treatments, and a better future. Find out how you can make a 10x difference. Senior Financial Analyst, Commercial About the role: You will be providing financial analysis to help guide business decisions of the Senior Sales and Marketing Leaders. Dealing with the budgeting and forecasting process, including operating expense, headcount, and capital expenditures. What you will be doing: Establish solid business partnership with various teams in an assigned function, e.g. Sales, Marketing, Customer Support Work closely with the Manager, Commercial FP&A to develop and analyze sales compensation plans to drive targeted selling behavior. Manage commissions calculations and payments across the sales organization Manage, improve and streamline the annual budgeting and quarterly forecasting process for the team, including operating expense, headcount, and capital expenditures Responsible for the delivery of accurate and timely month-end variance and management reporting. Create standardized reporting packages to effectively communicate relevant information Provide analytical support and financial guidance to help with various business decisions. This includes developing new analyses and improving reports and metrics to better support business partners' decision-making process Develop in-depth knowledge of business partners' areas of focus and critical issues to provide value-add insight and guidance Develop ideas for process improvement for scaling the finance department and implement in collaboration with other FP&A team members To be successful in the role, you will need: Multi-year relevant experience in a financial planning and analysis role A Masters university degree (or equivalent) in preferably Finance, Accounting and/or Economics Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills/modeling Proven track record in business partner or corporate FP&A role Highly detail oriented and organized Ability to apply knowledge of Generally Accepted Accounting Principles (GAAP) Advanced Excel and PowerPoint skills Strong verbal, written, and interpersonal communication skills Demonstrated success working in a deadline driven and multi-task, fast-paced environment Business level English language skills (both written and spoken) It would be fantastic if you already had: Experience in the biotech or pharmaceuticals industry Experience with data science and visualization (BI-) tools (Tableau, Alteryx, ML, R, etc.) Experience within a multinational organization #LI-LN1

title: KYC-Analist CDD
summary:
Jouw onderzoekende skills zijn FBI-waardig.
Als er iets niet klopt, zoek je het tot op de bodem uit.
Sterker nog, je zou hier wel je beroep van willen maken.
description: Jouw onderzoekende skills zijn FBI-waardig. Als er iets niet klopt, zoek je het tot op de bodem uit. Sterker nog, je zou hier wel je beroep van willen maken. Stel je voor, jij als gatekeeper voor het klantportfolio van je opdrachtgever. Ruimte geven aan je research-ambities? Brunel zet je op het juiste spoor! Over deze functie  Als KYC-Analist (Know Your Customer) doorgrond, identificeer en screen jij de productaanvragen die jouw opdrachtgever binnenkrijgt. Dat gaat zo. Jouw opdrachtgever, dat is een bekende bancaire instelling. De goede reputatie van deze bank is het resultaat van een transparante en integere bedrijfsvoering. Wat goed is, willen we graag goed houden. Dus voordat potentiële klanten een beleggingsproduct, rekening, lening of hypotheek kunnen openen/afsluiten/afnemen, vindt er eerst een klantanalyse plaats. Hier kom jij in beeld. Jij analyseert iedere potentiële klant - zowel zakelijk als particulier - die zaken wil doen met de opdrachtgever. Reputatieschade willen we immers voorkomen. Het imago van de bank loopt namelijk ernstig risico wanneer een nieuwe klant belasting ontduikt, geld witwast of criminele activiteiten financiert. Hiervoor heb je diverse onderzoeksbronnen tot je beschikking. Jij bent dus degene die de integriteit van de klanten toetst aan het interne compliancebeleid van je opdrachtgever. Blijkt er uit je analyse dat er stukken ontbreken of onjuist zijn? Dan ben jij degene die de diverse belanghebbende in- of externe partijen informeert. Wat dat betreft leer je als KYC-Analist (of CDD-Analist, zoals de functie ook wel genoemd wordt) klanten en prospects ontzettend goed kennen.  Over jou  De rol van KYC/CDD-Analist is een onderzoekende. Durf jij het aan om je neus in andermans zaken te steken? Vink dan de volgende zaken af: Je hebt een hbo-/wo-diploma (liefst juridisch- en/of finance-gerelateerd) Je hebt enige ervaring op het gebied van compliance (stage/traineeship/project telt mee) Fraude- en veiligheidszaken hebben je interesse AML, CDD en KYC zijn geen onbekende termen voor je Jouw onderzoekend en analytisch vermogen, daar kunnen anderen nog wat van leren  Wat wij bieden  Terwijl jij je als KYC-Analist inzet bij onze opdrachtgever, zetten wij ons in voor jou. Gedetacheerd worden door Brunel betekent namelijk dat je bij ons in dienst treedt. Bij ons draait het om jou, dus wij houden altijd een oogje in het zeil. Hoe zich dat uit? Je hebt je eigen Brunel-consultant die jou begeleidt, check-ups doet, nieuwe projecten voor je vindt en jouw carrière en ontwikkeling vooropstelt. Daarnaast, want daar blijft het niet bij, stellen we diverse opleidingsmogelijkheden aan je voor waardoor jij je zowel op zakelijk als op persoonlijk vlak kunt blijven ontwikkelen. Wat betreft het salaris, daar kunnen we kort over zijn: dat is goed. En dan hebben we het nog niet eens over al die bonuskansen gehad. En de secundaire arbeidsvoorwaarden, daarmee zit het ook wel snor. Wij hebben tenslotte ook een reputatie om hoog te houden!  Over ons Je kent Brunel als zakelijk dienstverlener; wereldwijd actief en gespecialiseerd in projectmanagement, detachering en consultancy in de vakgebieden Finance & Risk, Engineering, IT, Legal, Marketing & Communicatie, HR en alle disciplines in de olie- en gasindustrie. Dit doen we samen met meer dan 14.000 collega’s in meer dan 45 landen. Brunel Finance & Risk is gespecialiseerd in het detacheren van vakspecialisten binnen de financiële dienstverlening. Dankzij onze medewerkers en onze manier van werken onderhouden wij goede relaties met alle gerenommeerde financiële spelers in de branche, met wie we jou graag in contact brengen. Onze kernwaarden zijn terug te zien in onze deelname aan en sponsoring van de Volvo Ocean Race: ambition, teamwork and operational excellence. Vandaar ook ons motto: Navigate The Future. Herkenbaar? Welkom aan boord!  HBO

title: Web Analist
summary: Je komt te werken in het hart van de organisatie, het multidisciplinaire marketing team bestaat uit ruim 9 getalenteerde e-commerce specialisten.
description: Jouw nieuwe baan: Web Analist | Google Analytics 360 | GTM | Automotive | Amsterdam Wil jij werken voor een label van het grootste media bedrijf in Nederland? Zou je aan de slag willen gaan met websites die maandelijks bijna 6 miljoen bezoekers bereiken? Wil je mee werken aan de analyses en conversie verbetering van websites en verschillende marketingkanalen? Zoek jij een plek waar je in samen met een multidisciplinair team kunt knallen en waar vrijheid en zelfstandigheid voorop staan? Wil je daar boven op volop de ruimte krijgen voor (persoonlijke) doorgroeimogelijkheden? Ja? Klinkt interessant? Lees dan verder, dit is voor jou! Jouw nieuwe werkgever: Een van de grootste mediahuizen van NL met een enorm portfolio aan diverse A-merken Bij deze uitdaging als Web Analist ga je aan de slag voor een label van het grootste media bedrijf van Nederland, die zich focust op de automotive markt. Dit label heeft daarmee een maandelijks bereik van bijna 6 miljoen mensen! Deze organisatie zorgt er al jarenlang voor dat hun merken dagelijks in miljoenen brievenbussen komen te liggen en daarnaast ook talloze keren online gelezen worden. Om de bestaande abonnees te onderhouden en natuurlijk nieuwe te winnen werkt het marketing team iedere dag aan next-level strategieën om hun doelgroepen op de best mogelijke manier te benaderen. Je gaat werken voor groot scala aan veelzijdige A-merken waar je U tegen zegt. Dit betekent een schat aan waardevolle gebruikersdata die blijft groeien. Door meer dan 6 miljoen maandelijkse website bezoekers weten zij waar de consument naar op zoek is, waar ze vandaan komen en kunnen ze daardoor voorspellingen doen. Het aantal bezoekers en daarmee de data blijft enorm toenemen, daarom ben jij heel hard nodig! Je komt te werken in het hart van de organisatie, het multidisciplinaire marketing team bestaat uit ruim 9 getalenteerde e-commerce specialisten. Dat betekent niet alleen een breed scala aan kennis in huis, maar ook de kans om de data verder uit te bouwen en jezelf hierin te blijven ontwikkelen. Bij jouw nieuwe werkgever draait het echter niet alleen om hard werken, maar ook hard genieten. Zij houden van het vieren van successen en genieten als geen ander van een borreltje aan het einde van de week. Het is namelijk belangrijk dat iedereen op zijn plek zit en op maandag ochtend weer met plezier naar het werk gaat. Jouw nieuwe baan: meer data dan je ooit van te voren hebt durven dromen! Als Web Analist spring jij een gat in de lucht om de grote hoeveelheid traffic op de websites van deze werkgever te mogen analyseren. Je bent onder andere verantwoordelijk voor de tag management van verschillende A-merk websites. Alle data die daar binnen komt weet jij in een handomdraai te koppelen en in dashboards te bouwen. Daarnaast ben je als geen ander in staat om uit al die cijfers verschillende inzichten te halen en daar de business mee te adviseren. Je hebt hierdoor direct impact op de inzet van verschillende marketingplatformen en verbetert ook nog eens de conversie van lopende processen en campagnes. Ben jij klaar voor de volgende stap in jouw carrière? Wat hebben we van je nodig? Je hebt Google Analytics 360 al helemaal uitgespeeld en voor een sessie data analyseren kunnen wij jou ’s nachts wel wakker maken! Je hebt ervaring met Google Optimize en A/B testing Ervaring met Javascript, SQL en GTM is een pré Je bent nieuwsgierig, creatief en je wilt je graag verder ontwikkelen in complexe data vraagstukken Je kunt business vragen en doelstellingen perfect vertalen naar een dashboard Je spreekt goed Nederlands en Engels Wat krijg je ervoor terug? Een salaris tot €59K bruto per jaar Bovenop je vakantiegeld krijg je 4% persoonlijk budget Een 36-urige werkweek Volop ontwikkelings- en opleidingsmogelijkheden Doorgroeimogelijkheden binnen een groot brand en digital team Klinkt dit als jouw nieuwe baan? Solliciteer dan nu via de sollicitatiebutton of stuur je cv naar b.zimmerman@finestpeople.nl of bel voor meer info naar 020-8200 676 Kijk voor al onze andere Web Analist vacatures in Amsterdam op onze website: www.finestpeople.nl

title: Product Manager
summary:
Coordinate teams of business analysts, functional and technical experts and create amazing team culture;
Salary range: 30-60k (depending on experience).
description: Salary range: 30-60k (depending on experience) The mission. The world does not need a slightly better website or app. What it does need, is an amazing Veriteer product manager that understands how to make consumers' lives better by crafting incredible interactions across all channels. Our product managers don't just wrangle stories and mindlessly go through the motions of Agile , they pull out all the stops to connect brand value to consumer value, drive product development and deliver measurable outcomes. Above all, like every Veriteer they have a clear passion for what they do and they raise the bar in every piece of work. If this sounds like you, we'd love to speak to you. In practical terms, here's the kind of thing you might get up to: As a product manager at Veriteer you will work on a variety of transformational projects to manage the vision of digital products for our partner brands. Practically, this means that you will do some or all of the following: Collaboratively develop product vision and direction for global brands; Create and refine detailed stories and requirements across multi-disciplinary Agile teams; Coordinate teams of business analysts, functional and technical experts and create amazing team culture; Plan and prioritise feature backlog and development of the products; Workshop and meeting facilitation; Test solutions to accept developed stories; Work closely with Product Leadership to integrate your product roadmap into programme and company objectives; Advise on eCommerce, Marketing or Customer Service capability best practices; Coach clients in product and agile methodologies; Engage senior executives to provide visibility of programme/project status; and Be an advocate for more effective ways of getting things done. In addition, you will get to be part of Veriteer's exciting adventure. We want to walk the talk, and demonstrate what good really looks like. This means bringing a range of project management skills to help our partner brands achieve better performance. You will be working both independently or as part of a project team depending on the project at both client sites and in our offices. The dynamic nature of our work means that your tasks can vary, sometimes day-to-day, and include workshop facilitation, preparation of documents and presentations, delivery of training and more. Our work often requires us to co-locate with our partner brands on their sites. We need passionate and ambitious product managers that can being the tip of the arrow on all of our work, both internally and for partner brands. The bit about you. As a product manager at Veriteer, you will have: Practical experience working with Agile methodologies in multi-team agile environments; Ideally, experience working with system integrators and technology vendors; Ideally, experience working with databases and APIs; Ideally, experience working in a consulting capacity on client-based projects; Ability to work under pressure whilst delivering against many conflicting priorities; A knack for communicating to executive stakeholders; and View of the big picture and an ability to develop effective business strategies. All Veriteers strive to achieve the incredible, and we believe that diversity will help us achieve this: Current capability is more important than background. It doesn't matter where you've come from if you can bring aptitude and experience to your role. Personal impact is more important than academic attainment. You can have demonstrated this in one or more of a business, creative or technology discipline. Teamwork is more important than individual skills. Although Veriteers will work in different ways, these must be compatible with, and tolerant of, all of your colleagues. We value people joining Veriteer from another career. This could be from the retail or FMCG industries, a strategy consultancy, a software development lab, project management or something completely different...just be clear about what you bring. Experience aside, we know what it takes to be a Veriteer. If the following sounds like you and the people you want to work with, then Veriteer will feel like home, so get in touch: You are honest You are collaborative You commit to the incredible You want everyone to value the time they spend with you The bit about us. Veriteer is a customer experience consultancy on a journey of rapid expansion. We partner with the world's biggest brands and high-growth startups to set customer-focused strategies, create successful customer experiences, and enable the delivery of ground-breaking initiatives. It's not easy to be a Veriteer, we're doing the stuff that no one else can do. So bringing someone new into the family is always our biggest decision, and our biggest investment. We come in all shapes and sizes, but we all back each other in our quest for the incredible. This means we share a number of key characteristics: We always believe that there is a better way; We are the calm in the storm; and We have a redoubtable will and an indomitable spirit. The small print. You must be able to work in the EU with no visa requirements or restrictions, and have no existing preclusion from working in the USA. You must be flexible to travel, including internationally. You will be provided with all technology, insurances and expenses to enable you to perform your duties as expected. Membership of a professional body is not required, but all professional certifications and memberships should be detailed in your application for this post. You must declare up front, any restrictions on the nature of work that you can perform, including any client-specific covenants in place that would limit your ability to work for them. Please note that have locations across Europe and the UK, so if this role is not in the right location for you, then contact us anyway, and see what we can offer.

title: Tech Recruiter
summary:
Support the team in participating in talent acquisition events (conferences), networking, HR-marketing activities.
What's in it for you.
description: About the team There is an ever growing team of professionals in our People team globally and we are in charge of talent acquisition, onboarding and employee experience, L&D, performance management, and talent brand development. We have a team culture that is highly collaborative and we expect our new team member to contribute proactively to our common projects. We have a lot of freedom and opportunity to choose the tools we need and build out new solutions and practices that will level up the quality and delivery of our teamwork. This is a fantastic opportunity for someone who wants to grow their career and change the world together with our super talented team! About the role We are looking for a passionate, purposeful, Talent Acquisition professional with a high level of self-responsibility and drive who would like to join our international recruiting team and build our Product Engineering hub in Amsterdam. As a Tech Recruiter you will partner closely with hiring managers across the globe to align on hiring needs, you will keep on improving effective candidate selection process to provide our teams with the best talents, who match Miro's high bar for performance, potential, and our values. Miro is in a hyper-growth stage - we are scaling up rapidly, hence you will be part of building our Amsterdam hub, contribute with your ideas, practices and share this exciting times with the team. What you'll do Partner with hiring managers to understand their needs Source, screen, interview and process candidates for multiple roles in Product Engineering (Product Managers, Software Engineers, Designers, Team Leads, Development Managers, Analysts, Data Scientists) Identify and implement best practices and tools for attracting and selecting A-players. Constantly network with candidates Support the team in participating in talent acquisition events (conferences), networking, HR-marketing activities What you'll need Extensive experience with full-cycle recruiting in a hyper-growth environment Experience with recruiting wide range of tech roles, e.g. product, engineering, analytics in Europe Experience with managing a large amount of stakeholders Excellent verbal and written communication skills Proven abilities to attract passive candidates and build a diverse pipeline through sourcing Think critically, adapt easily to changing priorities, optimize their own time and enjoy collaborating What's in it for you Stock Option Grant Medical Insurance coverage Travel allowance for your commute Lunch, snacks and drinks provided Allowance to facilitate remote working during WFH period Weekly team activities (even virtually) to keep the spirits high Opportunity to work for a truly global team Inspiring workplace in the heart of Amsterdam About Miro Miro is an online collaborative whiteboard platform that enables distributed teams to work effectively together, from running brainstorming sessions and workshops to planning projects, from designing new products and services to facilitating agile ceremonies. With over 10 million users, Miro is trusted by Dell, Cisco, Salesforce, PWC, EY, Deloitte and many more global companies of all sizes. At Miro, we are a team of dreamers. We look for individuals who dream big, work hard and above all stay humble. Collaboration is at the heart of what we do and through our work together we hope to create a supportive, welcoming, and innovative environment. We strive to play as a team to win the world and create a better version of ourselves everyday. If this sounds like something that excites you, we want to hear from you! Check out our career page for all our open roles or hop onto this Miro board to learn more about us!

title: Analytics Lead – Data Hub
summary: The Analytics Center of Excellence owns the management of centralized analytics infrastructure and brings together a group of data analysts across the company…
description: Mendix is on a mission to enable anyone in any organization – from the marketing coordinator to the software developer to the CEO – to create things that are transformational for their company. We are fundamentally reinventing the way applications are created and we’re reinventing the future of software development. Sounds ambitious, right? We agree.  Not to brag, but nearly 4,000 organizations worldwide, including KLM, Medtronic, Merck, and Philips, rely on Mendix to build web and mobile applications. Thousands of our customers use our platform to delight their clients and empower their employees. It’s no surprise that we’re a recognized Leader by Gartner and Forrester in a red-hot market expected to exceed $21 billion by 2022. Ok, maybe we did want to brag a little. But we’re proud of what we’ve accomplished…and…we’re humble enough to admit that we need you to make us even more effective.  The position:  Are you the experienced Analytics expert to help build a new and exciting data-centric product suite? Do you know how to use data to drive the right decisions in product development and how to build up this practice from the ground up? We might have a challenging position for you! We are looking for an ambitious and proactive Analytics Lead to join the Data Hub Group in Rotterdam.  Responsibilities:  As a Analytics Lead, you are responsible for everything related to product analytics, with the ultimate goal to drive data driven decision making within the product unit and leveraging data intelligence in our customer-facing product. You are involved in all analytics related aspects of the product development process from ensuring the right data gets measured to synthesizing information into insights and action. As our team is being newly formed and in ‘entrepreneurial mode’ this will require a combination of being able to think strategically and working with/managing others, as not being afraid to get your hands dirty and building analyses/dashboards yourself.  You make scalable impact by leading data-driven product evaluations and communicate and collaborate well with stakeholders regarding the evidence that underpin the choices that we need to make. You guide teams how to use data as an asset and enable them to do this efficiently. Your work will help shape our(strategic) decision making and will be an important pillar of our future success. A handful of activities that you can expect to be part of a work week: Defining the analytics strategy & processes; Helping the define, create and operationalize KPIs and other metrics; Building operational and management level dashboards in Power BI; Transforming data using SQL, R or Python; Designing and doing in depth research with large raw datasets; Applying statistical techniques to metrics and hypotheses to prove significance of results; Presenting your findings and actionable recommendations or analytics products to the business; Coming up with enablement strategies to drive adoption of analytics based processes; Mentoring and teaching others your tools of the trade; Introducing new techniques, tools, and best practices for the COE. Who we are looking for: You’re in a medior or senior data related role having 5+ years of experience working in an agile work environment;  You have relevant experience with:  KPI creation, target setting, forecasting, operationalization; Data processing languages or scripting languages such as: SQL, R or Python; BI tooling such as Power BI, Tableau, QlikSense or BI dashboard creation using languages such as Python or Shiny; Research and hypothesis design; Presenting outcomes to a variety of audiences; Creating, implementing, releasing, and enabling the business in using analytics products such as: automated health score or priority systems, account based marketing, smart chat bots, automated notifications triggered by changes in metrics, forecasting models, prediction models, clustering systems, or other analytics related techniques or products; Managing stakeholders across different levels of the organization. Data Hub Group:  In the Data Hub group we’re building a product that all revolves around data as well: an innovative low-code data integration platform. The Data Hub product aims to solve an important challenge for businesses, enabling their people to take the data that they have available across their company and use it effectively. Data Hub takes on the challenge of getting rid of the high amount of friction that usually exists when trying to find and use data, by offering a solution that simplifies this process from start to finish.  While Data Hub is part of the larger Mendix platform, we’re organized as a separate product unit that operates as autonomous as possible. As we’ve just released the 1st version of our product, we’re still very much in an entrepreneurial mode with a strong focus on innovation & growth. We recognize the importance of a strong analytics foundation for our success and are therefore looking for a strong addition of our product leadership team.  You’ll be working with developers, designers, product managers, user researchers and other stakeholders to optimize decision making based on data.  Analytics Center of Excellence:  While being part of the Data Hub team, Mendix also has a centralized Analytics Center of Excellence that will support you to reach your goals. The Analytics Center of Excellence owns the management of centralized analytics infrastructure and brings together a group of data analysts across the company to share knowledge and best-practices.  Our Guiding Principles  While we live on different continents, speak different languages, and work on different things, we are bound by our “MendixBlue” guiding principles. Being “MendixBlue” means that you live the culture, and you consistently improve it as we grow. It’s kind of a big deal.  We put the customer first. Without our customers, we have no business. So, if you act in the best interest of our customers, always…you belong here.  We think big. We work to have a meaningful, lasting impact on the world. So, if you aim high and think long term…you belong here.  We innovate. We want to be what happens next. So, if you ask “what if?” and work to find a way or make one…you belong here.  We nurture talent. We look, not just at the sum of what an individual has done, but at the potential of who they can be. So, if you’re up for learning from your failures…you belong here.  We hear every voice. Inflated egos don’t last here, humility does. So, if you share credit and ensure that the best ideas win – regardless of who they come from…you belong here.  We own it. If something needs doing, we do it. So, if you focus on the outcome, and take initiative to get it done…you belong here.  We have fun. We use laughter as a common language. We can ask for help and we’re happy to give it. So, if you find joy and purpose in what you do…you belong here.  Make your career at Mendix.  There are precious few jobs that let you create the future. But you’ll find one at Mendix. We are at a pivotal time in our company’s existence: where rapid growth meets stable funding. This is the time for industrious people to raise their hands to solve the next generation of problems. Mendix is a place where ambitious people can thrive; where you can identify an issue, propose a solution, and build the structure to make it happen.  Important to know: Mendix is a Siemens business, which means we’re backed by the resources and stability of one of the world’s largest and most forward-looking enterprises. Think: job security.  Since our company was founded in 2005, our aim has been to create a great work environment for people at all stages in their careers. That’s why we are so pleased and honored that we were rated a top Cloud Computing Company to work for in 2019, based on feedback from our employees on Glassdoor. With offices in the Netherlands, the UK, Germany, and the US, (and more coming), we provide an international playground to truly impact the world through low-code.

title: 1:1 Customer Engagement Account Executive
summary: Extensive experience selling complex enterprise software solutions to major organizations and / or equivalent in a marketing services / consultancy / agency…
description: Meet Our Team: The 1:1 Customer Engagement Business Unit has the mission of accelerating Pega’s growth and scaling our business in relation to RTIM (Real Time Interaction Management) - delivering Customer Value Optimization for our clients. As a 1:1 CE seller, you will report directly into the Pega sales organization but enjoy close links with the 1:1 CE Business Unit through matrix reporting to 1:1 Sales Leadership  Picture Yourself at Pega: You will have access to Pega’s market-leading solutions, uncapped earning potential and the world’s most innovative organizations as reference-able clients. As the recognized industry leader in Real-Time Interaction Management according to analysts such as Forrester, we challenge companies to rethink the way they manage 1:1 customer engagement and optimize customer value. What You'll Do at Pega: Penetrate new organizations/accounts or radiate within the existing customer base for 1:1 Customer Engagement opportunities and to meet or exceed defined booking targets. Leverage the challenger selling principles for 1:1 Customer Engagement by providing insight to the customer as the basis of the commercial conversation, teaching customers something new/valuable about how to compete in their market Through training, become deeply conversant in Pegasystems’ value propositions for 1:1 Customer Engagement and Customer Decisioning, including the technology, differentiators, customer references and solutions to learn how to map solutions to client needs and develop an expertise in Pegasystems 1:1 Customer Engagement advantages. Work and sell with Partners on 1:1 Customer Engagement opportunities. Who You Are: Comfortable dealing with senior executives in marketing, retention, customer experience, (digital) channels, data and analytics, customer value management Excellent communication skills with the ability to interact with both senior business and IT managers within large blue-chip organizations. Comfortable working in an entrepreneurial, high growth and pressurized environment Able to grasp new technology concepts quickly and think creatively Able to communicate and organize up, down and across the organization to get desired outcomes What You've Accomplished: Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent work experience. Extensive experience selling complex enterprise software solutions to major organizations and / or equivalent in a marketing services / consultancy / agency environment. Extensive knowledge of the CMO, Retention Executive, Revenue Officer etc., Next Best Action, predictive analytics and real-time marketing services and products from an enterprise technology perspective. Thorough understanding of the Digital Marketing landscape including Paid Media & Social. Pega Offers You: Gartner and Forrester Analyst acclaimed technology leadership across our categories of products The opportunity to join, contribute to and learn from, the market-leading global team Continuous learning and development opportunities An innovative, inclusive, agile, flexible, and fun work environment Competitive global benefits program inclusive of pay + bonus incentive, employee equity in the company  As an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer, Pegasystems will not discriminate in its employment practices due to an applicant's race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, genetic information, veteran or disability status, or any other category protected by law. Accessibility – If you require accessibility assistance applying for open positions please contact PegaApplication@pega.com.

title: Performance Data Analyst
summary:
We're counting on you to analyse our data and transform it into valuable insights, supporting the performance marketing team.
Our story (the bitesize version).
description: Do you want to be a part of the future of food delivery? Are you the expert that can decipher data and help optimise our online presence? Ready to make an international impact with your skills? You will be a Data Analyst in the Performance Measurement team, who will look into the challenges from the data perspective and help to transform data into valuable insights for the entire Performance Marketing department. Our story (the bitesize version) We've grown from an attic start-up to become Just Eat Takeaway, a global food delivery powerhouse. With customers across 24 countries, we take millions of orders every day from Amsterdam to Auckland! What you'll do as a Performance Data Analyst: We're counting on you to analyse our data and transform it into valuable insights, supporting the performance marketing team. You guide the team with your analysis and ensure they make the right investments. You are able to interpret the questions behind the question and have experience in communicating clearly and in a concise manner with stakeholders. You know exactly how data is gathered and processed by the different analyzing tools like GA, Firebase, Adjust, DoubleClick, SA360, DV360 and Tableau. You review and resolve current ad fraud detection and prevention efforts. You conduct analyses using multiple data sources to develop audiences testing. You are able to deep dive into the collected data in our databases as you are a master in SQL. You are the first point of contact for looking at the incrementality and cannibalisation within channels and platforms. You know how to find improvement points and spot tracking issues on Web and App across all performance channels. You will create data visualizations to improve business processes by creating Tableau dashboards and Google Data Studio. Your profile You have at least 2-3 years working experience as a Web Analyst, Business Analyst, or similar area. You have been working together with marketing departments responsible for channels like SEO, SEA, Display Advertising and/or CRM. You know how to assist them with insights from the analytics platforms/databases and help them optimize their channels. You have at least 3 years experience with A/B Testing, SQL / BigQuery and dashboarding software like Tableau. Experience with AWS and Google Cloud Platform (GCP) You relish working in a team and enjoy collaborating and sharing knowledge with your peers. Experience with App tracking tools would be an asset. Our offer The freedom to go where no one in our company has gone before; Possibilities to strengthen your skills and grow in the role; Work in a fast-growing company; Being part of a young, professional and international team; A competitive salary; Custom workstations/laptops (Mac/Linux/PC); Opportunity to join native language courses; Traveling between the different office locations Awesome company events; Free drinks and fruits.

title: Senior Business Consultant (Eng)
summary: You are part of a team of savvy analysts and you get the chance to influence the development of many international topics steered by regulations but also…
description: Make a difference by using your knowledge of supply chain processes in an international environment by working in multi-disciplinary teams which are responsible for the development of new products, systems, and processes including the implementation. You achieve succes by your understanding of the supply chain and the customers' needs and your capability of coming up with solutions for short-mid-and long term purposes. As a Senior Business Consultant you are positioned within the Digital Development team of the International IT department. In your day to day work you are part of a multi-disciplinary team and you work on the design of business processes and IT solutions in the supply chain. You are able to identify/understand the IT needs of the supply chain and customers and together with your colleagues, you think of ways in how to achieve the strategic themes which lie ahead. You are able to identify the gaps between supply chain and IT and translate the business needs into solutions. As a Digital Consultant you give guidance in decision making for short term and long term solutions. You also play an important role in the development of the supply chain roadmap. You operate comfortably in a very complex stakeholder environment with many levels of users (from operational to executive) and (international) suppliers and you maintain relationships and interact with managers, process owners, suppliers, customers and partners in Europe, North America and Asia. Furthermore you understand the IT architecture and are able to identify the strenghts and weaknesses of different solutions.  We want to be the favourite logistics company by delivering special moments every day. Our employees and customers are key. We are always looking for ways to improve. As a Digital Consultant in our supply chain you want to contribute to the digitalization of our organization. And you also contribute to new end-to-end solutions where shallow and fast delivery and a flexible architecture are very important. We want to work on solutions that will contribute to a more data driven organization. You discuss with business development, customers and/or partners and product management, new business opportunities and provide input with regard to the opportunities provided by potential IT solutions.
