PostNL IT is the central IT organization of PostNL and is responsible for the specification, development and running of the IT services of PostNL. Cross Border Solutions is an International Business Unit that combines products and services for both mail and eCommerce for international customers.  A University degree (BSc/MSc) in business informatics or proven equivalent experience plus fluency in English (working language within CBS), working knowledge of Dutch is a real pre; 3-5 years’ experience in either a postal/logistics or e-commerce environment preferably including Cross-Border business processes and IT solutions; Affinity with business development, product management, logistics and marketing in an e-commerce environment Experience with design methods and techniques for applications and data; Working knowledge of SAFe methodolgy working is a benefit; Experience with multiple functional domains and the corresponding functional specifications, architecture and current guidelines; Well developed socials skills in guiding various teams, giving presentations for decision makers/ users and transferring knowledge; Strong network and relationship building skills and ability to thrive in an international environment with a variety of users and suppliers and complex stakeholder management Open to social, commercial and cultural differences.  To be successful in this role excellent analytical and solution driven skills, advanced technical writing skills, good interpersonal, connecting and communicating skills, and an in-depth understanding of business procedures and objectives are required. Your entrepreneurship and realisation skills help you to achieve results.  Gross salary indication between€ 4.416,- tot € 6.420 based on a fulltime contract (37 hours) (level 12) of the PostNL Collective Labour Agreement); 25 vacation days and 8% holiday pay and attractive Pension and health insurance benefits; Flexibility and freedom to perform your job effectively; Laptop, mobile phone and compensation towards your travel costs/home-office. Read more about our remuneration package here; A challenging position within a dynamic and International Department; Room for personal development through education and training in PostNL learning environment, content driven and knowledge sharing sessions; Great office location in The Hague with easy public transport access.  As Senior Business Consultant you are the linking pin between the business and IT. You have an important role in the digital future of PostNL International. You are part of a team of savvy analysts and you get the chance to influence the development of many international topics steered by regulations but also trending digital changes in the market. A good working knowledge of Dutch is a real advantage for this role. Interested? Please apply with your resume and compelling cover letter in English.  PostNL aims to be the favorite logistics company for everyone. Therefore, everyone is welcome to join us irrespective of where you were born, what your beliefs are and who you love. We are just looking for great talent. A pre-employment screening is part of the application process. This entails providing a positive Certificate of Good Conduct (VOG) on joining the company.  Heb je vragen over deze vacature? Neem dan gerust contact met mij op via WhatsApp, telefoon of e-mail. Georgina Broeken - Wilson T: 0620439986

title: Product Owner
summary:
Help build the best marketing technology product there is.
You’re a fit if you are deeply interested in marketing, architecture, and technology.
description: Full-time, Nijmegen, the Netherlands Hurry up! We’ve got a dream to build! BlueConic is a fast-growing SaaS startup in search of that unique individual who blends a customer service attitude with technical problem solving. Do you have a passion for building world class products with a top tier team? We’re looking for an ambitious Product Owner that drives the execution of our vision into the best product there is. About BlueConic BlueConic is the market-leading customer data platform, which gives marketers the power to liberate their data and use it to improve marketing outcomes. Our clients use BlueConic to unify individual-level data and then use that single view across channels. Our SaaS platform is the solution for challenges marketers haven’t been able to solve for years. We’re headquartered in Boston and our development team works from the Netherlands. With more than 300 brands currently using the platform, our work is experienced by millions. About the job We’re looking for an ambitious Product Owner who will be responsible for our product and its implementation from start to finish. You will manage the backlog and sprint definitions and communicate with our internal stakeholders – customers, prospects, analysts and partners – to deeply understand our target market and buyer’s needs. You are responsible for all functionalities of the BlueConic platform and for the product’s success. On a daily basis you will work with BlueConic’s team of highly experienced software Engineers. The incredible success of our software product is largely due to the vision and the implementation of the technology, as well as timeliness to hit the market! You’re a fit if you are deeply interested in marketing, architecture, and technology. You are patient and exceptionally smart, have an eye for details, and are a great communicator. A sense of humor and an enthusiasm for participating in discussions about random things on Slack are also a must. Your activities will consist of: Managing and refining the product backlog. Clearly expressing and prioritizing product backlog items to best achieve goals and delivering value. Working closely with a team of Software Engineers and a QA Engineer. Working closely with the Product Manager to understand the roadmap and translating roadmap items into user stories. Participating in Refinement sessions, Sprint planning meetings, Sprint Reviews and Retrospectives. Understanding and internalizing the product vision, and being available and approachable for your team at all times. Ensuring the quality of the releases by testing, validating, and accepting the work done. Having a proactive role in continually improving the process. We are looking for someone with the following skills: You have a bachelor’s or master’s degree or equivalent working experience. Technical proficiency for tools in marketing technology, advertising technology, and/or customer analytics. Deeply familiar with Web and mobile technologies. At least 5 years of experience in software design. Deep experience with Scrum. Impeccable organizational and time management skills. Have superlative communication skills. You will be a great fit if you: Are eager to drive the creation the best marketing technology product in the world. Are a strong team player with a “can do’’ attitude. Are passionate, enthusiastic, and eager to learn. Are fascinated with all things technical. Are equally fascinated by software design. Have got a mind for asking questions and synthesizing information that turns into results. Don’t ever think “good enough” is good enough. Do enjoy going into the nitty gritty details if necessary, but still see the big picture. See patience as a virtue. Reasons to join us: Work in an international fast growing start-up with the opportunity to come over and work at our headquarters located in “Title Town,” USA (Boston) and share our love for US sports. Be part of a dynamic and professional, very seasoned team (most of our engineers have more than ten years’ experience). Take advantage of great opportunities for career progression. You want to work with the very latest tools and tech. Help build the best marketing technology product there is. Enjoy competitive salary, 28 days off, a MacBook, travel expenses and a good retirement pension. Do you think this is the perfect job for you? To join our team, please apply through the link below and we will get in touch with you very soon to talk about a future at BlueConic! Acquisition for this vacancy is not appreciated.

title: Customer Intelligence Analyst
summary:
Takeaway's Customer Intelligence team is seeking for a business-minded marketing intelligence specialist.
Identify specialized customer segments and increase…
description: Takeaway's Customer Intelligence team is seeking for a business-minded marketing intelligence specialist. The Customer Intelligence team is a new team within the Global Retention Marketing department which further consists of a Loyalty Program, CRM and Customer Activation team. The goal of the Global Retention team is to grow the order frequency of our customers. The goal of the Customer Intelligence team is to uncover insights through advanced analytics and test opportunities to do exactly so. The Customer Intelligence team lives at the intersection of Marketing, Data & Analytics and Product departments. The team consists of 2 pillars: customer analytics and customer excellence deployment. The analytical focus of the team is the customer. Everything starts with digging into customer data to define problems and hypotheses and refine and enrich data when necessary. To understand the ‘why' behind the data, the team also derives customer insights, by blending data with a deep understanding of user needs, habits, and perceptions developed through targeted interviews, usability studies, and customer feedback. The role of the lifecycle analyst is to bring the next level of data sophistication to the team. You will build statistical models to better understand and predict customer behavioural patterns and work with the entire retention team to define campaign triggers on critical points in the path to loyalty. Besides the more in depth projects you will also have a supporting role on more basic analytics for the entire Global retention team. The Customer Lifecycle analyst resides in the Retention Marketing Team and has a very strong link to the central data scientists and analysts, who will give you an extensive onboard training, support you in your daily work and provide you with regular training as if you were part of the central team. Your responsibilities: Deepdive into big retention challenges such as new customer churn, prediction of purchase paths and reengagement triggers Develop statistical models and reports and tools on top of our Amazon Redshift Datawarehouse using languages such as SQL, Python or R. Quantify overall return on investment generated from a customer post considering all possible touchpoints and product interactions over his lifetime. Implementing cross functional projects across analytics, product and CRM teams with objectified goals of customer retention Handle large volume of data, and be responsible for maintaining, modifying and owning the relevant CRM data schemas and segmentation models along with the central data engineering and full stack tech teams. Identify specialized customer segments and increase discoverability and targetability via multi channel marketing promotion. Facilitate the teams setting up and analyzing A/B tests using statistical best practices and evaluate incrementality from campaigns. Provide actionable insights to business from engagement and transactional data Proactively propose business actions that result from your analysis data to stakeholders, so that they can take an innovative approach to efficiently and effectively improve their business; By training your fellow team members on the usage of the various data & analytics tools available you will contribute to Takeaway.com's goal to work as data-driven as possible through the entire organization. Aligning with the central BI Team to define goals and follow up on ongoing and future projects. Your profile: 6+ years of experience working in Marketing Intelligence and/or data science Solid experience in a number of the following technologies/programming languages R, Python, Julia, Spark, Hadoop, Tensorflow, Amazon AWS Knowledge of SQL and Business Intelligence tools like Tableau or any other visualization tool; Being able to do in-depth analysis, for example, performance analysis of retention team, CLV, cluster, churn analysis, forecast and modelling Excellent communication, teamwork, and stakeholder management skills. Hands-on and flexible in personality, structured and solution-oriented thinking, critical questioning and focusing on ongoing development. Experience in defining and calculating KPIs. Experience working in an agile environment. Preferably an academic quantitative degree (MSc) in Econometrics, Mathematics, Statistics, Data Science or another related field with a strong emphasis on advanced quantitative analysis. Understanding and experience on AWS/GCP data offerings. You have a positive mindset and enjoy working in an international and multicultural environment We offer: Work in a fast growing eCommerce company; Being part of a new, young, professional and international team; A competitive salary including 8% holiday allowance; Travel costs 1st class public transportation; Pension plan 60% paid by Takeaway.com; 26 holidays a year on a full-time basis; An office location within the heart of Amsterdam (5 min. from Central Station); Hackathons and prototyping of new solutions; Variety in your work and a fantastic, informal work atmosphere. Mentoring and personal development opportunities in an international team of experts. A challenging environment that will stimulate you to grow as a professional. Awesome company events (e.g. summer party and yearly snow trip). A dynamic work environment with a culture that is open, innovative and performance-orientated.

title: Projectmanager
summary: Verder zijn we bezig met de vertaling van onze ervaring en kansen die we zien in de markt, naar eigen producten die we met een nieuwe marketing afdeling gaan…
description: Wat ga je doen? Als Projectmanager / ProductOwner neem jij de touwtjes in handen en leidt alle stakeholders naar de oplevering van een succesvolle oplossing waar iedereen blij van wordt. Je bent in feite het verlengstuk van onze opdrachtgevers en de schakel naar onze Scrum teams. Je zorgt voor een goede product backlog en stelt de juiste prioriteiten met je teams samen. Maar je neemt ook deel tijdens leuke strategische sessies die onze Strateeg organiseert in de Get Ready, houdt sprint refinements en bent verantwoordelijk voor een goede oplevering. Dat doe je met onze ervaren Scrum teams bestaande uit o.a. een Scrum Master, Developers en QA-ers. Ieder Scum team wordt natuurlijk bijgestaan door een Business Analist, Visual UX designer en een Strateeg. We werken in een internationale en professionele werkomgeving met (inter)nationale opdrachtgevers en een kantoor in hartje Rotterdam en Lviv (het Silicon Valley van Oost Europa). We ontwikkelen geen simpele websites maar praten over online platforms. High traffic oplossingen, portals met integraties, (inter)nationale corporate websites en e-commerce oplossingen. Verder zijn we bezig met de vertaling van onze ervaring en kansen die we zien in de markt, naar eigen producten die we met een nieuwe marketing afdeling gaan lanceren. We werken met hoogwaardige frameworks en wereldwijde standaarden. Ook maken we gebruik van de complete Atlasian suite en ondersteunende tools zoals Miro, Figma, test software en zeer geavanceerde en schaalbare cloud ontwikkelstraat (OTAP) met Docker en Kubernetes voor Continious Integration in onze projecten. Tot slot hebben onze klanten service contracten om de optimalisatie van onze oplossingen telkens naar een hoger niveau te tillen. Samen met onze opdrachtgevers zijn we namelijk constant in gesprek om met elkaar iets moois te maken en door te ontwikkelen.  Wat kunnen we voor elkaar betekenen? We bieden een goed marktconform salaris (maandelijks tussen 3.500 en 5.500 euro bruto) tegen een vast loon dat we in onze sollicitatieprocedure zullen bepalen aan de hand van jouw ervaring en kennis. Daarnaast bieden we uitstekende arbeidsvoorwaarden een tof kantoor op een fantastische plek in het centrum van Rotterdam. Je krijgt een MacBook Pro en eigen werkplek met twee schermen. Uiteraard horen 8% vakantietoeslag, reis- en pensioenkostenvergoeding en een mooie winstdeling ook tot de arbeidsvoorwaarden. Tot slot bieden we mogelijkheden tot een hybride vorm van thuis- en op kantoor werken.  Maar wat verwachten we van jou? Je hebt minimaal 3 jaar ervaring als Product Owner bij een online bureau. Je weet zaken voor elkaar te krijgen, legt de juiste prio’s, maar kunt ook ‘nee’ zeggen wanneer nodig. Een drukke, gezellige en dynamische werkomgeving geeft je energie Je weet op enthousiaste wijze je collega’s te motiveren en onze klanten te overtuigen van je ideeën en adviezen. Je kunt wensen van gebruikers of klanten goed vertalen naar kansen en oplossingen. Je werkt zelfstandig, gestructureerd, houdt graag overzicht en bent resultaatgericht. Je kunt sparren met andere ervaren collega’s. Je schakelt snel op tactisch en functioneel niveau. Je kunt – als je het leuk vindt – soms mee op kort werkbezoek van 2 of 3 dagen naar onze Lviv vestiging (niet noodzakelijk) en zodra we gevaccineerd zijn natuurlijk:) Je communiceert ook gemakkelijk in het Engels met zowel collega’s als externe stakeholders.

title: UX Designer
summary:
Je hebt naast UX ook kennis van meerdere vakgebieden, zoals marketing, communicatie en webredactie.
Anders gezegd: je zorgt ervoor dat eindgebruikers de…
description: Dit wordt je functie Als UX Designer help jij online bezoekers doeltreffend, vlot en naar tevredenheid gebruik te maken van websites en applicaties. Anders gezegd: je zorgt ervoor dat eindgebruikers de belangrijkste (online) taken kunnen en willen uitvoeren in het verlengde van organisatie en marketing & communicatiedoelen. Daarvoor voer je analyses uit, geef je advies over ‘wat werkt op internet’, maak je interactieve prototypes en test tussentijdse digitale producten op kantoor met échte eindgebruikers (usability testing). Waar nodig schakel je met externe leveranciers. We zoeken een UX Designer, die voor de klanten van APG Groep werkt aan: UX ADVIES Advies dat gebaseerd is op gedegen kennis en ervaring, ook over de uitvoerbaarheid. Zowel op stakeholder als uitvoerend niveau. User Centered Design (UCD) proces introduceren en uitdragen. Om via UCD de kans te vergroten dat APG digitale producten oplevert die stakeholders waarderen en die eindgebruikers in hun customer journeys kunnen én willen gebruiken. UX RESEARCH Online research-activiteiten om evidence based beslissingen te kunnen nemen. In alles wat we doen streven we ernaar data-driven te werken. In staat zijn van het zelf opzetten en uitvoeren van usability tests, treetests, cardsorts, site search, SEO, persuasion scans (Persuasion, Emotion and Trust), usability expert reviews, heuristische evaluaties, A/B-testing. Accessibility-kennis is een pré. UX DESIGN Getting the right design. Door schetsen / paper prototyping om de eisen en ideeën te visualiseren die anders alleen in woorden op papier staan. Divergerend kom je samen met stakeholders tot meerdere conceptdesigns. Getting the design right. De beste ideeën bundel je tot interactieve responsive prototypes. Je bent dan ook een kei in – bij voorkeur – Axure RP Pro . Met prototypes neem je usability tests af en voer je samen met je team verbeteringen door. De uitkomst: het meest effectieve, efficiënte interactie-ontwerp dat de verschillende doelgroepen naar tevredenheid gebruiken. Dit breng je mee We geven er de voorkeur aan dat jij je kennis en ervaring hebt opgedaan in een commerciële omgeving. Je hebt naast UX ook kennis van meerdere vakgebieden, zoals marketing, communicatie en webredactie. Je begrijpt waar klantvragen vandaan komen en hoe ze te interpreteren (business). Tegelijkertijd kun je ook goed inschatten wanneer met een Content Management Systeem oplossingen gerealiseerd kunnen worden en wanneer onderdelen hard gecodeerd zijn (techniek). We zoeken een UX’er met een hbo/wo-opleiding. Denk aan marketing & communicatie, human computer interaction (HCI), design for interaction en CMD. Daarnaast heb je relevante UX-vervolgopleidingen gevolgd, bij voorkeur Certified Usability Analyst (CUA) en Certified User Experience Analyst (CXA). Cursussen bij Nielsen Norman Group zijn een pré. Je hebt meer dan 4 jaar ervaring met het ontwerpen van Responsive Websites en Apps. Binnen je team en de IT-afdeling ben jij een vraagbaak als het gaat om UX Design en ben je niet bang om je mening te geven en te verdedigen. Je hebt ervaring met het ontwerpen van Responsive Web Design (RWD)-websites. Je hebt affiniteit met toegepaste analytics. Niet meten om te weten. Wel om verbeteringen op het spoor te komen en initiatief te nemen om ze door te voeren. Hoge mate van proactiviteit in het zelf ‘verkopen’ van (de ROI en businessvoordelen van) UX: hogere conversie / minder afhakers, kostenreductie door minder calls/e-mails, hogere productiviteit, preventie hoge kosten door re-work, hogere klanttevredenheid (loyaliteit/retentie). Hier ga je aan de slag We bieden je een salaris van maximaal € 5.210 (38 uur) en mooie arbeidsvoorwaarden gericht op flexibiliteit.  Voor pensioenuitvoerder APG gaat pensioen over mensen, leven en samenleven. Met zorgvuldig vermogensbeheer, pensioenadministratie, communicatie en advies wil APG meehelpen aan een leefbare toekomst waarin we welvaart en welzijn eerlijk en duurzaam samen delen. Voor huidige en toekomstige generaties. Voor nu, straks, en later.

title: Web Analyst
summary:
Solid understanding of digital marketing channels.
CarNext.com couldn't do without a web analyst.
You fill the gap between business, marketing, and web…
description: Web Analyst (Marketing) Amsterdam Central Is 'data visualization and analytics' what triggers you? Do you have a bachelor's degree in a relevant field combined with 3+ years' experience as a Web Analyst ? Did you gain this experience in a commercial environment? If you answered yes to all three questions, please apply for our Web Analyst Marketing role.  This is CarNext.com CarNext.com is a scale-up with a start-up mentality. We're bold and have a passion to change the status quo. We're building a transparent digital marketplace that customers can trust. And it's the same at CarNext.com. We're proud of our open culture, collaborative ethos, vibrant environment and can-do approach. As we grow our business, we're keen to hear from people who understand what we're about and can help us achieve our mission.  What you will be doing CarNext.com couldn't do without a web analyst. With your analysis and consequential conclusions you help us to navigate towards our business goals. You fill the gap between business, marketing, and web engagement, closely collaborating with product development teams. As a Web Analyst at CarNext.com, you are responsible for boosting our general Marketing performance. For example by tagging and tracking all the features on the website. Next to that, you monitor and fix data deficiencies. Your challenge lies in translating your insights to comprehensible business recommendations. Using state-of-the-art data visualisations and analytical tooling. You collaborate with marketeers to show them opportunities from your analytics. As we are a scale-up, working at CarNext.com is super dynamic. If you know how to embrace fast-paced change, this is your job! We are looking for someone who is eager to learn and has a hands-on mentality. Taking initiative to improve results should be second nature to you.  Your responsibilities Manage Google Analytics, Google Tag Manager, and Data Studio Tag and track all website features Define and monitor KPIs for our website Help CRO team by identifying opportunities for A/B testing Support performance teams with your ideas and solutions  What do we think you need to have to be successful in this position? Bachelor's degree in Economics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Business Administration, Engineering, or another relevant quantitative field. 3+ years' experience as a Web Analyst in a commercial environment Preferably experience with BigQuery Experience with measurement protocol is a plus Advanced knowledge on data generation, collection, and analysis Solid understanding of digital marketing channels Know how to create tags and triggers in GTM Sufficient understanding of APIs and how to connect GA with other tools Tableau experience is a plus A real Excel mastermind Able to present data in an attractive way Language abilities Fluent English – written and spoken Another European language is preferred Grow with us CarNext.com provides ample opportunities for personal and professional growth. If this position interests you, Go ahead, apply and send us your CV

title: Digital Platform Strategist
summary: Have 3-5 years of experience when it comes to the (further) development of digital products; preferably within e-commerce (such as a product owner, e-commerce…
description: We're looking for a Digital Platform Strategist with a track record in e-commerce for our Amsterdam or Rotterdam office, who considers it a challenge to make digital platforms better, more efficient and more fun! As a leading digital agency, we strive to create the best online solutions and make our clients happy. As a Digital Platform Strategist with a specialisation in the (continuous) development of digital products, preferably with a background in e-commerce, you're invaluable in that pursuit! Are you looking for your next career opportunity and to use your years of experience to take on a bigger responsibility for the further development of digital platforms? Then this role is perfect for you! As a Digital Platform Strategist, you breathe digital and are constantly contemplating the healthy balance between developing a digital platform and looking towards the future. You're assertive, more than familiar with the market and you've got a keen eye for developments that allow clients to accelerate their digital business, with the ability to explain everything clearly. Your communication methods gain you your client's trust and ensure that they see you as an important conversation partner, on an operational, tactical and strategic level. You're a paragon of advisory sales and notice commercial opportunities which you translate into proposals for the client with the help of the account manager. You also translate visions and strategies into useful roadmaps and backlogs, which clarify what the team of designers, developers and marketeers will be working on. You leave the work to the experts, but like keeping an eye on things and ensuring that no topic such as IT, design, digital marketing or measurability is overlooked. In other words: under your supervision, you craft amazing digital platforms and make clients happy. Does that sound like music to your ears? We're a young company and our brightest minds spend every day working for a plethora of clients, such as Eneco, BPD, Bol.com, Aegon, Takeaway and Bugaboo.Yes, we are eager to bring on board the most talented experts in the game. But we are also looking for a perfect Dept-fit. Someone who is eager to learn and strives towards a better world, takes the stage, is a futurist at heart, and someone who is down to cheer with us to a successful week as well! We strongly support diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. Ultimately, we are looking for a unique individual who is able to strengthen our collective. YOU: Have a university degree in the field of business, innovation or design; Have 3-5 years of experience when it comes to the (further) development of digital products; preferably within e-commerce (such as a product owner, e-commerce manager, conversion specialist, digital strategist, web analyst or business analyst); Are experienced when it comes to developing product visions, multi-year strategies and roadmaps; Are looking for your next career move where you leverage your expertise to take on a broader responsibility for the establishing and development of digital platforms; Have amazing communicative skills that gain you the client's trust and thus ensures they view you as an important conversation partner on an operational, tactical and strategic level; Understand the world of platform personalisation and the required methods and technology; Want to create the best possible platform for our clients and remember to put end users front and centre; Develop your digital vision and strategy through co-creation and interactive workshops, and you keep internal and external stakeholders involved; Use data or user testing to support your decisions; Look beyond only the (further) development of the platform and assist our clients with the formation of a digital team; Are enterprising, fun to work with and you know how to motivate and inspire people; WE'RE OFFERING: An open company culture; Possibilities to work from home; Working from home setup; Pension scheme; Possibilities to develop your skills even further via training and certifications; Healthy and tasty food; Free Bootcamp training twice a week; Friday drinks/open bar to wrap up the week; Great fringe benefits; laptop, mobile phone, NS business card and many other goodies WHO ARE WE? Hi, we are Dept – an international agency featuring the most experienced thinkers and makers. One agency that brings together creativity, technology, and data. We help you to reinvent and accelerate your digital reality by creating experiences that people want and organisations need. You can also apply via WhatsApp: please send your CV to 06 82 44 21 20!

Supporting the Sales Organisation on preparing high quality presentations, bids, How To and ad hoc…

title: Data Analyst
summary: You will play a key role shaping the product road map, marketing and content as well as helping to define, recommend and improve KPI's plus you will have ample…
description: Location Eindhoven Sector: Games, Technology, Games Production & QA Job type: Permanent Salary: €42000 - €62000 per annum Client: Creative Personnel Contact: Lanre Akanni What this studio does is simple - They produce popular mobile games Why they do what they do is also simple - They want to bring engaging gameplay experiences to players Part of how they do is also very simple -Data  And this is where you as an already successful Data Analyst comes in, especially if you are looking to make a strong impact within the world of mobile games. title: Director of Digital Product Management
summary:
Participate actively in marketing and business development, contribute to pre-sales initiatives.
You have coached multidisciplinary teams (marketing, creative…
description: About Mobiquity  Founded in 2011, Mobiquity provides end-to-end omnichannel digital consulting services to leading B2B and B2C brands (HealthCare, Banking, IoT, Big Data, and cutting edge Web & Mobile Applications). With over 750 employees spread across the USA, Europe, and India, 40 different nationalities combined; we create compelling digital experiences to help our clients create the best human-centric products. Our key competencies include Strategy, Design, Product Engineering, Analytics, and Cloud Services. Each day, 50 million users interact with our solutions.  Our teams are inspired by technology but it doesn’t rule them. We love to learn, we are curious by nature and driven to make a mark. Working at Mobiquity means that sometimes you’ll be working outside your comfort zone, and you’ll work with smart people, possibly some that are even smarter than you. We value people that judge their success by the success of the team and the happiness of customers. We’re also proud to be an Amazon Web Services (AWS) Premier Consulting Partner.  What will you be doing?  Your main goals are to ensure our clients get the best out of the product they develop with Mobiquity, but also to grow the Digital Product Management competence.  This entails: Set the vision and strategy for the DPM competence and the positioning within Mobiquity, Lead, consult and deliver products in larger engagements with our clients, Translate vision into a pragmatic way of working and contribute to Mobiquity’s Digital Traction Methodology for digital innovation, Manage DPM team leads and team members, consisting of Product Owners and Business Analysts. Inspire and coach the DPM team to grow, Add Product Manager/Strategist roles to extend the capabilities of DPM, Search for the opportunity in existing and new clients to position and grow product management services, Align on strategic, tactical, and operational levels with other competencies, e.g., Engineering, Strategy, Creative, Operations, Evangelise and demonstrate thought leadership on Product Management, both internally and externally, Position Mobiquity as a service provider for product-centric services in the Netherlands, Participate actively in marketing and business development, contribute to pre-sales initiatives. About you  You are a seasoned product leader who has launched and grown multiple products. You have coached multidisciplinary teams (marketing, creative and technical) to reach the maximum of their potential. Now you are looking to maximise the impact of your experience on more organisations and grow a team of smart and eager business analysts, product owners and product managers to the next level.  Your skills include: 15+ years of experience, lastly as a Head of Product Management or similar functions, Proven track record in product strategy, planning, defining, launching, and growing successful digital products, Proven thought leadership on product - you inspire the people around you, Superior ability to synthesise diverse and complex information and data and design refined strategies, solutions, workflows, and procedures that are presentable to C-level executives, Excellent people skills and leadership skills. Ability to create long-lasting working relationships with customers and smooth collaboration with other competences, Preferably experience in multiple industries like banking, healthcare or retail, for B2B and B2C products, Master’s Degree in Business Administration, Marketing, Finance, Economics, or equivalent. What we offer Competitive salary, 25 holidays, Pension plan, Travel costs compensation, Training via our Mobiquity Academy, Health insurance compensation (€100,- per month), Free fruits, Friday breakfast, lunch and afternoon drinks, and lots of fun in the office including a game room with pool & ping pong table, Xbox, etc., A challenging learning environment and cool creative and innovative projects, When you are not working at a client’s location, join us in our Amsterdam office, We invest in your growth, success, and happiness, and celebrate the world-class work you produce, We are famous for our healthy work-life balance and being really flexible. Apply  After giving your consent in the section below, please upload your resume and details. Have questions before applying? Please address them to our recruiter: Alice Revest (arevest@mobiquityinc.com).

title: Senior BI Visualization Consultant – Einstein Analytics
summary: To continue LeasePlan's success story in the fast-moving automotive industry, we are actively building our digital presence to create the "future of Digital" in…
description: To continue LeasePlan's success story in the fast-moving automotive industry, we are actively building our digital presence to create the "future of Digital" in the mobility industry, and to achieve our vision of "any car, anywhere, anytime".  PURPOSE OF THE JOB The BI Visualization Consultant in our team is instrumental on enabling data driven decision making and a "Best in Class" Self-Service Analytics capability with SalesForce Einstein Analytics. Some key elements of the activities are: Establish a clear BI Visualization product vision and roadmap to enable Self-Service Analytics to fulfil business objectives. Develop, maintain and operationalize enterprise level interactive dashboards and reports that meet the critical business needs across multiple customer journeys and key projects in central functional Value Drivers and local entities. Jointly with Product Owners, Project Managers, BI Analysts and Data Management specialists ensure the KPI requirements and data pipelines are established clearly to meet business needs. Establish a "Single Source of Truth" user adoption program, to materialize "self-service analytics" vision within Leaseplan.  What do you need to do the job? Hands on experience in data visualization, preparation principles, tooling is a must for the following tools: Predominantly SalesForce Einstein Analytics. Hands on experience with Sales Cloud, Service Cloud, Marketing Cloud and Community Cloud. Having experience also with Tableau, Tableau Embedded in portals, QlikView, Google Data Studio, Alteryx, SQL is a plus. Hands on experience in data provisioning principles. Strong business understanding of how (digital) data drive analysis and insight for business impact. Knowledge of accelerating user adoption for Self-Service Analytics capability at an enterprise setting. Bachelor/master's degree in the field that emphasizes internet technology, coding, and/or analytics. Min of 2 years of experience of data visualization development at global scale. Knowledge in advanced analytics principle is a bonus.  About you: Professional integrity and strong work ethics. Ability to articulate vision of transformation efforts and a sense of mission. Results oriented, willingness to commit to a direction and drive operations to completion. Ability to manage senior relationships and complex conflict situations. Ability to develop, teach and coach people across the organization. Effectiveness in building trust, respect and cooperation among teams. Comfortable with ambiguity, flexibility, tenacity, eagerness to learn and steer the organization based on data expertise. Fluent in English.  What do we offer? A challenging job in the middle of a global transition. Besides, it is an inspiring environment that is always in motion. In normal circumstances (post Covid '19) your workplace will be in a beautiful new office in Amsterdam.

title: Lead Data Scientist at Transavia
summary: You have demonstrable knowledge of data science and you can stimulate craftmanship among data scientist and data analyst colleagues.
description: Come and work at Transavia and join us as a Lead Data Scientist At Transavia, we are looking for a Lead Data Scientist within our Strategy, Data & Intelligence department. Can you ensure the continued high performance development of our team? Do you also share our key values, namely friendliness, responsibility, enthusiasm and decisiveness? If so, you may well be the Lead Data Scientist we are looking for.  The central Strategy, Data & Intelligence (SDI) team is responsible for the strategy (development), leads the transformation to become more data driven, supports all departments with information and insights and develops data, business intelligence, machine learning and operations research tools for Transavia customers and employees. SDI develops information products for every department of Transavia e.g. flight operations, network planning, marketing, revenue management and sales.  The new SDI team is founded in 2020 as part of our journey to take Transavia to the next level in Data & Analytics, which offers you the chance to take a leading role in this transformation. Do you have the experience to further improve the way of working of our growing team? Do you want to be part of this journey and guide and challenge the team towards continuous delivery of state-of-the-art analytics?  What will be your responsibility? In your role as a Lead Data Scientist, you will ensure the continuous improvement of the analytics way of working and best practices. You will be the tech-sidekick of the lead of the team and the ambassador for the analytical quality of our data and analytics solutions. You will guide and support Data Scientist and Data Analyst colleagues in developing data and machine learning solutions. You will contribute to the development and execution of the Transavia Data & AI strategy.  You will be part of the Strategy, Data and Intelligence (SDI) team, consisting of the SDI Lead, Lead Data Engineer, Analytics Translators, Data Scientists, Data Engineers, Data Analysts and Business Consultants. You will maintain close contact with the team members and our colleagues from Transavia France. In this position you will report to the SDI lead.  Who are you? To start with, you have a higher education or academic level of working and thinking. You have 5-7 years of relevant work experience in a data science position and therefore thorough knowledge from both theory and practice on many data science areas like advanced analytics, simulation, machine learning, operations research, statistics, data visualization, software engineering, model interpretation etc. You have demonstrable knowledge of data science and you can stimulate craftmanship among data scientist and data analyst colleagues. You want to continuously improve your knowledge level and skill set in the field of/regarding data science. You get energy from leading, guiding and coaching people and organisations. You are able to make the AI solutions relatable and relevant for the business You are ‘versatile’, i.e. constantly open to change. This is necessary to ensure we become continuously better at what we do and evolve along with the continuously changing world around us. Having worked as a lead data scientist in a medium sized team is a huge plus. Fluent in both Dutch and English.  What can you expect from us? First of all, a nice place to work at Schiphol Oost (but now from home); The responsibility to shape your job as you see fit; Plenty of scope for personal development; Flexible working hours; Friendly and enthusiastic colleagues; Last but not least, if you are an avid flyer in your free time, our ISA scheme (excellent fares if seats are available) is absolutely for you! Based on knowledge and experience we make you an offer between € 4468,43 and € 7546,30 gross per month, based on a fulltime employment.  About Transavia Our motto is: "We make low cost feel good". We happily go the extra mile for our passengers and for each other. The atmosphere in our organisation is characterised by our passionate staff with a ‘green’ heart! Every day we work as a team to achieve a common goal: a memorable customer experience.  As an independent airline within the Air France-KLM Group, we have been operating scheduled and charter flights to more than 100 destinations, primarily in Europe and North Africa, for the past 50 years. There are about 2,500 colleagues working at Transavia: 230 in Technical Services, 600 pilots, 1,300 cabin attendants and 370 office staff.  Transavia is a dynamic organisation (never a dull moment) that continuously evolves with the changing world of aviation. Would you like to work in an environment with enthusiastic, decisive colleagues who look out for each other? Do change and innovation give you a boost of energy and do you feel right at home in an environment where you can manage your own work? Then we would like to hear from you.  Want to apply? Are you the Lead Data Scientist we are looking for and who can further enhance the power of our team? If so, apply via the button below. Any questions about this opportunity? You can contact us via recruitment@transavia.com  Your job application procedure You apply! We will assess your application within two weeks and let you know whether you will be invited for an interview. First contact: We will call you to get acquainted and to schedule an appointment. The first (digital) interview: There will be an initial interview with a leader and a team member. Is there a match? Then this is followed by an assessment consisting of a homework assignment, a presentation of your results and a technical interview. Is the match complete? Then we will plan a final interview and after that we will gladly make you an offer and your journey at Transavia can begin! You will need to go through a screening procedure first for (aviation) security requirements. Acquisition for this vacancy is not welcomed! A background check is included in the procedure.

title: Business Intelligence analist
summary:
Stakeholders hierbij zijn IT, marketing, product management en sales.
Voor het Europese kantoor van Nissan in Amsterdam kan jij aan de slag als Business…
description: Functieomschrijving Excel, SQL en Tableau kenners opgelet! Voor het Europese kantoor van Nissan in Amsterdam kan jij aan de slag als Business Intelligence analist. In de rol van Business Intelligence analist ben jij, met jouw internationale team, er verantwoordelijk voor dat grote hoeveelheden data gestructureerd gaan terugkomen in heldere dashboards en worksheets. Als Business Intelligence analist word je betrokken bij het brainstormen over hoe deze dashboards te bouwen; wat moet er voor wie en op welke manier aan data terugkomen? En niet alleen voor Nederland, maar voor heel Europa. Vervolgens ga jij prototypes maken van deze dashboards. Tevreden? Dan ga je deze dashboards testen bij een selectie medewerkers. Nog steeds tevreden? Dan zie je jouw dashboards terug bij kantoren door heel Europa. Concreet: Je gaat prototype dashboards bouwen die er voor zorgen dat grote hoeveelheden data voor verschillende afdelingen, in verschillende landen, inzichtelijk worden. Een stadium daarvoor zal je ook meedenken over wat deze dashboards kunnen doen; naast het bouwen denk je dus ook mee over de inhoud. Je zal veel communiceren met verschillende stakeholders over wat de perfecte manier is om data zo te gebruiken dat iedereen binnen het bedrijf er op een betere manier mee om kan gaan. Stakeholders hierbij zijn IT, marketing, product management en sales. Arbeidsvoorwaarden Prachtige werkervaring op de aftersales afdeling van een internationaal aansprekende naam. Een bruto salaris afhankelijk van kennis en ervaring, maar tussen €2200,- en €2600,- per maand op fulltime basis. Reiskosten worden uiteraard vergoed. Er is een dertiende maand. Functie eisen Je gaat aan de slag in een analytische functies waarbij verschillende programma’s worden gebruikt. Belangrijk is daarom dat je op professioneel niveau kan werken met Excel en SQL en dat je een basiskennis hebt van Tableau en Visual basics. De functie wordt uitgevoerd op wo/hbo niveau en het gaat je zeker helpen wanneer je een opleiding volgt / hebt gevolgd in de richting van dataverwerking, bedrijfskunde of waar veel data in verwerkt wordt. Omdat je aan de slag gaat in een internationaal bedrijf is een professionele beheersing van de Engelse taal een vereiste. Het eerste contract zal tot 31 maart zijn, waarna een vervolg besproken wordt. Interessant of heb je een vraag? Bel ons op 020-6124945 of stuurt een mailtje naar amsterdam@justinrecruitment.nl

title: Web Analist (32 uur per week)
summary:
Minimaal 5 jaar relevante werkervaring in (online) marketing.
De Web Analist is de vraagbaak voor data-gerelateerde vragen in alle online marketing en…
description: De Web Analist is de vraagbaak voor data-gerelateerde vragen in alle online marketing en communicatie activiteiten rondom Zwitserleven. Jij voorziet het multidisciplinaire team van de juiste data en insights, om samen te zorgen voor een uitgekiende complete Customer Journey. Op basis van jouw inzichten, dashboards en testen wordt de online ervaring van een klant vormgegeven en verbeterd.  Je werkt nauw samen met de (online) Marketeers om verbeteringen te vinden waar nog weinigen ze gevonden hebben. Tevens heb je verstand van conversie optimaliserende inzichten, en ontwerp je samen met de Marketeers de juiste testen om de online conversie voor Zwitserleven te verbeteren. Je werkt in het multidisciplinaire team samen met oa. Product Owner en Developers om te zorgen dat inzichten een goede online doorvertaling krijgen, maar ook om te borgen dat data vanaf het moment van ontwikkelen correct wordt gemeten.  Je bent analytisch sterk en weet uit complexe datasets de juiste inzichten te destilleren. Je denkt kritisch na over zaken, en bent ook niet bang om deze te uiten met een juiste onderbouwing. Je hebt een passie voor cijfers en fact based werken en deinst niet terug voor technische vraagstukken rondom web analytics. Je weet jouw enthousiasme voor web analytics ook goed op anderen over te brengen. Je rapporteert aan de Manager Marketing.  Jij zorgt voor de fact based inzichten waarop je met het multidisiplinaire team online journeys optimaliseert Je bent verantwoordelijk voor het meten van online targets en de naleving op resultaat Inrichten van de verbeterideeën van bijv. online uitingen en landing pagina’s in A/B test software Samenwerken in het creëren van dashboards met Business Intelligence waarbij je verschillende datastromen combineert tot duidelijke inzichten en statistieken voor het MT en de Marketeers  Een WO denkwijze gecombineerd met een HBO werkinstelling Je hebt ervaring met web analytics (Google/ Adobe) of bent opgeleid in de richting van Marketing (Research) Minimaal 5 jaar relevante werkervaring in (online) marketing Je focust op ‘actionable insights’ en bent resultaatgericht en communicatief Je brengt je verhaal met overtuiging, zowel in het Engels als in het Nederlands (in woord en schrift) Ervaring met A/B testen, data visualisatie en databases is een vereiste Je hebt voldoende technische kennis om analytics implementaties te kunnen toetsen en beoordelen Je bent bekent met wet en regelgeving rondom oa. AVG en de telecommunicatie wet (cookiewet) Je bent flexibel, stressbestendig en hebt geen 9-5 mentaliteit Je bent bekend met de principes SAFe/ Agile Goed gevoel voor humor  COMPETENTIES Je bent specialist binnen je vakgebied en neemt altijd fact-based beslissingen Je bent in staat om complexe vraagstukken eenvoudig te rapporteren toe te lichten aan de organisatie en hier helder over te communiceren. Je bent een teamspeler die eigen belang ondergeschikt stelt aan het teambelang Je houdt van zaken oppakken en proberen. Minder praten, meer doen Je bent uitstekend in staat om vanuit de klant te denken Je hebt een scherp en analytisch vermogen en houdt van cijfers Signaleert kansen en handelt ernaar; is niet afwachtend maar begint zelf  Wij bieden Een dynamische werk omgeving en fijne collega’s Een goede balans tussen werk en vrije tijd (Het Nieuwe Werken) Veel ruimte voor opleidingen en cursussen (Persoonlijke ontwikkeling) Speciale development-programma’s voor starters en professionals Flexibele werktijden Aandacht voor gezondheid Een goed salaris en een 13e maand  Ben je er klaar voor? Herken je jezelf in de beschrijving stuur ons dan nu je cv. Voor verdere vragen kan je contact opnemen met Diederick Kavelaars, Talent Acquisition, +31 683 632 417.

title: Experienced Data Analyst
summary:
“Gaming Together, Wherever You Are!”.
GamePoint is one of the largest social game developing companies, based in the Netherlands.
What do we have to offer.
description: “Gaming Together, Wherever You Are!” GamePoint is one of the largest social game developing companies, based in the Netherlands. Every month we welcome large groups of unique players on Web, Facebook and Mobile from all over the world with our synchronous Bingo, Social Casino, Card and Board games. Some of our games are among the top 100 best earning games in the world. Due to the unique social features, users play an average of 120 minutes per day within our games. Our current top games are GamePoint Bingo, RoyalDice, GamePoint Casino and CardParty. We are committed to entertain and support a live global audience, building long term relationships with all of our players on a daily basis. Our dedication to localized community management and support is second to none.  Operating from The Hague and Kiev, we cultivate brilliant talented team members and we only hire the best from around the globe to complement our growing teams. Since our founding in 1998, we’ve been building a company where we take risks and dream big. We currently have 160 international team members embracing a common vision for quality experiences and all have a passion for gaming. And together, we bring fun and entertainment to our millions of players across the globe!  See for more information our corporate Website: www.gamepoint.biz or play our great games on www.gamepoint.com.  Position Summary – Data Analyst The Data Analyst will analyze current and past campaign efforts, query millions of users and their data and identify trends. With the gained insights you will be supporting decisions and presenting findings to various stakeholders. You will work with colleagues across our organization to help them understand our Social Games and Player behaviour with data. For example, improving helping the Marketing team understand the impact of specific campaigns and promotions, or the Product team to show the adaptation/ impact of a new feature in our Games. You will work together with our two data colleagues and our head of data, and work closely together with the IT department.  Note: EU residency is mandatory  Key Responsibilities Assists the team with analyzes, identifies and lead actionable data insights to solve real complex challenges to build the most successful web/mobile gaming platform, with games played by millions Analyzes current and past campaign efforts, query millions of users and their data and identify trends With the gained insights supports decisions and presenting findings to various stakeholders Under the supervision of HD BI reports to the Monetization (Sales), Marketing, User Acquisition & Game Development teams and delivers insights / reports fitting their needs Translates data into actionable reports and Tableau dashboards, Able to analyze trends that support our business questions, and helps to further develop our various products/ Games Collects terabytes of data from different platforms, merges it into data sets, and identifies actionable insights Works on new projects and apply cutting edge technology to further improve analytics across departmentsCreates automatic processes to verify the quality of our Data Understand our business and its various products, translate its needs into actionable data analysis and dashboards Work on new projects and apply cutting edge technology to further improve analytics across departments  Educational & (Work) Experience Bachelor or Master degree in IT, Math or Statistics Minimum 2-4-years’ experience in an analytical field – Video Games is a plus (internships not included)  Key Skills Required Ability to Create / Optimize SQL code on a bigdata environment Knowledge AWS Redshift / PostgreSQL is a plus Ability to create visualizations of your code, solid knowledge of Tableau is required Excel | Pivot tables, table structure, formula creation Experience with Python (2.x,3.x) and creating ETL scripts  Additional qualifications Fluent in English, both written and verbally Comfortable in presenting analysis to higher Management  What do we have to offer We offer a competitive package packed with pension benefits, a lunch arrangement and a fun and casual work environment, frequent team building events and lots of more fun and perks! We have a casual international work environment in a beautiful historical building in the middle of the center of The Hague!  Contact Do you have what it takes? Submit your resume and motivational letter explaining your history and why you think you should be a good fit for this role, our team. If you would like more information regarding this unique position within GamePoint B.V. please contact Inge van der Burg (HR Manager) by phone: +31 (0)70 – 3110110 or by e-mail: iburg@gamepoint.com.  See for more info information our corporate Website: www.gamepoint.biz  Please do not contact us for sales purposes

title: Presales Solution Consultant
summary: Orchestrate business processes from a central platform across the end-to-end insurance value chain, from marketing through underwriting and claims.
description: CCS enables insurers to play in the top of digital insurance and to make the step to embedded and real-time connected insurance. Thanks to our 35-year track record, we are able to understand and meet the challenges of the insurance industry. That is why over 2.000 organizations trust our expertise and software solutions. Headquartered in the Netherlands we are able to serve clients all over Europe with our Digital Insurance Platform. With our platform you can Integrate any technology and free data from silos so it’s shareable, usable and powerful. Orchestrate business processes from a central platform across the end-to-end insurance value chain, from marketing through underwriting and claims. And we make you Accelerate your digital transformation and future ready, innovating with OpenAPI technology and IoT connectivity. Presales Solution Consultant Due to our wide variety of digital solutions for the insurance market and our ambition for international growth, we endeavour to expand and strengthen our Presales department for the DACH region and we are looking for a Presales Solution Consultant. CCS´ goal is to deliver rapid, value-driven customer solutions for complex business problems. Our Presales Solution Consultants play a key role in determining how the CCS solutions optimally supports our customer´s business ambitions. Your responsibility will be together with the rest of the sales team to align the customer’s business requirements to the native CCS Digital Insurance Platform functionality and to construct a customer centric market message that articulates the benefits of the solution to the customer. You will have a deep knowledge of the core business processes and best practices in the insurance industry - and you’ll enhance that by acquiring an understanding of the specific business drivers for their program. A collaborative and empathetic relationship with the business stakeholders will be central to your role. Your commitment to their success should never be in doubt. You’ll also be working with developers, typically in Agile scrum teams, helping them convert the business requirements into technical activities and verifying that their deliverables satisfy the acceptance criteria. You’ll also be a key channel back to the CCS product management team as they look to drive innovation and improvements into future releases of the CCS products. What you will do: In order to be able to offer the best possible solutions, you will make an inventory of the wishes of our customers through interviews with various stakeholders, so that you best understand the customer needs. Sparring with colleagues from sales and product development to come up with a suitable solution for the customer. Provide support to Sales colleagues with solution-related questions. You are a sparring partner, knowledge expert and a source of information for customers and your colleagues in Sales and Product Development. Our solutions not only consist of our own development, but also those of our business partners. As part of the deal team, you ensure a qualitative interpretation of the sales process and an excellent structure from proposal to solution and price. In this position it is crucial to know the business of our customers, our services and software solutions and that of our business partners. To this end, you actively participate in on-the-job, internal and external training within your field in order to become an expert of our own solutions as well as those of our business partners. You You are a passionate and experienced presales professional, with knowledge of software solutions, preferably middleware solutions. You have a healthy level of entrepreneurship, decisiveness and analytical skills. You take responsibility for your work and are focused on achieving results together. You have: A completed BSc / MSc /WO high level education with a strong affinity with business administration or IT / information technology. At least 5 years of experience as a presales consultant, a business architect, a functional architect or a business analyst with the ability to present yourself to a C-level audience and an interest in transitioning into a more business development and sales-oriented role. Knowledge of the insurance industry is required. Excellent oral and written communication skills in the German and English language (Dutch will be an advantage). Ability to travel between the target territory and the HQ in Woerden, NL. Between 70 and 100 days of travel annually must be expected. You combine a strategic vision with a hands-on mentality to actually achieve set goals. In this you make optimal use of data, visualizations and presentations. You are a team player, customer-oriented and assertive. Strong technical skills related to Business Intelligence, Databases, software architecture, analytics is an advantage. You have the drive and interest to delve into technical developments. Our offer Our head office is in Woerden, while our customers are located all over the Netherlands and we are expanding further to other countries and at first the DACH region. You will be working in the DACH region. CCS practices and extensive working-from-home (WFH) policy and you will go to our offices in Munich, in Dusseldorf and from time to time to the head office in Woerden, NL. You will be part of the CCS international pre-sales team, reporting to the CCO and receiving business directions from the Regional Sales Director. We offer you: A full-time position for 40 hours a week. A good salary and fringe benefits. Even if you don't want to miss us, this function also includes 25 vacation days and 8.33% vacation pay. Enjoy sports, with or without colleagues: CCS has a company fitness scheme. Collective insurance Laptop + phone Lease car With us you get the space to be in charge and to determine your development. Of course this includes: Training and development opportunities; Opportunity to grow internationally with us. We are CCS We are CCS, an innovative IT company in the insurance industry. From our office in Woerden we work together with our teams in India and Poland on innovative software solutions. Not only do we find ourselves innovative, others notice it as well: we won the EFMA Innovation Award for our Marketplace. We know as much about insurance as we do about IT; we are convinced that we can offer our customers the best solutions possible. Our target group consists of insurers, MGA’s, insurance brokers, service providers and the intermediary. Our team consists of passionate professionals who work together in an informal working atmosphere. Witness the customer focus, personal initiative and knowledge transfer in all teams. Hard work is just as important as having fun with each other, which is why there are various company activities such as football quiz, tennis tournament and game and poker evenings. Let’s connect! Are you as excited about CCS as we are? Get in touch with us! We would like to receive your CV and motivation at recruitment@ccs.nl, via the form below or directly via LinkedIn. For questions about the procedure or further information about the position, please contact our recruiter Valeska Visser on +31 6 82321425 or email the above email address.

title: Software tester | Muziekindustrie
summary:
Daarnaast bestaat het team uit een aantal customer service medewerkers, 1 data analist en er werkt 3 man op de marketing afdeling.
HBO/WO werk- en denkniveau.
description: Webwinkel | Internationaal | Amsterdam | Informeel | Klantencontact | Doorgroeimogelijkheden | Test automation | Lead | Selenium | Agile | 70K | 38 vakantiedagen Bedrijf Houd je van muziek en zou je willen bijdragen aan de meest bekende webshop met producten die alles te maken hebben met licht en geluid? Deze organisatie groeit steeds harder en in Europa zijn ze bijna de grootste in hun branche. . In Nederland en België hebben zij diverse winkels, maar daarnaast zijn er jaarlijks miljoenen klanten die hun online services gebruiken. In Nederland hebben ze 3 vestigingen met in totaal ruim 400 medewerkers. Deze vacature gaat om een functie op het kantoor in Amsterdam en hier werkt ruim 60 man. Het is een informele organisatie met korte lijnen en veel flexibiliteit. Omdat er vaste dagen thuis kan worden gewerkt, komt het regelmatig voor dat er vanuit huis wordt ingebeld voor een scrum stand-up. Mocht je creatieve ideeën hebben dan is er de mogelijkheid om 10% van je tijd te besteden aan eigen projecten, en als je 40 uur per week werkt dan heb je recht op maar liefst 38 vrije dagen. Team Momenteel is er één senior PHP developer werkzaam waar je mee zult samenwerken. Daarnaast bestaat het team uit een aantal customer service medewerkers, 1 data analist en er werkt 3 man op de marketing afdeling. Op het hoofdkantoor werkt 15 man op de development afdeling en dat team zal je eens in de twee weken bijwonen. Naast deze meetings zijn de lijntjes met het team op het hoofdkantoor kort door veel telefonisch contact en stand-ups. Er wordt Agile gewerkt in twee-wekelijkse sprints. Op het moment is een transitie gaande van de web omgeving, waarin jij volop de vrijheid krijg om jouw ideeën in te brengen en bij te dragen aan vernieuwingen van het systeem. Functie Het is belangrijk dat je ervaring hebt met testautomatisering want dit kan nog naar een hoger niveau gebracht worden. Naast het opzetten van de testautomatisering zal je je bezighouden met het implementeren van nieuwe testtools en het uitbreiden van bestaande tools. Het opsporen en uitwerken van bugs zal ook tot je taken behoren. Je zal zelfstandig aan de slag gaan maar je zal ook veel in contact staan met de developers op de andere vestiging en je hebt regelmatig contact met klanten. Er zijn grote doorgroeimogelijkheden en ook de mogelijkheid om binnen te komen als test coördinator. Vraag HBO/WO werk- en denkniveau Minimaal 3 jaar werkervaring als software tester Kennis van testautomatisering Communicatief vaardig Beheersing van de Nederlandse taal Aanbod Inhouse Salaris tot € 70.000,- 8% vakantiegeld Mogelijkheid voor 32, 36 of 40 uur 38 vakantiedagen Flexibele werktijden Thuiswerken 10% van je tijd besteden aan eigen projecten/ideeën Besturingssysteem van jouw voorkeur kiezen (Linux/Max/Windows) Opleidingsbudget Informele sfeer, gezamenlijke lunches en uitjes Reiskostenvergoeding Bedrijfsfitnessregeling Personeelskorting op het assortiment Perfect bereikbaar met OV Interesse Lieke@layer.nl 06 82 90 97 04 / 020 238 6984

title: Data Analist
summary: Stel je eens voor… je bent de data-spil om voor Know Your Customer (KYC)-processen informatie en inzichten te leveren door middel van rapportages en dashboards.
description: Stel je eens voor… je bent de data-spil om voor Know Your Customer (KYC)-processen informatie en inzichten te leveren door middel van rapportages en dashboards. Hiermee voed je de besluitvorming op deze processen en zorg je ervoor dat er gerichte klantcommunicatie kan plaatsvinden. Over deze functie  Als Data Analist voorzie je dus in de behoefte van de business met betrekking tot data-gerelateerde vragen. Je beheerst alle facetten om vanuit (complexe) data de juiste boodschap over te brengen om besluitvorming te ondersteunen. Je denkt mee over de business rules en bedenkt tegelijkertijd waar je de benodigde data vandaan haalt. Een voorbeeld hiervan is het identificeren van klantgroepen op basis van product en sociaal demografische kenmerken in het kader van KYC. Dat doe je door data uit verschillende bronnen te ontsluiten, samen te voegen en weer te geven in tabellen, visualisaties en actiegerichte werklijsten. Je bent verantwoordelijk voor zowel de ontwikkeling als het beheer van dashboards en rapportages. Verder denk je continu mee over de verbetering van onze KYC-datamarts.  Over jou  Ben jij klaar voor de volgende stap in je loopbaan als Data Analist? Check dan of je jezelf herkent in onderstaand profiel: Je hebt een afgeronde studie op hbo- of wo-niveau Je hebt minimaal 1 jaar ervaring als Data Analist Je bent bekend met de aanpak en methodieken van informatieanalyse Je bent bekend met data-bewerking, datawarehouses, data-kwaliteit en data-analyse Daarnaast is het heel fijn als je al kennis hebt van SQL, SAS Enterprise Guide, Excel, Python, Cognos Analytics, Power BI, Business Objects en datawarehouse-concepten en data-modelleringstechnieken.  Wat wij bieden Terwijl jij je als Data Analist inzet bij onze opdrachtgever, zetten wij ons in voor jou. Gedetacheerd worden door Brunel betekent namelijk dat je bij ons in dienst treedt. Bij ons draait het om jou, dus houden wij altijd een oogje in het zeil. Hoe uit zich dat? Je hebt een eigen Brunel-Consultant die jou begeleidt, check-ups doet, nieuwe projecten voor je vindt en jouw carrière en ontwikkeling vooropstelt. Daarnaast, want daar blijft het niet bij, stellen we diverse opleidingsmogelijkheden aan je voor waardoor jij je zowel op zakelijk als op persoonlijk vlak kunt blijven ontwikkelen. Je ontvangt een goed salaris en dan hebben we het nog niet eens over al die bonuskansen gehad. Ook met de secundaire arbeidsvoorwaarden zit het wel snor. Wij hebben tenslotte ook een reputatie hoog te houden. Over ons Je kent Brunel als zakelijk dienstverlener; wereldwijd actief en gespecialiseerd in projectmanagement, detachering en consultancy in de vakgebieden Finance & Risk, Engineering, IT, Legal, Marketing & Communicatie, HR en alle disciplines in de olie- en gasindustrie. Dit doen we samen met zo'n 14.500 collega’s in 44 landen. Brunel Finance & Risk is gespecialiseerd in het detacheren van vakspecialisten binnen de financiële dienstverlening. Dankzij onze medewerkers en onze manier van werken onderhouden wij goede relaties met alle gerenommeerde financiële spelers in de branche, met wie we jou graag in contact brengen. Onze kernwaarden zijn terug te zien in onze deelname aan en sponsoring van de Volvo Ocean Race: ambition, teamwork and operational excellence. Vandaar ook ons motto: Navigate The Future. Herkenbaar? Welkom aan boord!  WO Bachelor

title: Web Analyst
summary:
A few solid years of Online marketing experience is a good start.
Surprisingly, all of this has been achieved without spending a whole lot of money on marketing…
description: There’s this website. It’s pretty amazing. It’s so amazing that it’s been awarded website of the year. Not just once or twice, but 10 times in a row. And it’s still not enough. They want more. This is where you come in. Tell me more! With their unique E-commerce offering, this company has taken the European market by storm and they’re looking to stay on top. They’ve spent the last 15 years building a community of millions of satisfied customers, are active in a number of different countries and already get over 200.000 daily visitors on their website. Surprisingly, all of this has been achieved without spending a whole lot of money on marketing. Now imagine what they could achieve if they did. Or better yet, don’t imagine and just help them do it. What do they need me to do? Not much. Except for collecting and analyzing all website and marketing data, and extracting valuable insights to continuously improve the customer experience. Easy, right? Luckily, you won’t be doing it alone but will be working closely together with the performance marketeer and a number of other colleagues from different departments. Together you will determine what areas to focus on and what actions to take based on the insights you create. By building well-structured dashboards and reports, you help everyone else get better at their job. Sounds great, need me to bring anything? A few solid years of Online marketing experience is a good start. It’d be nice if you can actually back it up with a relevant degree but we’re focused more on your mindset than your resume. As long as you have a solid understanding of online marketing principles, are at home in SEO and SEA, and know a thing or two about Excel and web analytics platforms, it’s worth having a talk. Sure, they use fancy tools and don’t shy away from buzzwords but what really matters is whether you deliver. You have to like working independently (which is not the same as alone) and want to truly take ownership of both the successes and failures of your work. That’s me but I don’t work for free… Of course, you don’t. Which is why you’ll start with a base salary between € 40.000 and € 60.000,- gross a year. On top of that, you’ll receive a very competitive secondary package with pretty much anything you can imagine. The most exciting part of this opportunity though has to be the fact that you’ll be responsible for taking an already successful brand to even greater heights.

title: Product Marketing Manager
summary:
Conduct marketing research to gain insight into the CTI market;
The Product Marketing Manager plays a central role in EclecticIQ’s marketing and product…
description: We are looking for either a highly skilled all-round B2B Product Marketing Manager with a background in tech who can quickly familiarize themselves with our threat intelligence products and the cyber security market. Alternatively, someone who has strong knowledge of the cyber security market and has the ambition to sharpen their Product Marketing skills can also succeed in the role. The Product Marketing Manager plays a central role in EclecticIQ’s marketing and product strategies. Owner of our product positioning, they are the masterminds behind our differentiating messages, and provide the content and training our sales and marketing teams need to grow our revenue. Because they know our product and our market like no one else does, they are key in our product definition process and will effectively help shape the future of our portfolio. Responsibilities Continuously execute against the mission of establishing Product Leadership; Conduct marketing research to gain insight into the CTI market; Conduct Win/Loss interviews to learn how we can improve our products and services; Analyze competitive landscape as input for proposition & battle cards; Develop and/or refine proposition including positioning, naming, high-level messaging; Coordinate and plan product launches; Create/update copy and raw visual assets for all product content (e.g. use cases, webpages, data sheets, FAQs, battle cards, playbook, sales deck, etc.); Lead and coordinate Sales enablement trainings; Successfully collaborate with your immediate team (ca. 70 and internal stakeholders (Product, Sales, Presales, CSM), reporting to the VP Marketing; Build and maintain professional relationships in a client-facing role.  MSc in relevant field; 5 years of B2B Tech Product Marketing or 5 years of Product Management or Sales Engineering in Cyber Security domain; Demonstratable work experience in a SaaS environment; Excellent command of English; Adaptability paired with a hands-on and self-driven attitude; Creative mind-set and outstanding problem-solving skills; Dependability and a good sense of teamwork; The ideal candidate has experience with one or more of the following B2B product marketing activities (i.e. either has set it-up or been responsible for running the activity): Market research: Collecting expert opinions, market data or market research to discover market trends. Win/Loss analysis: Interviewing prospects and customers and find out what drove their decision to do business or not. Ability to distinguish the structural issues that influence long term success from incidents. Competitive analysis: Analyzing key competitor products down to feature level using publicly available information and by hunting down and talking to subject matter experts. Based on the analysis, ability to identify strengths and weaknesses and deduct the most likely strategic direction that competitors will take. Market segmentation: Identifying attractive market segments that can be targeted with relevant propositions by needs or other factors and their sizes. Positioning: Determining appropriate messaging and positioning against external competition and internal products. Developing an understanding of the customer’s decision-making unit and sales cycle. Vision and evangelizing: Representing the product externally at conferences, with the press, customers and industry analysts. Product launch planning: Creating and running launch and go-to-market plans. Ensuring Sales is trained and communicate across the business. Sales & marketing content: Writing short product features, video scripts or campaign related messaging (not as a content creator nor copy writer). Working with them effectively to create high-quality assets like white-papers. Creating use cases, case studies and sales battle cards. Benefits We offer a full-time position with a market conform salary and 24 annual holidays. On top of that, we have a hip, home-like working place in the heart of Amsterdam where you can work with (and build) the latest technology. Our teams are humble, effective, transparent and life long learners - while we love experiments and research, we are not afraid to make decisions. We are backed by international investors to build the future together! About EclecticIQ EclecticIQ is a global threat intelligence, hunting and response technology provider. Its clients are some of the most targeted organizations, globally. To build tomorrow’s defences today, they have to understand the threats against them – and align their efforts and investments to mitigate their risks. EclecticIQ helps governments, large enterprises and service providers manage threat intelligence, create situational awareness and adopt an intelligence-led cybersecurity approach. EclecticIQ extended its focus towards hunting and response with the acquisition of Polylogyx’s endpoint technology in 2020. Founded in 2014, EclecticIQ operates globally with offices across Europe, North America, and via value-add partners.  More info: www.eclecticiq.com In case of any questions or queries, please reach out to our Talent Management Partner at brenda@eclecticiq.com. The selection process may include security screening and/or background checks.

title: Business Analyst
summary:
Operational modifications and marketing evaluations.
For our client, a multi-metal organisation, we are looking for an experienced Business Analyst with a…
description: For our client, a multi-metal organisation, we are looking for an experienced Business Analyst with a financial background. You will be part of the Financial Planning and Analysis (FP&A) department. The FP&A plays a crucial role within the Finance Department! Key responsibilities Strategic financial planning and analysis. Produce monthly/quarterly management reporting on operational and financial results, consolidated/per site. Develop and interpret financial data/analysis in conjunction with operations management to make recommendations for business and cost improvement. Coordinate discussion and develop models to support strategic operational analyses, including business viability evaluations, operational modifications and marketing evaluations. Maintenance and operation of Group strategic financial models, mining valuation and impairment models. Financial / operational analysis and interpretation of variances vs plans on mining/refining site results. Support for controlling function. Provide active management, guidance, & coaching of mine/refining site BAs. Provide site FMs/BAs with specialised analysis. Build mining/smelting variance analysis models. Coordinate budget cycle.
