title: Solutions Engineer Benelux
summary: Freshworks has received numerous accolades from analysts and media including making it to Forbes’ Cloud 100 list, Economic Times Startup of the Year, 2019…
description: Full-Time, Utrecht  Freshworks is looking for a self-motivated Solutions Engineer to complement our Pre-Sales team. You will play a critical role by being the technical expert that helps the sales team with new business opportunities as well as consulting or selling to the most strategic prospects and accounts at Freshworks.  Solutions Product Engineers are responsible for articulating our value proposition, architecting technology solutions and offering thought leadership to both business and technical audiences. This role is ideal for someone with mid-market software pre-sales experience in a SaaS or technology product organisation and experience with customer engagement/support, CRM, Web/Mobile applications, ITSM/ITIL and cloud based infrastructure. You have a passion for demoing solutions to prospects, great discovery skills, and the ability to act as a trusted advisor through all stages of the sales cycle to mid-market and enterprise customers.  Your role and responsibilities: Work with our regional sales teams to convert prospects to customers Prepare and deliver bespoke technical product demonstrations at client meetings, webinars and customers events using storylines that resonate with the target audience Deliver product messaging to highlight Freshworks value proposition through whiteboard and slide presentations, proof of concept management and RFP response documents Respond to various functional and technical customers questions and requirements as well as performing complex workflow analysis and in depth examinations of the interaction between Freshworks and the customer’s infrastructure Collect, assess and convey different customer requirements to central product management Become an advocate for our brand and actively promote our product solutions and services to prospects, potential and existing customers, and partners Collaborate with internal organizations (including sales, product management, and client services) to execute sales strategy Train sales teams on the Freshworks' products suite, technical aspects and new product features Our perfect match Minimum 3 years of relevant experience in a similar technical pre-sales role, preferably in SaaS or software product environments Bachelor's or Master’s degree in information technology, computer science or a related field is strongly preferred Ability to explain complex technical concepts in a simple manner. (“Tell me like I am five”) Excellent communicational and listening skills, high-level presentation and demonstration skills, enthusiastic about helping and serving clients, strongly customer and solution oriented personality Highly driven individual with an execution focus and a strong sense of urgency A standout colleague who enjoys working in a high-energy sales team environment Fluency in English and Dutch is a must. These are some benefits you can expect from us in return: Great chance to define the European presence of a hyper-growth global company Flexible career development path within an international environment. We are just getting started! Work closely with smart, inspiring and encouraging international colleagues within a flat organizational structure An excellent compensation package, including bonus and equity Sounds interesting? Then please apply here via our website and share your salary expectations as well as the earliest date you can join us. Please also feel free to visit our website to find out about other job postings.  About Freshworks:  Freshworks provides innovative customer engagement software for businesses of all sizes, making it easy for teams to acquire, close, and keep their customers for life. Freshworks Software-as-a-Service (SaaS) products provide a 360-degree view of the customer, are ready to go, easy to use, and offer quick return on investment. Headquartered in San Mateo, USA, Freshworks 2,000+ team members work in offices throughout the world. Freshworks has global offices in India, Singapore, Australia, UK, Netherlands, France and Germany. The company counts over 220,000 businesses in its customer-for-life community around the world including Honda, Bridgestone, Hugo Boss, University of Pennsylvania, Toshiba, Sling TV, Sotheby’s and Cisco.  Freshworks’ suite of products that transform the way world class organizations collaborate with customers and co-workers, include Freshdesk (Omni-channel customer support), Freshservice (IT Service Desk), Freshsales (Intuitive fully-integrated CRM), Freshmarketer (Marketing Automation Suite), Freshteam (HR Management System for growing teams), Freshchat (Modern messaging software) and Freshcaller (Cloud PBX system).  Freshworks has received numerous accolades from analysts and media including making it to Forbes’ Cloud 100 list, Economic Times Startup of the Year, 2019 LinkedIn Top 25 Companies to work for in India and a listing on the Magic Quadrant for CRM Customer Engagement & IT Service Management. While Freshworks has had incredible organic growth over the last few years, the company also has made targeted acquisitions that add critical capabilities to the portfolio including Natural Language Processing, Chatbots, Machine Learning, Social and Messaging Transformation. Freshworks has raised over $250 million in capital and is funded by Accel, CapitalG, Sequoia Capital and Tiger Global Management. More information is available at: www.Freshworks.com.

title: Senior Financial Analyst, Accounting (FTC 12 Months)
summary: Entertainment inc. is a fully integrated, broad-based entertainment company and a global leader in the creation, production, distribution, licensing and…
description: Business Unit Overview Warner Bros. Interactive Entertainment is a leading worldwide publisher, developer, licensor and distributor of entertainment content for the interactive space across all platforms, including console, handheld, mobile and PC-based gaming for both internal and third-party game titles. WB Games studios include Avalanche, Monolith Productions, NetherRealm Studios, Playdemic, Rocksteady Studios, TT Games, WB Games Boston, WB Games Montreal, WB Games New York, and WB Games San Francisco. Opportunity Overview Warner Bros. Entertainment inc. is a fully integrated, broad-based entertainment company and a global leader in the creation, production, distribution, licensing and marketing of all forms of entertainment and their related businesses. A WarnerMedia company, the Studio is home to one of the most successful collections of brands in the world and stands at the forefront of every aspect of the entertainment industry, from feature film, television and home entertainment production and worldwide distribution to DVD and Blu-ray, digital distribution, animation, comic books, videogames, product and brand licensing, and broadcasting.  The Daily As Senior Financial Analyst, you will plan and execute day-to-day general accounting activities and processes, which include support in management of the BPO provider deliverables for the designated Business Unit/Territory. You will provide support to numerous entities working with teams in the Netherlands, France, UK, Spain, US and India. Provide direction and guidance to the BPO organization and use discretion in managing a tight close calendar to ensure all work is correct and on-time. Position may involve international travel and require the role to work independently in making decisions while abroad with little to no supervision. Duties include general ledger stewardship, review financial statements and ensuring all business objectives are met. In addition, must provide guidance and make decisions in the areas of financial accruals, cash flow impact, internal controls and assessment of consolidated results. Provide the highest level of customer service to the end user business unit and/or international finance executives who rely on the accuracy and timeliness of the information provided. Interact with various Warner Bros. finance staff and decide how best to ensure business dependencies are being satisfied.  The Essentials 3+ years prior work experience within a similar industry BA/BS and equivalent work experience in a related field SAP or other leading ERP experience Prior work experience within a US GAAP reporting environment Advanced excel skills (mid-level for all other Microsoft office suite applications) Ability to learn/utilize various systems and applications Comfortable in an international shared service environment Strong business level English language skills  The Nice to Haves Accounting qualification is not a requirement, but ideally you will be working towards completion i.e. CPA, Chartered Accountant or equivalent Knowledge of Accounting related tasks to include Treasury Proactive, detail-oriented, exceptional organizational skills Strong analytical, problem-solving and judgment skills Strong written and oral communication skills Self-motivated and able to work under a deadline and handle multiple tasks Team player with strong interpersonal skills Ability to work independently as well as partner with others  Our people make WM the inspiring organisation it is today.  At WarnerMedia, our commitment starts with you! As a company of storytellers and journalists we have a responsibility to make sure we have a collection of voices and people whose stories reflect and connect with the global audiences and communities we serve.  WarnerMedia, and its suite of brands like Warner Bros., CNN, HBO Max, HBO, TNT, TBS, Cartoon Network, Adult Swim, Boomerang and many more, have long been committed to equity and inclusion as moral and business imperatives. It is essential that our content and creative partners reflect the diversity of our society and the world around us. Together with other production companies, networks, guilds, unions, talent agencies and others in the industry, WarnerMedia is committed to greater inclusion of people of color, women, the LGBTQ community, those with disabilities and other underrepresented groups in greater numbers both in front of and behind the camera  There really has never been a better and more exciting time to join WarnerMedia. For more information on how to join our company and our commitment to diversity and inclusion, please click here.

title: Allround (Global) Content Marketer
summary: Manage the brand identity by developing a (global) content marketing strategy to stimulate, teach and enlighten audiences of a more sustainable approach.
description: Wat ga je doen als Allround (Global) Content Marketer In this newly created and diverse role, you will play an intricate role in safeguarding the (new) VPS brand, identity and all VPS brand expressions with a sustainable approach. The role of Allround Content Marketer is creative and online driven at the same! Manage the brand identity by developing a (global) content marketing strategy to stimulate, teach and enlighten audiences of a more sustainable approach. This includes dotted lines with satellite hubs worldwide to streamline a Global Marketing and Communications Policy. In your day-to-day activities, you will work closely together with the Group Business Development Manager for Data & Analytics, especially with regards to managing the VPS website and customer portal. You will be in charge of producing engaging, high-quality content that builds upon VPS’ brand identity and boosts brand recognition and reputation, including press releases, circulars, white papers and sales brochures. You will be the key person responsible for managing the content, structure and performance of the VPS website and customer portal, which includes increasing website traffic generation through SEO and content marketing, as well as managing customer contacts. You will also be responsible for organising marketing campaigns (both online and offline), as well as coordinating (online) events and conferences. Wij zoeken een Allround (Global) Content Marketer met Bachelor’s Degree in Online Marketing or/and (Digital) Communications; A minimum of 3 years’ experience in B2B content marketing & communications (experience working in the maritime, chemical or industrial sector is a plus). The ability to work closely with the C-suite and senior management. The ability and a proven track record in finding new angles or insights and you’re comfortable collaborating with insights analysts to create data driven content.\ Basic HTML, CSS knowledge is essential (Drupal). You will find your way around website analytic tools (SEO, Adwords and Google Analytics). Excellent written and verbal communication skills (primarily English, Dutch) for different types of content, from blog posts, whitepapers, press releases, and web/social media content. Attitude/Personality You are a digitally savvy all-rounder, creative but at the same time incredibly organised. A natural problem-solver, and self-starter with the ability to manage a high-paced/result-oriented work culture. Best of both worlds: you have a hands-on approach (experienced managing content on websites + multiple social platforms) and a more strategic outlook. You’ll fit in as a self-starter in an informal and multicultural environment! Hier ga je werken VPS is the world leader in marine fuel testing and inspection and advisory services. VPS has introduced fuel testing for the marine industry in 1981 and has remained market leader in this segment since its inception. VPS is present in multiple locations around the world with its labs in Singapore, Houston, Fujairah, Manchester and its headquarters in Rotterdam (Barendrecht). VPS offers a dynamic, fast-moving working environment with plenty of challenges and support for those who are motivated to change the status quo. The role of Allround Content Marketer is a newly created role. You will be working closely with the global sales team, the Group Commercial Director, the CEO and the Executive Assistant to the Management Board ,You have a direct reporting line to t Group Business Development Manager. Dit kan je verwachten An interesting and highly responsible position within a leading international organization and world leader within the segment. A market-based salary. Company-based bonus arrangement. Premium-free pension. 50% compensation for medical expenses. Minimum of 29 days annual leave. International, dynamic and ambitious environment! Aantal uren Fulltime 37.5 uur Status Open

title: Senior Growth Hacker
summary:
Je hebt bij voorkeur minstens 2 jaar werkervaring als UX-researcher of data analist (bij voorkeur in online marketing/CRO);
Jij herkent jezelf in het volgende:
description: Wat ga je doen als senior growth hacker? Als Senior Growth Hacker ben je verantwoordelijk voor de zoektocht naar verbeteringen op de websites van onze klanten. Je enthousiasmeert de klant over jouw creatieve ideeën, maar je weet die ideeën natuurlijk ook goed te onderbouwen met kwantitatief en kwalitatief gebruikersonderzoek. Naast het uitpluizen van grote datasets en het afnemen van online surveys, ga je met een team van specialisten aan de slag om jouw verbeterkansen te valideren. Jouw werkzaamheden bestaan onder meer uit: Het adviseren en enthousiasmeren van klanten over website verbeterkansen die bijdragen aan hun resultaten en doelstellingen. Het aggregeren, analyseren en rapporteren van grote datasets (in bijvoorbeeld Google of Adobe analytics) om de grootste problemen of kansen op de websites bloot te leggen; Het uitvoeren van diverse soorten (online) gedragsonderzoek en het opzetten van research frameworks voor uiteenlopende klanten; Het kunnen verklaren van gebruikersgedrag op basis van psychologische of gedragswetenschappelijke principes. Heatmaps, surveys, recordings opzetten en analyseren; Het continu optimaliseren van de huidige processen en werkwijze binnen onze research-discipline; Solution design sessies begeleiden en bijwonen; Het coördineren en uitvoeren van usability research en klantinterviews; Actief op strategisch niveau met de klant meedenken; Je kennis en skills delen met je collega’s en klanten. Wie zoeken we? Sociaal, enthousiast en analytisch, dat zijn de eigenschappen die we in onze nieuwe Growth Hacker zoeken. Je bent vindingrijk en durft nieuwe oplossingen op tafel te gooien. Je werkt oplossingsgericht, resultaatgericht en klantgericht. Aangezien je de klant, maar ook de gebruikers zelf te woord staat, verwachten we daarnaast dat je communicatief vaardig bent. Jij herkent jezelf in het volgende: Je hebt bij voorkeur minstens 2 jaar werkervaring als UX-researcher of data analist (bij voorkeur in online marketing/CRO); Je kunt uitstekend overweg met analytics tools zoals Google Analytics of Adobe Analytics; Je kent je weg in Hotjar, Typeform, UserTesting en Usabilla; Je bent resultaatgericht en zoekt continu naar verbeteringen die bijdragen aan de doelstellingen van je klant. Je bent procesvaardig. Het bijhouden van taken en deadlines gaat je gemakkelijk af en je communiceert hier goed over; Je bent zelfstandig en verantwoordelijk Je hebt een relevant HBO/WO diploma in een sociaalwetenschappelijke discipline, data science, psychologie of gedragswetenschappen; Uitstekende beheersing van de Nederlands taal en goede beheersing van de Engelse taal in woord en geschrift; Je bent 32-40 uur per week beschikbaar. Wat bieden we? ClickValue is een sterk groeiend online marketingbureau met jaar op jaar een topnotering in de Emerce 100. Een bureau met leuke mensen, een bureau met ambitie en een bureau met veel oog voor ontspanning na inspanning. Maar er is meer dan dat. Bij ons krijg je: Een marktconform salaris, uiteraard; Uitstekende secundaire arbeidsvoorwaarden: volledige reiskostenvergoeding, riante bonusregeling, pensioenbijdrage, en een laptop en telefoon van de zaak Goede coaching en begeleiding en een ruim opleidingsbudget wat je naar eigen keus kan inzetten; Goede doorgroeimogelijkheden naar Managing- danwel Expert Consultant. 32-40 uur leuk werk, flexibel in te delen. Elke dag een uitgebreide verse lunch, een kast vol versnaperingen en heerlijke koffie. Waar kom je terecht? ClickValue is onderdeel van LevelUp Group, een samenwerking tussen meerdere online marketingbureaus. Jij komt te werken in ons CRO-team. Dit team bestaat uit ongeveer 25 CRO-toppers, van junioren tot senioren, die allen een andere specialisatie binnen de CRO-discipline hebben ontwikkeld. Samen zijn zij een goed geoliede machine gevuld met professionals die begrip voor elkaar hebben, elkaar in hun waarde laten en open staan voor een andere mening. Leren en groeien staan in dit team centraal, zowel in de discipline als persoonlijk. Naast het harde werken is er ook voldoende ruimte voor ontspanning en lol, zowel op de werkvloer als buiten werk om.

title: Senior Data Engineer
summary:
Tiqets is one of the fastest-growing tech scale-ups in the Netherlands.
To keep it moving fast and making culture more accessible, we’re hiring a Senior Data…
description: Tiqets is one of the fastest-growing tech scale-ups in the Netherlands. To keep it moving fast and making culture more accessible, we’re hiring a Senior Data Engineer to join us! Full-time · Amsterdam Who are we? We’re revolutionising the way people buy tickets to culture and attractions all over the world. Our technology lets users easily book tickets to the best attractions in seconds, meaning customers can enter museums, zoos, theme parks, and more faster than ever. We’re dedicated to bringing simplicity to the world of travel and entertainment. If you want to join our team, working as a Senior Data engineer, send us your CV. We might be looking for YOU! Our values Be accessible: Help out, communicate honestly, and be there for each other. Be remarkable: Have fun, think creatively, and celebrate great moments together. Skip the line: Be fast, flexible, and smart; take responsibility and push forward. Life at Tiqets What you will do Tiqets is positioned for explosive growth in the post-pandemic world, and we're looking for an experienced Data Engineer to help us scale our Data Platform for the future. As a Senior Data Engineer you will be involved in designing and building out much of the core Data Platform being used by the company. You will be working closely with Data Scientists, Analysts, Engineers as well as Product and Marketing teams to understand their needs and architect systems to solve these needs. You’re an experienced Data Engineer with a passion for architecting resilient and reliable data systems. You obsess over data quality and operational excellence, build clean and efficient Data Pipelines, and constantly look for ways to make systems better. You see the value in being a data-driven organization. Researching or building MVPs is an important part of your role. You’re curious about new technologies, both open-source and SaaS. You like to work in a fast-paced environment and iterate quickly while continuing to build for the medium and long term.  Responsibilities Architect, build and improve our Data Platform and analytics infrastructure Take ownership of large production data systems to support a variety of growing data needs Design and implement fault-tolerant, resilient ELT/ETL pipelines using open source tools like Airflow or hosted AWS/SaaS services Build monitoring tools to help meet our data quality/availability SLAs and ensure high-availability for our infrastructure Assist in making important technical decisions to help scale the Data Platform for the medium and long term Manage large-scale data infrastructure and take full ownership of what you build Be a leader on the Data team by mentoring junior team members and setting a high standard for best practices Support Data Scientists and Data Analysts on the team to productionize their workflows, while building tools and infrastructure to improve their speed and effectiveness  Minimum qualifications Bachelor or Master in Computer Science, or other relevant technical education. 5+ years experience working as an Engineer on data-intensive applications, architecting large-scale production systems Substantial experience with Python and other scripting languages with a track record of writing clean, efficient code Experience using core Data Engineering technologies like Airflow and DBT Worked with AWS services like Redshift, Kinesis, Lambda, Glue, Athena Strong understanding of relational databases like PostgreSQL, as well as Data Warehousing technologies like Redshift, BigQuery, Snowflake, etc.  Deep knowledge of SQL fundamentals, and solid understanding of best practices with respect to data warehousing, data modeling and schema design DevOps mindset; experience deploying applications using technologies like Kubernetes and Docker on AWS Experience with event pipelines and real-time streaming use cases  Nice to Have Experience Business Intelligence tools like Looker, Tableau, Data Studio Machine Learning technologies like AWS Sagemaker and MLflow SaaS tools like Segment, Fivetran, Stitch, Snowplow Experience in the e-commerce domain Our Data Engineering Stack AWS  Python  Airflow  Redshift  DBT  Looker Perks & Benefits at Tiqets Young, dynamic, international working environment Bright, welcoming office located in the centre of Amsterdam Opportunity to make an impact in the fastest growing tech scaleup 20% personal Tiqets discount code to explore great museums/venues worldwide Annual company getaway to undisclosed location Health insurance Tiqets learning academy: skill lab, group & individual learningTuesday's Pizza & beer sessions Friday drinks Visa sponsorship Summer party Competitive salary and paid holiday leave Sports activities: free gym, running sessions, boot-camp, football, climbing and more Pension scheme and travel compensation Everyone - employed at Tiqets will receive a monthly contribution for working from home Everyone - employed at Tiqets can reimburse home work space necessities Meet the Team

title: Accounting Analyst – Sonos
summary:
As an Accounting Analyst within Sonos, you are working at a fast-paced and dynamic tech-minded organization.
In this position, you report directly to the Senior…
description: As an Accounting Analyst within Sonos, you are working at a fast-paced and dynamic tech-minded organization. Sonos is constantly developing new products and experiencing rapid growth. In this position, you report directly to the Senior Manager International Accounting. Further you will work together with the AP and AR colleagues and the Corporate Accounting team. As Accounting Analyst you will focus on the accounting for Sonos EMEA entities, as well as the preparation of the P&L and the monthly reconciliation of balance sheet accounts. In this position Sonos will hand you all the tools you need to develop yourself to a senior and professional Accounting specialist. The right person will have the experience, passion, and energy to successfully fulfill a wide variety of accounting and analyzing responsibilities. The ideal candidate for Sonos is someone who brings a unique perspective to the table and besides transparency and ownership, your list of values tops respect and collaboration, so you’re not like everyone else. Besides this, you enjoy a challenge and you are not afraid to make mistakes because you learn from them and bounce back quickly. Last but not least, you love to listen. You start every interaction from a place of listening and seeking to understand and you’re culturally connected.  Tasks and responsibilities: You own and drive the monthly close activities for multiple areas/companies (US GAAP and local GAAP); Enter monthly accounting journals, reconcile ledgers and other records detailing financial business transactions; You will reconcile balance sheet accounts and P&L (using Blackline as tool) and effectively execute processes that are SOX compliant; Further you actively participate and bring value to cross functional meetings intended to improve or automate accounting and control processes; You will drive a monthly accrual process by working closely with cross functional teams (i.e. Marketing, Logistics and Operations); Compile and analyze data and prepare a variety of reports for internal, audit and external reporting.  Education and Personal skills: Bachelor’s degree in Accounting, Finance or Business Economics, a Certified Accounting degree is a plus; Ability to perform the essential functions of the job typically acquired through 3 – 5 years of related experience in an international company, including experience with accounting systems; Experience with General Ledger and US GAAP accounting and familiar with major European countries taxes; Besides good experience in Microsoft Great Plains or SAP, you are proficient in Excel and Gsuit products; Fluently written, verbal communication and collaborative skills in English. Dutch, French and/or German is a plus; Strong organizational and communicational skills.  Sonos In 2002, Sonos set out to reinvent the way people listen at home. The wireless home sound system they created makes it easier than ever to fill any and every room with music, podcasts, TV, and just about anything else you could ever want to hear-all with brilliant, immersive clarity. Since then millions of people in over 60 countries have made Sonos part of their lives. Today, Sonos remains focused on innovation, thoughtfully designing products, inventing new technologies, expanding our software platform, crafting the best sound experience and making a positive social impact in the world. For additional information regarding this role please contact Jan van den Berg at 06-39 37 95 97 or Jan.vandenberg@greenbergnielsen.nl .

title: Data & Analytics Consultant
summary: Our broad range of data-driven solutions in data consulting and digital marketing are designed to meet our clients’ specific needs, always conceived with a…
description: Who we are Artefact is a new generation of a data service provider, specialising in data consulting and data-driven digital marketing, dedicated to transforming data into business impact across the entire value chain of organisations. We are proud to say we’re enjoying skyrocketing growth. Our broad range of data-driven solutions in data consulting and digital marketing are designed to meet our clients’ specific needs, always conceived with a business-centric approach and delivered with tangible results. Our data-driven services are built upon the deep AI expertise we’ve acquired with our 1000+ client base around the globe. We have 1000 employees across 20 offices who are focused on accelerating digital transformation. Thanks to a unique mix of company assets: State of the art data technologies, lean, AI, agile methodologies for fast delivery, and cohesive teams of the finest business consultants, data analysts, data scientists, data engineers, and digital experts, all dedicated to bringing extra value to every client. Role & Responsibilities As a Data and Analytics Consultant you will be conducting projects in the transformation of our clients’ businesses through the effective collection, processing and activation of data. We expect you to ensure quality and continuity of the full range of Data & Analytics services meanwhile actively contributing to the expertise level and competencies of the team. Your work will be done in close collaboration with the other divisions (Media & Activation, Creation, Consultancy, Data Science and Technology) to provide comprehensive services to our clients. Among your responsibilities will be the execution of our Data & Analytics projects ensuring delivery including: Analytics and Media Implementation Tag management setup, data layering, media tagging and custom scripting Performing audits, reviews and creating best-practice analytics setups Media tagging and conversion support Solution design, documentation and creating developer guidelines Data Collection & Enrichment Setting up and improving data collection (web, apps, offline, pos) Best practice Google Analytics, Adobe Analytics and Firebase implementations Lighter coding (JavaScript, Python, SQL, R) Data aggregation and channel attribution Data Visualisation and Storytelling Dashboarding (Data Studio, PowerBi, Tableau) Basic and advanced reporting Presentations and consulting work We expect you to stay up to date on developments within the industry, to share best practices and contribute to Artefact’s institutional knowledge. Your Profile Academic level of education (Bachelor or Master) A minimum of 1 year of work experience in a data-driven working environment Verifiable knowledge and experience of web analytics platforms like Google Analytics, Adobe Analytics etc. Familiarity with tag management systems like Google Tag Manager, Tealium iQ Ensighten etc. Familiarity with website optimization tools like Optimizely, Google Optimize, Convert, AB Tasty etc Optionally, familiarity with Data Management Platforms like BlueKai, Adobe Audience Manager, Tealium Audience Stream, etc. Basic knowledge of web-related technologies (JavaScript, CSS and HTML) and database techniques (REST-APIs, SQL, No-SQL) Knowledge of data processing and data modeling algorithms and techniques would be an advantage Fluency in English is a must, preferably also Dutch What we offer you A team that values professionalism. We are driven entrepreneurs that are eager to make a dent in the industry. Personal development. Every day offers new challenges and new opportunities to learn. This is a chance for you to take your career to the next level! A social working environment. We enjoy each other’s company both on and off the clock. Great office location in central Utrecht. A competitive salary package.

title: Business Analist
summary:
Als Business Analist ben je de schakel tussen business en IT.
Je weet de wens van de gebruikers uitstekend in kaart te brengen en te vertalen naar IT Solutions.
description: Als Business Analist ben je de schakel tussen business en IT. Je weet de wens van de gebruikers uitstekend in kaart te brengen en te vertalen naar IT Solutions. Je bent assertief en je weet de kern van de vraag ontdekken. Herken jij je in bovenstaand profiel? Dan zijn wij voor een grote financiële dienstverlener op zoek naar jou! Over deze functie Als Business Analist vertaal je de wensen van de Business naar praktische IT Solutions. Je organiseert en begeleidt workshops waarin je samen met de Business processen in kaart brengt en requirements opstelt. Op basis hiervan stel je een functioneel ontwerp op en zie je er op toe dat op basis van dit ontwerp ook daadwerkelijk een oplossing wordt gerealiseerd die aansluit bij de wensen en behoefte uit de business. Je bent in deze rol het aanspreekpunt voor zowel Business en IT als andere stakeholders. Ook schakel je makkelijk tussen alle verschillende partijen. Over jou Minimaal een afgeronde hbo-opleiding in de richting IT of Bedrijfskunde Minstens 3 jaar werkervaring als Business Analist Ervaring met het vertalen van processen naar de impact op de organisatie en haar systemen Ervaring met Agile en Scrum Analytisch sterk en het vermogen dit over te brengen Proactief en communicatief zeer vaardig Uitstekende schrijfvaardigheden Een goede beheersing van de Engelse taal in woord en geschrift  Wat wij bieden  Als Business Analist gedetacheerd worden door Brunel IT betekent dat je in dienst treedt bij Brunel. Bij Brunel IT staat jouw loopbaan voorop. Wij bieden je diverse opleidingsmogelijkheden om zo jouw carrière te versnellen. Je wordt binnen dit traject begeleid door je eigen Brunel-Consultant. Je kunt bij ons rekenen op een marktconform maandsalaris met bonusopportunity. Naast goede primaire arbeidsvoorwaarden bieden wij jou ook uitstekende secundaire arbeidsvoorwaarden, waaronder een gunstige pensioenregeling en collectiviteitskorting op individuele verzekeringen. Tevens biedt Brunel je leuke extra’s op cultureel en sportief gebied. Omdat niet iedereen dezelfde zaken belangrijk vindt, profiteer je ook nog eens van een flexibel arbeidsvoorwaardenpakket, specifiek gericht op jouw situatie. Zo kun je bijvoorbeeld zelf bepalen of je extra vakantiedagen wil aankopen. Je hebt bij Brunel dus niet alleen de zekerheid van een contract, maar ook van een carrière.  Over ons Brunel is een wereldwijde zakelijke dienstverlener gespecialiseerd in projectmanagement, detachering en consultancy in de vakgebieden Finance & Risk, Engineering, IT, Legal, Marketing & Communicatie, HR en alle disciplines in de olie- en gasindustrie. Sinds haar oprichting in 1975 heeft Brunel zich ontwikkeld tot een internationale groep met meer dan 14.000 medewerkers. Brunel IT zet op flexibele of permanente basis hoogwaardige kennis en capaciteit in voor de top van het Nederlandse bedrijfsleven, universiteiten en overheidsinstellingen, maar ook voor het groot-MKB. Kortom, organisaties met een grote gebruikersomgeving en interessante projecten. Brunel biedt jou de mogelijkheid om je te ontwikkelen door middel van een persoonlijk ontwikkeltraject. Je kunt hierbij denken aan het behalen van belangrijke en relevante certificaten. Hier (jouw) werk van maken? Solliciteer!  HBO

title: Lead Product Manager
summary:
In addition you establish a marketing strategy based on the assessment of market trends, customer needs and competitive analysis.
As Manager of the program:
description: Product Manager Digital Workspace We are looking for a Product Manager to join the global Product Development and Innovation (PD&I) Team within Wolters Kluwer to combine overall product management and senior product owner responsibilities within a dynamic, global environment. Digital Workspace is an award winning global program, launched in 2019, to limit the interruptions in the workflow of our customers in the Legal and Regulatory domain. This is achieved by providing a growing and global set of (API) integration products, services and agreements between solutions used by legal professionals. The role As the Product Manager you will be responsible for the overall product management, strategic vision and focus, P&L and execution of growth plans for Digital Workspace. You will effectively manage all aspects of the line of business in support of the organization’s goals and market needs and leads competitive analysis and market assessment activities. In addition you establish a marketing strategy based on the assessment of market trends, customer needs and competitive analysis. Furthermore, as product owner, you guide the agile development of the integration products and services, for example by identifying required development resources, leading Product Increment sessions, and ensuring quality control. Thereby using a SAFe methodology, as adopted by Wolters Kluwer Tasks and responsibilities: As Manager of the program: Communicate the Digital Workspace vision, both internally and externally Set and, when necessary, adapt the strategy of the Digital Workspace program Manage the existing and new LR integration capabilities. Stimulate and support the implementation and usage of the capabilities by LR’s businesses. Translate the vision/strategy in missions and backlog items Select and prioritize integration use cases with all businesses, central point of contact for the complete Digital Workspace program Manage the assigned DW development budgets As Senior Product Owner: Overall planning and execution of all required developments thereby ensuring projects are taken from original concept through final implementation, either by driving and coaching the responsible PO’s , or by personally acting as PO. Significantly contributes to vision and overall strategy of Digital Workspace and the business’s ecosystem Positioning of and support for Digital Workspace program Overall progress and positioning of PD&I, as a key member of the PD&I team Hierarchical supervision of 1-2 Product Owners/PMO Non- hierarchical supervision of all members of the agile teams (currently about 25-30 members) Your profile Degree in Business Informatics, Business Administration, Computer Science or similar qualification Professional experience in agile projects as Product Manager, Product Owner or Business Analyst with good knowledge of agile methods and tools Agile mindset With your strong communication skills and empathy, you are able to operate excellent stakeholder management even in complex international structures and control requirements in a targeted and efficient manner You are solution-oriented, have a hands-on mentality and enjoy working in interdisciplinary teams Developed personal responsibility, communication and coordination skills, social competence People management experience excellent English skills We offer We are a fast growing, financially healthy and listed organization. You will be part of a diverse, global workforce and join the dynamic, professional yet informal P&I team. You’ll work remotely and/or from a Wolters Kluwer office, for example the global head office in Alphen aan den Rijn, the Netherlands when we return to the office. We offer a competitive salary and with a fulltime job of 36 hours a week, a good work life balance. Furthermore, a laptop, generous contribution to your pension (we contribute 2/3), outstanding international career opportunities and a commitment to invest in your personal development are also part of the package. For more information about our solutions and organization, visit www.wolterskluwer.com, follow us on Twitter, Facebook, LinkedIn, and YouTube.

title: Business Intelligence Analyst
summary:
Think about departments like IT, marketing, product management and sales.
Experienced with Excel, SQL and Tableau?
What do you get in return?
description: Functieomschrijving Experienced with Excel, SQL and Tableau? Let us know! For the European HQ of Nissan in Amsterdam you could start as a Business Intelligence Analist. In this position you and your team, will be responsible for building and developing the right dashboards so big chunks of data can be sorted in a way your Dutch and international colleagues understand what is happening in the company. You and your team will brainstorm about what dashboards need to show for different departments in different countries. After that you will start building the dashboards and use a team of selected people for testing. The end goal? That all data within Nissan is used by the right departments. You will build prototype dashboards in Tableau. Beside that you will brainstorm with your team about what different dashboards should be able to do. So you will develop, but also think about the content. You will have a lot of communication with different stakeholders about what the perfect dashboards looks like. Think about departments like IT, marketing, product management and sales.  What do you get in return? A challenging position in the Business Intelligence department of a multinational. You will work in an international team and be in direct contact with HQ in Japan. a salary between 2200 and 2600 gross a month and there is a full travel cost reimbursement. A temperary contract untill march 31 and after that a continuation for 6 months. What do you bring? For Nissan it is important that you already have knowledge of Tableau, SQL and Excel so you can start fast! You have gained working experience in a B2B company with a supply chain. Beside that you are of course an analytical person, you can use English in a professional way and you have a Bachelor degree with experience in data processing.

title: Performance Marketing Software Developer
summary:
Integrate SEM and other marketing data with business data to support business growth.
5+ years of experience in working in a fast-paced digital agency, Ecomm…
description: About Calvin Klein Europe B.V. CALVIN KLEIN is a global lifestyle brand that exemplifies bold, progressive ideals and a seductive aesthetic. We seek to thrill and inspire our audience while using provocative imagery and striking designs to ignite the senses.  Founded in 1968 by Calvin Klein and his business partner Barry Schwartz, we have built our reputation as a leader in American fashion through our clean aesthetic and innovative designs. Global retail sales of CALVIN KLEIN brand products exceeded $8 billion in 2016 and were distributed in over 110 countries. Calvin Klein, Inc. employs over 10,000 associates globally. We were acquired by PVH Corp. in 2003.  The Team You are part of Calvin Klein Ecommerce departments, working with the Senior Manager Performance Marketing to drive growth and efficiency for SEA, SEO and Display. You will build the infrastructure to leverage the potential of each channel from day to day operational tasks automation to more advanced tooling and technology.  You will work closely with other teams within Analytics & Business Intelligence, Ecommerce Platform teams, other Marketing & Ecommerce teams, and external partners.  Key Responsibilities: Drive engineering efforts from design to implementation to drive growth through automation and data management Collect, transform and model unstructured data from different sources to structured output to be leveraged in different ways Work closely with data scientist and data analyst to structure and collect data, and to build tools and frameworks Building, maintain and develop data pipelines to power predictive Models, API connections and tooling Integrate SEM and other marketing data with business data to support business growth Design, build and deliver tools and data solutions to automate SEA, SEO and Display daily recurring tasks, operational and strategic tasks and processes, campaign creation, reporting, dash-boarding Work closely with the data team, marketing specialists and major search engines and platforms to develop new tools, implement new features and define automation roadmap Provide automation recommendations in terms of tools, techniques, systems, maximizing the usage of existing tools. The Ideal Candidate: 5+ years of experience in working in a fast-paced digital agency, Ecomm environment or performance marketing Experience with building scalable data pipelines Experience with parsing structured and unstructured data and creation of pipelines for data warehousing Knowledgeable about data modelling, data access, and data storage techniques Experience with cloud platforms, especially GCP and AWS Good understanding of basic analytics and machine learning concepts Experience with tools such as Google Analytics, Omniture, Insights Discover, Tableau, Looker Understanding of internet advertising systems such as Google Ads, Bing Ads, SA360, etc. Highly analytical and skilled in communication. Able to translate business questions and challenges into actionable & measurable solutions A detail-oriented, data-driven, and creative eye, combined with the ability to multi-task and manage several projects simultaneously. A strong learn-it-all and entrepreneurial mentality. Eager to learn and test new initiatives. Results and performance focused Strong commercial mindset Self-starter, efficient time management and strong problem solving skills Strong verbal and written communication skills, attention to detail & accuracy Knowledge of the retail & fashion industry is a plus What You Can Expect from Us: A beautiful state-of-the-art Campus, complete with our very own People's Place Gym and People's Place Cafés A company culture that fosters development, offering training and learning opportunities through our very own PVH University An international environment which respects diversity, equality, and individuality A smart work program that empowers our associates to work at their preferred location within a flexible schedule A chance to unwind with weekly social activities We would love to know why this is the role for you, so please include a motivational letter with your application.  PVH Europe and our brands, TOMMY HILFIGER and CALVIN KLEIN, are committed to fostering an inclusive and diverse community of associates with a strong sense of belonging. We believe we are bettered by all forms of diversity, and take pride in working with top talent from every walk of life and corner of the world. In the spirit of inclusivity, qualified applicants will be considered without regard to age, ethnicity, ability, gender, gender expression, gender identity, nationality, race, religion or sexual orientation. #LI-LP1

title: Technical Web Analyst
summary:
In your role as a technical web analyst you make, the impact we have on our customers, measurable.
Implementing, configuring, analyzing: in this role you…
description: De vacature Implementing, configuring, analyzing: in this role you analyse data from online platforms and initiate the steps that will deliver higher conversion rates. Because data makes your heart beat faster. In your role as a technical web analyst you make, the impact we have on our customers, measurable. You work for leading brands like Action, Proctor & Gamble and Danone within the Valtech Marketing Services team and feel at home in a challenging, international environment in which you collaborate with other experts and support them.  What will you be doing? You are responsible for measuring platforms. Successfully. Experience with Tag Management Systems is a must. You develop a measurement plan, implement the necessary codes and then ensure proper implementation. Apart from that you ‘own’ your data. You provide your colleagues with the data they need and, together with the team, distill insights for platform optimization. You work with web analytics packages such as Google Analytics, Adobe Analytics and Webtrends. From your data driven mindset you take yourself and our customers to a higher level. You proactively analyze data and optimize platforms where necessary (also known as data driven work or Conversion Rate Optimization), and you help brands such as Heineken and Yamaha and many more to further develop their data driven mindset. Functie eisen What do we expect from you? We are looking for someone with 3+ years relevant experience. Someone who is eager to discover the world and tools of tomorrow and who is eager to acquire new knowledge quickly.  This means: You love e-commerce and the idea of implementing tracking systems for the advanced e-commerce environments of our customers; You're naturally inquisitive and feel a constant itch to discover just what new tools offer (and don't offer); you're data driven and like to think things through (especially when things get technical); You create, audit and implement measurement frameworks (KPI's, tagging plans, reporting, analysis, etc); You have experience with analytics tooling, show strong analytical abilities and you know and have demonstrable experience with Tag Management Systems, web analytics tooling and/or dashboard tooling; Experience with data visualization tools like Google Datastudio or Klipfolio would be an asset; You feel at home in a multidisciplinary environment with creative colleagues and developers. You like working in an environment where you have contact with international clients and colleagues. One of our requirements is that employees have a permanent address in the Netherlands and/or a valid work permit. Jouw belangrijkste taken: 01 You love e-commerce and the idea of implementing tracking systems for the advanced e-commerce environments of our customers 02 You're naturally inquisitive and feel a constant itch to discover just what new tools offer (and don't offer); you're data driven and like to think things through (especially when things get technical) 03 Experience with data visualization tools like Google Datastudio or Klipfolio would be an asset 04 You create, audit and implement measurement frameworks (KPI's, tagging plans, reporting, analysis, etc) 05 You have experience with analytics tooling, show strong analytical abilities and you know and have demonstrable experience with Tag Management Systems, web analytics tooling and/or dashboard tooling

title: Quality Assurance Analyst (MTM)
summary:
At Saab, we constantly look ahead and push boundaries for what is considered technically possible.
We collaborate with colleagues around the world who all share…
description: At Saab, we constantly look ahead and push boundaries for what is considered technically possible. We collaborate with colleagues around the world who all share our challenge – to make the world a safer place. What you will be part of Saab Traffic Management (TM) serves customers around the globe with advanced solutions that enable the safe and efficient movement of people and goods. There are three operating units within TM: Maritime Traffic Management (MTM) solutions include Automatic Identification Systems (AIS), Terminal Operating Systems, Port (PMIS), and Vessel Traffic Management Information Systems (VTMIS); Air Traffic Management (ATM) provides airport surface safety and efficiency systems and tools, tower automation and advanced research, development and evaluation solutions. Public Safety and Security (PSS) which is the world leading solution provider for mission critical integrated operations. The MTM Quality Assurance Analyst is responsible for establishment and maintenance of below listed management systems and ensures that certificates, authorizations are obtained and renewed. He/she coordinates execution of internal audits of processes and project execution. Quality and Environmental Management Saab Global Management System (GMS) Business Unit Traffic Management ISO 9001 Quality Management (based on GMS) ISO 14001 Environmental Management CO2 Awareness Level 3 (only in the Netherlands) Security Management ISO 27001 Information Security Management General Security Requirements for Defense Contracts in the Netherlands (ABDO) Do you want to join us from our location in Apeldoorn committed to safe, efficient and secure maritime trade around the world? Do you have the talent and drive to really make a difference to complex maritime operations? We are looking for an experienced colleague with ability to create quality awareness among our colleagues, who is pragmatic, takes a business approach when maintaining management systems. Someone who is analytical, has an open and curious mind, accurate, can take a helicopter view and have eye for detail at the same time. Can you take something that is already good, to make it even better? If so we are looking for you…. Your role We are seeking for a Quality Assurance Analyst, based in Apeldoorn (the Netherlands), that maintains our management systems, coordinate internal audits, take actions to solve audit findings, perform management reviews and ensure that we prolong our certifications and authorizations. You will become part of the Project Management Office (PMO) that is part of the department Account & Project Management and report to the head of this department. Together with your colleagues from PMO you will also support Operations in Apeldoorn. You are responsible (but not restricted) to: Establishes, documents, implements and maintains the several management systems related to quality management, information security management and environmental management Prepares annually the audit program and audit plan Performs internal audits or coordinate conducting of internal audits related to business processes and (customer) projects Supports Marketing & Sales in preparing bid documents related to quality, environment and security Supports management in conducting regular management reviews Follows developments in (local) laws and regulations related to these management systems Participates in internal projects or act as internal project manager to related items Provides (ad-hoc) support in sales tenders or offers where we need to provide plans related to quality, information security and environmental management Provides support to HR and management in all other regulated areas such as GDPR, Health & Safety, Loss Prevention, ABDO, Personnel Security. Your experience and skills As Quality Assurance Analyst your expected experience is: Bachelor or Master degree in technology, engineering and/or business management; Communicates fluently in Dutch and English with excellent communication and writing skills; Profound interest in risks, processes, quality, problem solving and improvement; Ability to work in a dynamic, complex and multi-national environment wherein you connect with and influence various stakeholders in order to create (quality) awareness and challenge the status quo; Ability to collaborate with colleagues and teams in all layers of our organization. If you feel that this job seems to be interesting, you enjoy working with modern technology and you have some of the skills and merits mentioned above, then you should contact us or send in your application. More info: Saab.com/Maritime or werkenbij.saabnl.com About Saab Saab is a global defence and security company operating in the fields of air, land and naval defence, civil security and commercial aeronautics. We number 17,000 employees and have operations on all continents. Technologically we are leaders in many areas, and one-fifth of our earnings are spent on research and development.  Saab is also a company with opportunities. A company where we see diversity as an asset and where you have both considerable responsibility and good opportunities for advancing in your career. But also a company that respects each person’s needs for a rewarding life beyond work.

title: Functioneel Beheerder
summary: Kennis van e-commerce en e-business oplossingen (A/B testen, tooling Google Analitics, webtooling, gebruikers- en klantgedrag analyse, SEO, SEA, email marketing…
description: Functieomschrijving Tijdelijk 40 uur/week regio Rotterdam Start 6 april 2021 Voor onze opdrachtgever zijn wij op zoek naar een Functioneel Beheerder!  Functieomschrijving Per 6 april aan het werk als functioneel beheerder met de focus op web CMS, e-shops en websites? Dat kan! Het is een leuke tijdelijke klus ter vervanging/overbrugging van de functioneel beheerder die per 1 mei weg gaat. In april draagt hij zijn werk geleidelijk over aan jou. Als functioneel beheerder ga je zorg dragen voor stabiele (web)applicaties en productieplatforms, waarin de juiste wijzigingen op tijd en tegen zo laag mogelijke kosten worden gerealiseerd en de incidenten volgens afgesproken SLA tijden worden opgelost. Je bent de contactpersoon voor de interne klant (manager e-commerce en de e-commerce business development manager) en gebruikers en de sparringpartner voor de business analist, de architect, de informatieanalist, externe applicatie beheerders, interne technische applicatie beheerder en de teammanager.  Als functioneel applicatie-beheerder met focus op e-commerce en web CMS heb je aanvullend kennis van e-commerce/content en e-business oplossingen, processen, tools en technieken waarmee je in staat bent e-commerce te ondersteunen in het behalen van de e-commerce doelstellingen. Je verleent daarnaast eerste en tweedelijns support voor interne gebruikers.  Wat ga je doen? Analyseren van issues op de applicaties en aandragen oplossingen. Analyseren en oplossen van gebruikersvragen; Zorgen voor oplossing, afhandeling en implementatie van deze issues volgens de juiste processen en in de SLA gestelde richtlijnen; Zorgen voor inrichting van configuraties op de applicaties; Inzicht geven in en advies geven over inrichtingsalternatieven en hun impact op de organisatie, processen, gegevens en IT; Bewaken van het dienstenniveau zoals vastgelegd in de SLA, MAC en DAP; Doet voorstellen tot aanpassing van de e-commerce applicaties en stuurt op ontwikkeling daarvan; Ondersteunen en adviseren op e-commerce en e-business ontwikkelingen; Communiceren naar en adviseren van diverse stakeholders en betrokkenen zoals diverse managers, de e-commerce manager, users, architecten en business analisten. Functie-eisen Minimaal HBO niveau / Academisch werk- en denkniveau; Je hebt met name ervaring op het gebied van WebCMS-sen, websites en eShops; Kennis van e-commerce en e-business oplossingen (A/B testen, tooling Google Analitics, webtooling, gebruikers- en klantgedrag analyse, SEO, SEA, email marketing, etc.); Je hebt kennis van het materiegebied of ervaring in soortgelijke functie met minimaal 3 jaar werkervaring; Je hebt kennis en ervaring met complexe content management systemen; Je hebt kennis van internet technologie, server en database beheer; Ervaring met ontwikkel- en beheerprocessen van applicaties. Bij voorkeur Agile – Scrum; Kennis en ervaring met ASL/BiSL, ITIL; Ervaring met testen van systemen en project- en releasematig werken; Kennis van proces- en informatieanalysemethoden en -technieken; Ruime ervaring en coachende en coördinerende vaardigheden en ervaring; In staat om op basis van applicatiekennis initiatieven tot verbeteringen aan te dragen; Kennis van (externe) webmasters tools en tagmanagers (bijv. GWT en GTM); Je bent resultaat gericht, organisatie sensitief, communicatief vaardig, advies vaardig, in staat om zelfstandig of in teamverband te werken en je hebt analytisch vermogen; Je weet kennis te waarborgen en over te brengen op diverse betrokkenen.  Overige informatie Startdatum: Start 6 april 2021 Inzet: 40 uur/week Duur: 3 maanden Locatie: regio Rotterdam

title: Data Analyst - Accommodations - Pricing
summary:
We are responsible for accommodation growth, with clear ownership of all marketing, product and supply related to accommodations.
Technology is at our core.
description: At Booking.com, data drives our decisions. Technology is at our core. And innovation is everywhere. But our company is more than datasets, lines of code or A/B tests. We’re the thrill of the first night in a new place. The excitement of the next morning. The friends you make. The journeys you take. The sights you see. And the food you sample. Through our products, partners and people, we can empower everyone to experience the world. With over 1.6 million room nights booked every day, accommodation represents the largest share of our business to date. We are responsible for accommodation growth, with clear ownership of all marketing, product and supply related to accommodations. Our mission is to deliver the best customer experience and most varied selection of properties. Perfecting the right formula for competitive and compelling pricing is a high priority of the accommodation business unit. That means offering attractive rates and deals globally through creating deal events, offering a compelling loyalty program, monitoring of relevant prices in the market or discounting rates with Booking.com funds. The role in question relates specifically to the discounting activities, which we are looking to reinforce with an individual who would drive hypothesis generation and testing for our conversion enhancement initiatives through high-quality analytics. This is an exciting dynamic role with potential for incredible impact.  B. Responsible Works independently on data collection and preparation. Uses their past experience and seeks for help in complex scenarios to translate business problems into data stories Maintains and drives key reports, metrics and workflows running within their scope. Is able to communicate results and outcomes clearly to stakeholders based on their knowledge and experience. Communicates effectively, collaboratively and challenges constructively to create rapport and establish trust. Actively participates in business and/or analytics team activities and suggests ways of achieving objectives (standup, planning meeting, retrospectives) Networks and proactively connects with craft peers beyond the team scope Uses previous knowledge and experience on data analysis and visualization to answer business questions in the most efficient way Is aware and has experience working in our experimentation culture, process and results interpretation Is aware of statistical models used within their scope Is familiar with the larger data ecosystem at Booking and how it relates to their data and the work they do. Collaborates and is open to giving and receiving feedback with peers and direct stakeholders. Is flexible in adopting and proposing new approaches and expanding their technical competencies when a more efficient way presents itself. Expected to get significant deep knowledge about the operational, tactical and strategic workings of the department. Has a main focus on business and technical opportunities   B.Skilled Driven and results oriented personality Open to feedback and always looking for ways to improve own performance Able to understand details while keeping an eye on the bigger picture Analytical and curious mindset Strong interpersonal skills Open and friendly attitude Strong knowledge and experience on data analysis. Experience in data management, data visualization and quality. Knowledge and experience using data analysis and visualization tools (e.g: tableau, data studio, powerbi, mixpanel, etc) Advanced knowledge in Python and Spark. Experience with at least one data analysis language (e.g: R, SQL, Python, etc)   B. Offered Living and working in Amsterdam, one of the most cosmopolitan cities in Europe Contributing to a high scale, complex, world renowned product and seeing real-time impact of your work on millions of travellers worldwide Working in a fast-paced and performance driven culture Opportunity to utilize technical expertise, leadership capabilities and entrepreneurial spirit Promote and drive impactful and innovative engineering solutions Technical, behavioural and interpersonal competence advancement via on-the-job opportunities, experimental projects, hackathons, conferences and active community participation Competitive compensation and benefits package and some great added perks of working in the home city of Booking.com Booking.com is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, colour, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status. We strive to move well beyond traditional equal opportunity and work to create an environment that allows everyone to thrive.

title: Anti Money Laundering Analyst (AML)
summary:
Is onderzoeken echt jouw ding en spreekt transactiemonitoring je aan?
Dan is de functie van Anti Money Laundering Analyst echt iets voor jou.
description: Is onderzoeken echt jouw ding en spreekt transactiemonitoring je aan? Dan is de functie van Anti Money Laundering Analyst echt iets voor jou. In deze rol heb jij de mogelijkheid om malpraktijken als fraude, witwassen en terrorismefinanciering aan banden te leggen. Solliciteer! Over deze functie  Als AML-Analyst vervul jij een belangrijke poortwachtersfunctie: je bewaakt immers de integriteit van onze opdrachtgever (de bank) en haar klanten. Verder ben je, naast een echte speurder en ontdekker, ook iemand die graag samenwerkt. Je houdt je dagelijks bezig met het controleren en analyseren van alerts. Naar aanleiding van een klantprofiel en het betaalgedrag van de klant voer je onderzoek uit (in combinatie met openbare bronnen). Bevindingen worden uiteraard vastgelegd en indien je het vermoeden hebt dat de klant betrokken is bij het financieren van terrorisme duik je nog dieper en grondiger in de situatie! Heb jij al enige ervaring in dit vakgebied? Dan houd jij je, naast de meest complexe onderzoeken (op zowel particulier als zakelijk vlak) ook bezig met het begeleiden van junior collega’s; het proactief meedenken over procesverbeteringen en -veranderingen en sta jij bekend als echte vraagbaak. Dit houdt jouw functie uitdagend! Onze opdrachtgever, de Rabobank, is op 20 locaties binnen Nederland actief op het gebied van Compliance. De AML-werkzaamheden vinden vooral plaats binnen het Expertise Centrum in Utrecht. Voor jou houdt dit in dat je altijd de verbinding kunt zoeken met collega-experts om mee te sparren!  Over jou  De rol van Anti Money Laundering Analyst/AML-Analyst betreft een onderzoekende. Durf jij het aan verder te kijken? Dan beschik je in ieder geval over: Een diploma op hbo-/wo-niveau (bij voorkeur in de richting van criminologie, rechten of bedrijfseconomie) Relevante werkervaring; bancaire ervaring is een pre Het vermogen om integer om te gaan met alle Nederlandstalige documentatie Affiniteit met transactiemonitoring Kennis van AML, CDD en KYC Een onderzoekende en gedreven persoonlijkheid met analytische skills Beschik jij al over de nodige werkervaring binnen AML en/of CDD & KYC en ben jij klaar voor de volgende stap in je carrière? Ook dan ben je bij Brunel aan het juiste adres! Voor verschillende vooraanstaande opdrachtgevers zijn wij op zoek naar Analisten die toe zijn aan een vervolgstap. Werk jij het liefst in Utrecht, of is de regio voor jou interessanter? Wij gaan graag in gesprek met je!  Wat wij bieden  Gedetacheerd worden als Anti Money Laundering Analyst/AML-Analyst door Brunel, betekent dat je kiest voor een stuk zekerheid. Je treedt namelijk bij ons in dienst en hebt gedurende je dienstverband toegang tot onze eigen CDD-Community én vergaande mogelijkheden tot uitbreiding van je kennis door middel van het volgen van vakgerichte opleidingen/cursussen. Dit alles wordt begeleid door jouw eigen Brunel-consultant, die jouw carrière en ontwikkeling vooropstelt. Ook arbeidsvoorwaardelijk is het prima voor elkaar bij Brunel. Naast je basissalaris zijn er verschillende bonusmogelijkheden. Over de secundaire arbeidsvoorwaarden kunnen we verder kort zijn; ook daar maken wij graag het verschil. Pensioen, kortingen op verzekeringen- en geldzaken, met voordeel naar de bioscoop, dit zijn slechts enkele voorbeelden. Stap jij aan boord?  Over ons Brunel is een zakelijk dienstverlener, wereldwijd actief en gespecialiseerd in projectmanagement, detachering en consultancy. In Nederland zijn we actief in de disciplines Finance & Risk, Engineering, IT, Legal en Marketing & Communicatie. Internationaal zijn we ook sterk vertegenwoordigd, onder andere in alle disciplines in de olie- en gasindustrie. Dit alles doen we samen met 14.500 collega’s in 44 landen! Brunel Finance & Risk is gespecialiseerd in het detacheren van zowel Young Professionals als ervaren vakspecialisten binnen de financiële dienstverlening. Dankzij onze medewerkers en onze manier van werken onderhouden wij goede relaties met alle gerenommeerde financiële spelers in de branche, met wie we jou graag in contact brengen! Onze kernwaarden zijn onder meer terug te zien in onze deelname aan en sponsoring van de Volvo Ocean Race; ambition, teamwork and operational excellence. Tot slot; navigate the future! Interessant & herkenbaar? Welkom.  HBO

title: Business Analyst
summary:
Je hebt minimal 3 jaar werkervaring als business analyst of soortgelijke functie.
Als business analyst gedetacheerd worden door Brunel IT betekent dat je in…
description: Hoe vind jij het om een katalysator voor verandering te zijn? Als business analyst zorg jij ervoor dat organisatiebehoeftes, kansen en problemen worden geïdentificeerd om vervolgens zelf oplossingen aan te dragen. Over deze functie  In jouw rol als business analyst ben je bezig met het in kaart brengen van een organisatie en hoe zij in de markt ligt. Dit betekent dat je verschillende databronnen raadpleegt om inzicht te krijgen in de diensten of producten van die organisatie. Daarbij is het belangrijk dat je weet hoe de organisatie in elkaar steekt en wat de strategische doelen zijn. Om deze reden spreek je regelmatig met verschillende stakeholders waarmee jij jouw expertise mee deelt. Daarnaast geef je aanbevelingen op basis van data die kunnen zorgen voor prestatieverbeteringen en kostenbesparingen.  Over jou Je bent in het bezit van een hbo/wo-diploma richting Informatica, Bedrijfskunde of Logistiek Je hebt minimal 3 jaar werkervaring als business analyst of soortgelijke functie Kennis over verschillende BI Tools Drive om zoveel mogelijk informatie te verzamelen vanuit relevante bronnen en dit te vertalen naar anderen toe Het vermogen om met anderen samen te werken en deze samenwerking in stand te houden Initiatiefrijk, taak- én persoonsgericht Analytisch sterk  Wat wij bieden Als business analyst gedetacheerd worden door Brunel IT betekent dat je in dienst treedt bij Brunel. Bij Brunel IT staat jouw loopbaan voorop. Wij bieden je diverse opleidingsmogelijkheden om zo jouw carrière te versnellen. Je wordt binnen dit traject door een consultant van Brunel begeleid. Je profiteert van een vast maandsalaris met bonusopportunity. Naast goede primaire arbeidsvoorwaarden bieden wij jou ook uitstekende secundaire arbeidsvoorwaarden, waaronder een gunstige pensioenregeling en collectiviteitskorting op individuele verzekeringen. Tevens biedt Brunel je leuke extra’s op cultureel en sportief gebied. Omdat niet iedereen dezelfde zaken belangrijk vindt, profiteer je ook nog eens van een flexibel arbeidsvoorwaardenpakket, specifiek gericht op jouw situatie. Zo kun je bijvoorbeeld zelf bepalen of je extra vakantiedagen wilt aankopen. Je hebt bij Brunel niet alleen de zekerheid van een contract, maar ook van een carrière. Over ons Brunel is wereldwijd zakelijk dienstverlener, gespecialiseerd in projectmanagement, detachering en consultancy. We verlenen onze diensten binnen de vakgebieden Finance & Risk, Insurance & Banking, Engineering, IT, Legal, Marketing & Communicatie, HR en alle disciplines in de olie- en gasindustrie. Dit doen we samen met 10.000 collega’s vanuit 35 landen. En we doen dit met focus. Want bij Brunel geloven we erin dat als je ergens 100% voor gaat, dat je daar de allerbeste in kan worden. Brunel IT zet op flexibele of permanente basis hoogwaardige kennis en capaciteit in voor de top van het Nederlandse bedrijfsleven, universiteiten en overheidsinstellingen tot aan het groot MKB. Kortom, organisaties met een grote gebruikersomgeving en interessante projecten.  WO Master

title: Digital marketeer
summary:
Minimaal een hbo-diploma binnen het marketing domein.
Minimaal een hbo-diploma binnen het marketing domein.
Tier-1, Tier-2, Google Analytics en andere relevante…
description: Dit ga je doen Tier-1, Tier-2, Google Analytics en andere relevante marketing termen zijn jou niet onbekend! Voor een opdrachtgever in Amsterdam zoeken wij een ervaren digital marketeer. In ruil voor jouw expertise kun je rekenen op een spannende en dynamische werkplek en een brutosalaris tot € 20,00 per uur. Meer weten? Lees dan snel verder!  Manpower is voor een adviesorganisatie in Amsterdam op zoek naar een digital marketeer.  In jouw functie als digital marketeer werk je nauw samen met het Data & Analytics team om de prestaties van digitale kanalen voor specifieke marketingprogramma’s te analyseren. Ook draag je zorg voor een contante optimalisatieloop om zo de effectiviteit van de campagne te maximaliseren. Verder kun je denken aan de volgende werkzaamheden: Samenwerken met de campagnebeheerder en de leidinggevende van sociale media binnen hun respectieve branche om digitale marketingprogramma's voor middelgrote en grootschalige marketingcampagnes te ontwerpen en uit te voeren (Tier 1-campagnes) Schakelen met marketing- en communicatieleiders en social media-leads binnen hun respectievelijke branche om digitale marketingprogramma's te ontwerpen en implementeren die kleinere, meer gerichte marketingcampagnes ondersteunen (Tier 2-campagnes) Samenwerken met Project Management Analyst om de digitale marketingelementen van een campagneprojectplan te ontwikkelen en te beheren Leveren van strategische input voor de startfase van nieuwe campagnes Beheren van de digitale voetafdruk voor de industrie, rekening houdend met de gezondheid van de inhoud en de algehele gebruikerservaring Ondersteunen van digitale marketingprogramma's buiten de specifieke groepsafstemming wanneer dat nodig is (bijvoorbeeld versterking van campagnes op bedrijfsniveau, piekperioden binnen andere industrieën)  Dit krijg je Fulltime baan van 40 uur per week Brutosalaris van € 15,00 tot € 20,00 per uur Reiskostenvergoeding van € 0,19 per kilometer Gratis toegang online learning Studytube via Manpower Pensioenopbouw na 26 gewerkte weken  Hier ga je werken Dit neem je mee Minimaal een hbo-diploma binnen het marketing domein Ten minste zeven jaar werkervaring als marketeer, marketing specialist of vergelijkbaar Beschikbaarheid van 40 uur per week Goede beheersing van de Engelse taal in verband met de voertaal van de organisatie  Bij voorkeur woon je in Amsterdam, Almere, Haarlem, Hoofddorp of omstreken. Start het nieuwe jaar met een nieuwe baan! Dat doen we met een enorme gedrevenheid. We helpen je om succesvol te zijn bij een sollicitatie en dagen je uit om je te (blijven) ontwikkelen. Eerlijkheid vinden we belangrijk; we zijn transparant, staan open voor feedback en we doen wat we beloven.
