title: Ervaren Product Portfolio Manager
summary:
Vanuit het vakgebied verzekeringstechniek werk je op het snijvlak tussen marketing, commercie en actuariaat.
Volg je de marktontwikkelingen op de voet?
description: Ben jij de resultaatgerichte Product Portfolio Manager die data gedreven denkt én ga je graag uitdagingen aan? Volg je de marktontwikkelingen op de voet? Ben je proactief, klantgericht en wil je een belangrijke rol spelen in de ontwikkeling van ons productportfolio om zo nog beter invulling te geven aan ARAG als Juridisch Probleemoplosser voor iedereen? Dan gaan wij graag het gesprek met jou aan!  Voor onze afdeling Marketing, Rendement en Risico zoeken wij een ervaren Product Portfolio Manager. Vanuit het vakgebied verzekeringstechniek werk je op het snijvlak tussen marketing, commercie en actuariaat. Data driven is iets wat je in je bloed hebt: je focust op klant- en marktinzichten, brengt interne en externe data bij elkaar en vertaalt deze naar praktisch inzichtelijke modellen en dashboards. Je monitort, analyseert en rapporteert de ontwikkelingen in de portefeuille qua volume en rendement. Je brengt advies uit over de verzekeringstechnische risico’s in portefeuille en de bijbehorende prijsstelling. Je bent bekend met concepten als dynamic pricing en bent gedreven om mee te werken aan het verder optimaliseren van onze pricingmodellen. Kortom, een uitdagende functie waarin je bijdraagt aan de ambities van ARAG als Juridisch Probleemoplosser voor iedereen.  Over de afdeling / bedrijfscultuur De afdeling Marketing, Rendement en Risico heeft een sleutelpositie binnen ARAG en is mede daardoor op veel gebieden nadrukkelijk aanwezig binnen de organisatie. De kerntaken van de afdeling zijn het realiseren van een concurrerend en renderend productportfolio door zowel het ontwikkelen van nieuwe producten als door het goed beheren van de bestaande portefeuille. Daarnaast is het team verantwoordelijk voor het initiëren en uitvoeren van het strategisch marketing en communicatieplan, zowel offline als online. Van groot belang in het proces is de samenwerking met de verschillende afdelingen binnen ARAG en de afstemming met ons hoofdkantoor in Duitsland. De bedrijfscultuur van ARAG is een cultuur van je en jij, waarbij iedereen even tijd voor elkaar vrijmaakt. En waar kennis en successen gedeeld worden. Professioneel richting de klant, informeel richting je collega’s waarvan er 15 deel uitmaken van het team Marketing, Rendement en Risico. • Een marktconform salaris gebaseerd op een 38-urige werkweek Variabele werktijden en de mogelijkheid tot inruilen van vrije tijd en salaris Aantrekkelijke secundaire arbeidsvoorwaarden, zoals 8% vakantiegeld, een vaste 13e maand en een goede pensioenregeling Ruime mogelijkheden voor persoonlijke ontwikkeling en het volgen van opleidingen ARAG Vitaliteitsprogramma (waaronder ons sportprogramma) ARAG is een onafhankelijke rechtsbijstandverzekeraar en juridisch dienstverlener. Wij maken het recht toegankelijk en betaalbaar voor iedereen. Onze ambitie is om de beste juridische dienstverlener van Nederland zijn. Klanttevredenheid en kwaliteit van dienstverlening zijn hierbij de uitgangspunten.  ARAG Nederland maakt onderdeel uit van de ARAG Groep, een van oorsprong Duits familiebedrijf met vestigingen in 16 Europese landen, de Verenigde Staten, Australië en Canada. Met zo’n 800 professionals in Nederland werken wij in een collegiale omgeving en informele werksfeer vanuit de locaties in Amsterdam, Rotterdam, Den Haag, Leusden en Roermond. Meer weten? Klik dan op onze bedrijfspagina. Je beschikt minimaal over een afgeronde hbo-opleiding en hebt een aantal jaar ervaring in een rol als productmanager, verzekeringsspecialist, data analist of portefeuillemanager. Je bent vanuit die rol bekend met het distributielandschap voor verzekeringen. Je bent een leergierige en nieuwsgierige professional die sterk is in data analytics, maar altijd met gevoel voor een praktische oplossing. Je werkt graag in teamverband en creëert draagvlak voor jouw ideeën. Focus, executiekracht en eigenaarschap zijn kernwoorden die op jou van toepassing zijn. Je communicatieve vaardigheden zijn zowel mondeling als schriftelijk sterk ontwikkeld. Een goede beheersing van de Engelse taal is daarbij een pré. Ben jij de professional die wij zoeken? Dan ontvangen wij graag jouw CV en motivatie voor 1 maart 2020. Heb je nog vragen? Neem dan contact op met onze Recruiter Danny Rumpel op 06 30 46 07 01 of Manager Marketing, Rendement & Risico Nelleke Zuiderent op 06 30 71 67 09.

title: Senior Associate - Investor Solutions (fluent in Dutch)
summary: Responsible for delivering product updates to the Investor Solutions team and coordinating marketing plans together with Investor Solutions product captains.
description: About the role The Product Specialist will play an integral role within a wider team of Product Specialists, supported by an analyst pool which provides support across the European Investor Solutions Operations (“IS Ops”) team. All investor communications are channelled through the team of Product Specialists who, as part of the wider IS Ops team within Global Investor Solutions, strive to provide centre of excellence and first port of call for investors. Product Specialists each have responsibility for a fund/group of funds/mandates, working alongside the finance and portfolio teams in executing strategy, delivering on promises to investors, and supporting fund growth. They provide focus and expertise on their products, working closely with the fund teams, but also operate as part of a hub within which all information is centralised and shared to ensure the sharing of best practice and to promote consistency across the European funds. The Product Specialist will coordinate and manage all investor requests, materials and communications throughout the investor life cycle, providing quality control and ensuring appropriate sign-offs take place. As one of the more senior team members, they will be expected to provide oversight and provide first-hand previous experience for the wider team to learn from. Overall, the Product Specialist is the key partner to investment teams and Global Investor Solutions to attract new capital, retain existing investors and grow relationships across the business. The successful Senior Associate candidate’s primary responsibility will be for the Firm’s Dutch funds which invest in the Netherlands. They will focus on the production and coordination of deliverables for investors, collaborating with internal teams on all fund or mandate related communications. As key contact for the fund, they will be responsible for distributing formal communications and standard reporting, organising investor meetings, overseeing and providing content for RFPs and ensuring quality control of the final document, providing/coordinating responses to queries and assisting with bespoke reporting needs. They will be responsible for ensuring quality control of all fund related materials and for content creation. As such, fluency in English with excellent writing skills is a must. In support of capital raise efforts, the Senior Associate will work closely with the wider Investor Solutions team and other stakeholders to coordinate marketing materials, RFPs, due diligence & roadshows, and act as a central liaison to facilitate client onboarding. Another aspect of the role will include streamlining processes for document management, data integrity and monitoring activity of the fund. The successful candidate will strive to: Provide diligent service and cutting-edge solutions to investors Provide a unified approach across the platform Demonstrate thoughtful analysis, governance and transparency Contribute to knowledge-sharing, best practice, collaboration and innovation Improve workflow processes and provide ideas/initiatives for innovation Provide first-hand experience and expertise to mentor junior team members and oversee their work In joining the team, the successful candidate will have the opportunity to contribute to multiple service platforms across the European region, with exposure to a global institutional client base. Key Responsibilities One of the more senior team members, responsible for a group of products with responsibility for oversight of work produced by supporting analysts and associates Lead contact for the Dutch Fund teams in delivering information to investors Lead contact for all Investor Solutions Officers and Existing Investors for the products in scope, with in-depth knowledge of the programs Responsible for delivering product updates to the Investor Solutions team and coordinating marketing plans together with Investor Solutions product captains Contribution to production and sign-off of all existing investor communication including; welcome packs, day to day queries, formal communications, standard & bespoke reporting, marketing materials, presentations, ad hoc communications Manage and sign-off of proposed marketing activity: presentations, due diligence days, roadshow coordination, investor meetings Production of RFPs (may include managing the process, production of overall document, writing specific responses and quality control of final product) Sign-off of RFPs and quarterly INREV DDQs Ownership of Fund documentation in conjunction with legal counsel (PPM, Sub. Agr., Fee rebate letters, Side letters). Responsible for the legal onboarding of prospective investors working with external legal counsel, fund legal services, Investor Services and the client Organization of quarterly webcasts, annual meetings and advisory boards Responsible for document, data and systems management: facilitate and implement a centralised workflow to investors, fund managers and investor services, ensuring quality and integrity of data Salesforce platform management: dashboards, content, tracking, closings & pipeline, contact. Ensure Investor Services and Fund expectations are aligned Special Projects: Support internal teams (i.e. Business Development, Investment Structuring) on high-impact, complex initiatives, including funds in launch period, active marketing campaigns, asset syndications, restructuring, or investor initiatives Lead projects to roll out new initiatives and efficiencies across the group; ensure strong messaging, consistency, and best practice What do you have to offer us? Person Specification: Strong work ethic and a ‘’CAN DO” attitude Flexible approach to work Excellent organisation and time management skills - ability to prioritise and coordinate tasks efficiently ensuring all deadlines are met Maintains a positive attitude towards routine tasks Accurate and exceptional attention to detail Strong analytical skills when working with client financial information Fluency in Dutch and English absolutely essential, including strong writing skills Ability to coach and mentor junior team members Experience working with CRM systems Experience in writing RFPs and fund documentation Pro-active and enjoys working autonomously and as part of a wider team Good interpersonal skills (“Building Bridges”) and confident in speaking to senior stakeholders Confident and assertive where required Flexible approach to work, with the ability to work under pressure Strong organization and project management skills Team player who deals effectively with colleagues and clients Working knowledge of and experience in the real estate industry Skills Required: Good IT skills (Word, Excel, PowerPoint) Experience of Salesforce, Access & SharePoint would be advantageous, but not essential Undergraduate degree required, ideally in one of real estate, business, finance, law or economics Strong presentation and communication skills, both verbally and in writing Demonstrate understanding of legal documentation and KYC procedures Sound understanding of basic accounting principles (or at least familiar with INREV) Experience in a client services team in an investment management business a must, ideally in real estate 7+ years of previous real estate experience About CBRE Global Investors CBRE Global Investors seeks to be the global leader in the real asset investment management industry, by offering a broad and deep investment platform that consistently delivers world-class investment results and exceptional client service. The firm’s focus on real estate and infrastructure, comprehensive capabilities and fiduciary commitment to its clients provide a competitive advantage in offering investment solutions. Access to the CBRE Group, Inc. platform and its global resources, including research, local market intelligence, investment sourcing, financing, leasing and property management provides the Firm with a significant edge in executing each strategy benefitting its investors. The firm has over 890 employees spread over 31 offices. CBRE Global Investors sponsors real asset investment programs across the risk/return spectrum in the Americas, Europe and Asia for investors worldwide, including public and private pension funds, insurance companies, sovereign wealth funds, foundations, endowments and high net worth individuals. Programs include a complete range of investment solutions including equity and debt, direct and indirect, real estate and infrastructure, and listed and unlisted strategies delivered through separate accounts and commingled funds.

title: E-Commerce and Experience Management Consultant
summary: And with good reason: our work includes pioneering next-level marketing, implementing industry-changing digital transformations and improving business…
description: As an E-Commerce and Experience Management Consultant you work in highly collaborative mode with the client and the Accenture and other teams to capture and document business requirements, customer journey flows, and functional designs in areas of E-Commerce and/or Experience Management solutions. You are the linking pin between the client and Development teams, and in certain cases act as a Product Owner or shadow Product Owner on behalf of the client.  Your job You play a pivotal role in helping our customers to achieve success in their E-Commerce / Experience Management transformation. The key role you will play are the (lead) Consultant / Business Analyst. In early stages of a transformation, you will prepare and recommend customers in areas where they can grow their online sales and help in prioritising customers in key focus areas and the roadmap. You put the end consumer central and design customer journey flows to structure the user stories in the right context. You help capture business requirements in the form of epics, features and user stories, and make sure the acceptance criteria for the user stories are clear. You define customer personas and get clear with the customer on satisfiers and dissatisfiers of the personas. You help the customer in understanding the business value of the business requirements and facilitate in the prioritization. You understand what E-Commerce and/or Experience management platform offer and make sure that clients are aware and benefit of available features. You act as an advisor and propose alternatives that provide more or similar business value to less costs. You act as the linking pin on a day-to-day basis with the client’s Product Owner, the User Experience specialists and the technical development team. You collaborate with the Testing team to prepare for the end-to-end tests.  Your team At Accenture Interactive, we consider ourselves as the most effective 'digital enablers' around. And with good reason: our work includes pioneering next-level marketing, implementing industry-changing digital transformations and improving business performance using digital technology and data insights. We bridge the gap between brand promise and expectations - by creating transformative Experiences.  We collaborate closely with our clients (including some world-famous brand names) to figure out what the possibilities are for their business. Innovating through cloud, mobility, media or analytics, our end goal is to design and deliver custom digital solutions that really work in the field – whether that’s online or offline.  Your background A Master’s Degree is required in field of Business/Marketing/Computer science; Regardless of the field, your study must have a relevant IT component. Excellent communication skills, structured, strong analytical and results-oriented mindset. A professional in the field of E-Commerce and/or Digital Marketing business with at least 3 years’ experience. Working as an E-Commerce and/or Digital Marketing Business / Project manager for an international company in the B2C domain or deep experience in advising people having this role. Familiar with the latest trends and developments in the E-Commerce domain. Knowledge of the key platforms and technologies in the market.  Our offer Accenture is an incredible place to work - and keep learning. By joining us, you’ll become part of a global company with a world-class brand and reputation. Besides the work we do for our clients, we’re proud of our vibrant, diverse workplace culture: we believe in openness and honesty, fairness and equality, common sense and realism. We want to get to know the real you and help you explore and grow - whatever it is you're great at. So, you will always have lots of learning opportunities (formal and informal) to improve your role-specific skills and expertise.  Besides our high-profile, challenging projects and our nurturing work environment, we offer excellent employee benefits, including: A flexible transport arrangement that suits your personal situation (electric car or bicycle, flexible budget including NS business card) An expense allowance Discount on Accenture shares The possibility to work 4 x 9 hours a week Interested? Are you ready to join Accenture for a career where you can be yourself and do what you love? Apply now and change the world around you.  Questions? Connect with Lisette Werkman, lisette.werkman@accenture.com

title: Regulatory Affairs Specialist - Dossier Development (CMC, module 3)
summary:
Coordinate and provide technical oversight for the generation of the CMC dossier of marketing and clinical trial submission.
Vind je deze vacature interessant?
description: Regulatory Affairs Specialist - Dossier Development (CMC, module 3) Location: Leiden Contact: Nicol Heijtbrink Job type: Temp to Perm Contact phone: +31 (0)20 406 97 50 Industry: Pharmaceutical , Life Sciences Contact email: nicol_heijtbrink@oxfordcorp.com For one of our clients, we are looking for an experienced Regulatory Affairs Officer who will thrive in a coordinating role. Do you have this experience within a pharmaceutical or biotechnological environment? Then please respond now! Job Description In this position as RA officer you will ensure that research projects are guided towards clinical product development. You make sure that the right legislation is complied with and you are responsible for all issues regarding CMC. Responsibilities Coordinate and provide technical oversight for the generation of the CMC dossier of marketing and clinical trial submission. Develop the technical eCTD sections to support Regulatory CMC dossier applications. Authorize sections of the CMC dossier and ensure that final versions comply with regulatory requirements and fulfill regulatory agency expectations. Lead dossier authoring activities for late stage projects for regulatory filings. Develop process and business improvements within own functional organization, and aligns with other departments as needed. Represent the department on multi-functional project development teams to support regulatory filings. Requirements You have a Masters/PhD degree (optional: with post-doc experience) in a pharmaceutical or biotechnology field Minimum of 3-5 years of working experience as a Regulatory Affairs officer and with CMC Experience with module 2.3 and module 3 You have good verbal and written communication skills You are organizational, structured and have technical insight and an eye for detail Benefits Employment: Start via Oxford Global Resources, realistic long term perspective, Salary indication: €4200- €7000 gross per month Working hours: 32 to 40 hours per week Location: Leiden region Vacancy number: 17112  Oxford Global Resources is het grootste recruitmentbureau binnen de vakgebieden Science, Engineering en IT. Al onze recruiters hebben zelf een relevante achtergrond binnen deze gebieden en helpen je graag bij het vinden van de perfecte baan in ons uitgebreide netwerk. Als gespecialiseerde partij hebben wij een groot aanbod aan laboratorium vacatures op het gebied van Quality Control (QC) en Research &Development (R&D) binnen diverse sectoren, waaronder de Farmaceutische industrie, Biotechnologie, Contract Manufacturing, Contract Research, Voedingsmiddelenindustrie, Chemie, Milieu en Plantensector. Oxford is altijd op zoek naar talent met expertise op het gebied van Biotechnologie, Immunologie, Biochemie, Virologie, Microbiologie, Moleculaire Biologie, Life Science, Analytische Chemie, Fysische Chemie, Polymeerchemie, Petrochemie en Diagnostiek. Wij komen graag in contact met kandidaten die ervaring hebben met een of meerdere van de volgende technieken: USP (Upstream Processing) DSP (Downstream Processing), Bioprocesses, viruskweek, celkweek, ELISA, FACS, Western Blot, SDS-page, PCR, RT-PCR, qPCR, kloneren, sequencing, eiwit zuivering, purificatie, HPLC, UPLC, chromatografie, fysische chemie, viscositeit, smeltpunt, pourpoint, pH, XRF, GC, GC-MS, LC, LC-MS, ICP ICP-MS, AAS, UV, titraties, Karl Fisher, formuleren, steriliteit, determinaties, bioburden, environmental monitoring, LIMS, GMP, GLP, GCP, GDP, ISO17025. Vind je deze vacature interessant? Of ben jij op zoek naar een functie op MLO, HLO, BSc, WO, MSc of PhD en heb je interesse in de vacature laboratorium Assistent, Laborant, Laborant monstervoorbereiding, Analist, Technician, Assistant Scientist, Associate Scientist, Scientist, Manufacturing Specialist, Process Engineer, Validatie Engineer, QA (Quality Assurance) Officer, RA (Regulatory Affairs) Officer, Supervisor, Teamleider, Afdelingshoofd, Hoofd Laboratorium, Manager, Director, etc. Neem dan direct contact met ons op! Apply Now

title: Research Analyst Grain Trading
summary:
Collaborate with the marketing teams to forecast regional Corn/feed grain flows basis key indicators (S&Ds, policy, and price).
Chinese language is a plus;
description: We are looking for an enthusiastic and motivated Research Analyst to join our Grain Research team at our Rotterdam office. Company Our world-leading, fully integrated agriculture network connects producers and consumers to supply sustainable, traceable and quality-controlled agricultural products. With our talented people, decades of experience and diverse capabilities, we offer innovative solutions to open pathways and create value for customers through our supply chains. As a responsible long-term business, we will continue to invest in and develop our network, allowing us to meet the needs of a growing world. Together, we are stronger and achieve more. Job description Coordinate and collate Corn/Barley supply and demand (S&D) data from the regional offices and other sources. Track and maintain a database of trade-flow statistics for Corn/Barley. Collaborate with the marketing teams to forecast regional Corn/feed grain flows basis key indicators (S&Ds, policy, and price). Track domestic and international prices for import/export parity analysis. Build price/profitability models. Join discussions with the trading team to identify directional, inter/intra market, geographical and cross-commodity spread opportunities and arbitrages. Produce a monthly corn/Barley S&D and trade flow book. Handle ad-hoc requests. Requirements Minimum Bachelor of Science in Economics, Statistics, Engineering, or similar; Ideally 2-5 years of experience in Commodity research/trading, preferably in a corporate environment; Strong analytical, writing and communications skills; Programming skills, database knowledge a plus; Ability to perform under pressure and meet time sensitive deadlines; Strong work ethic and an attention to detail; Ability to prioritize work and multi-task responsibilities; Self-starter – resourceful, highly organized and able to work independently; Good personal skills and the ability to work effectively within a team environment; Excellent command of English; Chinese language is a plus; Hands- on, can- do mentality. Offer We are located in over 35 countries and employing over 15.000 people worldwide. The position you are applying for is part of our Trade Research department. You will work in an informal and diverse team, and be part of an international organization that will help develop your skills and expertise. As well as this, we offer: A competitive salary; Flexible and attractive pension scheme; A 13th month salary; Working in an office located in the Centre of Rotterdam, next to Blaak station.

title: Senior Systems Engineer
summary: As we specialize in datadriven solutions, you can develop yourself by learning data analyst skills, discovering the field of marketing automation and deepen…
description: Beschrijving van het bedrijf You are the one who takes the red pill, the one that wants solutions that make things better and you have found the balance between novelty solutions and quality. You have a second home on GitHub and Stackoverflow and enjoy tweaking the performance of pretty much everything. The idea to work on multiple solutions in different projects excites you. And some trip abroad - as soon as we are allowed again – sounds adventurous right? Working with us, you will be challenged to keep learning, deploying, testing and tweaking. As senior systems engineer you are in charge of helping our customers to find the best solutions, run the projects on installation and figure out efficient ways to keep the systems up to date and running their best. As we specialize in datadriven solutions, you can develop yourself by learning data analyst skills, discovering the field of marketing automation and deepen your consultancy skills. You have options with us  What we do at Datalogue We specialize in valuable customer interactions. This means that we help customers use data to make sales, marketing and service interactions better and more relevant. We cover everything from system selection and installation, data integration through systems integration, AI, ML and analytics to the execution of marketing campaigns conform the marketing strategy. The focus is always on the end-customer and their interaction with a company. This allows us to serve multiple industries, which makes our job much more interesting and helps us to specialize in the field of customer interactions. We are vendor independent so we tailor the solution to the wishes of the client. No off-the-shelf solutions with us. Be sure to check our website if you’d like to know more.  Functieomschrijving What your job will be like Our world is large, the amount of data keeps on growing and the tool stack is constantly evolving. This also goes for this role. You have already seen lots of tooling and can (almost) independently form an opinion on the most optimal setup of the whole data architecture. You will plan, install/deploy and configure open- and closed-source software on Windows and UX-based systems. For example JupyterHub and webservices in (Kubernetes/OpenShift/ Docker) containers. You know your way around builidng, deploying and optimizing data pipes. You also help customers with middleware solutions on different cloud platforms and scheduling solutions. The ability to adapt fast to new technology, work together with your colleagues and the clients on both a functional and IT level is almost as important as the actual technical tasks. Yes, we know, we’re looking for the (im)possible. And finally, you’re keen on traveling every once in a while, either to our sister companies or clients (in Europe).  Functie-eisen Expected hard skills Background in Information Management, Business Informatics, Data Science or similar Minimum of 8 years of relevant working experience Experience with two or more programming languages, preferably Python, Java, C#, Scala or R Expert for versioning tools (i.e. GIT, CVS, …) Strong affinity with data science, AI and ML. In-depth administration skills of UX-Systems Good understanding of networking and systems security Professional Dutch is mandatory, English a strong plus, German would be nice. Please be aware of this requirement, as we will hard-select on this. And important soft skills You are able to manage complex work situations, are independent and pro-active. You want to understand the full picture to work towards an optimal solution, if necessary in iterations. You are an exact worker and thrive on getting the nitty-gritty details right. You don’t mind working in several teams/projects (also possibly on client side) and are not afraid to communicate about your work. You are not scared of figuring things out by yourself or proposing new processes for … well anything.  Skills that will be seen as a bonus: Knowledge of relational databases and SQL language Knowledge of No-SQL systems Experience with ETL tooling or scripting Experience with newer Big Data technology (Hadoop, Cassandra, Spark, Kafka) Knowledge of Single Sign On tooling Experience with System Administration for Windows Experience with Reporting or Business Intelligence (Tableau, QlickView, Cognos)  Extra informatie Feel like this is something for you? Contact Esmee Warmerdam or Pepijn Born directly by sending us a message. Be sure to include a short motivation and CV. We’ll shortly plan a zoom call of about 45 minutes. If there’s a mutual match, we’ll dive into your skills some more and make sure our motivation and expectations are in line with each other. We might also introduce you to our German colleagues or ask you to show some actual work. We just want to be sure, you too right?! Acquisitions resulting from this job opening is not appreciated.

title: Senior Product Manager - Paid Acquisition channels
summary: Over time, you will expand our product efforts across other key paid marketing channels such as email marketing, facebook, instagram, youtube etc.
description: Company Description We are on a mission to be the easiest and most reliable way to arrange home services, connecting homeowners with qualified tradespeople. We operate the market-leading brands in France (Travaux.com) and The Netherlands (Werkspot.nl), and are expanding in Italy (Instapro.it). Our product, technology & UX department consists of approximately 100 talented professionals, deeply passionate about creating great digital marketplaces. Travaux, Werkspot and Instapro are part of IAC / ANGI Home Services.  Job Description Product management for Paid acquisition channels at Travaux, Werkspot and Instapro We are a marketplace that connects homeowners with tradespeople to arrange services at home (home service examples are painting a room, installing a heater etc). We have several product teams that work on improving different parts of our marketplace platform everyday. We are forming a new product team that will focus on improving our ‘paid acquisition’ efforts related to acquiring demand (a.k.a homeowners with jobs to be done) on our marketplace. An example of a paid acquisition is buying an advertisement on google (via google adwords) for upper funnel keywords such as “install an air conditioner”, “find a painter in amsterdam” etc. We’re looking for a senior product manager to join this newly formed ‘Paid acquisition’ team.  Qualifications What you’ll be doing You will be leading the product efforts for a team composed of multiple backend & frontend engineers, a user experience specialist, an agile coach, a data scientist, and a business analyst You will build products that optimize the performance of all our paid acquisition channels You will start with productizing & leveraging technology to improve the performance of our paid search marketing on google. Over time, you will expand our product efforts across other key paid marketing channels such as email marketing, facebook, instagram, youtube etc Data science & machine learning (ML) will be an increasingly important part of solving this marketing performance puzzle. You will be working on product improvements that find the sweet spot between marketing, data science & user experience Our marketing department will be a key internal stakeholder that you will regularly collaborate with Who you are You have 4+ years of experience in Product Management You have 2+ years of experience on paid marketing related product efforts (e.g. Google adwords, Double click, facebook etc.) You have a lean mindset and have worked in agile product development environments You have built products that leverage data science & machine learning You are data-driven and have strong analytical skills You enjoy going through numbers and you base your decisions on facts rather than opinions You are a reliable, communicative and collaborative team player You are open-minded, curious and embrace diversity You have excellent communication skills in English Bonus points for communication skills in French and/or Dutch Bonus points for any marketing related certifications (e.g. Google adwords) What we offer We have offices in both Amsterdam and Aix-en-provence. We offer a great working environment in either of these offices (once we go back to the office) Flexible working hours and remote working to accommodate personal needs A competitive salary Personal growth budget and time for attending training courses and conferences Relocation budget if coming from abroad (once it is safe/possible) 25 days of annual leave Pension arrangement Lunch allowance (even with the current remote working situation) Free fitness in our building (once it is safe/possible) Frequent and fun events with the entire company to celebrate achievements and milestones  Additional Information How we are organized: Our Product, Technology and UX department currently consists of 3 tracks and approximately 100 professionals, with more than 15 different nationalities from all over the world. Each track focuses on the most valuable opportunity within their given scope. Within the tracks, multidisciplinary product development teams collaborate on achieving the goals that they set and commit to each quarter. We approach our decisions in an experiment-guided and Agile way: we validate new directions using a variety of quantitative and qualitative research methods. Our shared values: We believe our success starts with sharing the same values when it comes to how we work. These values are the foundation of everything we do, and you’ll experience them on a daily basis. Our values are: Be stronger together; Aim high; Take ownership; Be transparent and respectful; Be open-minded and curious; Embrace diversity; Focus on our customers. The company culture in our organisation is very open and inclusive; we are committed to building teams that represent a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. Special note related to COVID-19: We will be onboarding remotely. Until the government (RIVM) is no longer advising us to work from home, we will be working remotely. We will do our best to make the onboarding as smooth as possible and help you get up-to-speed.  Is this for you? Send your resume with a brief explanation of why you are highly motivated by this role. You can apply via the “Apply” button or by sending your information to Aravind Nair, Principal product manager at Werkspot, Travaux and Instapro. We’re looking forward to meeting you!

title: Marketing Intelligence Analist
summary:
Het optimaliseren van de marketingdata, zodat alles uit de offline én online gegevens gehaald wordt.
Dat is waar jij als Marketing Intelligence Analist energie…
description: Het optimaliseren van de marketingdata, zodat alles uit de offline én online gegevens gehaald wordt. Dat is waar jij als Marketing Intelligence Analist energie uit haalt én verantwoordelijk voor bent! Je maakt analyses & dashboards, past machine learning toe en automatiseert (online) marketingacties. Als Marketing Intelligence Analist bij deze informele organisatie in Dordrecht ontwikkel je dashboards in Tableau, maak je analyses met R & Python, waarbij je continu op zoek bent naar het realiseren van groei. Nieuwsgierig? We vertellen graag meer! Organisatie Jouw nieuwe werkgever is actief in de zakelijke dienstverlening. Het is een informele organisatie waarin de medewerkers gestimuleerd worden en de ruimte krijgen om zichzelf verder te ontwikkelen. Met ruim 200 collega’s zijn zij elke dag bezig om hun klanten zo goed mogelijk van dienst te zijn.  In deze professionele en ambitieuze organisatie worden medewerkers gestimuleerd en krijgen de ruimte om zichzelf te blijven ontwikkelen. Er heerst een open & prettige werksfeer waar ook ruimte is om gezellig met elkaar te lunchen in de mooie bedrijfskantine en op vrijdagmiddag de week af te sluiten met een borrel op het dakterras met een prachtig uitzicht over Dordrecht!  Je komt als Marketing Intelligence Analist te werken met zeven enthousiaste collega’s, het team waarin je komt te werken is gedreven, leergierig en gericht op innovatie. Functie Het optimaliseren van de marketingdata, zodat alles uit de offline én online gegevens gehaald wordt. Dat is waar jij als Marketing Intelligence Analist energie uit haalt én verantwoordelijk voor bent! Je maakt analyses & dashboards, past machine learning toe en automatiseert (online) marketingacties. Daarnaast ga je je ook met verschillende projecten bezighouden. Eén daarvan is het slimmer inrichten van zoekwoordanalyses, zodat dit niet meer handmatig gedaan hoeft te worden én er effectiever geadverteerd kan worden. Hiervoor combineer je verschillende tools, laat je er marketinganalyses op los en richt je scripts in voor Google Ads. Uiteraard kunnen bij zulke analyses conversie-attributiemodellen niet ontbreken. Een ander project is het automatisch importeren van e-mailingselecties in het e-mailingsysteem. Waarbij je via de api koppeling automatisch e-mailings gaat verzenden naar de juiste ontvangers op het juiste moment. Daarna volgt uiteraard het verbeteren van de voorspelmodellen en selecties!  Al met al, datagedreven werken is helemaal jouw ding en jij gaat er met jouw expertise als Marketing Intelligence Analist voor zorgen dat jullie continu kunnen inspelen op de meest actuele trends & ontwikkelingen in dit mooie vakgebied. Functie-eisen Als Marketing Intelligence Analist heb je een passie voor marketingdata en automatisering, hierbij vind je ook de technische kant interessant. Natuurlijk breng je ook een groot analytisch vermogen en een commerciële instelling mee. Verder herken je jezelf in het volgende profiel: Een afgeronde hbo- of wo-opleiding in bijvoorbeeld de richting van Marketing, Commerciële Economie, Communicatie & Multimedia Design (CMD) of Marketingdata; Minimaal twee jaar ervaring als Marketing Automation Analist, Marketing Data Specialist, Data Analist of een andere vergelijkbare functie; Je hebt een uitstekende beheersing van de Nederlandse taal; Ervaring met Tableau en/of Power BI; Ben je bekend met Google Ads scripts en/of Javascript, dan is dat mooi meegenomen; Heb je ervaring met Python of R? Dit is een grote pre! Aanbod En wat bieden wij jou als toekomstig Marketing Intelligence Analist in Dordrecht? Een inspirerende en informele werkomgeving met enthousiaste en inspirerende collega’s, waar je de vrijheid krijgt om mee te denken en ideeën aan te dragen; Een mooi bruto maandsalaris tussen de €2500 en €4000, afhankelijk van jouw leeftijd en ervaring; Een uitdagende functie waarin je afhankelijk van jouw voorkeur 32, 36 of 40 uur per week werkt; 25 vakantiedagen; De mogelijkheid om opleidingen te volgen, jezelf verder te ontwikkelen en door te groeien; Een vitaliteitsvergoeding; Gezellige borrels en feestjes; En tot slot (voor later!) een goede pensioenregeling! Sollicitatie Je kunt via de button ‘solliciteer’ rechtstreeks reageren op deze functie. Vul jouw gegevens in op het invulformulier en stuur je CV (en eventuele motivatie) als bijlage(n) mee. Jouw sollicitatie wordt dan direct gekoppeld aan deze vacature en in behandeling genomen. #prio2

title: Senior Data & Analytics Consultant
summary:
Daarnaast zoeken we een sterke analist.
Data Analytics bureau Cloud Nine Digital is per direct op zoek naar een Senior Consultant voor de Data & Analytics…
description: Data Analytics bureau Cloud Nine Digital is per direct op zoek naar een Senior Consultant voor de Data & Analytics afdeling om onze klanten door middel van het beschikbaar maken en het benutten van data te ondersteunen met hun digitale groei. Heb jij een scherp oog voor details? Ben je kritisch en goed met verscheidene tools als Google Analytics 360, Adobe Analytics en Tealium IQ? Dan ben jij wat we zoeken! Wat ga je doen als Senior Data & Analytics consultant? Als Senior Data & Analytics consultant ga je in teamverband aan de slag met klanten om de (digitale) data operatie naar een hoger niveau te tillen. Dit doe je door ze te adviseren op strategisch en tactisch niveau en door operationeel de meest complexe zaken op te pakken. Hiervoor heb je kennis van en werk je met: Datalayer design Google Marketing Platform (GA & GTM) Adobe Marketing Suite (Analytics & Launch) Cloud diensten van Google (Firebase & BigQuery), Amazon en Microsoft Tag Management en CDP oplossingen als Tealium, Ensighten en Relay42 Visualisatie oplossingen zoals PowerBI en Tableau Als voornaamste bezigheid help je onze klanten bij de implementatie, de configuratie, en het gebruik van web- en app analytics tools. Dankzij jouw sterk ontwikkelende analytische vermogen kan je de wensen, propositie en situatie van de klant vertalen naar een concreet implementatie advies wat resulteert in waardevolle en betrouwbare data. Je houdt je daarnaast ook bezig met: Advies uitbrengen over het gebruik van (digitale) data in combinatie met andere databronnen; Het opzetten van rapportages en dashboards; Het geven van trainingen: dit vakgebied is immers jouw expertise en jij wil anderen daarin helpen groeien! Wie zoeken we? We zoeken een consultant die chaotische en complexe situaties weet te overzien en vertalen naar structurele verbeteringen en georganiseerde chaos ;). Je bent technisch sterk en kan door je ervaring werken met meerdere tools. Het implementeren hiervan is voor jou een tweede natuur. Daarnaast zoeken we een sterke analist. Jij kan door jouw opgedane kennis en werkervaring zelfstandig data analyseren en vertalen in verbeterpunten of verwerken in dashboards en rapportages. Verder is je werk nauwkeurig en gestructureerd, en ben je punctueel. Klanten zijn blij met jou: jij bent immers goed in het opbouwen en onderhouden van klantrelaties. Servicegericht is jouw tweede naam! Verder herken je jezelf hierin: Je hebt ervaring met Tagmanagement en bent bekend met tools als Google Tag Manager, Adobe Launch en Tealium IQ; Je hebt kennis van- en ervaring met het implementeren van nieuwe tools; Je hebt ervaring met het zelfstandig maken van analyses en dit omzetten tot een advies; Je hebt gewerkt voor/bij grote en complexe organisaties; Je hebt HBO- of WO werk- en denkniveau minstens 3 jaar relevante werkervaring; Je bent procesvaardig en zelfstandig. Het bijhouden van taken en deadlines gaat je gemakkelijk af en je communiceert hier goed over; Uitstekende beheersing van de Nederlandse taal en goede beheersing van de Engelse taal in woord en geschrift; Je bent 32 tot 40 uur per week beschikbaar. Wat bieden we? Bij Cloud Nine Digital kijken we wat jij nodig hebt om je zo goed mogelijk te kunnen ontwikkelen. Op goede, individuele begeleiding kan je rekenen. Daarnaast ontvang je bij ons: Een marktconforme beloning voor je harde werken; Een riante bonusregeling bovenop je salaris én 25 vakantiedagen; Een jaarlijks opleidingsbudget van €1500,- en goede doorgroeimogelijkheden; Volledige reiskostenvergoeding; Een uitdagende plek in een bedrijf waar feestjes, borrels en uitjes regelmatig plaatsvinden. Parttime uren: 32-40 per week Soort dienstverband: Fulltime, Parttime, Bepaalde tijd, Onbepaalde tijd Aanvullende betalingen: Bonusregeling Vakantiegeld Arbeidsvoorwaarden: Bedrijfsfeesten Budget voor professionele ontwikkeling Flexibele werkuren Lunchkorting Pensioen Reiskostenvergoeding Telefoonplan Vrijdagmiddagborrel Werkschema: Dagdienst Flexibel werkrooster ma-vr Ervaring: Data & Analytics: 3 jaar (Aanbevolen) Taal: Nederlands (Vereist) Thuiswerken: Tijdelijk vanwege COVID-19

title: Marketing Data Analyst
summary:
4+ years of experience as data analyst, which required good stakeholder management and communication skills.
Are you a master in SQL, (PostgreSQL and Big Query)…
description: Senior Marketing Data Analyst Do you have 4+ years of experience as a data analyst after you finished your Bachelor’s degree? Are you a master in SQL, (PostgreSQL and Big Query) combined with experience with programming in Python or R? Would you like to work for a ambitions growth organisation as CarNext.com in an exciting and constantly changing (online) market? If you answered yes to the above questions, please apply for this challenging position as our Senior Marketing Data Analyst in our international scale-up environment!  This is CarNext.com CarNext.com is a scale-up with a start-up mentality. We’re bold and have a passion to change the status quo. We’re building a transparent digital marketplace that customers can trust. And it’s the same at CarNext.com. We’re proud of our open culture, collaborative ethos, vibrant environment and can-do approach. As we grow our business, we’re keen to hear from people who understand what we’re about and can help us achieve our mission.  Help us build the future of mobility! As the Senior Marketing Data Analyst, you will make a crucial contribution to the insight and utilization of data within the company. Whilst being a valuable member of the Marketing Department, you will work with all parts of the company to help them give the right business decision. It’s important to us that our new Senior Data Analyst is someone who works with precision, is decisive, has a great set of analytical skills and loves driving business decisions coming from data.  In this role you will be: Identifying trends Analyzing patterns in measurement data, expanding validation options; Fixing the data issues and communications around it Creating new metrics after doing all the necessary checks Testing hypothesis Participate in project teams for custom measurements and data flows; Developing the data collection of new meters; Support in the daily activities of the Data team; Organizing imports and exports of data (APIs); Contributes actively to securing and transferring knowledge in the organization; Building knowledge meters and protocols;  Must haves for this role: Bachelor’s degree (undergraduate program completed), preferably in Engineering, Business, Marketing or other relevant fields, a Master’s degree is a nice to have 4+ years of experience as data analyst, which required good stakeholder management and communication skills Stakeholder Management and good communication skills Statistical knowledge and data modelling is required Really analytical mindset and eye for business needs Mastered in Excel Mastered in SQL, (PostgreSQL and Big Query) Have experience with Programming Languages – Python (or R) Statistical knowledge and good understanding of mathematical theorems English (fluent, verbally and written), and second language is a nice to have  Skills that you need in order to succeed in this position: Ambition and self-motivation Energetic, flexible and always looing to learn new things; An amazing team player and willing to go above and beyond in delivering great work; Have a proactive and flexible mind set, with an attitude to thrive in a dynamic, fast-paced, start-up like environment.  The team You will work in a small team in which you will get every opportunity to further develop yourself.  Grow with us CarNext.com provides ample opportunities for personal and professional growth. If you feel this is a great match with your skills, Go ahead, apply and send us your CV

title: Product Manager/Product Owner/Business Analyst – Payment and Fleet Technology Solutions
summary: The successful candidate is likely to have in excess of 5 years’ work experience as a product manager/ product owner/ business analyst or similar role…
description: At TreviPay, we help clients grow by streamlining B2B payments through a combination of innovative technology, service expertise, and working capital to improve their customer’s experience and free up funding for growth. We facilitate $6 billion in transactions per year in 18 currencies for customers in more than 27 countries. We specialize in payment and credit management for B2B companies across the globe, setting the stage for the future of omni-channel B2B payments by extending terms, handling invoicing and managing collections. We take care of our clients by taking care of their customers.  Every day, TreviPay employees are challenged and empowered in a supportive, collaborative, entrepreneurial environment.  Product Manager/Product Owner required by a rapidly expanding Fintech brand!  The Product Manager/Product owner is a pivotal, mid-level management role in the product management group at Multi Services Technology Solutions and is responsible for translating business ideas and vision into tangible deliveries using IT systems.  TreviPay provides net pay commercial billing services and payment solutions within closed loop merchant networks, including truck stops and service stations, worldwide aviation fuel and marine fuel locations, European tolls and tunnels, as well as retail merchants.  Reporting into the Director, European Product Management and Software Engineering, the Product Manager will oversee all major product strategies and development initiatives across the EMEA region in terms of innovative developments in the field of logistics, payment card technology platforms, telematics.  This is an exciting opportunity to collaborate with and support the EMEA senior management team and be part of the global IT management team.  Key success factors for the role are the natural abilities to: Develop and drive the product road map and product vision in alignment with the company’s near-term goals and long-term vision. Collaborate with internal and external stakeholders in developing key growth initiatives. Ability to prioritize. Manage all aspects of a successful product through its life cycle. Lead and inspire product development teams to push boundaries in building products focused on excellent customer experience.  Principal Responsibilities Determine new product requirements or existing product enhancement (functional) gathering relevant input from internal subject matter experts, internal stakeholder teams (e.g. Sales, Support, Operations, FP&A), customers and key partners. Collaborate with other product owners and the product manager to create the product road map. Create and Own a product backlog based on the product road map. Continuously groom the product backlog in collaboration with the technical leads. Create user stories from the backlog for the development team to develop the product. Accept user stories post development. Interact with the Technology team and drive the agile practices. Lead E2E implementation of new products and services: Define the real value proposition of the product. Co-Create the product launch plan in collaboration with Sales, Support, Finance and Marketing. Collaborate with multiple stakeholders within the organizations to ensure successful product launch. Develop and monitor post launch product KPIs. Produce product description document and any other documents relevant to the product launch. Act as POC to internal stakeholders for assigned product(s). Key stakeholders are the functional or departmental leads of other business functions. Contribute to the Product strategy by keeping abreast of market dynamics, competitor and partner activities in relevant industries, and building a robust view of the market landscape.  The Individual The successful candidate is likely to have in excess of 5 years’ work experience as a product manager/ product owner/ business analyst or similar role supporting web products/apps/sites in the areas of payment card technologies, logistics/fleet management technologies or telematics. Experience of owning the product development strategy is essential. Strong written and oral communication skills in English are essential. Strong business partnering skills and the ability to communicate product ideas to senior management and partner with technology teams to deliver the solution is essential. Strong analytical skills are essential. Strong team working skills are essential. Strong team leadership experience and skills are essential.  Why you will love working at TreviPay Competitive salary Casual environment and dress Employee referral program  At TreviPay we believe: in saying yes to unique and challenging requirements empowered team members are creative team members our products make the customer’s day just a little bit better work/life balance makes us all more effective  TreviPay is an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer. We welcome all veterans and disabled applicants.

title: Finance Professionals
summary: Wij zijn doorlopend op zoek naar ervaren Finance professionals die op zoek zijn naar een functie binnen de profit of de non-profit sector.
description: Wij zijn doorlopend op zoek naar ervaren Finance professionals die op zoek zijn naar een functie binnen de profit of de non-profit sector. Je hebt minimaal een financiële HBO opleiding afgerond en beschikt over tenminste 5 jaar relevante werkervaring, bij voorkeur op o.a. de gebieden (business)controlling, management rapportering, administratieve organisatie, planning & control. Denk hierbij aan de volgende functies: Controller| (senior) Adviseur P&C Medewerker AO Finance manager Business analyst. Profiel Als persoon ben je nieuwsgierig en zelfverzekerd en heb je altijd oog voor de vernieuwingen in jouw vakgebied. Aanbod Organisatie Pro-Link bemiddelt MBO+/HBO/WO professionals met de juiste persoonlijkheid. Met een jarenlange kwalitatieve ervaring in de werving & selectie / headhunting zijn wij DE recruitmentspecialist. op het gebieden: Techniek (maintenance, productie, kwaliteit, operations, supply chain, inkoop, engineering); Sales & Marketing; Finance. Wij brengen jou graag in contact met potentiële opdrachtgevers, pas je binnen ons profiel en ben je toe aan een volgende stap? Stuur dan je cv en dan nodigen wij jou uit voor een kennismakingsgesprek om de mogelijkheden en jouw wensen te bespreken. Contact Maak jij het verschil? Dan komen wij graag in contact met jou. Solliciteer via onderstaande button of mail naar Saskia Leenders-van der Linden. Mail: s.leenders@pro-link.nl of bel via: 06 43889347.

title: Market & Product Analyst
summary:
Voor ons internationale Supply team zijn we op zoek naar een market & product analyst die ons team wil komen versterken.
Wat hebben wij te bieden?
description: Uren: 40 uur per week | Contact: recruitment@dvep.nl| Internationale functie Voor ons internationale Supply team zijn we op zoek naar een market & product analyst die ons team wil komen versterken. Binnen de Supply afdeling van Energy Marketing zoeken en genereren we nieuwe kansen voor ons bedrijf. Dit doen we door gebruik te maken van onze expertise en innovatieve aanpak. We zijn sterk in groei, het beheersen van risico’s en het leveren van extra waarde aan de organisatie. In deze rol ben jij het eerste aanspreekpunt voor alle sales kantoren binnen de Energy Marketing groep. Vanuit de afdeling Supply ondersteun jij je sales collega’s op allerlei gebieden, zoals het afgeven van prijzen, productontwikkeling en wet- en regelgeving vraagstukken. Je krijgt veel vrijheid in de invulling van deze functie en wij verwachten dan ook dat je iemand bent met een ondernemende en ambitieuze instelling. Wat ga je doen? Dagelijks genereren van prijzen voor je sales collega’s van onze Europese verkoopkanalen voor gas, elektriciteit en GvO’s. Je houdt je bezig met contractontwikkeling, productontwikkeling en houdt de prijzen op de markt in de gaten. Onderhouden van contact met je interne collega’s van o.a. Supply, Sales en IT. Bijwonen en coördineren van voorkomende projecten. Contact met marktpartijen in verschillende landen over o.a. de regelgeving en lokale eisen op leverancier en PV gebied. Optimaliseren van tools en processen om onze klanten optimaal te ondersteunen en risico’s te minimaliseren. Verhandelen van groencertificaten (GVO’s). Eerste aanspreekpunt voor de sales kantoren in diverse landen. Wat breng je mee? Je hebt een HBO of WO afgeronde opleiding. Je bent commercieel en communicatief vaardig. Je bent cijfermatig sterk en werkt accuraat. Je hebt ervaring met projectmatig werken en haalt hier energie uit. Je bent goed in het stellen van prioriteiten en kan met deadlines werken. Je bent klantgericht, besluitvaardig, nieuwsgierig en innovatief. Goede kennis van de Nederlandse en Engelse taal in woord en geschrift. Franse kennis in woord en geschrift is een pre. Wie zijn wij? Binnen Europa opereren wij onder de vlag van Energy Marketing. Dit is een onderdeel van UGI International en wij werken o.a. in België, Frankrijk, Nederland en Engeland. Je zult binnen deze functie continu contact hebben met de verschillende bedrijven die vallen onder Energy Marketing. Zo werk je onder andere voor Antargaz (België & Frankrijk), Avantigas (Verenigd Koninkrijk) en DVEP Energie (Nederland). Het Energy Marketing team is ambitieus, internationaal en hecht veel waarde aan persoonlijke ontwikkeling van talent. Wat hebben wij te bieden? Je komt te werken in een internationale organisatie met betrokken collega’s en doorgroeimogelijkheden. Jij krijgt de vrijheid en mogelijkheid om deze functie verder uit te werken. Werken in een jong team binnen een snelgroeiend bedrijf. 26 vakantiedagen en de mogelijkheid tot het bijkopen van extra vakantiedagen. Korting op je energierekening. Heb jij interesse in deze functie? Stuur dan je sollicitatie via het formulier op deze pagina. We nemen dan zo snel mogelijk contact met je op. Wil je meer weten over de vacature? Neem dan contact op met Laura van den Berge via recruitment@dvep.nl of via 06-27858954.  Een VOG maakt onderdeel uit van de procedure.

title: Online Marketeer (medior/senior)
summary:
Je bent goed met (marketing)teksten, en weet ook hiermee de juiste klanten aan te spreken.
Je zal brede ervaring opdoen, samenwerken met een ervaren growth…
description: Ben jij er klaar voor om als Online Marketeer aan de slag te gaan bij een innovatieve scale-up? Ligo is een snelgroeiende legal tech bedrijf en is op zoek naar een ervaren marketeer die alle kansen krijgt om door te groeien en impact te maken!  Ligo Ligo is bestaat inmiddels 5 jaar en is het nummer 1 legal platform in Nederland. Wij maken ‘legal’ makkelijk, snel en betaalbaar. Met onze technologie zorgen we ervoor dat elk persoon onbeperkt gebruik kan maken van betaalbare juridische diensten. Een bedrijf oprichten, een contract op maat maken, bellen voor advies van topadvocaten, handige workflows om “legal jobs to be done” te tackelen, een testament of samenlevingscontract opstellen regelen, bij Ligo kan dit allemaal. Het team van Ligo groeit snel en we bieden jou een unieke kans om als Marketeer deel te nemen aan dit mooie avontuur. Je zal brede ervaring opdoen, samenwerken met een ervaren growth hacker/data analist en meebouwen aan een leading platform dat nu in Nederland al een hele industrie domineert.  Wat ga je bij ons doen? Als Online Marketeer heb jij een belangrijke rol in de verdere groei van Ligo. Jij zet de marketingstrategie uit en bouwt aan naamsbekendheid, de groei van leads en optimaliseert de conversie. Dit doe je door doelgericht te experimenteren met online marketingkanalen en strategieën, die je niet alleen bedenkt, maar ook uitvoert. Je krijgt hierin veel vrijheid en werkt samen met de growth hacker die van vele markten thuis is, scherpe developers en ons Customer Success team. Door jouw brede kennis weet je goed welke kanalen in te zetten om meer omzet te generen en de business uit te bouwen. Termen als SEA, SEO, CRO en Viral Marketing zijn voor jou aan de orde van de dag. Binnen deze functie met je zowel hands-on als strategisch verantwoordelijk om de juiste online doelstellingen te behalen en de juiste doelgroepen te bereiken. Je bent goed met (marketing)teksten, en weet ook hiermee de juiste klanten aan te spreken. Je rapporteert aan de CEO, je kan het Marketing Team gaan uitbreiden en je kan snel doorgroeien! Waar worden wij blij van? HBO- of WO-studie afgerond; 4 jaar werkervaring in een soortgelijke functie; Je hebt ervaring met Google Analytics, SEA en SEO; Je spreekt en schrijft uitstekend Nederlands en Engels; Je kan snel schakelen tussen strategie en executie; Je bent ambitieus, resultaatgericht en proactief; Je bent zelfsturend en houdt van verantwoordelijkheid; Je bent organisatorisch sterk en kan team members meekrijgen. Voor jou hebben wij: Een super enthousiast jong team dat er het maximale uit wil halen elke dag Een omgeving waar legio aan mogelijkheden zijn: voor jezelf en de groei van het bedrijf Mogelijkheid tot impact maken bij een leading B2B en B2C platform dat een hele industrie domineert Marktconform salaris Friday drinks, fruit, snacks & verse lunch elke dag! Hoe is het Ligo Team? Our team consists of enthusiastic enthusiasts who go the extra mile every day to make Ligo a great success! We love tackling, striving for a goal, making an impact and that is noticeable every day. It is not without reason that we want to become the largest in the market. If you get excited about this, then you certainly fit Ligo. Lijkt dit je wat? Solliciteer direct via de link hieronder. We kijken uit naar je reactie!

title: Principal Product Manager Equinix Metal
summary:
Strong business and industry analyst awareness.
Manage the execution of regional and global product marketing, GTM, strategy and plans, in conjunction with core…
description: Principal Product Manager Equinix Metal Job Description - Principal Product Manager– EMEA – Equinix Metal Equinix, Inc. connects the world’s leading businesses to their customers, employees and partners inside the most interconnected Data Centres. In a digital economy where enterprise business models are increasingly interdependent, interconnection is essential to success. Equinix operates the global interconnection platform, sparking new opportunities that are only possible when companies come together. The Principal Product Manager is responsible for: Product launches in the region working with cross functional teams to create/develop/execute product line specific go to market strategy and plans. Serves as the primary product technical expert within the region in support of sales, solution architects, partners, customers. Serves as the voice of the regions (leadership, sales, solution architects, customers, partners, market) back into the global Equinix Metal organization Hiring Location: Amsterdam Responsibilities: Responsible for product vision and roadmap updates in the region aligned with global core Promotes specific product line in region with key stakeholders to increase product adoption Support regional customer meetings, public speaking opportunities, analyst briefings, partner forums as product SMEs Act as regional expert on the Competitive Landscape, market requirements and overall product needs for the EMEA region Product backlog based on data and input, feedback from customers and customer facing sales/sales support organisations Working with Core Product Management, provide Market prioritisation and business case input for opportunity, forecast and insight as well as recommendation for new market/product expansions Work with regional presidents and sales management to develop and drive targeted sales, partner enablement programs Market sensing - Participate in regional CABs and other forums, provide actionable insight as needed to drive positive change in the performance of our products in region. Manage the execution of regional and global product marketing, GTM, strategy and plans, in conjunction with core product, business development, vertical marketing, partner marketing teams Accountable for end-to-end product launch activity Contributes to the development of global product positioning and messaging that establishes the need for Equinix products in the market and differentiate them against the competition and substitutes Stakeholder management · Effectively maintains and utilizes relationships with key stakeholders throughout the company and Ensures alignment in cross-functional priorities Set and approve pricing and discounts to meet revenue and margin objectives, aligned to Global pricing frameworks Responsible for non-standard contractual SLA approvals Contributes to company product planning to ensure deployment and delivery according to plan and budget Review market research to identify new opportunities Monitor evolution of customer segment needs, market and industry developments to help with strategic product planning including new services, markets, IBXs Conduct Win/Loss and ROI analysis Ensure smooth handover of new products/services from product development / Core product management, to regional marketing, sales and sales support teams in the country operations Experience and Skills 10+ years with Business or Technology focus, with at least 5 years in product management or product marketing lead or strategy and planning positions Product management and Product marketing experience gained from Cloud/Devops/IT/ (experience of Colocation, networking, cloud connectivity and network virtualisation ideal); Experience in high-growth business sectors Market expertise in Cloud, Edge Computing and Virtualisation. Ability to analyse complex business issues, identify, design & implement effective practical recommendations Deep customer-facing and market-facing experience Proven ability to build strong working relationships with Marketing Peers, Sales Leadership and Country Managers to be the voice of the region in global product planning activities Excellent interpersonal skills Sets high personal standards and is goal oriented Effective communications skills, both verbal and written Able to operate in a performance driven organization Culturally aware and adept at working across multiple geographies Leadership of highly visible programs and provide thought leadership Strong business and industry analyst awareness Strong product lifecycle management skills Proven project management skills Strong technical acumen and understanding of Colocation, networking, clouds, SDN, portals, digital customer experience Good analytical, problem solving and planning skills Willingness to travel in the EMEA Region Qualifications Technical and/or business degree What we offer The opportunity to leave your mark in a company that is growing quickly and still manages to keep a pioneer spirit. We offer a competitive salary and a great opportunity to build and expand your experience in an international environment. Want to know more? Feel free to contact us when you have any questions regarding the vacancy

title: Business Support Analyst IT
summary: In addition to a large marketing and sales network, Dümmen Orange has a diversified network of specialized production sites.
description: Dümmen Orange is the world’s largest breeder and propagator of cut flowers, bulbs, tropical plants, pot plants, bedding plants and perennials. For our IT department in De Lier, we are looking for a Business Support Analyst. Job objective Our organization grows and flourishes via organic growth and by acquiring other companies. This results in a fast-changing and, therefore, challenging environment. Dümmen Orange is operating within a digital transformation related to customer facing tools like a web shop and different app’s to be used by our customers. The number of customer actively working with our web shop and associated app’s is increasing rapidly. As a Business Support Analyst you give IT-support for these applications and help to develop and implement functionality and as well as new applications. You will work within our IT team to guard the interfaces between all the systems we have in our landscape, all part of the total IT landscape that does support our sales and production entities all over the globe. You are working within the IT team, your colleagues (around 20 persons) are mainly located in de Lier and also in Germany and within the US. You are reporting to the Manager Information Management. Your tasks and responsibilities As a business support analyst, you are one of the key players within the customer IT to implement and support projects like Web shop, App development & Sales Force. You guard the complex IT landscape, Architecture and interfaces to ensure to correct data gathering and flow. As a second line IT-support behind our key users, you will support our customers in working with applications like web shop and apps. Answering helpdesk questions and solving incidents are part of the daily work. The customer applications do extensively interface within our complete application landscape. It’s your task to oversee and troubleshot this interfaces. These interfaces are build up of connections using API’s, web services to our backend systems. You will work with the suppliers to manage the development and perform IT-tests on new functionality that has been developed. You stay on close contact with our suppliers from the different applications to ensure availability & correct response on incidents in order to maintain a stable environment. You will assist Key users in doing acceptance testing of new functionality. Your profile Analytical mindset with hands-on on details as well as helicopter view. You have knowledge of and experience with modern Web platforms, Web services, Low Code & API’s. You like to work in a fast changing environment, using all kind of different tool sets. You are a team player having excellent communication skills. Education level: bachelor degree (HBO) with minimum 3 years of relevant experience within similar functions. Knowledge Oracle or Microsoft SQL, experience in querying data. Preferably experience in the Agriculture business. Dutch speaking as well as excellent command of the English language required. We offer Dümmen Orange has great global ambitions. Innovation, technology and quality are high priorities. This results in a challenging working environment in which you can develop yourself. Dümmen Orange offers plenty of room for personal growth and development to its employees. We have an informal and easily accessible working environment in which cooperation is very important. Dümmen Orange Dümmen Orange is the world’s largest breeder and propagator of flowers and plants. Its annual turnover is about 350 million euro. The company employs over 7.300 employees worldwide. In addition to a large marketing and sales network, Dümmen Orange has a diversified network of specialized production sites. The key to Dümmen Orange’s success is a broad and deep product range, supported by a global supply chain. The company embraces its social responsibilities and invests in the health, safety and personal development of its staff. Your application Click on the button below to apply for this job. If you have questions about the job, you can contact Rik Juffermans (IM Manager), via 0174 - 530 100. Acquisition with reference to this advertisement will not be appreciated. Soort dienstverband: Fulltime, Bepaalde tijd, Onbepaalde tijd Aanvullende betalingen: Vakantiegeld Arbeidsvoorwaarden: Budget voor professionele ontwikkeling Kerstpakket Pensioen Reiskostenvergoeding Zorgverzekering Werkschema: Dagdienst ma-vr

title: Product Manager - Accommodations - Pricing
summary: We are responsible for driving accommodation growth, with clear ownership of all marketing, product and supply related to accommodations.
description: It wasn’t so long ago that booking a trip to see the Eiffel Tower, stroll down New York’s iconic Madison Avenue or feel the sand between our toes on Copacabana Beach was simply a matter of a few taps on our smartphone. In fact, that’s what we do at Booking.com. We make it easier for everyone to experience the world. And while that world might feel a little farther away right now, we’re busy preparing for when the world is ready to travel once more. Across our offices worldwide, we continue to innovate. To solve for some of the most complex challenges in travel and technology, and to plan for the exciting developments that lie ahead. With strategic long-term investments into what we believe the future of travel can be, we are opening up new career opportunities that will have a strong impact on our mission. We are united in the belief that our very human desire to explore the planet’s beauty and discover more about other people and cultures will endure. The world is waiting for us. Together, we will be ready. With over 1.6 million room nights booked every day, accommodation represents the largest share of our business. We are responsible for driving accommodation growth, with clear ownership of all marketing, product and supply related to accommodations. Our mission is to deliver the best customer experience and most diverse selection of properties all around the world. We are working towards creating the ultimate travel experience, building and improving great products for both travellers and the accommodation partners. A Product Manager drives the design, development, and implementation of products based on user needs and the company's product strategy and vision. A Product Manager actively owns the product strategy and direction for the product area by understanding user, partner, and market needs and by working closely with designers, developers, analysts, researchers, product marketing managers, copywriters and others to deliver successful products. A Product Manager is deeply committed to solving user (customer, partner, and/or other users) pain points and identifying opportunities to improve their experience. They are responsible for collecting and understanding qualitative and quantitative data as necessary to inform and prioritize product direction, form and test hypothesis driven solutions, and assist in the building of scalable technology that addresses long term needs. This is an individual contributor role supported by a senior product manager or group product manager, where it is possible to learn and be mentored by others to learn the skills, acquire the experience, and grow through development plans to become an expert at product management. Description We are looking for a Product manager for the Price intelligence team. Price intelligence enables us to understand how we are delivering value to our customers. It requires coordination of both external and internal data providers, and working closely with a team of Data Scientists in order to interpret the competitive pricing dynamics in the market, and put them to use. Applying our understanding of market dynamics is still a very large opportunity by developing further our partner-level product gating mechanism EPO (External Price Overview) as well as using product-focused hit lists to identify price sourcing opportunities for partners, and channeling those insights in the right way through our GTM channels. The role requires a combination of core product skills, strong data acumen, and knowledge of revenue management practices with our partner base. b.responsible Responsible for one product team including the short and long term roadmap for the product area. Identify user needs through various methods of research (quantitative, qualitative, market research, benchmarking) Responsible for data analysis, experimentation, and reporting on their product to drive changes and improvements to the user experience. Building of business cases and supporting business models to be able to understand and explain the impact of team on the wider business Serve as the product team’s primary contact for information, work prioritization, and decision-making Works independently with support and coaching from senior and group product managers. Actively participate in product networks and the craft community outside of their own track. Contributing to the craft community and company wide efforts where needed (e.g. recruitment activity generating leads, doing phone interviews) Responsible for selecting the right methodology for the product that is being developed given the stage of the product life cycle, by applying knowledge of the limitations and possibilities of the various product development methodologies. Responsible for ensuring a high quality user experience with our products by applying technical awareness and understanding of technical risks. Support and justify the chosen technical solutions and build a bridge between technical and non-technical stakeholders by ensuring the technical feature development and strategy are scoped to satisfy the short and long terms needs of the business. Creativity and curiosity - A creative problem solver with a deep curiosity about our business and product. Excellent degree of communication skills - Being able to effectively communicate both the strategic vision and specific details to various stakeholders, from senior leadership to individual project members. Being able to write clear and concise product requirements, status updates, and product results. b.skilled Strong interpersonal skills Strong data acumen: ability to formulate data-related hypotheses, work with DSI to analyze and interpret complex data, and be able to connect it to the broader product and commercial narrative Experience in data testing Previous commercial experience an advantage Strong work ethic; self-directed and resourceful Solution oriented and result driven Proactive, flexible and capable of working independently as well as working in a team Good communication (e.g. public speaking) and analytical skills Ability to multi-task & flexible attitude Strong project management skills Level of Craft Knowledge Have a practical understanding of concepts based upon working experience Able to consistently perform tasks associated with this competency Expected to seek help from a more proficient expert from time to time Booking.com is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, colour, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status. We strive to move well beyond traditional equal opportunity and work to create an environment that allows everyone to thrive.

title: Senior Business Analyst
description: Job Description The Senior Business Analyst (BA) is a role within a squad. The Senior BA plays an important role in the squad on the cooperation between the business and IT part of the squad and takes on additional responsibilities within the squad.
