The squads are organized around 4 focus areas which together we call the Digital Service Platform: Monitoring by which we aim to analyse ING’s customer transactions for suspicious activity worldwide; Screening by which we check transactions for suspicious behaviour prior to executing them; Customer due diligence for natural persons where we screen and manage the risk profile of ING’s private individual customers; Customer due diligence for companies where we screen and manage the risk profile of ING’s business customers. We are looking for an experienced senior business analyst for Post Transaction Monitoring. As a Senior BA you take an active role in the refinement of the user stories and usually perform the role of Scrum Master. You support the Product Owner (PO) and squad with your FCRM application and KYC process knowledge, ensuring compliancy by design. You refine the roadmap and guarantees that the business requirements and non-functional requirements are translated to the IT Solution requirements. Particularly for KYC, we are looking for Analysts with a track record in successfully transforming complex KYC requests into simple and concise demands. Moreover, we look for a BA’s that is able to work within a multidisciplinary team in a fast-moving, challenging environment. Experience in the customer journeys of Post Transaction Monitoring and process and IT solution implementation is a must. As Senior Business Analyst (BA): You refine the backlog to support the PO of the squad, building focused simple solutions for complex problems; You play an active role in the refinement of user stories to ensure user story feasibility, applying your business and FCRM knowledge; You translate regulatory requirements in functional designs, ensuring compliancy by design; You design a solution approach of the stories, together with the Domain Architects. You create and maintain the process flow of the application, together with the Squad; You play an active role in the incident and problem process, together with the Squad; You ensure that the end-consumer’s experience as well as compliance is recognized by the Squads; You build the bridge between business and IT. Key responsibilities As Senior Business Analyst (BA): You refine the stories for the Squad that are aligned with the owner’s objectives of the product and process; You refine the stories to have it written in a straightforward and executional way to optimize velocity in the teams; You take the bigger picture into account and look beyond your own Squad; You make sure your work is always on time for the Squad; You perform the role of Scrum Master and function as back-up for your PO, You analyse business requirements for the development of products and services in the KYC scope and play a supporting role in the Quarterly Business Review (QBR); You are able to simplify solutions and processes and tell the story clearly to various international stakeholders; You work with colleagues from the Global KYC Centre of Expertise to ensure all solutions and processes are compliant and fit-for-purpose; You apply your experience in marketing, strategic road mapping and adhering to target audiences in the fast-changing context of digital transformation; You contribute to the ING One Agile Way of Working and safeguard the Orange Code; You ensure compliance with ING’s policies and standards; You stimulate cross-border interaction and alignment between people, Tribes, Squads, Chapters, FO organizations, Local KYC activities and Service organizations; You give and ask for constructive feedback. We are looking for: An experienced, inspiring, energetic & approachable Senior Business Analyst (BA), displaying the following behaviours: A proactive, can-do, no surprises and positive mind-set; Strong analytical skills; Experience in the area(s) of multidisciplinary complex deliveries with a track record of fast learning in the area of KYC (CDD, FATCA, CRS), Post Transaction Monitoring, AML or Compliance; Experience and affinity with working together in IT and solution-build driven teams; The ability to facilitate decision-making to drive complex design issues to a conclusion; Strong organizational sensitivity; ability to understand and take into account the underlying issues, opportunities and dynamics of an international organization with multiple functional lines and one hierarchical line and deal with multiple (sometimes conflicting) interests; Strong focus on understanding the regulatory and business requirements and supportive facts and data to build the target operating model design in line with INGs ambitions; Agility to adjust the approach if required; The ability to work successfully in multiple countries and make sure these different cultures will work together as one team; taking into account different habits, beliefs, languages and time-zones, etc.; The ability to display style flexibility to teams and adapt plan, approach and behaviour to the different needs, cultures and situations; Strong resilience; ability to navigate through ambiguity and simplify complexity without losing essence. Scale 11 Proven track record and technical skills: Master or bachelor’s degree; Minimal 3-10 years of direct working experience as a Business Analyst/Process Manager (depending on role specification and related seniority level); Minimal 4 years of working experience with KYC (CDD, FATCA, CRS), Financial Economic Crime, Anti Money Laundering or Compliance; proven experience with Post Transaction Monitoring systems. You have proven experience in translating regulatory requirements into functional designs and/or processes; You have experience with implementing tooling or processes in different countries A personality and capabilities to optimally function within an Agile environment; experience as Scrum Master; experience as back-up for Product Owner in agile way or working would be a bonus Natural analyst and voice of reason; Strong analytical skills; Experience/affinity with innovation KYC and IT; Experience in guiding and realizing regulatory change; Strong communicative, networking and influencing skills; Proven experience in large consultancy initiatives with high impact; Fluent in English speaking and writing. To apply for this challenging role within the organization please use the link below

title: Reporting Specialist – Greetz
summary:
Van productie tot marketing; je vindt het bij Greetz allemaal onder één dak in Amsterdam.
Het Finance team bij Greetz breidt uit met diverse specialisten op dit…
description: Introductie Het Finance team bij Greetz breidt uit met diverse specialisten op dit moment. Dit komt grotendeels doordat ze sterk groeien met de organisatie en ook dat ze met de Moonpig Group sinds een maand beursgenoteerd zijn. Dit is leuk, want je krijgt echt de kans om zelf te bouwen in een snel groeiende organisatie. Greetz zoekt een Reporting Specialist / Analyst binnen de financiële afdeling. In deze rol ben je verantwoordelijk om de diverse stakeholders te voorzien van adequate en juiste informatie. Dit bevat zowel interne als externe rapportages. Voorbeelden van de interne rapportages zijn oa: maandelijkse balans, P&L, cash flow overzichten en consolidatie richting moedermaatschappij, interne maandrapportages naar onder andere commercie, management en IT zodat deze inzicht hebben in de maandelijkse performance en op basis hiervan kunnen bijsturen en beslissingen kunnen maken. Externe verslaggevingen zoals belasting aangiftes, CBS opgaves en jaarverslaggeving behoren ook tot je takenpakket. Je rapporteert in deze rol aan de Head of Accounting & Reporting. Het totale team bestaat zo uit een 5 ambitieuze en ook gezellige collega’s. Takenpakket Beheren van de interne rapportages en deze op tijd en accuraat uitsturen naar de diverse stakeholders Interne rapportages richting de moedermaatschappij waaronder consolidatie in Cognos en het opstellen van diverse presentaties Bewaken van internal control framework Externe verslaggeving van het jaarverslag Diverse externe rapportages en opgaves waaronder: Belastingdienst, CBS, Afvalfonds Ver-pakking Deadlines bewaken en escaleren waar nodig Vereisten Je bent HBO/WO opgeleid in een bedrijfseconomische richting; Je hebt minimaal 5-7 jaar werkervaring in een audit rol met daarnaast ervaring in het com-merciële bedrijfsleven. Kennis en ervaring met IFRS en RJ Je werkt accuraat Ervaring met systemen zoals Exact/SAP en Cognos is een pre Ervaring met Excel Vloeiend in Engels en Nederlands Je bent zelfsturend, een doordenker en pro-actief Over Greetz Met ruim 3 miljoen klanten is Greetz van Nederlands marktleider in online echte wenskaarten uitgegroeid tot hét online platform voor persoonlijke verrassingen zoals bloemen, ballonnen, fotocadeaus en kaarten. Van productie tot marketing; je vindt het bij Greetz allemaal onder één dak in Amsterdam. Met een team van ruim 160 gedreven en enthousiaste mensen werken we hard aan de groei van Greetz. Want wat je ook stuurt via Greetz; het eindresultaat is altijd een glimlach. En daar krijgen we nooit genoeg van. Greetz in NL en Moonpig in de UK vormen samen de Moonpig Group. Lijkt jou dit interessant? Neem dan contact op met: laura.vangent@greenbergnielsen.nl of bel 06 48 27 13 35

title: Senior Digital Analyst
summary: Provide insights into commercial business performance, digital customer and partner journey, marketing channel effectiveness, digital product features, etc.
description: To continue LeasePlan's success story in the fast-moving automotive industry, we are actively building our digital presence to create the "future of Digital" in the mobility industry, and to achieve our vision of "any car, anywhere, anytime". We are looking for a Senior Digital Analyst to act as the expert data advisor on digital and commercial performance and to further mature the data literacy of the organization across local and global entities. What are you going to do? The Sr. Digital Analyst will work in a high performing team of analytics specialists, with Best-In-Class analytics tools and in an environment where continuous learning and entrepreneurial ideas are encouraged. Collect, track, mine and analyse data to extract fact-based insights about the digital customer journey in our digital business. Regularly interface and build relationships with stakeholders and the wider analytics team, to establish yourself as the expert data advisor on digital/commercial performance. Jointly drive business growth, cutting-edge customer experience, and establish "Single Source of Truth" digital performance measurement. Act as domain expert for (digital) analytics expertise, working together with the other data analytics to consistently drive forward the data literacy maturity of the company. Provide insights into commercial business performance, digital customer and partner journey, marketing channel effectiveness, digital product features, etc. with the goal to support stakeholders' decision-making with impactful analyses and recommendations. Drive scalable & measurable business growth, across local and global entities with the key focus on the indirect journey (i.e. partners). What do you need to do the job? Hands on experience & knowledge using Google Analytics (or Adobe Analytics) preferably in an ecommerce enterprise environment. Strong communication skills (verbal & written). Knowledge in CX Analytics, Advanced Analytics, Data Visualization and/or Data Transformation & Blending is a strong plus. A bachelor's/master's degree in Business, Marketing or quantitative field (Math, Science etc.). of 5+ years of experience in (digital) analytics. of 2+ years of experience in eCommerce / Digital Business. About you: Curiosity, not content without understanding the "why" behind the "what. Desire and active effort to keep up to date with developments in (digital) analytics and improve oneself. High standard of analytical delivery towards oneself and others. Comfortable to challenge colleagues, stakeholders and the status quo. Bringing impact/data/analytics into day-to-day conversations and way of thinking. Self-starter, not requiring step-by-step guidance. Professional integrity and strong work ethics. Ability to develop cooperative and constructive working relationships with colleagues. Fluent in English. What do we offer? We offer a dynamic and challenging atmosphere with the backing of one of the world's leading fleet management companies. You can expect a competitive salary and benefits, room to grow and plenty of can-do attitudes. Most importantly? You'll get the opportunity to help shape the future of an exciting, dynamic industry. This role is based in Amsterdam and a pre-employment screening is part of the selection process.

title: Pre-Sales Consultant
summary: Orchestrate business processes from a central platform across the end-to-end insurance value chain, from marketing through underwriting and claims.
description: CCS connects enables insurers to play in the top of digital insurance and to make the step to real-time connected insurance. Thanks to our 35-year track record, we are able to understand and meet the challenges of the insurance industry. That is why over 2.000 organizations trust our software solutions. Headquartered in the Netherlands we are able to serve clients all over Europe with our Digital Insurance Platform . With our platform you canIntegrate any technology and free data from silos so it’s shareable, usable and powerful. Orchestrate business processes from a central platform across the end-to-end insurance value chain, from marketing through underwriting and claims. And we make you Accelerate your digital transformation and future ready, innovating with OpenAPI technology and IoT connectivity. Presales Solution Consultant Due to our wide variety of digital solutions for the insurance market and our ambition for international growth, we endeavour to expand and strengthen our Presales department for the DACH region and we are looking for a Presales Solution Consultant. CCS´ goal is to deliver rapid, value-driven customer solutions for complex business problems. Our Presales Solution Consultants play a key role in determining how the CCS solutions optimally supports our customer´s business ambitions. Your responsibility will be together with the rest of the sales team to align the customer’s business requirements to the native CCS Level X functionality and to construct a customer centric market message that articulates the benefits of the solution to the customer. You will have a deep knowledge of the core business processes and best practices in the insurance industry - and you’ll enhance that by acquiring an understanding of the specific business drivers for their program. A collaborative and empathetic relationship with the business stakeholders will be central to your role. Your commitment to their success should never be in doubt. You’ll also be working with developers, typically in Agile scrum teams, helping them convert the business requirements into technical activities and verifying that their deliverables satisfy the acceptance criteria. You’ll also be a key channel back to the CCS product management team as they look to drive innovation and improvements into future releases of the CCS products. What you will do: In order to be able to offer the best possible solutions, you will make an inventory of the wishes of our customers through interviews with various stakeholders, so that you best understand the customer needs. Sparring with colleagues from sales and product development to come up with a suitable solution for the customer. Provide support to Sales colleagues with solution-related questions. You are a sparring partner, knowledge expert and a source of information for customers and your colleagues in Sales and Product Development. Our solutions not only consist of our own development, but also those of our business partners. As part of the deal team, you ensure a qualitative interpretation of the sales process and an excellent structure from proposal to solution and price. In this position it is crucial to know the business of our customers, our services and software solutions and that of our business partners. To this end, you actively participate in on-the-job, internal and external training within your field in order to become an expert of our own solutions as well as those of our business partners. You You are a passionate and experienced presales professional, with knowledge of software solutions, preferably middleware solutions. You have a healthy level of entrepreneurship, decisiveness and analytical skills. You take responsibility for your work and are focused on achieving results together. You have: A completed BSc / MSc /WO high level education with a strong affinity with business administration or IT / information technology. At least 5 years of experience as a presales consultant, a business architect, a functional architect or a business analyst with the ability to present yourself to a C-level audience and an interest in transitioning into a more business development and sales-oriented role. Knowledge of the insurance industry is required. Excellent oral and written communication skills in the German and English language (Dutch will be an advantage). Ability to travel between the target territory and the HQ in Woerden, NL. Between 70 and 100 days of travel annually must be expected. You combine a strategic vision with a hands-on mentality to actually achieve set goals. In this you make optimal use of data, visualizations and presentations. You are a team player, customer-oriented and assertive. Strong technical skills related to Business Intelligence, Databases, software architecture, analytics is an advantage. You have the drive and interest to delve into technical developments. Soort dienstverband: Fulltime Arbeidsvoorwaarden: Werk vanuit huis Werkschema: ma-vr Ervaring: consultant: 3 jaar (Aanbevolen) IT: 5 jaar (Aanbevolen) Opleiding: Bachelor (Vereist) Thuiswerken: Ja

title: Conversie Specialist
summary: Het vertalen van de resultaten naar (commercieel) advies en acties voor collega's van het digital marketing team, zoals content specialisten, brand manager, e…
description: Waarom wil jij hier werken? Vind jij het als Conversie Specialist leuk om maximaal rendement te behalen uit online bezoekers? Weet jij de user experience te optimaliseren en daarmee impact te maken op de ideale customer journey? Ben jij iemand met lef en durf je fouten te maken, initiatief te nemen en bezit je de wil resultaat neer te zetten? Lees dan de vacature van Conversie Specialist bij een (pure) online speler binnen de eCommerce in de omgeving van Waalwijk! Functieomschrijving: Conversie Specialist Als Conversie Specialist is het jouw doel de optimale online customer journey te creëren en dat doe je natuurlijk niet alleen! Je bent onderdeel van het online team, circa 12 medewerkers en groeiende, waarbij je voor het creëren van een gepersonaliseerde journey gebruik kunt maken van het CDP systeem (BlueConic), je A/B testen kunt initiëren en uitwerken, data- en webanalyses kunt uitvoeren (in samenwerking met de Data Analist en SEA Specialist) en initiatief kan nemen om het UX (en UI) design aan te pakken. Met je analytische skills en vermogen om op de stoel van de online bezoeker te gaan zitten kun je kwesties bespreekbaar maken als: "hoe kunnen wij de orderwaarde van de gemiddelde bestelling verhogen?" of "hoe kunnen we ervoor zorgen dat de bezoeker niet op het laatste moment afhaakt." Het team, ook nog bestaande uit content specialisten, een e-mail marketeer, een brand manager, een webshop manager en online marketeer, wordt aangestuurd door een Manager E-Commerce.  Jouw taken gedurende een werkdag kunnen dus variëren van: Het verrichten van analyses en naar boven krijgen van waardevolle data en inzichten m.b.v. tools als Google Analytics, A/B testing, Google Optimize en Hotjar Het uitoefenen van jouw invloed op het UX en UI design, waarbij ervaring met HTML, CSS en Javascript een pluspunt is Het vertalen van de resultaten naar (commercieel) advies en acties voor collega's van het digital marketing team, zoals content specialisten, brand manager, e-mailmarketeer en SEA specialist Het samenwerken met externe bureaus en/of specialisten van het hoofdkantoor voor bijvoorbeeld de websites en webshops of het CDP platform Het efficiënter, strakker, klantvriendelijker, commerciëler inrichten van fases binnen de online customer journey. Je komt te werken binnen een hecht team waarin iedereen elkaar helpt én uitdaagt, waar jij je vrijheid durft te nemen binnen bepaalde kaders, elke dag je nieuwsgierigheid een antwoord weet te bieden en impact maakt! Organisatiecultuur Een "huis" vol mogelijkheden, dat is waar je terecht komt. Deze online speler binnen de eCommerce is succesvol én kapitaal krachtig. Er heerst een ondernemende cultuur en tegelijkertijd een informele, nuchtere en gezellige (Brabantse) sfeer. Ze onderscheiden zich op de grootte van het assortiment, hoge kwaliteit, klantvriendelijkheid en met name mogelijkheden tot snelle levering. Deze digitale club, als onderdeel van een grote groep die marktleider is in Nederland, bestaat uit 30 medewerkers die voor twee (digitale) merken werkzaam zijn, waarvan bijna de helft (Online) Marketing. Wie ben jij? Je komt te werken in een organisatie waar kernwaarden als ondernemend, succesvol, stabiliteit, lef, durf om fouten te maken (en van te leren), maar ook een nuchtere, informele en gezellige sfeer heerst. Het is een dynamische omgeving, waarin je samenwerkt en schakelt met verschillende teamleden, specialisten en externe bureaus. Jij bent de expert in personalisatie en conversie en kunt ervoor zorgen dat je ideeën, plannen en oplossingen breed in de organisatie worden gedragen, succesvol zijn en impact maken! Daarnaast breng jij de volgende ervaring met je mee: Hbo of WO afgeronde opleiding Minimaal 2 jaar ervaring in (digital) conversie of customer journey optimalisatie (en tools als Google Analytics, Optimize, Hotjar) Ruime ervaring met A/B testen en eventueel UX/UI design (HTML, CSS & Javascript is een plus) Ervaring met BlueConic (CDP) of vergelijkbaar personalisatie systeem Beheersing van de Nederlandse taal in woord en geschrift Wat biedt deze baan als Conversie Specialist jou nog meer? Een contract voor onbepaalde tijd (!) Een goed salaris (afhankelijk van ervaring) Een aantrekkelijke bonusregeling (op individueel- en teamresultaat) 32 tot 40 uur per week werken Aantrekkelijke pensioenregeling Vakantiedagen Reiskostenvergoeding (voorkeur auto) Flexibele werktijden en thuiswerken (in overleg) Uitgebreide trainings- en opleidingsmogelijkheden (online én offline) De kans om zowel horizontaal als verticaal te groeien in functies Fitness, kinderopvang en werknemerskorting Enthousiast? Solliciteer dan als Conversie Specialist via deze pagina. Heb je nog vragen, mail die dan naar Jasper@weknowpeople.nl

title: Director / Senior Director of Product Management (Evangelist), Industry Cloud
summary:
Collaborate with OU marketing teams to drive demand-gen activities for common layer products.
Leadership - proven ability to set a vision, excite and lead …
description: To get the best candidate experience, please consider applying for a maximum of 3 roles within 12 months to ensure you are not duplicating efforts. Job Category Products and Technology Job Details The Industry Cloud is a rapidly growing, strategic business for Salesforce. The Industry Product team is chartered to deliver deep vertical CRM products - disrupting each industry, one by one. We offer 12 Industry Clouds and many cross-industry products such as the recently launched Loyalty Management , Feedback Management and Scheduler . We bring the most innovative customer success platform that is designed and built for a specific industry. We are looking for a top Product Management professional to drive the growth of our cross-industry products. We are seeking a Product Evangelist for the Industry Common Layer Product team. As a member of this team, you’ll help grow the business for the product, enable Sales and Distribution teams, nurture the SI/ISV ecosystem. This role offers a unique opportunity to directly impact the product roadmap, vision, strategy and development. You have strong communication and people skills since you’ll be presenting in public, collaborating cross-functionally within Salesforce, and working side by side with developers every day.  Due to the breadth of responsibility, this role calls for a strong, proactive Product Manager capable of independently driving the product forward.  Responsibilities  Meet and exceed revenue and growth targets for Industry common layer products (Salesforce Feedback Management, Salesforce Scheduler & Loyalty Management) ACV as a quota carrier Work with PM and PMM to strategize key focus verticals and markets to meet the targets. Influence pipeline build/demand gen activities Orchestrate Sales enablement in the focus verticals markets Close the feedback loop with PMM, PM and Pricing Team to evolve product pricing, DAM, Solution plays to capitalize on the market opportunities and grow the Product AOV Work closely with vertical cloud Product Evangelist to ensure common layer products are positioned in their sales plays to achieve the targets Drive SICs and DSRs with strategic customers Be the Voice of the customer to influence product direction for the common layer products Build a pipeline of Reference Customers and the Business Impact (Value Study) from implementing the solution which will help drive revenue Influence product roadmap and participate in build/buy/partner strategy discussions based on the local and vertical market opportunities Collaborate with OU marketing teams to drive demand-gen activities for common layer products Conduct functional and technical deep-dives of common layer products with customers, prospects and partners Drive industry narrative for the common layer products thus winning external and internal mindshare Work with Demo Teams (supported by SEs and PMs) for packaged vertical demos in the landscape Maintain relationship with Sales leadership across different geographies to drive ACV, growth and AOV Jointly identify Sales plays with distribution for Industry products and industries and influence Sales strategy to ensure growth Identify, foster and manage relationships with top ISV partners to build on top of common Layer Products Represent Salesforce as a product expert at customer interactions, industry and corporate events, and through community sites and social media.  Key Competencies  Deep expertise in Salesforce platform and applications Industry/domain knowledge is preferred but not mandatory Leadership - proven ability to set a vision, excite and lead (directly and/or by influence) cross-functional multidisciplinary teams composed of account executives, sales engineers, product marketing managers, CSG, etc. Experience in scaling a nascent business to a multi-million dollar run rate 12+ years of product management or equivalent experience with demonstrated ability to discover opportunities, define and deliver impactful solutions for customers Strong technical abilities to hold your own in debates with technical architects and engineers. You are intimately familiar with modern software development practices used to build and deploy web and mobile applications. Effective communicator - Communicates well with engineering and cross-functional teams; can effectively present plans and roadmap to internal stakeholders and C-Level execs; comfortable pitching their product to diverse external audiences (customers, partners, and analysts); strong ability to convince and influence Entrepreneurial mindset, possess a high energy level to react to situations quickly and decisively, possessing self-confidence to be assertive when taking a position, not afraid to make decisions. Experience identifying and addressing customer needs, building relationships with customers, developing an awareness of relevant services, communicating with customers in an organized and knowledgeable manner, and delivering clear requests for information LI*Y Accommodations - If you require assistance due to a disability applying for open positions please submit a request via this Accommodations Request Form. Posting Statement At Salesforce we believe that the business of business is to improve the state of our world. Each of us has a responsibility to drive Equality in our communities and workplaces. We are committed to creating a workforce that reflects society through inclusive programs and initiatives such as equal pay, employee resource groups, inclusive benefits, and more. Learn more about Equality at Salesforce and explore our benefits. Salesforce.com and Salesforce.org are Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employers. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender perception or identity, national origin, age, marital status, protected veteran status, or disability status. Salesforce.com and Salesforce.org do not accept unsolicited headhunter and agency resumes. Salesforce.com and Salesforce.org will not pay any third-party agency or company that does not have a signed agreement with Salesfore.com or Salesforce.org. Salesforce welcomes all.

title: Senior IT Systems Analyst - Clinical Research Operations
summary: Analyzes production, inventory control, distribution, cost analysis, finance, marketing, human resources, and/or a variety of other business and technical…
description: Careers that Change Lives Contribute to offering Medtronic business units services to support their clinical operations at an outstanding quality and efficiency level, supporting their strategies for worldwide medical device approvals to introduce new products to market. In this role as a Senior IT Business Systems Analyst in MC2 Solutions development, your core responsibilities will be providing technical support for MC2’s core internal forecasting and demand management system, securing its stability, monitoring its performances, and partnering with the external vendor who owns the system to oversee its evolutionary maintenance interventions. In collaboration with key MC2 stakeholders, provide technical oversight as system changes are defined and implemented to ensure business operations remain unimpacted by changes to the system. In addition, you will have direct responsibilities supporting the rest of the Solutions Development team as a liason with the IT department in EMEA, securing data collectoin systems are correctly setup for study support, and contribuiting to shaping the evolution of your role to fit the ever-changing needs of our organization, in direct partnership with your managers and the functional leaders. Come for a job, stay for a career.  Our Department Medtronic Core Clinical Solutions (MC2) function offers support to clinical studies from all Medtronic Operating Units globally, offering to internal partners services that span across all stages of operation a clinical trial conduct, from designing and building data collection systems to partnering with statisticians in conducting analyses, through conducting monitoring activities at the hospitals and tracking adverse events and ensuring regulatory requirements on safety reporting are met. As part of MC2, Global Clinical Data Solutions (GCDS) offers Data Management, Solutions Development and Statistical Programming services to our partners, supporting the design and build of data collection systems, of reporting and dashboarding solutions, and statistical analysis routines. It also offers technical support and business analisys expertise in the technology and IT domain to other MC2 functions and Medtronic stakeholders. Tasks & Responsibilities The Senior IT Business Analyst main responsibilities are focused towards planning, conducting, and directing the analysis of complex business problems to be solved with automated systems. Analyzes production, inventory control, distribution, cost analysis, finance, marketing, human resources, and/or a variety of other business and technical problems to formulate and develop new and modified information processing systems. Provides technical assistance in identifying, evaluating, and developing systems and procedures, which are cost effective and meet user requirements. Configures system settings and options; plans and executes unit, integration, and acceptance testing; and creates specifications for systems to meet business requirements. Designs details of automated systems. May provide consultation to users in the area of automated systems. Work is performed under general direction. Participates in determining objectives of assignment. Plans schedules and arranges own activities in accomplishing objectives. Work is reviewed upon completion for adequacy in meeting objectives. Represents organization as a prime contact on contracts or projects. Interacts with senior internal and external personnel on significant matters often requiring coordination between organizations. Exerts some influence on the overall objectives and long-range goals of the organization. May assist with projects. Must Haves 6-9 Years relevant working experience with Bachelors degree; 4-7 Years relevant working experience with Masters degree; Knowledge of computer system capabilities, business processes and workflow; Good problem-solving skills; Good English language skills in reading, writing and speaking; Process oriented; Client and customer focused in all aspects; Team player skills; Good communication skills. Nice to Haves Medium SQL programming skills, and/or basic to intermediate knowledge of other programming languages (e.g. python, .NET, C#, java, R, SAS, etc.). We Offer In our 5th Tenet of our Mission we recognize the personal worth of employees by providing an employment framework that allows personal satisfaction in work accomplished, security, advancement opportunity, and means to share in the company's success. Also a competitive package is of course part of that. We offer a competitive salary and benefits package to all our employees: Flexible working environment; Annual Incentive Plan % depending on company results; Pension scheme and group discount on healthcare insurances; Training possibilities via Cornerstone/Harvard Manage Monitor/GetAbstract; Employee Assistance Program and Recognize! (our global recognition program). Your Answer Is this the position you were waiting for? Then please apply directly via the apply button! About Medtronic Together, we can change healthcare worldwide. At Medtronic, we push the limits of what technology, therapies and services can do to help alleviate pain, restore health and extend life. We challenge ourselves and each other to make tomorrow better than yesterday. It is what makes this an exciting and rewarding place to be. We want to accelerate and advance our ability to create meaningful innovations - but we will only succeed with the right people on our team. Let’s work together to address universal healthcare needs and improve patients’ lives. Help us shape the future. Founded in 1949 as a medical repair company, we're now among the world's largest medical technology, services and solutions companies, employing more than 86,000 people worldwide, serving physicians, hospitals and patients in over 155 countries. Whatever your specialty or ambitions, you can make a difference at Medtronic - both in the lives of others and your own career. Join us in our commitment to take healthcare Further, Together.

title: Pricing Manager (EN)
summary: You will work closely together with the various purchase- and category managers, the business analyst and sales and marketing colleagues and your team of…
description: Pricing Manager | HBL Online B.V. | Tilburg | 32-40 hours per week | HBL Online, founded 11 years ago, is a very fast-growing e-commerce machine with webshops in the Netherlands (Gereedschapcentrum.nl), Belgium, France, Spain and Italy (Fixami.be/fr/es). We are market leader in selling professional tools. For 4 years in a row we are the fastest growing company in the south of the Netherlands. Since the beginning our only goal is to make customers happy! Competitive prices, great deals and TOP customer service that is available for you every day. With more than 190 people, we work hard every day to exceed our customers' expectations. We are continuously working on innovation and optimization of our technology and organization. We wouldn’t be able to manage this without the right people! Currently, we are looking for a Pricing Manager. What will you do in your role as Pricing Manager? In e-commerce, offering a product at the right price is of great importance to achieve maximum results. As a Pricing Manager you are responsible, both strategically and operationally, for determining and implementing the right pricing policy, finding that sweet spot in the field of P * Q that ensures optimal results. You will work closely together with the various purchase- and category managers, the business analyst and sales and marketing colleagues and your team of pricing analysts that you will set up and lead. By using competition- and data analysis you discover commercial opportunities for which you create winning price strategies. In addition to optimizing our automatic pricing methodology, you also analyze specific product and bundle prices and you come up with improvement plans for the pricing on our own websites in Europe and the market places where we offer our products. You carry out tests to discover what makes our customers buy. You do research on new pricing methodologies and you play an important role in the development of these techniques within our organization. You are our ideal candidate if: You have a Master in Econometrics (or comparable) You have 2-5 years of experience in a commercial data / pricing role You have great analytical skills. You are able to find the patterns in data and are able to explain in a clear and structured way You have an excellent helicopter view and you have a good process-oriented way of thinking You are innovative and creative in finding solutions You have strong communication skills and you are proficient in the English language You are "eager to learn" with an entrepreneurial mindset Experience with Python / R studio and SQL is an advantage What we have to offer: Above all, a very interesting and challenging job in a fast-growing, informal and inspiring international work environment We are very open for your vision and input, we would like you think along with us about new possibilities; Flexible working hours A competitive salary in combination with secondary benefits, including 25 vacation days (option to purchase extra), company fitness, attractive staff discount & great company parties! Send your CV + letter of motivation to [email protected]

title: Analyst - Real Estate/Offices
summary: Work closely with the asset management team on portfolio reporting, budgeting, asset management plans, and attending meetings, including marketing strategies to…
description: Functie omschrijving Analyst - Real Estate/Offices Our client is an internationally recognized real estate fund in commercial real estate. In this position you will support in evaluating business opportunities in Europe, across commercial real estate (offices).  You will support the Asset Management department in the execution of portfolio management strategies for a portfolio of Office Real Estate in Western Europe. Responsibilities: Work closely with the asset management team on portfolio reporting, budgeting, asset management plans, and attending meetings, including marketing strategies to optimize income and realize the highest value of our assets, as well as operational work processes. Assist in the preparation and maintaining of financial variance analysis reports, prepare and monitor budgets. Assist with financial modelling at the asset and portfolio levels. Managing market intelligence, collating global market / industry information to ensure competitiveness of the Company’s products and services. Assisting in leasing activities (preparing leasing offers, financial analysis of prospects, maintaining and optimization of the leasing database, etc.).  Functie eisen Analyst - Real Estate/Offices Degree in Accountancy, Finance or its equivalent. 1 - 3 years’ relevant experience (preferably in the real estate industry) and advanced financial modeling and analytical skills. Hands-on, resourceful, a good team player, and possess a high level of initiative. Able to work independently in a fast-paced environment. Possess strong communication and interpersonal skills with good business and financial acumen. Good command of English to liaise with colleagues and partners across Europe and Asia. Next to English good knowledge/fluent Dutch or German is required. Good knowledge of Microsoft Excel is required, experience with MRI is an advantage. If you are interested in this position please send your application (in English) to Mandy van der Burght (burght@recruitment.nl). For other questions you can contact Mandy on +31(0)6 - 11725571.  Solid Recruitment (Netherlands) is an international recruitment agency which offers unique career opportunities in the real estate sector.

title: Online marketeer: Google Ads Specialist (SEA) / Webanalist
summary:
Slimme marketing, dat is waar wij als digital marketing bureau goed in zijn.
Ervaring hebt met inbound marketing, e-mailmarketing en / of marketing automation.
description: Functieomschrijving Ben jij een ervaren marketeer: specialist digital advertising / web analist? Dan zijn wij misschien wel op zoek naar jou! Wij zijn een razend ambitieus, enthousiast en groeiend digital marketing bureau in Barneveld met uitdagende opdrachten en interessante klanten. Functieomschrijving Zie jij het als een uitdaging om maximaal rendement te halen uit advertentiebudgetten? Ben jij altijd op zoek naar manieren om campagnes nog slimmer en effectiever in te zetten? Stuur jij als marketeer niet op je onderbuikgevoel maar op data? Dan ben jij wellicht die steengoede marketeer die wij willen toevoegen aan onze club van professionals. Sparklet is een Digital Commerce Agency. We streven altijd naar de beste online oplossingen en naar zeer tevreden klanten. In jouw rol als SEA Specialist / Web Analist wordt je de contactpersoon voor onze middelgrote en grote klanten. Dit zijn retailers, groothandelaren en fabrikanten. Door jouw ruime kennis en ervaring op het gebied van online marketing, zet je kanalen en budgetten zo in, dat er een optimaal resultaat voor onze klanten wordt behaald. Je achterhaalt diepgaande data voor onze klanten, waarmee we nog meer inzicht krijgen en waarmee we nog gerichter kunnen targetten. Dit diepgaande inzicht in data maakt voor onze klanten echt hét verschil. Jouw gevoel voor kwaliteit en je open manier van communiceren, zorgt dat je perfect past binnen onze no-nonsense bedrijfscultuur. Als echte teamplayer neem je je verantwoordelijkheid en samen met onze online marketing consultants, webdesigners, copywriters en developers vorm je de klantteams. We werken altijd samen met onze klanten aan de online projecten. Jouw analyserende vermogen, inlevingsvermogen, doordachte strategieen en jouw manier van communiceren zorgt dat de klant jou ziet als een vertrouwde en belangrijke gesprekspartner. Samen maken we online projecten tot een groot succes. Jouw profiel Minimaal een afgeronde HBO opleiding; Minimaal 1 jaar aantoonbare ervaring in een online (e-commerce) marketing functie; Uitgebreide kennis en ervaring met SEA, SEO, conversie optimalisatie, Google Analytics, Google tag manager en Data Visualisatie Tools; Je hebt eerder gewerkt voor retail, groothandel, fabrikant of marketing bureau; Je kan schakelen op zowel strategisch als operationeel niveau; Je bent goed in staat om analytisch, zelfstandig, creatief, resultaatgericht en projectmatig te werken; Proactief en sociaal en communicatief vaardig; Een goede beheersing van de Nederlandse en Engelse taal, in woord en geschrift; Het schrijven van (advertentie)teksten, daar draai je je hand niet voor om; Je woont in Barneveld of omgeving; Je bent minimaal 32 uur per week beschikbaar. Het is een pré als je: Kennis en ervaring hebt met WordPress en / of Magento; Ervaring hebt met platform marketing; Ervaring hebt met inbound marketing, e-mailmarketing en / of marketing automation. Taken en verantwoordelijkheden Meehelpen met het opzetten, monitoren en verbeteren van zoekmachine advertentie campagnes (SEA); Rapporteren van ontwikkelingen aan klanten van lopende campagnes; Meer leren over het gebruik en de inzet van Google Ads, trafficplannen, KPI dashboards, Google Analytics en Affiliate Marketing; Inrichten en optimaliseren van Google Analytics en Google Tag manager; Inrichten van dashboards met relevante KPI’s in Data Visualisatie Tools; A/B testen instellen voor conversie optimalisatie; Opstellen, uitvoeren en bewaken van online strategieën en concepten; Vergroten van traffic, het verbeteren van de conversie, sturen op retentie en meewerken aan het opbouwen van een merk; Verantwoordelijk voor het genereren van marketing qualified leads / e-commerce tegen een gezonde ROI voor jouw groep klanten; Coördineren van werkzaamheden van collega’s en externe partners; Het door ontwikkelen van je expertise en dit delen met collega’s en klanten. Wij bieden jou Een marktconform salaris; Goede arbeidsvoorwaarden; Een laptop van de zaak; Een afwisselende baan met afwisselende projecten; Goede doorgroei- en opleidingsmogelijkheden; Veel ruimte voor eigen inbreng; Een gezellig, hecht en jong team met een ongedwongen, informele sfeer waar je jezelf kan zijn; Een gezamenlijke en verzorgde lunch in onze kantine; Iedere pauze pingpongen, Playstation’en, tafelvoetballen of lekker wandelen buiten; Een prachtige werkplek met een sta-zit bureau en iedere dag heerlijke bonen koffie. We zijn gevestigd in een splinternieuw, modern en ruim kantoor op een prachtige plek tussen de landerijen van Barneveld; Leuke teambuilding activiteiten; Over Sparklet Sparklet is hét Digital Commerce Agency voor retail, brands en groothandel in Midden-Nederland. We zetten ons iedere dag voor 100% in om digitale successen te realiseren voor onze klanten. We helpen ondernemers binnen retail, brands en groothandel met het uitdenken van de online strategie, volledig gefocust op leadgeneratie, e-commerce en online branding. Slimme marketing, dat is waar wij als digital marketing bureau goed in zijn. We weten precies hoe we strategieën zo effectief en efficiënt mogelijk in kunnen zetten. Digital marketing kanalen laten we slim met elkaar samenwerken en we zoeken altijd naar de ultieme mix tussen marketing, techniek, data, design en content. Boven alles zijn we resultaatgericht, want een goede ROI is belangrijk voor onze klanten en dus ook voor ons. Constante optimalisaties van de verschillende kanalen is daarbij onze sleutel tot succes. Het Sparklet team is enthousiast en ambitieus, we dagen uit en blijven tegelijkertijd realistisch. We denken in stappen die haalbaar zijn, waarbij we ontzorgen waar nodig. Zo kunnen ondernemingen snel groei realiseren. Werken bij Sparklet Geïnteresseerd? Neem dan nu contact met ons op door een e-mail te sturen naar Sparklet of bel met 0342 – 40 56 37 en vraag naar Johan Van As. Acquisitie naar aanleiding van deze vacature wordt niet op prijs gesteld. Soort dienstverband: Fulltime, Parttime, Onbepaalde tijd Salaris: €2.800,00 - €4.500,00 per maand Aanvullende betalingen: Vakantiegeld Arbeidsvoorwaarden: Reiskostenvergoeding Vrijdagmiddagborrel Werkschema: Dagdienst ma-vr Opleiding: Bachelor (Vereist) Locatie: Postcode 3772 in Barneveld (Vereist) Thuiswerken: Tijdelijk vanwege COVID-19

title: DevOps Sales Specialist
summary:
Support regional field marketing activities.
Join us as we pursue our disruptive new vision to Turn Data Into Doing™.
Support the DevOps regional EBC.
description: Join us as we pursue our disruptive new vision to Turn Data Into Doing™. We are a company filled with people who are passionate about our technology and seek to deliver the best experience for our customers. At Splunk, we’re committed to our work, customers, having fun and most importantly to each other’s success. Responsibilities: Play an active role as part of the DevOps GTM leadership team Attend management calls/meetings/QBRs - contribute as a senior voice EMEA DevOps RSM teams. Contribute to the go forward DevOps RSM GTM and Engagement strategy. Work closely and align with the DevOps Theater leader to drive success in DevOps. Work with DevOps RSM Sales Leader to provide weekly forecasts as part of the Global Forecast process. Act as “Exec” level air cover/support and a proxy in region for DevOps exec presence with our most strategic, complex and impactful accounts. Support the DevOps regional EBC. Align with DevOps GTM stakeholders in Product Management, PMM, SE, Evangelist/Advocacy to enable effective communication of the DevOps strategy and roadmap to both Internal and External stakeholders/customers. Work with the Theater DevOps RSM leader to help identify, define and promote DevOps sales best practices. Source and define patterns and trends from the DevOps RSM field work. Work with the Theater DevOps RSM leader to feed these back into sales engagement process i.e. Big Bet reviews and Account Strategy & Planning process etc. Understand what’s working and where gaps exist and work with Theater DevOps RSM leader to package, reuse and scale. Act as “Tip of the Spear” for the roll out of new engagement motions/workshops working with wider DevOps RSM team Document learnings and recommendations gleaned from our most complex DevOps engagements/deployments so they can be scaled and packaged by the Strategist team. Align with Marketing and Customer Success to identify and maintain a robust framework of regional solution references. Stay current and across key developments and emerging trends in the DevOps domain - the goal for this role is to be ahead of where the wider Sales Specialist team are. Proactive communication of trends and changes in the domain and competitive landscape back into DevOps RSM team, Product and Competitive Intelligence team. Act as go to authority and guide for new emerging trends in the DevOps domain space for the wider DevOps RSM team. Work with DevOps RSM leaders on prioritization on how we evolve to take best advantage of these new patterns and trends.. Support Marketing and A&R teams for regional initiatives where required Support regional field marketing activities. Support the A&R team for regional Analyst meetings. Support global and regional Dev Ops PMM in developing sales and campaign messaging. Support and lead theater based M&A & NPI activities. Credible and active Internal & External evangelist. Contribution of blogs, whitepapers, webinars, presence at Splunk events etc. Requirements You will have 5-10+ years of direct sales experience selling enterprise software to mid-size to large enterprises (required), start-up experience welcomed! Strong cloud knowledge with a solid technical understanding, with the ability to conduct demos to startup organisations You have previous experience utilizing partners, channels and alliances to sell more successfully and overachieve your quota. You have sold a similar complex solution software and have experience in any of the following: IT systems, enterprise or infrastructure management, application development and management, security, business applications and/or analytics. You have a measurable track record in new business development and over achieving sales targets Experience in selling complex enterprise software solutions and ability to adapt in fast-growing and changing environments Experience in successfully selling during market creation phase Proven track record of successfully closing six and seven figure software licensing deals with prospects and customers in the defined territory. Experience in the “C” suite, strong executive presence and polish, and excellent listening skills. Experience with target account selling, solution selling, and/or consultative sales techniques; knowledge of MEDDIC and Challenger methodologies is a plus. Bachelor’s degree; MBA a plus or equivalent experience Modern application architecture (micro-services) understanding is key, along with the ability to understand and communicate technical challenges in business terms We value diversity at our company. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, or any other applicable legally protected characteristics in the location in which the candidate is applying. For job positions in San Francisco, CA, and other locations where required, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.

title: Management Traineeship HEINEKEN - Finance
summary:
Het Finance Management Traineeship van HEINEKEN is een programma van 1,5 jaar.
Gedurende deze periode word je uitgedaagd in verschillende opdrachten binnen je…
description: Het Finance Management Traineeship van HEINEKEN is een programma van 1,5 jaar. Gedurende deze periode word je uitgedaagd in verschillende opdrachten binnen je vakgebied (en soms ook net daarbuiten). Daarnaast zal je ook een opdracht in het buitenland doen*. Een leerzame periode in Europa of misschien wel aan de andere kant van de wereld. Naast de inhoudelijke uitdaging zal het werken in een andere en misschien wel voor jou nieuwe cultuur leuk maar ook spannend zijn! Natuurlijk leer je niet alleen in de praktijk. Je krijgt trainingen, zowel inhoudelijk als persoonlijke ontwikkeling, coaching en een persoonlijke mentor. Na het Finance Management Traineeship start je in een baan, bijvoorbeeld als: Junior Business Controller (Retail of Horeca) of Junior Revenue Analyst.  Bij HEINEKEN gaat veiligheid boven alles en daarom is het project in het buitenland alleen mogelijk als de situatie rondom COVID-19 dit toelaat.  Wat zijn de algemene vereisten? Een masteropleiding; Goede beheersing van de Nederlandse en Engelse taal; Maximaal 2 jaar werkervaring (na het afronden van je studie); Een open en ondernemende mentaliteit; Durf om out-of-the box te denken en anderen hierin mee te nemen.  Wat bieden wij: Een competitief basissalaris; 40-urige werkweek; 26 vakantiedagen en ATV vergoeding/dagen; Een trainingsprogramma samen met de trainees; Reiskostenvergoeding, optie tot collectieve zorgverzekering en een gedegen pensioenregeling.  Enthousiast om als Finance Management Trainee per 1 september 2021 aan de slag te gaan? Mooi! Als je profiel aansluit op de vacatureomschrijving ontvangen we graag je cv en antwoord op de volgende motivatievragen: Waarom solliciteer je voor het Management Traineeship bij HEINEKEN en kies je voor deze track? Welke (maatschappelijke) trends zie jij in de huidige biermarkt en hoe denk je dat HEINEKEN daarop in kan spelen? Wat maakt jou uniek en succesvol in dit Management Traineeship? Let op: wees duidelijk en bondig in je antwoorden en beperk je echt tot deze 3 vragen.  De vacature zal sluiten op 29 maart om 12.00 uur. Hoe ziet de selectieprocedure er uit? Stap 1: Klik op ‘Solliciteer nu’, vul alle velden in en voeg de gevraagde bijlagen (curriculum vitae en motivatievragen) toe. Dit kost enige tijd dus zorg dat je er even goed voor gaat zitten.  Stap 2: Als we alles in goede orde hebben ontvangen, krijg je van LTP binnen één week een e-mail met een activatielink voor de online capaciteitentest en persoonlijkheidstesten. Let op: je ontvangt alleen een test als je sollicitatie volledig is! Deze testen bestaan uit verschillende delen en kun je afzonderlijk van elkaar maken. Zorg dat je goed de tijd hiervoor neemt en dat er geen afleiding is.  Stap 3: We zullen een aantal kandidaten selecteren en uitnodigen voor een interview met collega’s van HEINEKEN. Details over dit interview volgen te zijner tijd. Na afloop van het gesprek zullen we je vragen om een controletest van eerdergenoemde testen te maken.  Stap 4: Als je voorgaande stappen goed hebt doorlopen, ontvang je van ons een uitnodiging voor de finale selectiedag. Tijdens deze dag krijg je verschillende opdrachten en leer je HEINEKEN als werkgever nog beter kennen. Dit is tevens de laatste selectieronde van deze sollicitatieprocedure. De beste kandidaten krijgen uiteindelijk een aanbod.  Stap 5: Als je een aanbod krijgt, zal je per 1 september 2021 starten als Finance Management Trainee bij HEINEKEN Nederland.   Als je vragen hebt over deze sollicitatieprocedure, neem dan gerust contact op met het HEINEKEN Nederland Recruitment team via werkenbijheinekennederland@heineken.com.  Over HEINEKEN HEINEKEN Nederland is al meer dan 150 jaar marktleider. We hebben een familiegeschiedenis en Nederlands erfgoed waar we trots op zijn. Deze trots komt terug in ons ondernemerschap en nemen we mee in alles wat we doen en waar we komen. We zijn merkenbouwers en de onmisbare schakel tussen de brouwerijen en hét perfecte biertje bij mensen thuis of op het terras. Dit doen we met ruim 700 collega’s die werken binnen Sales, Marketing, Finance, Procurement, IT, Legal, Tax, Corporate Affairs en HR. Samen staan we voor onze kernwaarden: passie voor kwaliteit, genieten van het leven en respect voor mens en milieu. We pleiten altijd voor verantwoord alcoholgebruik, voelen ons nauw verbonden met de Nederlandse maatschappij en lokale gemeenschap en streven er voortdurend naar om onze impact op onze planeet te verbeteren. Heb jij feedback op deze vacature? Mail dan naar werkenbijheinekennederland@heineken.com.

title: Business Analyst
summary: Maykers is an online platform that facilitates smart connections between farmers and their partners to make the business of farming successful.
description: Maykers is an online platform that facilitates smart connections between farmers and their partners to make the business of farming successful. We make it simple to sell, find and buy professional products based on fair prices and clear conditions. We’re a team that cultivates service excellence, growth and teamwork. Together with an international team of around 50 people we have the common goal to make farmers’ business run smoothly. For our fresh and fast-growing eCommerce start-up, we are looking for a smart, results-oriented and communicative Business Analyst to strengthen our team!  Your mission: In this job you play an important role in scaling up our business and specifically in translating business needs into IT solutions. You will be part of the scaling up our digital marketplace and our international expansion into more European markets. You will enable stakeholders to formulate their wishes, unravel the requirements, structure them and you ensure that it can be built by our development teams. You will be investigating and performing data analysis and making recommendations for solving problems. This is not an average BA job. You will come across an environment that is quite complex and includes many different stakeholders at different levels. But who can beat a challenge as beautiful as this? You are not taking on this challenge alone. You work closely with the Product owner, the Scrum teams and our Marketing team.  What will you bring to the table: We are looking for someone who preferably has experience in an eCommerce (b2b / b2c) environment Bachelor or University degree with technological focus or equivalent work experience 3+ years of relevant practical experience Affinity and love for a fast-moving environment Ease and clarity in communication with both internal and external stakeholders  You are: Analytical: data tells a story and you use it to experiment, adjust, come up with the ideas and bring them to life Self-motivated and self-directed: you take the initiative, you can multitask and set priorities with little guidance Communicative: You build relationships easily and quickly with all stakeholders at different levels and different backgrounds - tech and non-tech  You would work in a scale-up environment and culture while having the solid funding and market power of a corporate You'd be joining a new platform that will revolutionize the agri industry in the next years You'd be joining a small team where every new teammate makes a lot of difference You'd be in an energetic and flexible place, perfect for developing yourself and improving your entrepreneurial skills We cherish a great working atmosphere with smart colleagues with a good sense of humor N.B. to Recruiters: at this stage we don't require any assistance for this role. If that changes we will reach out to you. Please don't contact anyone on our team prior to this.

title: Product Owner IT bij Urban Arrow
summary:
Heb jij aantoonbare stakeholder management skills en kennis van dealerportals en digitale marketing technieken?
Fasten your seatbelt and enjoy the ride!
description: Urban Arrow zoekt een Product Owner IT Amsterdam, 32-40 uur Fasten your seatbelt and enjoy the ride! En dat bedoelen we letterlijk want we groeien hard door en zijn daarom dringend op zoek naar versterking. Heb jij ruime digitale ervaring in een productie/handelsbedrijf in een functie als bijvoorbeeld projectmanager/product owner. Heb jij aantoonbare stakeholder management skills en kennis van dealerportals en digitale marketing technieken? Dan dagen wij jou uit om te solliciteren op deze gave rol van Product Owner IT. Wie zijn wij? Urban Arrow is koploper in stedelijke mobiliteit en dat willen we blijven. We hebben de elektrische transportfiets internationaal op de kaart gezet. Maar we zijn er nog niet. We groeien in recordtempo daarom willen we onze processen verder automatiseren en ons IT landschap uitbreiden en vernieuwen. Wat zoeken we? IT is een belangrijke pijler in de groei van Urban Arrow. Met een beweging naar meer digitalisering van onze fietsen, groei van zowel consumenten als zakelijk gebruik van onze fietsen en de snelle groei van de organisatie wordt het steeds belangrijker dat onze dealers en klanten makkelijk informatie kunnen vinden over onze producten en services via nieuwe digitale kanalen (web, app, mobile) en dat interne platformen goed op elkaar aansluiten. Door de ambitie om meer fietsen de maken en leveren, om onze impact groter te maken, zoeken we nu een Product Owner IT die een helpt om digitale platformen te ontwikkelen. In deze rol rapporteer je direct aan de IT (Transformatie) Manager en werk je binnen IT samen met een Business Informatie Analist en een Product Informatie Manager. Daarnaast werken we intensief samen met collega’s van ons moederbedrijf Pon (voor integraties via Mulesoft, IT services en Software Architectuur voor ons dealerportal op basis van Mendix). We werken op dit moment op een aangepaste agile manier geïnspireerd door de Shape up methodologie van Basecamp. Welke verantwoordelijkheden vallen onder de Product Owner IT Je wordt in het IT team verantwoordelijk voor een selectie van bestaande IT producten zoals dealerportal, WMS en integratie laag (Mulesoft) en nieuwe producten zoals IOT, CRM en ERP; Je neemt eigenaarschap over jouw producten en ontwikkelt een visie (lange termijn) en tactiek (korte termijn) voor verdere doorontwikkeling; Hierbij betrek je actief en in de juiste mate alle stakeholders om tot gedragen oplevering van functionaliteiten te komen; Je zorgt voor een vlotte samenwerking binnen de verschillende ontwikkelteams (extern), interne stakeholders en externe consultants met een fail-fast, startup mentaliteit; Je neemt de leiding als belangrijke beslisser en stelt de juiste prioriteiten voor de verschillende teams rondom jouw producten; Ophalen en challengen van requirements en vertalen in epics, stories en acceptatie criteria; Je helpt als teamlid om het IT team betere resultaten te laten behalen en stimuleert de groei van het team;  Wat vragen we van jou: Wie zoeken we? Jij brengt mee: Een Bachelor of Master degree in Engineering, IT of business administration; 5-10 jaar digitale ervaring in een productie/handelsbedrijf in een vergelijkbare functie (projectmanager/product owner) Je hebt genoeg kennis om technische afwegingen te maken; Hebt ruime ervaring met business software. processen en product data structuren in maak/productie/supplychain bedrijven, zowel het analyseren als signaleren en implementeren van verbeteringen; Goede stakeholder management skills richting zowel business als IT; Specifieke kennis en/of ervaring met Dealerportal, digitale marketing technieken of CRM; Je brengt een combinatie van analytisch vermogen, teamgeest en overtuigingskracht met je mee; Het is een plus als je concrete ervaring hebt met Lean / Six Sigma / Value stream mapping. Je kan een afweging maken welke verbeter tools bij welke problemen passen; Kennis over het managen van agile development processen; Interesse, ervaring en kennis over nieuwe IT technologies; Je woont in Nederland bij voorkeur in en om Amsterdam; Sociaal, optimistisch en zelfverzekerd vormen een deel van jouw DNA.  Wat bieden wij: Wat bieden wij? Een kans om bij te dragen aan de stad van de toekomst; het terugdringen van busjes en auto's en het bereikbaar houden van de stad. Een team met zeer gemotiveerde en enthousiaste collega's waarbinnen we naast hard werken ook dagelijks een lolletje maken. Een open en eerlijke bedrijfscultuur waarbinnen we ruimte bieden voor jouw talent en ontwikkeling. Ook krijg je de vrijheid om je ideeën te delen. Gezamenlijk lunchen Wanneer het allemaal weer kan een toffe Vrimibo en gave team / bedrijfsuitjes. Een Urban Arrow family of Shorty lease fiets voor eigen gebruik; Een spiksplinternieuw kantoor met eigen dakterras en alle luxe van dien.  Iets voor jou? Ben je enthousiast geworden. Leuk! Laat ons weten wie je bent en stuur je cv en korte motivatie. Doe vooral niet te plechtig en laat jezelf zien. En deel vooral alles waarvan je denkt dat wij het moeten weten. Projecten waar je trots op bent, je favoriete hobby... Kom maar door! Wij kijken uit naar je sollicitatie!

title: Global Account Manager – Professional Services
summary: Engages with Decision Makers to position Salesforce solutions through strategic value based selling, business case definition, ROI analysis, references and…
description: To get the best candidate experience, please consider applying for a maximum of 3 roles within 12 months to ensure you are not duplicating efforts. Job Category Sales Job Details Global Account Manager – Professional Services Location: The Netherlands  Role description: An opportunity exists for a proven new business sales joining the Professional Services enterprise sales team in Amsterdam. The role will focus on driving expansion in the Dutch market. This is an outstanding career option for a sales professional looking to further their career in a fast paced dynamic environment.  Your impact: To exceed quarterly / annual sales targets by driving new opportunities and selling salesforce.com solutions into enterprise accounts within a selected vertical.  Requirements: Relevant experience of selling enterprise software solutions, ideally business applications. Successful history of net new business sales (direct), with the ability to prove consistent delivery against targets. Demonstrable track record of sales overachievement. Credibility at all levels and evidence of building strong relationships internally and with the customer. Experience managing the end to end sales process through engagement of appropriate resources such as Sales Engineers, Professional Services, Executives, Partners etc. Ability to generate short term results whilst maintaining a long term perspective to maximize overall revenue generation. Provide accurate monthly forecasting and revenue delivery. Right to work in the Netherlands and fluent Dutch speaker, next to Advanced English language skills. Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent preferred. Current full driving license. Responsibilities: Global responsibility for a large Staffing & Recruiting company headquartered in The Netherlands. Major global roll-out of Digital Transformation project: liaise between the Salesforce services team and sr management when required Account plan closely maps to and influences the customers strategic board level priorities Seek, identify and initiate new go to market propositions through application of industry knowledge Identification of business value that the customer was not previously aware of Engages with Decision Makers to position Salesforce solutions through strategic value based selling, business case definition, ROI analysis, references and analyst data. Successfully interacts at the C-level. Drives significant coordination amongst groups such as Sales Engineers, Sales Specialists, Marketing, Business Development, Professional Services, Executives, Partners etc. to drive account strategy. Partners with GSIs and Services to deliver the contracted business solution and technical delivery plan. Provides mentoring relationships to more junior Account Executives and virtual team members. Conveys leadership, authority and confidence with every interaction, no matter what form the message; presentation, orally and in writing Accurately forecasts and achieves revenue goals. Coordinates a global team. Salesforce, the Customer Success Platform and world's #1 CRM, empowers companies to connect with their customers in a whole new way. The company was founded on three disruptive ideas: a new technology model in cloud computing, a pay-as-you-go business model, and a new integrated corporate philanthropy model. These founding principles have taken our company to great heights, including being named one of Forbes’s “World’s Most Innovative Company” five years in a row and one of Fortune’s “100 Best Companies to Work For” eight years in a row. We are the fastest growing of the top 10 enterprise software companies, and this level of growth equals incredible opportunities to grow a career at Salesforce. Together, with our whole Ohana (Hawaiian for "family") made up of our employees, customers, partners and communities, we are working to improve the state of the world. LI-Y Accommodations - If you require assistance due to a disability applying for open positions please submit a request via this Accommodations Request Form. Posting Statement At Salesforce we believe that the business of business is to improve the state of our world. Each of us has a responsibility to drive Equality in our communities and workplaces. We are committed to creating a workforce that reflects society through inclusive programs and initiatives such as equal pay, employee resource groups, inclusive benefits, and more. Learn more about Equality at Salesforce and explore our benefits. Salesforce.com and Salesforce.org are Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employers. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender perception or identity, national origin, age, marital status, protected veteran status, or disability status. Salesforce.com and Salesforce.org do not accept unsolicited headhunter and agency resumes. Salesforce.com and Salesforce.org will not pay any third-party agency or company that does not have a signed agreement with Salesfore.com or Salesforce.org. Salesforce welcomes all.

title: Functioneel beheerder
summary: Kennis van e-commerce en e-business oplossingen (A/B testen, tooling Google Analitics, webtooling, gebruikers- en klantgedrag analyse, SEO, SEA, email marketing…
description: Bedrijfsomschrijving  Je gaat werken voor een groot, goedlopend internationaal bedrijf dat op veel vlakken digitaliseert en innoveert. Er hangt een goede sfeer en komt te werken en in aanraking met diverse expertises.  Functieomschrijving  Per 6 april 2021 aan het werk als functioneel beheerder met de focus op web CMS, e-shops en websites? Dat kan! Het is een leuke tijdelijke klus ter vervanging/overbrugging van de functioneel beheerder die per 1 mei weg gaat. In januari draagt hij zijn werk geleidelijk over aan jou.  Als functioneel beheerder ga je zorg dragen voor stabiele (web)applicaties en productieplatforms, waarin de juiste wijzigingen op tijd en tegen zo laag mogelijke kosten worden gerealiseerd en de incidenten volgens afgesproken SLA tijden worden opgelost.  Je bent de contactpersoon voor de interne klant (manager e-commerce en de e-commerce business development manager) en gebruikers en de sparringpartner voor de business analist, de architect, de informatieanalist, externe applicatie beheerders, interne technische applicatie beheerder en de teammanager.  Als functioneel applicatie-beheerder met focus op e-commerce en web CMS heb je aanvullend kennis van e-commerce/content en e-business oplossingen, processen, tools en technieken waarmee je in staat bent e-commerce te ondersteunen in het behalen van de e-commerce doelstellingen.  Je verleent daarnaast eerste en tweedelijns support voor interne gebruikers.  Wat ga je doen? Analyseren van issues op de applicaties en aandragen oplossingen. Analyseren en oplossen van gebruikersvragen. Zorgen voor oplossing, afhandeling en implementatie van deze issues volgens de juiste processen en in de SLA gestelde richtlijnen. Zorgen voor inrichting van configuraties op de applicaties. Inzicht geven in en advies geven over inrichtingsalternatieven en hun impact op de organisatie, processen, gegevens en IT. Bewaken van het dienstenniveau zoals vastgelegd in de SLA, MAC en DAP. Doet voorstellen tot aanpassing van de e-commerce applicaties en stuurt op ontwikkeling daarvan. Ondersteunen en adviseren op e-commerce en e-business ontwikkelingen. Communiceren naar en adviseren van diverse stakeholders en betrokkenen zoals diverse managers, de e-commerce manager, users, architecten en business analisten.  Functie-eisen Minimaal HBO niveau / Academisch werk- en denkniveau. Je hebt met name ervaring op het gebied van WebCMS-sen, websites en eShops. Kennis van e-commerce en e-business oplossingen (A/B testen, tooling Google Analitics, webtooling, gebruikers- en klantgedrag analyse, SEO, SEA, email marketing, etc.) Je hebt kennis van het materiegebied of ervaring in soortgelijke functie met minimaal 3 jaar werkervaring. Je hebt kennis en ervaring met complexe content management systemen. Je hebt kennis van internet technologie, server en database beheer. Ervaring met ontwikkel- en beheerprocessen van applicaties. Bij voorkeur Agile – Scrum. Kennis en ervaring met ASL/BiSL, ITIL. Ervaring met testen van systemen en project- en releasematig werken. Kennis van proces- en informatieanalysemethoden en -technieken. Ruime ervaring en coachende en coördinerende vaardigheden en ervaring. In staat om op basis van applicatiekennis initiatieven tot verbeteringen aan te dragen Kennis van (externe) webmasters tools en tagmanagers (bijv. GWT en GTM) Je weet kennis te waarborgen en over te brengen op diverse betrokkenen.  Arbeidsvoorwaarden  Het is een tijdelijke rol voor een detacheerder of ZZP.  Projectduur: de verwachting is 3 maanden met kans op verlenging.  Locatie: Alphen aan den Rijn

title: Growth Analytics Manager
summary: Mentor 1-2 middle/junior analysts (evaluate the performance of analytics team members and provide them the necessary coaching, guidance, and learning…
description: About the team At the Growth Analytics team it is our responsibility to uncover what our users are aiming to accomplish within Miro. And we are doing this at scale! As the name (Growth Analytics) suggests, we are working a lot with understanding user behaviour by analysing their actions. But this is not everything we do though! We create hypotheses, build growth models, own metrics and experiment together with our fellow Growth PMs and Growth Marketing people. About the role Growth data analytics is focused on the quantitative understanding of users and customers behavior across different stages of their lifecycle (product-led acquisition, activation, engagement, decision to pay, retention and expansion). We consider Data Analyst as a bi-direction driver. On the one hand, they transform business goals to data requests and reports/dashboards, on the other - proactively explore data to bring insights and drive right decisions. What you'll do You will be a direct partner for Product-led acquisition / Engagement growth teams. When start: 90% hands-on analytics; 10% methodology elaboration. When team grows (in 3-9 months): 60% hands-on analytics; 20% team development; 20% methodology elaboration.  Hands-on Analytics: Rolling-out 'data-as-a-service' approach for partner team to make data easy to access, understand and make decisions Communicate with growth and cross-functional teams, defining metrics they track, planning report structures, making it visually appealing and easy to understand, and automating the reporting process in our BI system Work hands-on with the team to manage the end-to-end process: scope projects, build pipelines and data models, synthesize results, build dashboards and reports Measure the impact of both existing and new features and growth experiments on our key metrics (eg. number of collaborative boards, conversions, etc) Identify and share insights that will impact growth strategies Reply for ad-hoc data requests from partner team  Team Development: Contribute to building a high-performing, high-throughput Data team in Perm and Amsterdam (Data Analysts, Engineers and Scientists) Mentor 1-2 middle/junior analysts (evaluate the performance of analytics team members and provide them the necessary coaching, guidance, and learning opportunities to help them grow in their careers) Coach and facilitate cross-functional team behaviour  Methodology elaboration: Introduce and coach the team on the latest analytical methodologies Think outside the box regarding the data we're collecting and analyzing Evolve experimentation framework and workflow In collaboration with data scientists elaborate and implement ML/econometric models What you'll need 4-6 years of experience in growth analytics within product customer-centric organisations Expertise in statistical methods, experimental design, using quantitative analysis to impact key decisions Profound experience writing SQL queries and working with large data sets Experience in product analytics and BI tools (eg.
