Wanneer jij je draai binnen het team hebt gevonden en de campagnes structureel onder controle hebt mag jij ook nieuwe en innnovatieve projecten oppakken. Dit kan zijn omdat je zelf iets nieuws wilt leren en daarmee het bedrijf ook verder kan helpen, of omdat je iets ziet wat je resultaten direct doen verbeteren. De doorgroeimogelijkheden zijn hier aan jou omdat je aan het voorfront van de teamopbouw staat. Jij geniet van vrijheid om invulling aan je eigen rol te geven zodra de basis goed staat! Waar voldoet de ideale Display Marketeer aan? 1 a 2 jaar ervaring in digital marketing (voorkeur Display). Ervaring met biddingtools zoals DV360. Proactief, doortastend, kritisch en leergierig zijn geen vreemde kenmerken voor jou. Je wordt enthousiast van de laatste ontwikkelingen en trends en je bent continue op zoek naar innovatieve oplossingen. Commercieel ingesteld, analytisch sterk en overtuigend. Je hebt een strategische mindset met een pro-actieve drive om nieuwe ideëen uit te proberen. Doorzettingsvermogen om door je eigen impact de job helemaal zelf te vormen. Wat wordt er geboden? Een salaris tot €43.000,- per jaar Een carrière bij een top-speler in de publisher sector Lunchdates met een gezellig en divers team Een belangrijke rol in een snelgroeind team Dé kans om het verschil vanuit Display Marketing te maken

title: Senior Product / UX Designer
summary: In this team you will collaborate with a product manager, mobile/front-end developers, back-end developers, product analysts, data scientists, marketing,…
description: eBay Classifieds Group (eCG) is an innovative leader in online classifieds with brands that span the globe. Our sites help people find whatever they’re looking for in their local communities – whether it’s a job, an apartment, a sofa, a car, a concert ticket, financial services or new friends. Every connection made or item found makes a difference by creating a world where people share more and waste less. People who want to connect and trade visit our sites because they’re fun, easy to use and built on trust. About the business: Every month Marktplaats handles over 8 million unique visitors and 350.000 new advertisements each day making Marktplaats the largest online trading platform in the Netherlands. Consumer and professional sellers offer a large and varied assortment of used and new products. But we want to go even further - we are constantly changing our platform to deliver the experience our customers love. We are a mix of Dutch and Silicon Valley cultures; like both, we are an international team of passionate people who share a common interest in solving problems using software and data. We invite you to join us! This role is located within our User Experience & Design team, where you are part of a group of Product designers, researchers and other UX specialists. Besides that, you also work in a cross-functional team that is focussed on creating the best experience in the field of advertising. Your goal is to create the most wonderful experience for our users by balancing their needs and the business needs of advertisers. In this team you will collaborate with a product manager, mobile/front-end developers, back-end developers, product analysts, data scientists, marketing, customer service and more. We’re looking for an experienced Product Designer that: Shows leadership in defining, communicating and executing a design vision & strategy in delivering strategic objectives. Applies strong partner leadership skills to balance user and business needs. Encourage and collaborate with people from other subject areas, like product managers, developers and data analysts. Owns and is accountable for all aspects of the design process. Is experienced in designing a multi-platform experience for Android, iOS and web. Knows how to apply modern Design Thinking methods. You are comfortable organising and leading Design sprints and/or workshops. Is comfortable in combining research and data insights to drive decision making in the designing and the solution exploration. Validates design solutions using both qualitative and quantitative methods. Is Proficient in English. Bonus points: experience in the e-commerce and/or advertising domain. What we offer you: The User Experience & Design team is a young and quickly evolving team that focuses on continuous improvement, for example through team training. Together we create an environment with a lot of opportunity to express yourself, share your ideas and collaborate to make it happen. Learning, education and personal development are key when you work at Marktplaats & 2dehands. You have influence in your growth path with your own education budget. The position you have as a designer in your cross-functional team gives you the opportunity to be part of defining and influence the direction of the critical initiatives of your team. Interested? From the moment that you join our team we aspire to make your employment experience an outstanding and engaging one. If you are enthusiastic and thrive in a collaborative and friendly environment, just apply! Benefits: Benefits are an essential part of your total compensation for the work you do every day. Whether you’re single, in a growing family, or nearing retirement, eBay offers a variety of comprehensive and competitive benefit programs to meet your needs. We love creating opportunities for others by connecting people from widely diverse backgrounds, perspectives, and geographies. So, being diverse and inclusive isn’t just something we strive for, it is who we are, and part of what we do each and every single day. We want to ensure that as an employee, you feel Marktplaats is a place where, no matter who you are, you feel safe, included, and that you have the opportunity to bring your unique self to work. To learn about our Diversity & Inclusion click here: https://www.ebayinc.com/company/diversity-inclusion/ Covid-19 People are the heart of the eBay Classifieds business, and their health and well-being are our first priority. We continue to monitor local government guidance and partner closely with medical advisors to determine the safest and best next steps for everyone. As a result, most teams are working remotely, with a few teams able to collaborate in person with enhanced safety procedures. We will discuss the particular case for your region during the interview process. As a general rule, interviews will be completed remotely over video calls. eBay Inc. is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, veteran status, and disability, or other legally protected status. If you are unable to submit an application because of incompatible assistive technology or a disability, please contact us at talent@ebay.com. We will make every effort to respond to your request for disability assistance as soon as possible.

title: Strategic Account Executive, Public Sector- MuleSoft
summary: You will drive Pipeline development through a combination of customer engagements, marketing campaigns and market sector knowledge/intelligence.
description: To get the best candidate experience, please consider applying for a maximum of 3 roles within 12 months to ensure you are not duplicating efforts. Job Category Sales Job Details Role description An opportunity has been created for a Strategic new business sales professional joining the enterprise sales team. The role will focus on driving expansion in the local market. This is an outstanding career opportunity for a sales professional looking to further their career in afast paced dynamic environment.. Your impact To exceed quarterly / annual sales targets by driving new opportunities and selling MuleSoft solutions into enterprise accounts. Basic Requirements You will manage the entire sales process to ensure delivery against key performance metrics, with a strong emphasis on new business sales. By executing thorough customer discovery and research, you will formalize a Go To Market strategy and create qualified target account lists. You will drive Pipeline development through a combination of customer engagements, marketing campaigns and market sector knowledge/intelligence. Create and maintain a sales pipeline to ensure over-achievement. Engage with current and prospect organizations to position Mulesoft solutions through strategic value based selling, business case definition, return on investment analysis, references and analyst data. Manage the end to end sales process through engagement of appropriate resources such as Business Development Representatives, Sales Engineers, Professional Services, Executives, Partners etc. Generate short term results whilst maintaining a long term perspective to maximize overall revenue generation. Provide accurate monthly forecasting and revenue delivery. Preferred Requirements Relevant experience of selling enterprise software of SaaS solutions, ideally business applications gained within a major software vendor or system integrator. Successful history of net new business sales (direct), with the ability to prove consistent delivery against targets. Demonstrable track record of sales over achievement. Credibility at all levels and evidence of building strong relationships internally and with the customer. Bachelors Degree of equivalent preferred. MuleSoft is an explosive-growth, well-funded company on a mission to connect the world’s applications, data and devices. $593B is spent each year connecting applications, data and devices, and the challenge is growing dramatically with the explosion of cloud, big data, mobile and the Internet of Things. We’re “productizing” integration - making it as easy to connect systems and companies as it is to connect with friends on Social Media. MuleSoft’s Anypoint Platform™ enables companies to unlock the full potential of their applications and data through API-led connectivity, both on-premises and in the cloud, and our growth continues to accelerate. Our platform is used by organizations in over 60 countries, from emerging companies to Global 500 enterprises including Mastercard, Unilever, Tesla, Intuit, BSkyB and Verizon among others. We’re building a great company filled with exceptional people who challenge and inspire each other. MuleSoft is recognized as a Deloitte Technology Fast 500 company and 2015 Best Place to Work by Glassdoor. LI-Y Accommodations - If you require assistance due to a disability applying for open positions please submit a request via this Accommodations Request Form. Posting Statement At Salesforce we believe that the business of business is to improve the state of our world. Each of us has a responsibility to drive Equality in our communities and workplaces. We are committed to creating a workforce that reflects society through inclusive programs and initiatives such as equal pay, employee resource groups, inclusive benefits, and more. Learn more about Equality at Salesforce and explore our benefits. Salesforce.com and Salesforce.org are Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employers. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender perception or identity, national origin, age, marital status, protected veteran status, or disability status. Salesforce.com and Salesforce.org do not accept unsolicited headhunter and agency resumes. Salesforce.com and Salesforce.org will not pay any third-party agency or company that does not have a signed agreement with Salesfore.com or Salesforce.org. Salesforce welcomes all.

title: Senior Research Manager
summary:
As a Research leader, you define and drive the understanding of customers - and the future of travel experiences.
As a Senior Research Manager you will:
description: About the job: As a Research leader, you define and drive the understanding of customers - and the future of travel experiences. You partner with our teams to understand guests and partners. Your team identifies and shapes product strategy and inspires their cross-functional partners to create great experiences. Leading and growing a high performing team of skilled researchers who provide the foundation for well-informed, objective, data-oriented decision making across Booking.com accommodation business. In this role, you will guide research processes, manage and mentor your team and partner with multidisciplinary product teams to identify customer needs and develop insights for product development. You will build fundamental understanding of the current user experience, pull together customer data collected by teams across the business, develop an accurate and inspiring picture of our customers to guide ongoing product development and shape early product definition and strategy. You are a strong and empathetic leader who manages and develops the members of the team. You bring expertise in research practices across all phases of the product life-cycle, excellent knowledge of primary research methods (surveys, diary studies, interviews and focus groups) as well as secondary & expert methods (such as litreviews, cognitive walkthroughs and desk research), grounding in product development processes and effective cross-functional collaboration skills. You will define and lead research programs that influence the customer proposition, align UX research activities with wider plans and build user centred practices in product teams. You are a strong and empathetic leader who manages and develops the members of the team. You are an excellent communicator and will partner closely with senior stakeholders and the leadership team. As a Senior Research Manager you will: Provide vision and direction for a team of direct and indirect reports; inspiring and challenging them in their day to day work and their career path. Collaborate closely with the Research craft leader to outline and roll out definitions of research quality, improvements to processes and other craft improvements. Invest in and enable the team’s collective success, delivering business outcomes and building a cohesive, high performing organisation. Be a thought leader on how to set up research and use data from multiple sources to inform the product experience. Provide strategic insights, conduct independent research, collect and analyse behavior through a variety of qualitative and quantitative methods, understand and incorporate complex technical and business requirements into research. Build strong collaboration with Analytics, Marketing and Data & Reporting teams to validate and spot connections across data sources and connect disparate data points across consumer insights and other business data. Explore new ways of gathering consumer insights through innovative research tools such as online community panels, conversational research, etc. Define and measure quantitative UX goals and metrics in collaboration with Researchers, Designers, Analysts and Product Managers. Developing engaging methods of research dissemination and in developing appropriate UX KPIs for use by the business. Promote a user-centred design approach by educating and inspiring others throughout the business. Be the users' advocate, ensuring their needs are central to design and development decisions across the business. Experience (essential): 10+ years' UX research delivery in a consultancy, agency or in-house setting. Degree or higher degree in psychology, behavioural sciences, HCI, economics or similar. Experience managing and growing a team of UX Researchers (10+). Experience with primary and secondary research methods in UX Research. Experience with designing, leading and implementing UX Research projects at scale. Knowledge and practical experience of using a variety of UX research methods (qualitative and quantitative), with a strong awareness of their merits and weaknesses. Experience of using a variety of commercial UX Research or VOC software tools. Strong analytical skills, with a demonstrated ability to distill the output of complex datasets. Knowledge of UCD principles and best practices. Experience (desirable): Awareness of experimentation principles. Ecommerce or travel industry exposure. Master degree in business management, economics, psychology or similar. Your qualities: Personable – Adaptable and able to make others feel at ease. Analytical – Investigative, inquisitive, always asking 'why?'. Collaborative – Able to facilitate effective working among colleagues in various roles. Organised – Capable of managing multiple projects simultaneously. Articulate – Able to convey customer insights persuasively and accurately. Principled – Focussed on the right outcome for your users.

title: Senior Account Executive - Netherlands
summary: Engage with prospect organisations to position Salesforce solutions through strategic value based selling, business case definition, ROI analysis, references…
description: To get the best candidate experience, please consider applying for a maximum of 3 roles within 12 months to ensure you are not duplicating efforts. Job Category Sales Job Details Senior Account Executive - Netherlands Your role as an Account Executive: An opportunity exists for a proven new business sales joining the Commercial Sales team. This is an outstanding career option for a sales professional looking to further their career in a fast paced dynamic environment. As an Account Executive within the Commercial Business Unit, you will be responsible for selling the entire Customer 360 Platform (#1 B2B and B2C platform) and all the applications including Sales, Service, Marketing, Commerce, Communities, Collaboration and Industries. You will form part of a team that is highly independent, enjoys client facing interactions and has deep understanding of account planning. You will need to be innovative, creative and always looking to drive the organisation forward. You are able to design a strategy, look at the bigger picture and translate this into measurable actions for your team and yourself. Your Impact : To exceed quarterly / annual sales targets by driving new opportunities and selling Salesforce solutions into commercial accounts within a selected territory. You will manage the entire sales process to ensure delivery against key performance metrics, with a strong emphasis on new business sales, while expanding existing accounts. By executing thorough customer discovery and research, you will formalise a Go-To-Market strategy and create a qualified target account list. You will drive Pipeline development. You will learn Salesforce award winning products, platform and value proposition and drive digital transformation in net new and existing customers. Engage with prospect organisations to position Salesforce solutions through strategic value based selling, business case definition, ROI analysis, references and analyst data. Pipeline development through a combination of cold calling, email campaigns and market sector knowledge/intelligence. You will closely collaborate with appropriate support teams such as Sales Engineers, Business Developers, Marketers etc. Generate short term results whilst maintaining a long term perspective to maximise overall revenue generation. Strengthen client relationships through regular engagement and face-to-face meetings. Accurate monthly forecasting and revenue delivery. Managing industry events and user groups to generate market interest. Attend industry recognised sales training programmes. Daily update of the Salesforce system with accurate customer and pipeline data. Further development of sales techniques through our Sales Academy, Boot camp and Sales Productivity teams. Requirements: Proven track record of selling Enterprise Software Solutions or Business Applications to commercial businesses across multiple industries. Successful history of net direct new business sales, with the ability to prove consistent delivery against targets. Experience managing complex, transformative deals across multiple divisions and departments. Solid sales forecasting abilities and strong track record of revenue achievement. Credibility at all levels, including C-level and evidence of building strong relationships internally and with the customer. A background in prospecting, creating deals from scratch and closing of new business. Creativity, team player mindset and resilience Minimum of a Bachelor's degree Fluent Dutch What's in it for you: Clear and structured career path into positions of increased seniority and responsibility including leadership roles. World - Class Training & Development in the areas of professional growth and product knowledge. Constant learning and knowledge sharing with some of the best complex selling professionals in the industry. Environment for an entrepreneurial minded person with a lot of energy, ideas and courage for their implementation. Comprehensive training offering supplemented by individual coaching & mentoring. Chance to work in a dynamic, fun and challenging environment where we will make sure you are set up for success. Extra Benefits: Wellness Allowance, Travel Scheme, Education Allowance, 7 Volunteering Days a year and free snacks and drinks. About Salesforce:  Salesforce, the Customer Success Platform and world's #1 CRM, empowers companies to connect with their customers in a whole new way. The company was founded on three disruptive ideas: a new technology model in cloud computing, a pay-as-you-go business model, and a new integrated corporate philanthropy model. These founding principles have taken our company to great heights, including being named one of Forbes’s “World’s Most Innovative Company” seven years in a row and #1 on the FORTUNE ‘100 Best Companies to Work For®’ List. We are the fastest growing of the top 10 enterprise software companies, and this level of growth equals incredible opportunities to grow a career at Salesforce. Together, with our whole Ohana (Hawaiian for "family") made up of our employees, customers, partners and communities, we are working to improve the state of the world. Accommodations - If you require assistance due to a disability applying for open positions please submit a request via this Accommodations Request Form. Posting Statement At Salesforce we believe that the business of business is to improve the state of our world. Each of us has a responsibility to drive Equality in our communities and workplaces. We are committed to creating a workforce that reflects society through inclusive programs and initiatives such as equal pay, employee resource groups, inclusive benefits, and more. Learn more about Equality at Salesforce and explore our benefits. Salesforce.com and Salesforce.org are Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employers. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender perception or identity, national origin, age, marital status, protected veteran status, or disability status. Salesforce.com and Salesforce.org do not accept unsolicited headhunter and agency resumes. Salesforce.com and Salesforce.org will not pay any third-party agency or company that does not have a signed agreement with Salesfore.com or Salesforce.org. Salesforce welcomes all.

title: Enterprise Customer Success Manager - Nordics
summary: Ease in speaking to stakeholders at all levels and various departments: from business executives to data scientists, analysts and IT.
description: Dataiku allows enterprises to create value with their data in a human-centered way while breaking down silos and encouraging collaboration. One of the most unique characteristics of our product, Data Science Studio (DSS), is the breadth of its scope and the fact that it caters both to technical and non-technical users. Through DSS, we aim to empower people through data and democratize data science.  The Dataiku Entreprise Customer Success Manager is responsible for serving a portfolio of enterprise Nordics accounts. This position proactively works with a broad set of stakeholders to illustrate the value delivered through Dataiku’s software & services. The Entreprise Customer Success Manager serves as the internal voice of the customer while working with other Dataiku teams and partners to exceed customer expectations. This individual's performance is based on specific metrics associated with customer product adoption, expansion & retention.  This role will be preferably based in Amsterdam. In this role, you'll help the team: Actively serve a portfolio of accounts from various industries, ranging from SMB to large enterprises, mostly based in the Nordics region Gain an understanding of your clients’ desired business outcomes and objectives / Align with customers on a Joint Success Plan, mapping their goals to concrete actions and establish success metrics to track progress Proactively engage with customers and propose ways to support their journey with DSS and to maximize the value their get out of the platform Provide guidance to customer organizations on how to leverage DSS to implement data science projects from design to production Leverage Customer Health analytics to identify customer expansion opportunities & churn risks Collaborate with Dataiku’s Sales team to expand customer relationships & ensure renewals Partner with Dataiku Implementation Managers to ensure successful initial rollout and deployment of DSS Collaborate effectively with Dataiku Data Scientists and Data Ops/architects to enable your customers and solve their technical challenges Effectively solve ad-hoc customer issues as needed, interacting with Customer Support, escalating customer issues as needed and identifying solutions/resources Collaborate with Marketing to grow library of customer testimonials Inform customers of Dataiku’s Product roadmap & provide continuous customer feedback to Dataiku’s Product team Stay current on Dataiku’s products, competitive landscape & data science trends Embrace & contribute to Customer Success team methodologies You might be a good fit for the role if you have: Masters (MSc) in business, management or engineering, computer science or data science. This is a hybrid role where both business acumen and technical curiosity are sought after. Awareness of the big data technology ecosystem (Hadoop, Spark, Kubernetes, Cloud technologies…) and eagerness to learn more Knowledge of data science use cases and methodologies 5 to 8 years of prior account management, customer success, consulting experience, preferably within enterprise software or data science Fluency in English Comfort establishing credibility with key customer decision makers & influencers Ease in speaking to stakeholders at all levels and various departments: from business executives to data scientists, analysts and IT Strong problem solving & analytical skills; formulate solutions that deliver real business value Ability to recognize & maximize new business opportunities Good organization skills: ability to handle multiple accounts & assignments simultaneously A commitment to exceed goals that is internal, constant & self-imposed Here are some metrics associated to the role: Increased depth & breadth of product adoption across customer accounts Identification of additional revenue opportunities for Dataiku Sales team High revenue retention with limited churn & downsells Verifiable customer proof points, references and case studies across customer portfolio High NPS & Customer Satisfaction scores Benefits Opportunity to join Dataiku early on and help scale the company Competitive compensation package, equity and health benefits Regular trips to Paris, London and customers’ offices (depending on COVID policy) Opportunity to work with a smart, passionate and driven team To fulfill its mission, Dataiku is growing fast! In 2019, we achieved unicorn status, went from 200 to 400 people and opened new offices across the globe. Spanning from Sydney to Frankfurt, Denver to London, geography doesn’t stop Dataikers from working closely together and sharing experiences. Collaboration is key within our product and culture. We strive to create a sense of belonging and community while fostering diverse thinking by encouraging cross-team, cross-office interactions like our annual company offsite or Paris onboarding. Fly over to Twitter, LinkedIn, and Instagram to read stories about our culture, people, and success.  Our practices are rooted in the idea that everyone should be treated with dignity, decency and fairness. Dataiku also believes that a diverse identity is a source of strength and allows us to optimize across the many dimensions that are needed for our success. Therefore, we are proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All employment practices are based on business needs, without regard to race, ethnicity, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, religion, age, neurodiversity, disability status, citizenship, veteran status or any other aspect which makes an individual unique or protected by laws and regulations in the locations where we operate. This applies to all policies and procedures related to recruitment and hiring, compensation, benefits, performance, promotion and termination and all other conditions and terms of employment.

title: Talent Program Data & Analytics
summary: Wat dacht je ervan om te werken data analyst, Database marketeer of marketing intelligence specialist bij Bol.com, Eneco, De Persgroep, ING, ABN AMRO of andere…
description: Organisatie Cmotions is specialist en marktleider in data, analytics en data science. Cmotions levert advies en implementatie consultancy, opleiding en werving en selectie diensten voor toonaangevende bedrijven en instellingen. Cmotions heeft al meer dan 18 jaar ervaring met het ontwikkelen, plaatsen en coachen van toptalent in data en analytics. We zijn de founder van toegepaste data en analytics opleidingen in Nederland. Functie Wat doen wij voor jou? We beginnen met een state of the art data & analytics opleiding van 7 weken fulltime. De volgende opleiding start rond maart 2021. Je wordt door de beste specialisten in de markt getraind in vakkennis, tools en persoonlijke vaardigheden. Niet alleen maar theorie, maar juist veel praktijk, toepassingen en cases. Hiermee kick-starten we je carri\u00e8re als data & analytics specialist. Vervolgens begeleiden we je naar een baan bij een top werkgever. Niet voor tijdelijke inzet, maar in vaste dienst bij een corporate. We brengen je aan tafel, geven je gesprekstraining en begeleiden je sollicitatieproces. Wat dacht je ervan om te werken data analyst, Database marketeer of marketing intelligence specialist bij Bol.com, Eneco, De Persgroep, ING, ABN AMRO of andere top werkgevers! Als je aan de slag bent zijn we niet klaar. We coachen en ondersteunen je gedurende je eerste jaar. Je krijgt een persoonlijke mentor die je begeleidt in je persoonlijke- en vakontwikkeling en je carri\u00e8reverloop; Je wordt gecoacht: persoonlijk en professioneel; Je krijgt kennissessies om je vakkennis te boosten; In intervisiesessies en bedrijfsbezoeken deel je ervaringen met andere Cmotions data & analytics talenten uit jouw programma; En ben je klaar voor een volgende stap in je carri\u00e8re, dan adviseren we je daar ook bij. Functie-eisen Heb je een (bijna) afgeronde WO opleiding of maximaal 2 jaar werkervaring. Toegepaste statistiek in je curriculum en bovenmatige interesse in data en analytics? En wil je van young professional ontwikkelen tot data specialist? Dan is Cmotions Talent Program data & analytics misschien wel jouw kick-start. Het eerstvolgende programma start rond maart 2021. Ben je enthousiast geworden en wil je deel uitmaken van Cmotions Talent Program data & analytics neem dan contact met ons op. Aanbod Tijdens je opleiding tot de start bij je werkgever krijg je een opleidingsvergoeding betaald. Genoeg om je vaste lasten mee te voldoen. Daarna krijg je natuurlijk een uitstekend salaris betaald bij de top werkgever waar jij aan de slag gaat. Sollicitatie Ben je enthousiast geworden en wil je deel uitmaken van Cmotions Talent Program data & analytics, meld je dan nu aan! Wil je meer informatie? Neem dan contact op met Melvin Lindeman 06 50 64 89 09 of recruitment@cmotions.nl.

title: Senior Product Manager - Tradespeople Product
summary:
You will liaise with stakeholders throughout the business, such as sales & operations, marketing to develop all-rounded strategies.
What you’ll be doing.
description: Company Description  We are on a mission to be the easiest and most reliable way to arrange home services - such as painting a room or installing a heater - by connecting homeowners with qualified tradespeople. We operate the market-leading brands in France (Travaux.com), The Netherlands (Werkspot.nl) and Italy (Instapro.it). Our product, technology & UX department consists of approximately 100 talented professionals, deeply passionate about creating great digital marketplaces everyday. Travaux, Werkspot and Instapro are part of IAC / ANGI Home Services.  Job Description  We’re looking for a Senior Product Manager for one of our teams looking after our product for our tradespeople (supply side of the marketplace). We currently have two platforms, a mobile app and a website that enable tradespeople to find and react to jobs and communicate with homeowners.  Qualifications  What you’ll be doing You will be leading the product efforts for a team composed of backend & front-end engineers, a UX designer, a product analyst, supported by an agile coach and a UX researcher You will build products that maximise the quality, retention & engagement of tradespeople on our platform You will deliver impactful product improvements thanks to your throughout understanding of our customers’ problems, business challenges and technology capabilities You will liaise with stakeholders throughout the business, such as sales & operations, marketing to develop all-rounded strategies You will use elaborate product development and measurement techniques to ideate, deliver and assess the impact of the product changes. Who you are You have 4+ years of experience in Product Management You demonstrate a lean mindset and have worked in an agile product development environment You are data-driven and have strong analytical skills: you enjoy going through numbers and you base your decisions on facts rather than opinions You are a reliable, communicative and collaborative team player You are open-minded, curious and embrace diversity You have excellent communication skills in English Bonus points for communication skills in French and/or Dutch What we offer We have offices in both Amsterdam and Aix-en-Provence. We offer a great working environment in either of these offices (once we go back to the office) Flexible working hours and remote working to accommodate personal needs Personal growth budget and time for attending training courses and conferences Relocation budget if coming from abroad (once it is safe/possible) 25 days of annual leave Pension arrangement Lunch allowance (even with the current remote working situation) Free fitness in our building (once it is safe/possible) Frequent and fun events with the entire company to celebrate achievements and milestones  Additional Information  How we are organised: Our Product, Technology and UX department currently consists of 3 tracks and approximately 100 professionals, with more than 15 different nationalities from all over the world. Each track focuses on the most valuable opportunity within their given scope. Within the tracks, multidisciplinary product development teams collaborate on achieving the goals that they set and commit to each quarter. We approach our decisions in an experiment-guided and Agile way: we validate new directions using a variety of quantitative and qualitative research methods. Our shared values: We believe our success starts with sharing the same values when it comes to how we work. These values are the foundation of everything we do, and you’ll experience them on a daily basis. Our values are: Be stronger together; Aim high; Take ownership; Be transparent and respectful; Be open-minded and curious; Embrace diversity; Focus on our customers. The company culture in our organisation is very open and inclusive; we are committed to building teams that represent a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. Special note related to COVID-19: We will be interviewing through video calls. Until the government (RIVM) is no longer advising us to work from home, we will be working remotely. We will do our best to make the onboarding as smooth as possible and help you get up-to-speed. Is this for you? Send your resume with a brief explanation of why you are highly motivated by this role. You can apply via the “Apply” button or by sending your information to Sophie Uny, Product lead at Werkspot, Travaux and Instapro. We’re looking forward to meeting you!

title: Business analist BI/ functioneel beheerder
summary:
Ben jij de business data analist die wij zoeken?
Aldipress is marktleider op het gebied van trade marketing en distributie van tijdschriften.
description: Organisatie Aldipress is marktleider op het gebied van trade marketing en distributie van tijdschriften. Zij werken voor titels zoals: LINDA, Voetbal International, Donald Duck en Quest. Als business analist heb je als hoofdtaak ervoor te zorgen dat de data en de BI-systemen voor analyse- en rapportagedoeleinden continu op orde zijn. Dat is een bijzondere taak in deze tijd omdat Alidipress in een overgang zit van: Een centrale data omgeving. Alle reporting in SAP BI naar Power BI. Functie Je bent verantwoordelijk voor de continue beschikbaarheid van de BI-systemen en de data. Dit betekent enerzijds een regelmatige afstemming met commercie over wensen en ontwikkelingen en anderzijds een vertaalslag naar de benodigde aanpassingen in data en BI-systemen. Denk hierbij aan de rapportages en query\u2019s in SAP BI, het datamodel (functioneel en technisch), de datamarts in AWS en de beschikbare portals in Power BI. Aangezien de rol van business analist een nieuwe functie binnen Aldipress is, kun je de precieze invulling ervan mede vormgeven. Functie-eisen HBO/Academisch werk- en denkniveau en minimaal 5 jaar werkervaring. Aantoonbare kennis en ervaring met AWS, Power BI en SAP (BW, BI). Kennis en ervaring met datamanagement en data governance. Sterke analytische vaardigheden met oog voor detail. Ervaring met het aansturen van IT leveranciers in een outsourcing omgeving. Communicatief zeer sterk, kan authentiek en effectief communiceren met alle levels van de organisatie (zowel mondeling en schriftelijk). Zelfstandig, je staat stevig in je schoenen en hebt een \u2018hands on mentaliteit\u2019. Ervaring met DevOps en scrum is een pre. Een proactieve en klantgerichte werkhouding. Spreekt vloeiend Nederlands en Engels. Aanbod Werken bij de marktleider in de distributie van tijdschriften. 36-urige werkweek. Jaarsalaris tussen 45K en 55K, afhankelijk van kennis en ervaring. Winstdelingsregeling Persoonlijk keuzebudget. Laptop van de zaak. Ruimte voor persoonlijke ontwikkeling. Informele organisatie. Sollicitatie Ben jij de business data analist die wij zoeken? Is jouw interesse gewekt? Dan ontvangen wij graag jouw CV. Voor vragen en/of informatie kun je contact opnemen met Melvin Lindeman, 06 50 64 89 09 of m.lindeman@cmotions.nl.

title: Business Data Analyst
summary: Wij zijn een onderdeel van de wereldwijd opererende BMW Group in München en verantwoordelijk voor de verkoop en marketing van BMW, BMW Motorrad en MINI in…
description: De Business Data Analyst bij BMW Group Nederland ontwerpt voorspellende strategische modellen en/of algoritmes op basis waarvan de business haar doelstellingen realiseert. Wil jij het verschil maken als het gaat om het verzamelen, asessen en prepareren van data(sets)? Lees dan eens verder, want deze fulltime baan in Rijswijk kan dan van jou zijn! Mis deze baan niet, solliciteer snel want volgende week vinden de gesprekken al plaats! De functie De Business Data Analyst bij BMW Group Nederland vertaalt de business vraagstukken (zoals salesresultaten, marketingdata over conversie, personalisatie, optimalisatie en forecasting als ook financiële cijfers) naar voorspellende strategische modellen of algoritmes op basis waarvan de business haar doelstellingen realiseert: méér auto’s verkopen tegen de juiste marge. Je bouwt concrete dashboards en modellen met Tableau en Python. Je bent eveneens verantwoordelijk voor de exploitatie van nieuwe datasets en technieken. Kortom: Je voorspelt welke acties de business moet nemen om de verkoopdoelstellingen effectiever en efficiënter te halen. Hiermee verbeter je ook de klantbediening en/of commerciële klant/markt benadering In deze rol maak jij het verschil, als het gaat om het verzamelen, asessen en prepareren van data(sets). Je visualiseert data-inzichten, op basis van hypothesen vanuit de business, als ook op basis van eigen ideeën. Natuurlijk werk je samen met een data-engineer. Je bent ook een Business Consultant die vervolgvragen beantwoordt vanuit de directie en business over de werking en validatie van het resultaat. Je geeft trainingen en technisch/inhoudelijke ondersteuning, met name op het gebied van Tableau. Je bent sparring partner richting Directie Nederland en BMW AG (Duitsland) op het gebied van nieuwe datatechnieken en GPM (granular performance management). Je maakt deel uit van het Market Intelligence Team. Jouw profiel De Business Data Analyst is iemand die vragen stelt, in oplossingen denkt, assertief en integer is. Wij zoeken een gemotiveerde en resultaatgerichte persoonlijkheid die drive en overtuigingskracht heeft. Jouw analytische vaardigheden stellen jouw in staat een visie op de juiste wijze te vertalen en tot uitvoer te brengen. Je krijgt dingen voor elkaar! Je bent in staat om nieuwe inzichten en/of modellen vanuit de beschikbare data statistisch te modelleren. Je communiceert makkelijk in verschillende situaties naar verschillende personen. Het is belangrijk dat je jouw visie goed kunt overbrengen naar stakeholders. Dit doe je op een enthousiaste en overtuigende manier. Natuurlijk stem je dit af op verschillende situaties en gesprekspartners. Jouw enthousiaste werkinstelling werkt aanstekelijk. Hiermee motiveer je ook anderen. Je hebt de gave anderen van jouw ideeën te overtuigen en je behandelt mensen op de manier waarop je zelf behandeld wilt worden. In deze baan is het belangrijk dat je goed onder druk kunt werken. Verder breng je met je mee: HBO+ | WO Werk- en denkniveau; achtergrond in een sterk kwantitatieve richting bijvoorbeeld econometrie, (toegepaste) wiskunde of natuurkunde; Ervaring met Tableau en Python (of vergelijkbaar), statistiek, modelbouw en optimalisatie; Tenminste 2 jaar werkervaring in een vergelijkbare functie; Je hebt kennis van de business domeinen zoals Marketing, Operations of Finance; Je kunt uitstekende communiceren in het Nederlands en Engels in woord en geschrift; Kan je ook Duits dan is dat een voordeel. Bedrijfsprofiel BMW Group Nederland zit middenin een groots modellenoffensief, terwijl ze tegelijkertijd zeer ambitieuze duurzaamheidsdoelstellingen nastreeft. Premium en duurzaamheid zijn immers onafscheidelijk. Het BMW Group portfolio bevat volledig elektrische modellen, vele plug-in hybrides én zeer efficiënte verbrandingsmotoren met de laagst mogelijke CO2-uitstoot. Zo hebben onze klanten zélf de keuze. Deze boeiende mix van vooruitgang en optimisme vindt haar weg richting de wereldwijde markten. Met name de Nederlandse, waar BMW Group Nederland met de merken BMW, MINI en BMW Motorrad al jaren marktleider is in het (premium)segment. Wij zijn een onderdeel van de wereldwijd opererende BMW Group in München en verantwoordelijk voor de verkoop en marketing van BMW, BMW Motorrad en MINI in Nederland. Onze marktpositie wordt verder versterkt door de nauwe samenwerking met het BMW/MINI dealernetwerk en BMW Group dochterondernemingen BMW Financial Services en Alphabet. Binnen de organisatie werken vele specialismen samen aan ambitieuze doelstellingen en processen. Er is een uitstekende samenwerking tussen de teams in een bedrijf waar iedereen de passie deelt voor onze begeerlijke twee- en vierwielers. Het aanbod De Business Data Analyst treedt direct fulltime in dienst bij BMW Group Nederland in Rijswijk. Je kan rekenen op: Salaris tussen €3.500 en €4.500 afhankelijk van kennis en ervaring; 24 vakantiedagen en 6 adv-dagen; Een persoonlijke bonus op basis van behaalde persoonlijke doelstellingen en ontwikkeling; Een company-bonus op basis van behaalde organisatie- en persoonlijke doelstellingen; 8% vakantietoeslag; Een collectieve pensioenregeling (DC regeling); Reiskostenvergoeding; Aantrekkelijke BMW, MINI en BMW Motorrad regelingen. Ben jij de Business Data Analyst die wij zoeken? Wij ontvangen graag jouw CV. Wil je eerst meer informatie? Dat kan: bel over deze vacature met Kasia Lamens, Recruitment Consultant Key Accounts, telefoon 06-25080695.  Het sollicitatieproces Lees meer op onze website over het sollicitatieproces bij Exact.  Exactpi Referentienummer: 3156.

title: Sales Support Analyst
summary:
Ervaring als sales support analyst is een grote plus.
Centrale contactpersoon voor de interne afdelingen van het bedrijf (logistiek, inkoop, finance, marketing,…
description: Over onze klant Mijn klant is gevestigd in Amsterdam en zit in de retail industrie. De cultuur kan worden omschreven als ambitieus, ruimdenkend en voortdurend op zoek naar nieuwe mogelijkheden. Taken en verantwoordelijkheden Ondersteunt verkoop bij alle activiteiten met betrekking tot klanten Volgt en bewaakt de deadlines van actiepunten uit de bezoekrapporten van de accountmanager Formuleert de verkoopwaarde en-marge t.o.v. het budget en de afstemming met accountbeheer Bewaakt alle deadlines, zodat de verwachtingen van de klant worden beheerd en, waar mogelijk, overtroffen Analyseert het service level voor de klant en rapporteert/bespreekt de bevindingen met de klant Analyseert het service levelvan de toegewezen productgroep en rapporteert/bespreekt de bevindingen met de relevante planner van de toeleveringsketen Controleert en verzekert dat de contracten en handleidingen van de klant zijn opgenomen in de systemen en processen van het bedrijf Controleert en fiatteert facturen, creditering en klachten van klanten Lost commerciële problemen op facturen en klachten over producten op Ondersteunt bij (tender) calculaties Analyseert, fiatteert en volgt aanvragen van klanten vooraanbiedingen Analyseerten rapporteert de commerciële KPI's Escaleert belangrijke problemen bij Manager Support Team en Business Unit Manager Centrale contactpersoon voor de interne afdelingen van het bedrijf (logistiek, inkoop, finance, marketing, klantenservice, supplychain) voor de toegewezen klanten Bedrijf is continue in ontwikkeling Informele werksfeer Profiel Bachelor-diploma/-denkniveau Ervaring als sales support analyst is een grote plus Uitstekende vaardigheden op het gebied van Microsoft Office (met name Excel) Ervaring in een soortgelijke functie Ervaring met een CRM is een pré Commercieel ingesteld Ervaring met het analyseren van (verkoop)cijfers Spreekt vloeiend Engels, Nederlands en Frans Aanbod Een leuk, ambitieus en commercieel team Informele werksfeer Schitterend en nieuw kantoor Vaste functie

title: Account Executive - Dutch Market
summary: Engage with prospect organisations to position Salesforce solutions through strategic value based selling, business case definition, ROI analysis, references…
description: To get the best candidate experience, please consider applying for a maximum of 3 roles within 12 months to ensure you are not duplicating efforts. Job Category Sales Job Details Account Executive - Dutch Market Location: Amsterdam About Salesforce  Salesforce, the Customer Success Platform and world's #1 CRM, empowers companies to connect with their customers in a whole new way. The company was founded on three disruptive ideas: a new technology model in cloud computing, a pay-as-you-go business model, and a new integrated corporate philanthropy model. These founding principles have taken our company to great heights, including being named one of Forbes’s “World’s Most Innovative Company” seven years in a row and #1 on the FORTUNE ‘100 Best Companies to Work For®’ List. We are the fastest growing of the top 10 enterprise software companies, and this level of growth equals incredible opportunities to grow a career at Salesforce. Together, with our whole Ohana (Hawaiian for "family") made up of our employees, customers, partners and communities, we are working to improve the state of the world. Your role as an Account Executive: An opportunity exists for a proven new business sales joining the Commercial Sales team. This is an outstanding career option for a sales professional looking to further their career in a fast paced dynamic environment. As an Account Executive within the Commercial Business Unit, you will be responsible for selling the entire Customer 360 Platform (#1 B2B and B2C platform) and all the applications including Sales, Service, Marketing, Commerce, Communities, Collaboration and Industries. You will form part of a team that is highly independent, enjoys client facing interactions and has deep understanding of account planning. You will need to be innovative, creative and always looking to drive the organisation forward. You are able to design a strategy, look at the bigger picture and translate this into measurable actions for your team and yourself. Your Impact : To exceed quarterly / annual sales targets by driving new opportunities and selling Salesforce solutions into commercial accounts within a selected territory. You will manage the entire sales process to ensure delivery against key performance metrics, with a strong emphasis on new business sales, while expanding existing accounts. By executing thorough customer discovery and research, you will formalise a Go-To-Market strategy and create a qualified target account list. You will drive Pipeline development. You will learn Salesforce award winning products, platform and value proposition and drive digital transformation in net new and existing customers. Engage with prospect organisations to position Salesforce solutions through strategic value based selling, business case definition, ROI analysis, references and analyst data. Pipeline development through a combination of cold calling, email campaigns and market sector knowledge/intelligence. You will closely collaborate with appropriate support teams such as Sales Engineers, Business Developers, Marketers etc. Generate short term results whilst maintaining a long term perspective to maximise overall revenue generation. Strengthen client relationships through regular engagement and face-to-face meetings. Accurate monthly forecasting and revenue delivery. Managing industry events and user groups to generate market interest. Attend industry recognised sales training programmes. Daily update of the Salesforce system with accurate customer and pipeline data. Further development of sales techniques through our Sales Academy, Boot camp and Sales Productivity teams. What you will need to be successful: Proven track record of selling Enterprise Software Solutions or Business Applications to commercial businesses across multiple industries. Successful history of net direct new business sales, with the ability to prove consistent delivery against targets. Experience managing complex, transformative deals across multiple divisions and departments. Solid sales forecasting abilities and strong track record of revenue achievement. Credibility at all levels, including C-level and evidence of building strong relationships internally and with the customer. A background in prospecting, creating deals from scratch and closing of new business. Creativity, team player mindset and resilience Minimum of a Bachelor's degree What's in it for you: Clear and structured career path into positions of increased seniority and responsibility including leadership roles. World - Class Training & Development in the areas of professional growth and product knowledge. Constant learning and knowledge sharing with some of the best complex selling professionals in the industry. Environment for an entrepreneurial minded person with a lot of energy, ideas and courage for their implementation. Comprehensive training offering supplemented by individual coaching & mentoring. Chance to work in a dynamic, fun and challenging environment where we will make sure you are set up for success. Extra Benefits: Wellness Allowance, Travel Scheme, Education Allowance, 7 Volunteering Days a year and free snacks and drinks. Salesforce, the Customer Success Platform and world's #1 CRM, empowers companies to connect with their customers in a whole new way. The company was founded on three disruptive ideas: a new technology model in cloud computing, a pay-as-you-go business model, and a new integrated corporate philanthropy model. These founding principles have taken our company to great heights, including being named one of Forbes’s “World’s Most Innovative Company” seven years in a row and #1 on the FORTUNE ‘100 Best Companies to Work For®’ List. We are the fastest growing of the top 10 enterprise software companies, and this level of growth equals incredible opportunities to grow a career at Salesforce. Together, with our whole Ohana (Hawaiian for "family") made up of our employees, customers, partners and communities, we are working to improve the state of the world. Accommodations - If you require assistance due to a disability applying for open positions please submit a request via this Accommodations Request Form. Posting Statement At Salesforce we believe that the business of business is to improve the state of our world. Each of us has a responsibility to drive Equality in our communities and workplaces. We are committed to creating a workforce that reflects society through inclusive programs and initiatives such as equal pay, employee resource groups, inclusive benefits, and more. Learn more about Equality at Salesforce and explore our benefits. Salesforce.com and Salesforce.org are Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employers. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender perception or identity, national origin, age, marital status, protected veteran status, or disability status. Salesforce.com and Salesforce.org do not accept unsolicited headhunter and agency resumes. Salesforce.com and Salesforce.org will not pay any third-party agency or company that does not have a signed agreement with Salesfore.com or Salesforce.org. Salesforce welcomes all.

title: Backend Engineer, Data
summary: We're looking for a Backend Engineer who can build systems to empower internal teams to elevate the way we work with data.
description: Backend Engineer, Data We're looking for a Backend Engineer who can build systems to empower internal teams to elevate the way we work with data.   Overview  As a Backend Engineer (Data) at Framer, you'll work on the Growth team, where you'll build and operate an event delivery system, manage and build our data warehouse and integrate different services to make this information available. In your role, you'll have the opportunity to work across multiple departments and on a variety of projects that will involve everything from product code and backend services to developer experience.  As the first Backend Engineer hired to focus on our data stack, you'll be in a unique position to determine the direction of our architecture and tools. We'll expect you to take a lot of ownership and drive your own work, with support from the rest of the Growth and Engineering teams. Our foundation includes a modern data stack built on Airflow, Dataflow, BigQuery, and our backend system is in Typescript, Go, Node.js, running on AWS. It's not a hard requirement to have experience working with similar data stack. We're more interested in candidates with the right mindset and willingness to learn—we'll provide you with the right platform and tools to become an expert.   What you'll do  Collaborate closely with other Engineers and Data Analysts Do the best work of your career, work normal hours, and focus on shipping Work on projects with multiple departments like Sales, Marketing, and Product Build out fundamental datasets across the business, from revenue reporting to product usage Help drive the strategy for data collection, storage, and warehousing   Your background  2+ years of experience in software engineering Self-driven and capable of tackling very loosely defined problems Advanced level of Go and/or TypeScript Advanced level of SQL Container technologies, such as Docker / AWS ECS / Kubernetes Cloud infrastructure architecture / Amazon Web Services   What we offer  You'll work with some of the best global talent and build a tool used by all the companies you know and love, including Amazon, Microsoft, and Spotify. Our philosophy is simple—hire diverse, passionate people and foster a culture that empowers great work. From flexible holidays and education stipend, we do everything to make sure you feel motivated and supported.  Remote Friendly Flexible Holidays Flexible Hours Parental Leave Pension Plan Education Stipend New Laptop & Tools  Framer is an equal opportunity employer. As part of our dedication to diversity, we work to ensure a fair interview process and maintain an inclusive work environment.

title: Consultant Advanced Analytics
summary: Als specialistisch bureau in het toepassen van advanced analytics en data science op marketing en business vraagstukken is jansen en van der zee een…
description: Organisatie Als specialistisch bureau in het toepassen van advanced analytics en data science op marketing en business vraagstukken is jansen en van der zee een gewaardeerde partner bij het vinden van de juiste oplossingen voor onze opdrachtgevers. Niet alleen op gebied van inzet van professionals maar ook op gebied van ontwikkeling. Naast het invullen van personele vraagstukken voor zowel vast als interim, helpen wij organisaties en professionals bij het realiseren van groei en ontwikkeling. Door onze jarenlange ervaring binnen deze specifieke markt weten we als geen ander op ontwikkelingen te anticiperen.  Functie consultant advanced analytics Als Consultant Advanced Analytics bij jansen en van der zee ga je diverse werkzaamheden uitvoeren voor onze opdrachtgevers. Onze opdrachtgevers zijn divers. Denk bijvoorbeeld aan klanten als banken, verzekeraars, telco's, uitgeverijen etc. waar jij jouw kennis en expertise gaat delen. De werkzaamheden die je gaat uitvoeren zijn divers en altijd anders! Het kan zijn dat je ergens deel uit gaat maken van een project of dat je tijdelijk iemand vervangt. Je werkt veelal op locatie van de opdrachtgever, dit kan door heel Nederland zijn. Per opdracht zullen de werkzaamheden verschillen maar zullen o.a. bestaan uit: Het helpen van organisaties wegwijs te worden met Big Data, machine learning, data mining en deep learning. Met behulp van tools als Python, R en wiskundige technieken en statistische modellen, leg jij verborgen data bloot en help je de klant met end-to-end data-oplossingen. Jij helpt de klant – gedetacheerd op locatie, of vanuit ons kantoor – van big data, naar real impact. Denk hierbij aan taken als; Zoeken naar kansen en mogelijkheden in een aanzienlijke hoeveelheid data Opschonen en verwerken van ruwe data tot bruikbare data Correleren van verschillende soorten data Detecteren van onregelmatigheden in data Identificeren van vragen vanuit de bedrijfsvoering Herkennen van patronen in ‘big data’, om hiervoor een voorspellend algoritme (zelflerend wiskundig model) te ontwikkelen – ook wel ‘machine learning’ genoemd Analyseren en selecteren van de beste statistische methodologie (bijvoorbeeld regressie, cluster analyse, decision trees) voor het oplossen van vragen vanuit de bedrijfsvoering Inzetten van voorspellende algoritmes ten behoeve van de besluitvorming Beschrijven en visualiseren van ontdekte inzichten en voorspellingen Rapporteren en delen van gegenereerde inzichten en kennis met het management en andere betrokkenen Onderzoeken en ontwikkelen van mogelijkheden om nog meer uit bestaande data te halen Beheren en optimaliseren van datastromen en data-analyses Opstellen, aansturen en/of trainen van een data science team Functie eisen Een relevante afgeronde wo-opleiding (Econometrie, Informatica, Machine Learning, Toegepaste Wiskunde, Statistiek of een gelijkwaardige kwantitatieve studie). Minimaal 3 jaar werkervaring als Data Scientist of Analist. Je beheerst één of meerdere van de volgende tools: SQL, R, Python, SAS, SPSS; Analytisch en communicatief ben je sterk of je bent gedreven je hierop te ontwikkelen, daarnaast ben je nieuwsgierig, leergierig en ambitieus; Je hebt passie voor het vakgebied en wil je hierin verder ontwikkelen; Aantoonbare ervaring met werken met grote datasets. Aantoonbare ervaring met bouwen van modellen Ervaring met statistische (regressie, clustering en classificatie), descriptieve en diagnostische methoden en kennis van voorspellende analysemethoden. Als Consultant bij jansen en van der zee ben je resultaatgericht, analytisch sterk, zelfstarter, pragmatisch en ben je in staat om (complexe) werkzaamheden uit te leggen. Wat bieden wij Gezellige, informele werkomgeving Goede arbeidsvoorwaarden Wij zijn een ster in het nieuwe werken. Dus veel flexibiliteit Wij vinden het belangrijk om kennis te delen en te pionieren in ons snel groeiende vakgebied Volop doorgroei- en ontwikkelmogelijkheden Wij staan open voor nieuwe initiatieven

title: Senior Product Manager (Content Management)
summary:
Communicate strategy, tactics, and progress to the team and stakeholders, including sales, marketing, and executive leadership.
What's in it for you.
description: About the team The Enterprise Product Team serves the needs of large customers that utilise Miro as a mission critical tool for collaboration and getting things done, in order to capture the revenue and growth opportunities that they represent. You will be working with a cross-functional team of Engineers, Designers and Analysts, who are focused on evolving Miro to meet the needs of large businesses who are looking to integrate Miro across their organisation. About the role Miro is a mission critical enterprise collaborative whiteboard platform that transforms the way high-performing distributed teams work. We're seeking an experienced Product Manager to lead the development of Knowledge Management for Enterprise customers. You will manage the development and delivery of strategic features that enable customer data to be accessible, relevant and secure at scale. Areas of focus will include bulk data import and export, archiving and retention, data security and access management, logging and auditing, integrations with external services, and data preservation. What you'll do Set up goals, define and execute the Miro Enterprise Management roadmap in line with the overall product and go-to-market goals. Ensure timely delivery of knowledge management services and capabilities. Communicate strategy, tactics, and progress to the team and stakeholders, including sales, marketing, and executive leadership. Package offerings according to overall product strategy and best customer experience. Build strong partnership with go-to-market teams to provide a better product and grow revenue through product enablement What you'll need 4-5 years product management experience in SaaS B2B/B2C2B companies. Proven track record of shipping elegant, pleasant, and productive user-facing products at scale. Experience working with enterprise customers to understand their challenges and build solutions to meet their needs. Strong prioritization and project management skills, understanding of business impact for solutions. Outstanding communication skills. Comfortability navigating and executing in ambiguous situations. Growth mindset. Empathy for customers and stakeholders. What's in it for you Stock Option Grant Medical Insurance coverage Allowance to facilitate remote working during WFH period Weekly remote team activities to keep the spirits high Opportunity to work for a truly global multicultural team Lunch, snacks and drinks provided when back in the office About Miro Miro is an online collaborative whiteboard platform that enables distributed teams to work effectively together, from running brainstorming sessions and workshops to planning projects, from designing new products and services to facilitating agile ceremonies. With around 10 million users and counting, Miro is trusted by Dell, Cisco, Salesforce, PWC, EY, Deloitte and many more global companies of all sizes. At Miro, we are a team of dreamers. We look for individuals who dream big, work hard and above all stay humble. Collaboration is at the heart of what we do and through our work together we hope to create a supportive, welcoming, and innovative environment. We strive to play as a team to win the world and create a better version of ourselves everyday. If this sounds like something that excites you, we want to hear from you! Check out our career page for all our open roles or hop onto this Miro board to learn more about us!

title: Product Manager
summary: Solid technical/business analyst background with a strong understanding of software development process in the Agile development framework.
description: Job scope: Saxo Bank offers several award-winning online platforms and APIs to retail and institutional traders and investors globally. We offer execution across a wide range of assets including Stocks, ETFs, CFDs, Forex, Options, Futures, Funds, Warrants, Turbos and Bonds, all from a single consolidated account as well as a full suite of back office services. We are now looking for a Product Manager who can help us realize our ambitious strategy by owning and defining the roadmap for our cutting-edge asset management solution servicing clients globally across desktop, tablet and mobile devices. As our new Product Manager, you will join a highly motivated and successful team where you will focus on the development and positioning of our new asset management offering across all our existing platforms: SaxoInvestor, SaxoTraderGO and SaxoTraderPRO.  You'll be equally adept at collaborating with development teams and business stakeholders as well as presenting to sales and marketing and soliciting feedback from clients directly.  You'll also have excellent interpersonal skills as they are essential in order to effectively collaborate with other internal teams. We need someone with the ability to approach challenges with creativity and enthusiasm; someone who has the courage to innovate and advocate for change and then deliver on those proposals. We'll expect you to influence the overall product vision, and then execute on that vision in our Agile development environment. You will be reporting to the Head of Wealth Management Platforms. Your responsibility: Participate in defining the Value Proposition for asset management and help drive the delivery of the enhanced client experience. In coordination with the Head of Wealth Management Platforms and all stakeholders across the value chain, drive the development process of the new solution. Help coordinate the migration of existing asset management client base to the new asset management proposition. Support the global rollout of the offering, both to Saxo Bank's direct clients (B2C) and through the WL version (B2B2C) of the offering. Support initiatives to constantly improve the Asset Management offering across the value chain. Prioritize development of new features and ancillary services both on a tactical and strategic level, ensuring that the solution remains scalable on a global level. Work closely with Sales and Marketing teams to support the go-to-market and targeted local marketing campaigns. Always ensure that the offering is fully compliant, considering target market and MIFID II rules. Required skills and competences: Ability to work independently and handle the challenges that span across the value chain. Strong problem solving skills, ownership and a willingness to make sure the job gets done. Solid technical/business analyst background with a strong understanding of software development process in the Agile development framework. Working experience in fund/asset management, both from a client-facing and regulatory perspective, is a must. Skilled at working effectively with cross functional teams in a sophisticated organization. Excellent written and verbal communication skills. We offer: A chance to join a truly growth-embracing culture, which will commit to helping you grow personally and professionally. An opportunity to work as part of a dynamic, very ambitious and, at the same time, informal and pleasant working environment. An attractive salary plus benefits package.

title: Senior Analist Amsterdam
summary:
Wil jij werken aan nieuwe data gedreven marketing oplossingen?
Jouw nieuwe werkgever is onderdeel van een groot internationaal bedrijf van meerdere agencies en…
description: Jouw nieuwe baan: Senior Analist Amsterdam | Data label | Post en pre campagne analyses Zit zoeken, analyseren en vertalen van data je in het bloed? Wil jij werken aan nieuwe data gedreven marketing oplossingen? Wil jij in de lead zijn van een team van ambitieuze media/data researchers? Wil jij werken in een multidisciplinair team van getalenteerde specialisten? Wil jij je volop verder ontwikkelen en je eigen groeipad kiezen? Ja? Klinkt interessant? Lees dan verder, dit is voor jou! Jouw nieuwe werkgever: Big 6 agency I Data, tech & analytics Jouw nieuwe werkgever is onderdeel van een groot internationaal bedrijf van meerdere agencies en richt zich met name op het behalen van data power marketing resultaten en technologische oplossingen. Zij bestaan inmiddels al 5 jaar en groeien hard, ook in tijden van Corona en daarom ben ben jij hard nodig! Dit bureau heeft inmiddels een multidisciplinair team opgebouwd van ruim 20 getalenteerde specialisten. Het gevoel van een start up waar jij hard in mee kunt groeien en de kans om met jouw data gedreven mindset impact te kunnen maken. Ze worden steeds beter in wat ze doen en daar draag jij aan bij! Dat betekent veel ruimte voor eigen initiatief. Doordat dit label onderdeel is van een Big 6 Agency werken ze niet alleen voor projecten voor hun eigen klant, maar werken ze ook met de andere bureaus samen en genieten ze van internationale samenwerkingen. Dat betekent niet alleen een breed scala aan kennis in huis maar ook een schat aan data waar jij uit kunt putten. Jouw nieuwe baan: Senior Analist Amsterdam | Media | Python Het doen van pre- en post analyses van het effect van een bepaald type media maakt jou blij. Jij vindt niks leuker om vanuit analyse de klant te overtuigen waarom zij een bepaald type medium (of mix hiervan) moet inzetten bij een bepaalde doelgroep. Dit ga je doen voor A klanten zoals een Heineken, Mercedes, Unilever en T-Mobile. Het analisten team waar jij komt te werken bestaat momenteel uit 5 collega’s waarvan jij de 2e Senior zal zijn. Door jouw kennis van Python/R ben je complementair aan de andere Senior waardoor jullie samen de kartrekker zullen zijn van het team, en het niveau naar een hoger niveau gaan tillen. Ook zal je op op Senior niveau meedenken met de klant, jij weet de mogelijkheden verder uit te bouwen en te professionaliseren. Daarnaast heb jij met jouw communicatieve skills het vermogen om de complexiteit uit te leggen aan klanten en collega’s. Doordat deze agency hard aan het groeien is, heb jij de mogelijkheid om je eigen groeipad te bepalen en jezelf verder door te ontwikkelen. Jouw collega’s hebben een “wij gaan er met zijn allen voor” mentaliteit om door te blijven groeien. Daarnaast kom je terecht in een team met een mooie mix van symphatieke collega’s die elkaar graag verder helpen. Daarnaast is er veel ruimte voor eigen initiatief, je denkt graag mee in verbeterplannen en verdere professionalisering. Ben jij klaar voor de volgende stap? Wat hebben we van je nodig? Minimaal 3+ jaar ervaring met media analyses, (pre/post) research Je bent gek op data en deze te analyseren Je hebt kennis van verschillende soorten onderzoek Je kan complexiteit vertalen en vindt het leuk om deze te presenteren WO opleiding in Communicatiewetenschap / Consumer Psychologie Ervaring met R/Python en/of wilt dit verder leren Ervaring met SPSS, SQL en cloudoplossingen Wat krijg je ervoor terug? Een salaris tot € 52K bruto per jaar; Een total package aan mooie voordelen: 27 vakantiedagen Pensioen bijdrage Een 37,5 urige werkweek Mobiel/vergoeding voor gebruik prive mobiel Laptop Reiskostenvergoeding Volop doorgroeimogelijkheden en ruimte voor eigen initiatief Klinkt dit als jouw nieuwe baan? Solliciteer dan nu via de sollicitatiebutton of stuur je cv naar k.bakker@finestpeople.nl of bel voor meer info naar 020-8200 676 en vraag naar Kim. Kijk voor al onze andere CRO/Data/E-commerce vacatures in Amsterdam op onze website: www.finestpeople.nl/vacatures

title: (Senior) Account Executive BeNeLux (m/f/x)
summary: Communicate constantly with other departments such as the marketing and pre-sales regarding the design and execution of campaigns to improve our internal and…
description: Full time, Utrecht  The Freshworks team is looking for an entrepreneurial driven sales professional. As an Account Executive you will play a leading role in accelerating our company's revenue growth across the BeNeLux region. In this role you will advocate multiple Freshworks product-lines targeted mainly at mid-market clients. As a brand ambassador you will champion our innovative Software-as-a-Service products to make organizations more productive, efficient and customer oriented. Working hand-in-hand with our marketing team and our business development representatives, you will especially be responsible for the acquisition of new customers, the business development representatives (BDRs) will support you during the initial contact with potential customers and their qualification. You will be partially responsible for helping your team of BDRs become successful. The position is based in the center of Utrecht and you will report directly to the Head of Sales for the Nordics/BeNeLux region.  Your role and responsibilities: Define and execute sales action plans to meet pre-defined goals in the region Build, develop and manage your sales pipeline Communicate constantly with other departments such as the marketing and pre-sales regarding the design and execution of campaigns to improve our internal and external processes Use and administer available resources effectively, e.g. steering the business development and presales representatives to reach your individual sales goals. Provide regular reporting of pipeline and forecasting to the Head of Sales Nordics/BeNeLux Travel to customer locations and customer focused events regularly Educate yourself to become an expert in SaaS products, CRM systems, and our product suite  Our perfect match Diploma or Master’s degree desirable Sales experience, preferably in an inside/field sales role in a high velocity software sales environment. Domain knowledge in the field of SaaS, CSM, CRM or ITSM is advantageous Highly motivated, with a driven personality and a positive attitude towards sales and CRM products Customer oriented, extraordinary communication skills, eagerness to learn and consultancy skills in order to understand our customers and to best support them Big motivation to thrive in a globally-dispersed work environment Fluent in English and Dutch; additional EU language skills are advantageous  These are some benefits you can expect from us in return: Great chance to define the European presence of a hyper-growth global company Flexible career development path within an international environment. We are just getting started! Work closely with smart, inspiring and encouraging international colleagues within a flat organizational structure An excellent compensation package, including bonus and equity  Sounds interesting? Then please apply here via our website and share your salary expectations as well as the earliest date you can join us. Feel free to visit our website to find out about other job postings.  About Freshworks Freshworks provides innovative customer engagement software for businesses of all sizes, making it easy for teams to acquire, close, and keep their customers for life. Freshworks Software-as-a-Service (SaaS) products provide a 360-degree view of the customer, are ready to go, easy to use, and offer quick return on investment. Headquartered in San Mateo, USA, Freshworks 2,000+ team members work in offices throughout the world. Freshworks has global offices in India, Singapore, Australia, UK, Netherlands, France and Germany. The company counts over 220,000 businesses in its customer-for-life community around the world including Honda, Bridgestone, Hugo Boss, University of Pennsylvania, Toshiba, Sling TV and Cisco.  Freshworks’ suite of products that transform the way world class organizations collaborate with customers and co-workers, include Freshdesk (Omni-channel customer support), Freshservice (IT Service Desk), Freshsales (Intuitive fully-integrated CRM), Freshmarketer (Marketing Automation Suite), Freshteam (HR Management System for growing teams), Freshchat (Modern messaging software) and Freshcaller (Cloud PBX system).  Freshworks has received numerous accolades from analysts and media including making it to Forbes’ Cloud 100 list, Economic Times Startup of the Year, 2019 LinkedIn Top 25 Companies to work for in India and a listing on the Magic Quadrant for CRM Customer Engagement & IT Service Management. While Freshworks has had incredible organic growth over the last few years, the company also has made targeted acquisitions that add critical capabilities to the portfolio including Natural Language Processing, Chatbots, Machine Learning, Social and Messaging Transformation. Freshworks has raised over $250 million in capital and is funded by Accel, CapitalG, Sequoia Capital and Tiger Global Management. More information is available at: www.Freshworks.com.

title: Junior Data Analist
summary:
Vaak hebben onze klanten geen eigen data analist in dienst dus is je contactpersoon bij de klant de CFO, CEO of E-commerce.
Het begint immers bij de business.
description: Bedrijfsomschrijving Insight First is een allround data & analytics adviesbureau. We helpen klanten om inzicht te krijgen in de belangrijkste KPI’s die hun merk laten groeien. Het begint immers bij de business. We zijn zoals je dat anno 2021 noemt ‘data translators’. We weten welke inzichten nodig zijn maar ook waar deze te vinden zijn en hoe we deze mooi weergeven in een dashboard. We werken veel voor hard groeiende online merken en zijn gespecialiseerd in Shopify & online marketingdata zoals Google Analytics, Facebook – en Google Ads. Daarnaast werken we veel met Marketplace data (Bol.com & Amazon) maar bijvoorbeeld ook voor marketing agencies waar dan weer hele andere inzichten bij komen kijken. Een greep uit onze klanten: Nuud, Veloretti, Naïf Care, First Energy Gum, NATWERK, Active Living. Inmiddels hebben we ca. 20 klanten onder onze hoede en zijn we hard op zoek naar uitbreiding!
